PURPOSE:THIS APPLICATION APPLIES FOR A TOTAL OF $739387 IN SECTION 5339 STATEWIDE FORMULA FUNDS FOR TWO CONSTRUCTION PROJECTS. THE TOTAL IS COMPOSED OF $697617 IN REMAINING FFY2019 LAPSING FUNDS PLUS A PORTION OF THE FFY2020 APPORTIONMENT OF $41770. (AFTER AWARDED A BALANCE OF $3458230 IN FFY 2020 FUNDS WILL REMAIN.) THE MATCHING RATIO IS 80% FEDERAL TO 20% LOCAL.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMEDTHIS APPLICATION WILL FUND THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE FOLLOWING PROJECTS:- BUFFALO SENIOR CENTER BUFFALO WY - RECONSTRUCTION OF A FOUR-STALL BUS GARAGE. LOCAL MATCH SOURCES ARE THE CITY OF BUFFALO AND LOCAL DONATIONS.- SENIOR CITIZENS CENTER SHERIDAN WY - INSTALLATION OF FOUR NEW BUS SHELTERS. LOCAL MATCH SOURCES ARE LOCAL DONATIONS.EXPECTED OUTCOMESTHE APPLICATION WILL ASSIST IN FUNDING IMPROVED INFRASTRUCTURE FOR EMPLOYEES AND TRANSIT PATRONS IN THE SHERIDAN AND BUFFALO COMMUNITIES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIESTHESE PROJECTS WILL BENEFIT THE TRANSIT PATRONS AND PUBLIC TRANSIT EMPLOYEES IN THE COMMUNITIES OF BUFFALO AND SHERIDAN WYOMING.SUBRECIPIENTS:- BUFFALO SENIOR CENTER IN BUFFALO WY - SENIOR CITIZENS CENTER IN SHERIDAN WYOTHERPRE-AWARD AUTHORITY IS REQUESTED FOR FULL AMOUNT OF THE ENGINEERING WORK (AS OF 8/2/2021) AND FOR THE CONSTRUCTION WORK ON THE BUS SHELTERS (STARTING 8/12/2022). (RECONSTRUCTION OF BUFFALOS FACILITY WILL NOT START UNTIL NEXT YEAR.) BOTH PROJECTS ARE IN THE APPROVED STIP AND STIP DOCUMENTATION AND THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS IS ATTACHED.THE PROJECTS HAVE BEEN CLEARED AS CATEGORICAL EXCLUSIONS AND RELEVANT DOCUMENTATION IS ATTACHED.

PURPOSE OF AWARD:WYDOT IS APPLYING FOR THE FULL AMOUNT OF FFY2021 5339(C) LOW OR NO EMISSION VEHICLE COMPETITIVE APPORTIONMENT ON BEHALF OF THE SOUTHERN TETON AREA RAPID TRANSIT AGENCY (START). THE PROJECT WAS SELECTED TO RECEIVE $1108000 IN FEDERAL FUNDS AS ANNOUNCED BY FTA ON JUNE 25 2021 (DISCRETIONARY ID #D2021-LWNO-051). THE FUNDING WILL BE USED TO PURCHASE FOUR BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES. THE MATCHING RATIO (74.11% FEDERAL TO 25.89% LOCAL) IS CONSISTENT WITH THE MATCHING RATIO INCLUDED IN STARTS COMPETITIVE APPLICATION.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THIS GRANT WILL ALLOW START TO PURCHASE FOUR BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES FOR PROVIDING PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION. THE VEHICLES WILL BE ADA ACCESSIBLE AND WILL ALSO BE FUNDED WITH WYDOT SEC 5339 FORMULA FUNDS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:SOUTHERN TETON AREA RAPID TRANSIT (START) IS COMMITTED TO REDUCING EMISSIONS FROM THE TRANSPORTATION SECTOR AND IMPROVING AIR QUALITY IN THE JACKSON HOLE REGION THROUGH THE CONTINUED INTRODUCTION OF ZERO EMISSION ELECTRIC BUSES TO THE START BUS FLEET.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THIS GRANT WILL BENEFIT THE JACKSON HOLE COMMUNITY AND TRANSIT PASSENGERS BY REDUCING HARMFUL EMISSIONS AND ENERGY CONSUMPTION.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THIS APPLICATION WILL FUND THE PURCHASE OF BATTERY ELECTRIC VEHICLES FOR SOUTHERN TETON AREA RAPID TRANSIT (START) WHICH BENEFITS THE JACKSON HOLE COMMUNITY AND TRANSIT PASSENGERS.OTHER:THE LOCAL MATCH WILL BE PROVIDED FROM THE TOWN OF JACKSON TETON COUNTY JACKSON HOLE MOUNTAIN RESORT AND TETON VILLAGE ASSOCIATION (THROUGH IMPACT AND SHORT TERM RENTAL FEES). TOWN AND COUNTY PORTION WILL COME FROM A SALES/LODGING TAX.ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION IS ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION INCLUDING STIP AND DISCRETIONARY APPLICATION DOCUMENTATION.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: WYDOT IS APPLYING FOR A PORTION OF LAPSING FFY2019 SECTION 5339 STATEWIDE FORMULA FUNDS OF $1547005 (FEDERAL) TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL FUNDS FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE NEW UNIVERSITY OF WYOMING MAINTENANCE FACILITY. THE FUNDS ARE LAPSING AND ARE PROVIDED AT 80% FEDERAL MATCHING RATIO. THE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO ASSIST IN FUNDING THE UNIVERSITY OF WYOMING FOR CONSTRUCTION OF THEIR NEW MAINTENANCE FACILITY WHICH IS ALSO BEING FUNDED BY THE EXISTING SECTION 5339(B) AWARD #WY-2021-003. (AFTER AWARD OF THIS APPLICATION A REMAINING BALANCE OF $697617 WILL REMAIN IN SECTION 5339 LAPSING FUNDS TO BE APPLIED TO OTHER PROJECTS LATER THIS FISCAL YEAR.); ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: CONTINUED CONSTRUCTION OF UNIVERSITY OF WYOMINGS NEW TRANSIT MAINTENANCE FACILITY LOCATED AT 2102 SOUTH 15TH STREET IN LARAMIE WYOMING. BESIDES FUNDING THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE OVERALL PROJECT THIS FUNDING WILL ALSO BE USED FOR CONSTRUCTING THE SOUTH VEHICLE STORAGE CANOPY AND THE FUELING FACILITY IDENTIFIED ON THE UPDATED BUDGET LOADED IN ATTACHED DOCUMENTS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS AWARD WILL SUPPLEMENT THE PREVIOUSLY AWARDED GRANT TO COMPLETE THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE MAINTENANCE FACILITY.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE TRANSIT PATRONS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF WYOMING THE CITY OF LARAMIE AND ALBANY COUNTY AS WELL AS THE EMPLOYEES OF THE UNIVERSITY OF WYOMING WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS FACILITY.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THIS GRANT WILL SUPPLEMENT THE CONSTRUCTION COSTS OF THE MAINTENANCE FACILITY FOR THE UNIVERSITY OF WYOMING SUBRECIPIENT.

8/3/2022 BUDGET REVISION 1:PROPERTY WAS PROCURED FOR $1180017 TOTAL ($944014 FEDERAL). THE REMAINING FEDERAL FUNDS OF $55986 WILL BE USED TOWARDS THE RENOVATION OF THE BUILDING.A PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE EXTENSION IS REQUESTED THROUGH 12/31/2023 TO ALLOW TIME FOR PLANNING AND CONSTRUCTION.________________________________PURPOSE OF AWARD:THIS GRANT APPLIES $1040000 IN FFY 2018 2019 2020 AND 2021 SEC 5339 FORMULA FUNDS TO BE UTILIZED FOR THE PURCHASE OF A PARCEL OF PROPERTY WITH AN EXISTING BUILDING THAT WILL HOUSE CHEYENNE TRANSIT OPERATIONS. THE SPECIFIC AMOUNTS OF THE SEC 5339 SMALL URBAN FORMULA FUNDS BY YEAR ARE: $ 255935 FFY2018 FULL APPORTIONMENT (LAPSING);$ 264781 FFY 2019 FULL APPORTIONMENT;$ 275581 FFY 2020 FULL APPORTIONMENT; AND$ 243703 FFY 2021 PARTIAL APPORTIONMENT (LEAVING A REMAINING UNOBLIGATED BALANCE OF $10296 FOR A FUTURE GRANT) FOR A TOTAL OF:$1040000 TOTAL FTA SEC 5339 SMALL URBAN FORMULA FUNDSACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR PURCHASING THE PROPERTY AT 1800 WESTLAND ROAD IN CHEYENNE WYOMING AND FOR MAKING MINOR IMPROVEMENTS TO THE EXISTING BUILDING AND SURROUNDING PARKING LOT.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THIS GRANT WILL ENABLE CHEYENNE TRANSIT TO RELOCATE THEIR TRANSFER FACILITY FROM THE EXISTING DOWNTOWN LOCATION TO A BETTER SITE FOR TRANSIT AND PEDESTRIAN CIRCULATION AND SAFETY. THE EXISTING FACILITY CURRENTLY LOCATED DOWNTOWN IS CONSTRAINED AND HAS CIRCULATION/SAFETY ISSUES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE EMPLOYEES AND PATRONS OF CHEYENNE TRANSIT WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT.SUBRECIPIENTS: NONEOTHER INFORMATION:THE MATCHING RATIO IS 80% FEDERAL TO 20% LOCAL. LOCAL FUNDS ARE BEING PROVIDED BY CITY OF CHEYENNE SALES TAX AND GENERAL FUNDS.RELEVANT STIP NEPA AND PROPERTY-RELATED DOCUMENTATION IS ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION.THESE FUNDS ARE SUBALLOCATED BY THE STATE OF WYOMING AS CONSISTENT WITH THE SUBALLOCATION LETTER ATTACHED.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS GRANT FUNDING GOES TOWARD THE DOWNTOWN TRANSIT CENTER PHASE 2 DEVELOPMENT PROJECT WHICH ADDRESSES CAPACITY SAFETY ACCESSIBILITY ISSUES AND ADDS GREATLY NEEDED PASSENGER AMENITIES TO THE MAIN DOWNTOWN TRANSFER HUB FOR THE GO TRANSIT SYSTEM.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE PROJECT WILL CONSTRUCT A SECOND BUS BOARDING PLATFORM AND A NEW PASSENGER AMENITY FACILITY ADJACENT TO THE CURRENT TRANSIT CENTER LOCATED AT 110 PEARL AVENUE. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO ACQUIRE AND DEMOLISH AN EXISTING OFFICE BUILDING LOCATED AT 222 PEARL AVENUE TO ALLOW SPACE FOR THE SECOND BUS PLATFORM.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PROJECT WILL REDUCE CONGESTION AND IMPROVE EFFICIENCY OF BUS MOVEMENT AT THE BUS PLATFORM. THE CUSTOMER CARE FACILITY WILL PROVIDE AN ENHANCED CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE BY PROVIDING SHELTER FROM INCLEMENT WEATHER ADA COMPLIANT RESTROOM FACILITIES AND VENDING MACHINES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT RIDERS OF THE GO TRANSIT SYSTEM AS WELL AS PASSENGERS TRANSFERRING TO INTERCITY BUS ROUTES. OUR COMMUNITY WILL HAVE A MODERN SAFE AND ACCESSIBLE TRANSIT HUB DOWNTOWN AND ALL RESIDENTS BUSINESSES STUDENTS AND VISITORS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE IMPROVEMENTS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NO SUBRECIPIENTS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THE PROJECT IS TO UPDATE ALL BUILDING AND BUS SECURITY SURVEILLANCE CAMERAS AND REPLACE AGED AND NON-FUNCTIONING DESTINATION SIGNS ON BUSES WHICH ASSIST RIDERS TO FIND THE ROUTE THEY INTENDED TO TAKE. THE GRANT WILL ALSO REPLACE 4 PARATRANSIT VEHICLES (3 2009 1 2016) THAT HAVE MET USEFUL LIFE BALANCE AND MILEAGE. FINALLY WE PLAN TO CONDUCT INTERIOR DESIGN AND RENOVATION IN OUR ADMIN/MAINTENANCE FACILITY TO IMPROVE FUNCTIONALITY AND ADDRESS ADA AND STRUCTURAL ISSUES.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: CAMERAS WILL BE REPLACED AT TWO PROPERTY LOCATIONS TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL SECURITY FOR RIDERS AND EMPLOYEES. A NEW CAMERA SYSTEM WILL BE INSTALLED ON FIXED-ROUTE BUSES AND PARATRANSIT VEHICLES TO ALLOW FOR EASIER ACCESS TO FOOTAGE AND HIGHER RESOLUTION OF ACTIVITIES OCCURRING ON BUSES. BROKEN AND OBSOLETE ELECTRONIC DESTINATION SIGNS WILL BE REPLACED ON FIXED-ROUTE BUSES TO GIVE A VISUAL NOTIFICATION TO RIDERS NEEDING TO KNOW WHAT ROUTE/DESTINATION THE BUS IS TRAVELING. FOUR DEMAND RESPONSE PARATRANSIT VEHICLES THAT HAVE MET USEFUL LIFE WILL BE REPLACED. THIS WILL ALLOW RYDE RACINE TO PROVIDE RELIABLE SERVICE WITH REDUCED MAINTENANCE COSTS. DESIGN AND ENGINEERING OF ADMINISTRATIVE/MAINTENANCE FACILITIES WILL BE CONDUCTED TO IMPROVE INTERIOR FUNCTIONALITY ADDRESS ADA AND STRUCTURAL ISSUES. THE WORK WILL INCLUDE INTERIOR RENOVATION OF ADMINISTRATIVE/MAINTENANCE FACILITIES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: REPLACEMENT OF AGED AND NON-FUNCTIONING EQUIPMENT WITH EQUIPMENT THAT IS RELIABLE EASIER FOR EMPLOYEES TO USE AND WILL ENHANCE SERVICE PROVIDED TO RIDERS. REDUCED COST TO MAINTAIN AGED PARATRANSIT FLEET. IMPROVED AND COMPLIANT WORKSPACE FOR EMPLOYEES AND MECHANICS AT FACILITIES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: RIDERS DRIVERS AND MECHANICS WILL BENEFIT FROM ALL IMPROVEMENTS LISTED. ALSO ENHANCED CAMERA SYSTEMS WILL ALLOW THE PUBLIC WILL HAVE INCREASED SECURITY AND PARTNERSHIP WITH LAW ENFORCEMENT AS NEEDED FOR BUSES AS THEY TRAVEL THROUGH COMMUNITY.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO FUND THE BUS FACILITY RENOVATION PROJECTS INCLUDING SATELLITE FACILITY ACQUIRED WITH FTA FUNDS IN JULY 2021 TO OUTFIT IT FOR TRANSIT PURPOSES. FORMALLY IT WAS USED AS A FEDEX PROCESSING CENTER AND WAREHOUSE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS UNDER THIS GRANT WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT THE BUS FACILITY RENOVATION PROJECTS INCLUDING SATELLITE FACILITY ACQUIRED WITH FTA FUNDS IN JULY 2021 TO OUTFIT THE FORMER FEDEX PROCESSING CENTER AND WAREHOUSE FOR TRANSIT PURPOSES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL ALLOW THE CITY OF MADISON--METRO TRANSIT TO RENOVATE THE BUS FACILITY IN ORDER TO USE IT FOR TRANSIT BUS SERVICES AND STORAGE. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR SERVICE EXPANSION AND HELP IMPROVE SAFETY.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFIT FOR THE CITY OF MADISON AND DANE COUNTY RIDERS WILL BE THE IMPROVED TRANSIT OPTIONS WHICH ENHANCE THE PUBLIC TRANSIT EXPERIENCE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND CAPITAL PURCHASES FOR TRANSIT SERVICE TO THE GREATER LA CROSSE AND LA CRESCENT AREA.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR THE CAPITAL PURCHASES OF 4 BUSES AND FOR ALL ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES TO PROVIDE CONTINUED TRANSIT OPERATIONS IN 2023.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT GROWTH IN SERVICE AND PROVIDE RELIABLE SERVICE TO THE RESIDENTS OF THE GREATER LA CROSSE AND LA CRESCENT AREA.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS AWARD WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS OF THE CITY OF LA CROSSE TOWN OF CAMPBELL CITY OF ONALASKA AND CITY OF LA CRESCENT BY PROVIDING CONTINUED TRANSIT SERVICE WITH A WELL-MAINTAINED FLEET.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NO SUBRECIPIENTS.

APPLICATION EXECUTIVE SUMMARYTHIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST 5307 AND 5339 FUNDS APPORTIONED AS FOLLOWS: MILWAUKEE UZA FY20 5339 FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $84721; MILWAUKEE UZA FY21 5339 FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $55279; MILWAUKEE UZA FY20 5307 FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $467942.THE APPLICATION REQUESTS FUNDS FOR MULTIPLE PROJECTS INCLUDING VEHICLE REPLACEMENT FOR DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE THE CAPITAL COST OF THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE. THIS GRANT APPLICATION IS FOR A TOTAL OF $759928 WITH $607942 FEDERAL AND $151986 LOCAL MATCH. THE LOCAL MATCH WILL BE PROVIDED THROUGH THE LOCAL TAX LEVY.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE ONE YEAR OF ASSISTANCE FOR THE CAPITAL COST OF THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE AND THE PURCHASE OF 2 REPLACEMENT VEHICLES FOR OZAUKEE COUNTY TRANSIT SERVICES TO ASSIST IN FIXED ROUTE AND DEMAND RESPONSE TRANSIT SERVICES. THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE FOR THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING ASSISTANCE IS 01/01/2022 - 12/31/2022; THE VEHICLE REPLACEMENTS ARE EXPECTED TO OCCUR BETWEEN 01/01/2022 AND 12/31/2024. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT ARE VEHICLE REPLACEMENTS PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE AND THE CAPITAL COST OF 3RD PARTY CONTRACTING. ROLLING STOCK BEING REPLACED WILL HAVE MET OR EXCEEDED ITS USEFUL LIFE OF 5 YRS/150000 MILES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT OZAUKEE COUNTY TRANSIT SERVICES TO MEET PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE STANDARDS KEEP ROLLING STOCK IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR AND CONTINUE 3RD PARTY CONTRACTED SERVICES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: OZAUKEE COUNTY TRANSIT SERVICES AND THE RIDERS WHO RELY ON ITS SERVICE FOR ACCESS TO TRANSPORTATION WILL BENEFIT FROM CONTINUED SERVICE AND RELIABLE VEHICLES TO PROVIDE THE SERVICE. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONEDOCUMENTS ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION ARE: PROJECT STIP/TIP HUMAN SERVICES COORDINATION PLAN FOR OZAUKEE COUNTY AND FUNDING DISTRIBUTION LETTERS FROM SEWRPC FOR FY20 AND FY21. IN EXECUTING THIS GRANT THE RECIPIENT OZAUKEE COUNTY TRANSIT SERVICES AGREES TO ABIDE BY SECTION 3011 OF THE FAST ACT (49 U.S.C.533(J)(2)(C) REGARDING THE PHASED INCREASE IN DOMESTIC CONTENT UNDER THE BUY AMERICA STATUE FOR ROLLING STOCK. AS GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDES AN FTA-FUNDED TRANSIT VEHICLE PURCHASE RECIPIENT AGREES TO COMPLY WITH THE RELATED REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN 49 CFR SECTION 26.49(A). SPECIFICALLY RECIPIENT MUST ENSURE AS A CONDITION OF BEING AUTHORIZED TO BID OR PROPOSE ON FTA-ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS THAT EACH TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER CERTIFIED THAT IT COMPLIED WITH DOT REQUIREMENTS FOR SUBMITTING A DBE PROGRAM AND GOAL TO FTA PRIOR TO BIDDING. RECIPIENT IS ALSO REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE NAME OF THE SUCCESSFUL BIDDER AND THE TOTAL DOLLAR VALUE OF THE CONTRACT WITHIN 30 DAYS OF MAKING AN FTA - ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE AWARD USING THE REQUIRED FTA REPORTING TOOL RECIPIENT UNDERSTANDS THAT FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS MAY RESULT IN FORMAL ENFORCEMENT ACTION OR APPROPRIATE SANCTION AS DETERMINED BY FTA INCLUDING REIMBURSEMENT OF FTA FUNDS USED FOR THE VEHICLE PROCUREMENT.

THE FEDERAL FUNDS ARE FROM THE FOLLOWING PROGRAMS:-SECTION 5307 FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $4051987 FROM FFY2020; $12406474 FROM FFY2021-STBG FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $3557523 FROM STATE ID 2967-18-00 FROM FFY2021-SECTION 5339 FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $2094984 FROM FFY2019 MILWAUKEE COUNTY DIRECT ALLOCATION; $2394891 FROM FFY2020 MILWAUKEE COUNTY DIRECT ALLOCATION; $854040 FROM FFY2021 MILWAUKEE COUNTY DIRECT ALLOCATIONLOCAL FUNDS OF $6339975 ARE FROM VEHICLE REGISTRATION FEE PROCEEDS.ATTACHMENTS TO THIS GRANT INCLUDE VEHICLE REPLACEMENT INFORMATION FUND ALLOCATION LETTERS AND STIP INFORMATION: TIP #82 FROM 21-24 STIP; TIP #570 FROM 21-24 STIP; TIP #92 FROM 21-24 STIP; TIP #399 FROM 21-24 STIP; TIP #520 FROM 21-24 STIP.-PURPOSE: FUNDS AWARDED FOR THIS VEHICLE PURCHASE WILL ASSIST THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY TRANSIT SYSTEMS EFFORTS TO PROVIDE MORE EFFICIENT AND RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION TO THE FIXED-ROUTE TRANSIT RIDERS IN MILWAUKEE COUNTY.-ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: PURCHASE OF FIFTY-NINE (59) 40-FOOT CLEAN DIESEL BUSES.-EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THESE REPLACEMENT BUSES ARE EXPECTED TO OFFER LOWER EMISSIONS AND FEWER ROAD CALLS RESULTING IN A CLEANER MORE RELIABLE SERVICE FOR RIDERS. -INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ALL USERS OF THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY TRANSIT SYSTEMS FIXED ROUTE SERVICE.-SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A - THERE IS NO SUBRECIPIENT. IN EXECUTING THIS GRANT MILWAUKEE COUNTY AGREES TO ABIDE BY SECTION 3011 OF THE FAST ACT (49 U.S.C. 5323(J)(2)(C) REGARDING THE PHASED INCREASE IN DOMESTIC CONTENT UNDER THE BUY AMERICA STATUTE FOR ROLLING STOCK. AS GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDES AN FTA-FUNDED TRANSIT VEHICLE PURCHASE RECIPIENT AGREES TO COMPLY WITH THE RELATED REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN 49 CFR 26.49(A). SPECIFICALLY RECIPIENT MUST ENSURE AS A CONDITION OF BEING AUTHORIZED TO BID OR PROPOSE ON FTA-ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS THAT EACH TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER CERTIFIED THAT IT COMPLIED WITH DOT REQUIREMENTS FOR SUBMITTING A DBE PROGRAM AND GOAL TO FTA PRIOR TO BIDDING. RECIPIENT IS ALSO REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE NAME OF THE SUCCESSFUL BIDDER AND THE TOTAL DOLLAR VALUE OF THE CONTRACT WITHIN 30 DAYS OF MAKING A FTA- ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE AWARD USING THE REQUIRED FTA REPORTING TOOL. RECIPIENT UNDERSTANDS THAT FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS MAY RESULT IN FORMAL ENFORCEMENT ACTION OR APPROPRIATE SANCTION AS DETERMINED BY FTA INCLUDING REIMBURSEMENT OF FTA FUNDS USED FOR THE VEHICLE PROCUREMENT.

PURPOSE: THIS GRANT PROVIDES $428425 OF FY 2019 SECTION 5339 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES (LAPSING) FOR THE PURCHASE AND REPLACEMENT OF ONE (1) FIXED ROUTE HEAVY DUTY BUS AND ONE (1) PARATRANSIT MEDIUM DUTY BUS PLUS $1840000 IN FY 2021 5307 CMAQ FUNDS FOR THE PURCHASE AND REPLACEMENT OF FIVE (5) ADDITIONAL FIXED ROUTE HEAVY DUTY BUSES. THE TOTAL FEDERAL FUNDING IS A COMBINED $2268425 AND MATCHED AT 20% LOCAL SHARE FOR THE PURCHASE AND REPLACEMENT OF TRANSIT VEHICLES . THE LOCAL SHARE OF $567107 IS FUNDED THROUGH THE GENERAL FUND VIA CAPITAL BORROWING (BONDING). THE TOTAL COST OF THIS PROJECT IS $2835532.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: CAPITAL PROCUREMENT FOR SIX (6) REPLACEMENT DIESEL BUSES WITH A USEFUL LIFE OF 12 YEARS AND 500000 MILES PLUS ONE (1) REPLACEMENT PARATRANSIT VEHICLE WITH A USEFUL LIFE OF 7 YEARS OR 200000 MILES FOR SHORELINE METRO/CITY OF SHEBOYGAN WISCONSIN TRANSIT SERVICE.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS CAPITAL PROJECT WILL INCREASE EFFICIENCY AND CAPACITY AND MAKE OPERATIONS MUCH MORE EFFECTIVE IN DELIVERING PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICE TO CUSTOMERS. SHORELINE METRO EXPECTS RIDERSHIP TO CONTINUE INCREASING IN 2022 AND THE NEW VEHICLES WILL GREATLY ASSIST IN THESE INCREASES AND MAKE OPERATIONS MUCH MORE EFFICIENT AND EFFECTIVE. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: RESIDENTS VISITORS BUSINESSES AND THE TRANSIT-DEPENDENT POPULATION OF THE SHEBOYGAN METRO AREA. THIS CAPITAL PROJECT REPLACES HEAVY-DUTY FIXED ROUTE VEHICLES CURRENTLY IN REVENUE SERVICE THAT ARE 19+ YEARS OLD. THESE VEHICLES HAVE SIGNIFICANT MILEAGE AND ARE BECOMING COSTLY TO OPERATE. THE PROJECT BENEFITS AIR QUALITY IN THE SHEBOYGAN UZA BY REPLACING OLD INEFFICIENT AND DIRTY BUSES WITH NEW CLEAN DIESEL BUSES THAT SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCE POLLUTANTS EMITTED BY THE BUS INTO THE ATMOSPHERE. THESE VEHICLES MEET ALL THE NEW AIR QUALITY CONTROL SPECIFICATIONS AND WILL MAKE SHORELINE METROS FLEET CLEANER FOR THE ENVIRONMENT. THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (WISDOT) RECEIVED TWO PARTIAL AWARDS THROUGH FTAS FFY2018 SECTION 5339(C) LOW OR NO EMISSION (LOW/NO) GRANT PROGRAM -- ONE OF $1500000 TO FUND MULTIPLE RURAL TRANSIT AGENCY CUTAWAY BATTERY ELECTRIC BUS (BEB) PROJECTS THE OTHER OF $1475000 - ORIGINALLY TO FUND A HEAVY-DUTY BEB PROJECT FOR THE CITY OF MERRILL. FTA SUBSEQUENTLY APPROVED A SCOPE CHANGE REQUEST FOR THE LATTER PERMITTING WISDOT TO APPLY THE HEAVY-DUTY BEB PROJECT FUNDS TOWARDS AN EXPANDED SET OF CUTAWAY BEB PROJECTS. THE TOTAL FTA FUNDING IS $2975000 IN FY18 5339 LOW-NO FUNDS. WISDOT NOW SEEKS TO ACCESS FUNDS FOR THE BATTERY ELECTRIC CUTAWAY BUS PROJECTS. WISDOT IS SUB-ALLOCATING THESE FUNDS TO THE BAD RIVER TRIBE OF THE LAKE SUPERIOR CHIPPEWA (BAD RIVER) BAY AREA RURAL TRANSIT COMMISSION (BART) DUNN COUNTY TRANSIT COMMISSION (DCT) LA CROSSE COUNTY AND THE RED CLIFF BAND OF LAKE SUPERIOR CHIPPEWA (RED CLIFF). EACH SUB-ALLOCATION SAVE BAD RIVERS WILL HELP FINANCE THE ACQUISITION OF TWO CUTAWAY BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES ACCOMPANYING CHARGING EQUIPMENT AND RELATED FACILITY IMPROVEMENTS TO INCLUDE UPGRADED ELECTRICAL SERVICE. BAD RIVERS SUB-ALLOCATION WILL HELP FINANCE THE ACQUISITION OF ONE CUTAWAY BEB ACCOMPANYING CHARGING EQUIPMENT AND RELATED FACILITY IMPROVEMENTS. BART AND DCT WILL BE DRAWING LOCAL MATCH FUNDS FROM COMMISSION RESERVE ACCOUNTS WHICH IN TURN ARE FUNDED PRIMARILY BY TAX REVENUE CONTRIBUTIONS FROM MUNICIPALITIES THEY SERVE. LA CROSSE COUNTY WILL USE COUNTY PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION TRUST ACCOUNTS FUNDED WITH BOTH STATE GRANT ALLOCATIONS AND COUNTY REVENUES AND COUNTY TAX REVENUE AS LOCAL MATCH. BAD RIVER WILL TAP ITS CAPITAL RESERVE FUND TO PROVIDE LOCAL MATCH FUNDS. RED CLIFF WILL USE A SET-ASIDE OF ITS TRIBAL TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM FORMULA FUNDS AS LOCAL MATCH FOR ITS PROJECT. LOCAL MATCH FOR THE PROJECTS TOTALS $486500: THE BATTERY ELECTRIC - NO EMISSION BUSES QUALIFY FOR 85% FEDERAL SHARE. THE ASSOCIATED ELECTRIC CHARGERS AND FACILITY UPGRADES QUALIFY FOR 90% FEDERAL SHARE UNDER THE PROJECT SELECTION AND AWARD.THE FIVE CUTAWAY BUS PROJECTS ARE INCLUDED IN THE APRIL 2021 AMENDMENT TO WISCONSINS 2021-2024 STIP. THE AMENDMENT AND FTAS SUBSEQUENT APPROVAL LETTER ARE ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION. THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS DISCRETIONARY AWARD INFORMATION AND FTA SCOPE CHANGE REQUEST INFO AND APPROVAL ARE ALSO ATTACHED. THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES $6380100 IN FY 2021 SECTION 5339(C) LOW-NO COMPETITIVE FUNDING (DISCRETIONARY ID #D2021-LWNO-050) FOR THE PURCHASE APPROXIMATELY TEN (10) 40-FT FIXED ROUTE BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES TO REPLACE DIESEL BUSES THAT HAVE REACHED THEIR USEFUL LIFE. THE PROJECT PART OF AN ONGOING FLEET REPLACEMENT STRATEGY WILL REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND IMPROVE AIR QUALITY FOR SPOKANE RESIDENTS.PURPOSETO PURCHASE APPROXIMATELY TEN (10) NEW BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES WHICH WILL REPLACE DIESEL BUSES THAT HAVE EXCEEDED THE MINIMUM USEFUL LIFE AND WHICH SUPPORTS THE STA BOARDS LONG-TERM FLEET TRANSITION PLAN (ADOPTED IN DECEMBER 2014 BY RESOLUTION).ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMEDPURCHASE AND DELIVERY OF APPROXIMATELY TEN (10) NEW BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES WHICH WILL OPERATE ON FIVE FIXED ROUTES (20222728 33) SERVING URBAN AREAS WITHIN THE CITY OF SPOKANE NORTH OF I-90.EXPECTED OUTCOMESFUNDING WILL PERMIT SPOKANE TRANSIT TO PROVIDE SIGNIFICANT BENEFITS TO ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE POPULATIONS IN THE PROPOSED SERVICE AREA BY PROVIDING A CLEANER TRANSPORTATION ALTERNATIVE. INTENDED BENEFICIARIESTHE ROUTES TO WHICH THE BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES SOUGHT FOR IN THIS GRANT WILL BE PRIMARILY ASSIGNED TO SERVE SOME OF THE MOST VULNERABLE POPULATIONS IN SPOKANE. BASED ON 2017 AMERICAN COMMUNITY SURVEY DATA 21% OF RESIDENTS LIVE IN POVERTY WITH 48% OF RESIDENTS AT THE 200% OF THE POVERTY LEVEL. IN ADDITION 20% OF THE RESIDENTS ARE NON-WHITE AND 17% OF RESIDENTS LIVE WITH A DISABILITY. ZERO-EMISSION BUSES WILL IMPROVE ACCESS AND MOBILITY FOR THESE VULNERABLE POPULATIONS IN SPOKANE.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIESN/A

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS IS A VERMONT AGENCY OF TRANSPORTATION (VTRANS 1393) REQUEST FOR $2275616 FEDERAL/ $284452 STATE/ $284452 LOCAL AWARDED IN FFY2022 FOR SFY23 5339 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES COMPETITIVE DISCRETIONARY FUNDING. THE MARBLE VALLEY REGIONAL TRANSIT DISTRICT OFFICE FACILITY IS OVERDUE FOR IMPROVEMENTS. THE NEW OFFICE FACILITY IS NEEDED TO PROVIDE NECESSARY INFRASTRUCTURE FOR ADMIN STAFF. PROJECT #1 WILL DEMOLISH AND CONSTRUCT A NEW ADMINISTRATIVE BUILDING AT 165 SPRUCE STREET RUTLAND VERMONT. THE AE COSTS FOR PROJECT #1 LOCATED AT 165 SPRUCE STREET ARE FUNDED WITH $240000 FEDERAL UNDER TRAMS GRANT #VT-2021-011-01. ADDITIONALLY A PORTION OF CONSTRUCTION COSTS FOR PROJECT #1 LOCATED AT 165 SPRUCE STREET ARE FUNDED WITH $720000 FEDERAL UNDER TRAMS GRANT #VT-2021-011-01. THE REMAINING BALANCE OF $1004000 FEDERAL/$125500 STATE/$125500 LOCAL OF DISCRETIONARY FUNDING WILL BE OBLIGATED IN A FUTURE GRANT.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:PROJECT 1 WILL FUND:* NEW ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE BUILDING CONSTRUCTION AT 165 SPRUCE STREET RUTLAND VT.$2275616 FEDERAL/ $284452 STATE/ $284452 LOCAL* TOTAL ADDITIONAL PROJECT COSTS NOT COVERED UNDER GRANT #VT-2021-011-01$2275616 FEDERAL/ $284452 STATE/ $284452 LOCAL; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: EXPECTED OUTCOMES:SEE ATTACHED PROGRAM OF PROJECTS FOR DETAILED BREAKDOWN OF ALL SCOPES/ALIS IN 2019 MVRTD WAS GRANTED 5304 PLANNING FUNDS TO STUDY THEIR FACILITY NEEDS. THE CURRENT MVRTD TRANSIT FACILITY IS THE OLDEST IN VERMONT AND WAS ORIGINALLY RE-PURPOSED FOR TRANSIT OPERATIONS IN THE MID-1970S. FACILITY IMPROVEMENTS IDENTIFIED IN THAT STUDY INCLUDED EXPANDING THE ADMIN OFFICES CONSTRUCT COVERED PARKING FOR THEIR BUSES AND INCORPORATE ENERGY EFFICIENT MEASURES. VTRANS WAS SUPPORTIVE OF THOSE PLANS AND IN 2020 BEGAN FUNDING THE NECESSARY PLANNING AND PERMITTING PROCESSES TO PREPARE THE PROJECT FOR THIS 5339 COMPETITIVE GRANT. AS A RESULT THE AE (ATTACHMENT A) AND PERMITTING HAS BEEN COMPLETED AND THIS PROJECT IS TRULY SHOVEL-READY. THIS PROJECT HAS ALREADY STARTED WITH FTA STATE AND LOCAL FUNDING COMMITMENTS TO DATE AND FUNDS THROUGH THIS GRANT PROGRAM WOULD LIKELY BE AWARDED IN TIME TO ALLOW FOR A RELATIVELY SMOOTH CONTINUITY IN PROJECT ACTIVITY. ; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:VTRANS IS SUBMITTING THIS APPLICATION TO MAKE TRANSIT FACILITY IMPROVEMENTS AT THE MARBLE VALLEY REGIONAL TRANSIT DISTRICT (MVRTD). THESE IMPROVEMENTS CONSIST OF THE DEMOLITION OF AN EXISTING STRUCTURE THE CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW OFFICE BUILDING AND THE CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW BUS BARN. MVRTD IS A REGIONAL TRANSIT DISTRICT BASED IN RUTLAND VT AND THEIR SERVICES ARE LARGELY SERVING RUTLAND COUNTY LESS THE TOWN OF PITTSFIELD WITH ROUTES IN MIDDLEBURY (ADDISON COUNTY) AND MANCHESTER (BENNINGTON COUNTY) VERMONT COVERING ROUGHLY 10% OF THE STATES POPULATION. THESE SERVICES ARE DETAILED IN THE ROUTE SCHEDULE(S) PUBLISHED AND INCLUDE FIXED ROUTE COMMUTER DEMAND RESPONSE TOURISM AND ED. MVRTDS SYSTEM IS DESIGNED TO CONNECT PEOPLE PARTICULARLY THOSE LIVING IN LOW INCOME AND/OR SENIOR HOUSING TO CENTERS OF SHOPPING MEDICAL CARE AND EMPLOYMENT. THE RUTLAND REGION IS A HUB AND SPOKE MODEL BASED FROM THE RUTLAND MULTI MODAL TRANSIT CENTER. SERVICES INCLUDE LOCAL RUTLAND ROUTES AND CONNECTING RUTLAND TO THE TOURIST RESORTS TO THE NORTH AND SOUTHEAST. COMMUTER ROUTES CONNECT COMMUNITIES NORTH AND SOUTH OF RUTLAND ALONG ROUTE 7.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:VTRANS IS THE DIRECT RECIPIENT OF THIS GRANT THE AE AND CONSTRUCTION WILL BE CARRIED OUT BY MVRTD UNDER BOTH INDIVIDUAL AND STATEWIDE JOINT PROCUREMENTS. VTRANS WILL OVERSEE THE PROCUREMENTS AND INCLUDE THE COST OF THE PROJECTS IN THEIR YEARLY GRANT AGREEMENTS.

VTRANS IS REQUESTING $1026659 FEDERAL FY 2021 5339 LOW NO DISCRETIONARY FUNDS $60157 STATE AND $116313 LOCAL. PURPOSE:VTRANS IS REQUESTING $1026659 FEDERAL TO PURCHASE FOUR BATTERY ELECTRIC CUTAWAY BUSES AND PURCHASE AND INSTALL FOUR 24 KW DC ELECTRIC VEHICLE CHARGERS (EVSE). DC CHARGERS REQUIRE THE LEAST AMOUNT OF SITE WORK TO INSTALL AT EACH OF TRI-VALLEY TRANSIT (TVTS) SITES AND WILL SUPPORT MIDDAY CHARGING BOOSTING DAILY MILEAGE. THE ELECTRIC BUSES WILL SUPPORT EXISTING FIXED ROUTES AND DEMAND RESPONSE TRIPS IN TWO REGIONS SERVED BY TVT AND REPLACE GASOLINE-POWERED VEHICLES THAT HAVE REACHED THE END OF THEIR USEFUL LIFE PER FTA GUIDELINES. VTRANS IS COMMITTED TO DEPLOYING ALL-ELECTRIC TRANSIT VEHICLES THROUGHOUT THE STATE AND HAS SECURED FUNDING TO SUPPORT PROJECTS FOR FIVE OF THE SEVEN PROVIDERS OPERATING IN VERMONT. THIS PROJECT WILL INTRODUCE ELECTRIC BUSES TO A NEW PROVIDER THAT COVERS A WIDE SWATH OF THE STATE INCREASING AWARENESS OF ELECTRIC VEHICLES AND EXPANDING THE BENEFITS OF THIS TECHNOLOGY TO MORE VERMONTERS. IT WILL ALSO ADVANCE VTRANS COMMITMENT TO DEPLOY ALL-ELECTRIC TRANSIT BUSES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. LOCAL MATCHING FUNDS FOR THE PROJECT WILL BE PROVIDED BY VTRANS TVT AND GREEN MOUNTAIN POWER TVTS UTILITY.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:PROJECT 1:* TRI VALLEY TRANSIT - $954659 FEDERAL $56157 STATE $112313 LOCALPROJECT DETAILS: * TRI VALLEY TRANSIT INC. (TVT) TO PURCHASE FOUR (4) MEDIUM SIZE LIGHT DUTY BATTERY ELECTRIC CUTAWAY BUS 23 14 SEATS 2 W/C REPLACEMENT VEHICLES. VEHICLES TO BE REPLACED ARE AS FOLLOWS; 1. A 2016 FORD/EL DORADO NATIONAL AERO LITE 12-PASSENGER BUS IN MODERATE CONDITION WITH 104922 MILES; 1FDFE4FS8GDC57885 BUS 54 2. A 2015 FORD/EL DORADO NATIONAL AERO LITE 20-PASSENGER BUS IN GOOD CONDITION WITH 136850 MILES; 1FDAF5GY8FED12098 BUS 48 3. A 2016 FORD/EL DORADO F550 20-PASSENGER BUS IN ADEQUATE CONDITION WITH 160739 MILES; 1FDGF5GY7CEC46956 BUS 728 4. AND A FORD/EL DORADO NATIONAL F550 20-PASSENGER BUS IN GOOD CONDITION WITH 183653 MILES 1FDFE4FS2FDA37611 BUS 731PROJECT 2:THIS PROJECT WILL ALLOW TRI VALLEY TRANSIT INC. (TVT) TO PURCHASE AND INSTALL INFRASTRUCTURE UPGRADE FOR EV BUS FLEET AT $72000 FEDERAL $4000 STATE AND $4000 LOCALPROJECT DETAILS:* TVT TO PURCHASE FOUR (4) 24KW DC CHARGERS AT $36000 FEDERAL/$2000 LOCAL/ $2000 STATE* TVT WILL COMPLETE ONE (1) UVC TRANSIT FACILITY CHARGER INSTALLATION AT $18000 FEDERAL/ $1000 LOCAL/ $1000 STATE* TVT WILL COMPLETE ONE (1) ACC TRANSIT FACILITY CHARGER INSTALLATION AT $18000 FEDERAL/ $1000 LOCAL/$1000 STATEEXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE CUTAWAYS WILL SUPPORT EXISTING FIXED ROUTE SERVICE AND DEMAND RESPONSE TRIPS IN TVT SERVICES AREAS. THIS PROJECT IS CRITICAL TO EXPAND ELECTRIC BUS ADOPTION AMONG VERMONTS RURAL PROVIDERS WHO PRIMARILY OPERATE CUTAWAYS TO SUPPORT FIXED ROUTE AND DEMAND RESPONSE TRIPS. THE MATCHING FUNDS COMMITTED FROM LOCAL MATCH WILL BE RAISED BY TVT FROM MUNICIPAL REQUESTS FROM GREEN MOUNTAIN POWER CONTRIBUTIONS AND FROM VTRANS T-FUND FROM GAS TAX AND ASSOCIATED FEES. FINANCIAL COMMITMENT LETTERS ARE ATTACHED. IN 2017 THE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS IN ADDISON ORANGE AND NORTHERN WINDSOR COUNTIES MERGED TO FORM TRI-VALLEY TRANSIT. AFTER CONTINUING TO DO BUSINESS AS ACTR AND STAGECOACH UNTIL JUST RECENTLY THE SYSTEM HAS NOW TRANSITIONED FULLY TO TRI-VALLEY TRANSIT (TVT). WITH REGIONAL OFFICES REMAINING IN MIDDLEBURY AND RANDOLPH THIS CHANGE IN THE COMPANYS IMAGE REFLECTS THE UNIFICATION THAT BETTER MEETS THE TRANSPORTATION NEEDS FOR PEOPLE IN 50 TOWNS ACROSS A 2400 SQUARE MILE STRETCH OF CENTRAL VERMONT.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE FEDERAL SUBRECIPIENTS AND THE RIDING PUBLIC. THE LOW NO FUNDING HELPS VERMONT TO MAINTAIN SAFE RELIABLE FRIENDLY AND ACCESSIBLE PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICES FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. VERMONT PROVIDERS CONTINUE TO MAINTAIN SAFETY PROTOCOLS ON THEIR BUSES TRANSIT CENTERS ADMINISTRATIVE FACILITIES BUS STOPS AND SHELTERS IN AN EFFORT TO MAINTAIN AND IMPROVE THE RIDING PUBLICS CONFIDENCE IN PUBLIC TRANSIT.TRI-VALLEY TRANSIT (TVT) PROVIDES PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES IN ADDISON ORANGE AND NORTHERN WINDSOR COUNTIES OF VERMONT. TVT RELIES UPON THE GENEROUS SUPPORT OF INDIVIDUALS BUSINESSES TOWNS AND PHILANTHROPIC ORGANIZATIONS TO SUPPLEMENT THEIR PUBLIC GRANTS AS WELL AS TO PROVIDE THE LOCAL MATCH REQUIRED TO DRAW DOWN FEDERAL AWARDED GRANT FUNDS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:VTRANS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS TO EXECUTE THE ACTIVITIES IN THIS GRANT -TRI VALLEY TRANSIT INC. (TVT). SERVICE TYPES INCLUDED FIXED ROUTE DEVIATED FIXED ROUTE COMMUTER DEMAND RESPONSE.SMALL BATTERY ELECTRIC CUTAWAY BUSES ARE NOT CURRENTLY ALTOONA TESTED. FTA DOES NOT REQUIRE A VEHICLE MANUFACTURER TO TEST ITS MODEL BEFORE BIDDING. HOWEVER RECIPIENTS OF FTA FUNDS ACQUIRING ANY BUS MODEL MUST CERTIFY THAT AN EXAMPLE OF THAT MODEL WILL HAVE BEEN TESTED AND THE RECIPIENT WILL HAVE RECEIVED A COPY OF THE RESULTING TEST REPORT PREPARED ON THE BUS MODEL BEFORE THE FINAL ACCEPTANCE OF THE FIRST VEHICLE. EFFECTIVE OCTOBER 31 2016 THE EFFECTIVE DATE OF THE REVISION TO 49 CFR PART 665 RECIPIENTS MUST CERTIFY THAT THE BUS MODELS SUBMITTED TO ALTOONA FOLLOWING THE EFFECTIVE DATE RECEIVED A PASSING SCORE BEFORE FTA FUNDS CAN BE SPENT ON THAT VEHICLE. A DETAILED LIST OF BUS PURCHASES IS CONTAINED IN THE BUDGET DETAILS AS WELL AS IN THE ATTACHED PROGRAM OF PROJECTS. VTRANS GRANTS FUNDING TO ITS PROVIDERS TO PURCHASE VEHICLES. VTRANS WILL BE LISTED ON THE VEHICLE TITLES AS THE OWNER/LESSEE AND A FORMAL LETTER OF THIS ARRANGEMENT IS ATTACHED. VTRANS CONTINUES TO EXERCISE SATISFACTORY CONTINUING CONTROL OF THE ASSETS. THE PHYSICAL (PAPER) TITLES RESIDE AT VTRANS TO SECURE THE USE OF THE VEHICLE FOR TRANSIT PURPOSES AND TO ENSURE THAT THE INVESTMENT BOTH FEDERAL AND STATE IS RECOVERED WHEN IT IS DISPOSED.ALL ADMINISTRATIVE AND STATUTORY REQUIREMENTS HAVE BEEN MET. VTRANS IS CURRENT WITH ALL CIVIL RIGHTS REQUIREMENTS AND FTA ANNUAL CERTIFICATIONS. ADA AND CLEAN AIR REQUIREMENTS WILL BE MET BY THIS PURCHASE. THE PROJECT IS DETAILED IN THE ATTACHED STIP. THE FEDERAL AWARD NOTICE FOR THE FY2021 LOW-NO PROGRAM WAS PUBLISHED ON JUNE 25 2021 (SEE ATTACHED).

BUDGET REVISION #2 - GRTC CURRENTLY HAS TEN (10) 29-FOOT VEHICLES. AS GRTC HAS CONTINUED TO ANALYZE ROUTE AND TRIP LEVEL RIDERSHIP THE PLAN IS TO DESIGNATE VEHICLES BASED ON CAPACITY NEEDS. GRTC HAS IDENTIFIED THIRTEEN (13) ROUTES THAT ARE CANDIDATES FOR SMALLER VEHICLES BASED ON THEIR PEAK LOAD. THE MAJORITY OF THESE ROUTES ARE NEIGHBORHOOD OR COMMUNITY RADIAL ROUTES THAT SERVE AS FEEDERS TO ARTERIALS. THESE ROUTES BEING IN THE NEIGHBORHOODS ARE PROJECTED TO REMAIN RELATIVELY STATIC ON THEIR RIDERSHIP. IN ORDER TO SUPPORT THE SMALLER VEHICLE ROUTE ASSIGNMENTS GRTC NEEDS TO INCREASE THE 29-FOOT FLEET NUMBER FROM TEN (10) TO TWENTY (20). NOT HAVING TO DEADHEAD BACK TO SALT LAKE PROVIDES A MORE RELIABLE SERVICE TO THE PUBLIC.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

PURPOSE: THIS GRANT IS FOR A TOTAL OF $4709370 FOR RURAL TRANSIT PROJECTS IN PARK CITY (SUMMIT COUNTY) UTAH. THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO ASSIST IN MEETING THE TRANSPORTATION NEEDS OF RURAL TRANSIT RIDERS BY SUPPORTING CAPITAL NEEDS AND TRAINING. THE PROJECTS HAVE BEEN EVALUATED UNDER UDOT PTTS STATE MANAGEMENT PLAN AND FTA PROGRAM REQUIREMENTS.UDOT SELECTED PARK CITY TRANSIT PROJECTS TOTALING: $2246328 - (FFY 2019 5339 STATEWIDE APPORTIONMENT PARTIAL AMOUNT LAPSING FUNDS) + $344000 - (FFY 2020 5339 STATEWIDE APPORTIONMENT PARTIAL AMOUNT) + $539990 - (FFY 2021 5339 STATEWIDE APPORTIONMENT PARTIAL AMOUNT)+ $1579052 - (FFY 2020 5311 APPORTIONMENT PARTIAL AMOUNT LAPSING FUNDS) --------------------------- TOTAL: $4709370 THE REMAINING 5339 APPORTIONMENTS FOR FFY 2019 2020 WERE SUBALLOCATED TO CACHE VALLEY AND UTA. WITH THIS APPLICATION ALL 5339 FUNDS FROM FFY 2019 AND 2020 WILL NOW BE OBLIGATED.A PORTION OF 5339 APPORTIONMENT FOR FFY 2021 WILL BE OBLIGATED WITH THIS AWARD. THE REMAINDER WILL BE APPLIED TO FUTURE AWARDS AND SUBALLOCATIONS. THE REMAINDER OF 5311 FUNDS FROM FFY2020 IS OBLIGATED IN AWARDS UT-2022-007 AND UT-2022-008. WITH THIS APPLICATION ALL 5311 FUNDS FOR FFY 2020 WILL NOW BE OBLIGATED. -----------------------------ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE GRANT SCOPE OF WORK INCLUDES PURCHASE OF ONE REPLACEMENT BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUS FIVE EXPANSION BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUSES THE PURCHASE OF TWO DEPOT CHARGERS AND ONE TRANSFORMER AND EMPLOYEE TRAINING FOR MECHANICS. THE ACTIVITIES IN THIS APPLICATION ARE BROKEN INTO MANY PROJECTS TO TRACK MULTIPLE FUNDING ACCOUNT CODES AND VARIOUS PROCUREMENT ACTIVITIES WHICH IS REPRESENTED IN THE POP DOCUMENT ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION. THE OVERALL PERFORMANCE PERIOD FOR THIS AWARD IS THROUGH JUNE 1 2024.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE GRANT WILL ENABLE THE APPROPRIATE USE OF NEW BATTERY ELECTRIC BUS TECHNOLOGY AND BENEFIT THE GENERAL POPULATION OF THE PARK CITY TRANSIT (PCT) SERVICE AREA BY INCREASING ACCESS TO OPPORTUNITIES (E.G. EMPLOYMENT EDUCATION HEALTHCARE SOCIAL ETC.) AND IMPROVING QUALITY OF LIFE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: TRANSIT RIDERS IN THE PCT SERVICE AREA ARE THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THE GRANT. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: ALL ACTIVITIES IN THIS AWARD WILL BE PERFORMED BY PARK CITY TRANSIT. COSTS FOR THREE OF THE SIX VEHICLES IN THIS APPLICATION WERE INCURRED UNDER PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY BEFORE THE START DATE OF THIS AWARD; PRE-AWARD COSTS INCURRED TOTAL APPROXIMATELY $1740218 WHICH WILL BE REPORTED IN THE INITIAL FFR.OTHER INFORMATION: ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION IS ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION INCLUDING THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS APPLICABLE PAGES FROM THE 2022-2027 UDOT STIP AND ATT LABOR AND SERVICE AREA LABOR FORM.IN ATTACHMENTS TO THIS APPLICATION UDOT ALSO DOCUMENTS THE TRANSFER OF ASSETS FROM PARK CITY TRANSIT TO HIGH VALLEY TRANSIT (HVT). IN 2021 PARK CITY TRANSFERRED FOUR VEHICLES TO HVT TITLES WERE OFFICIALLY TRANSFERRED IN 2022. ADDITIONALLY PARK CITY TRANSFERRED OWNERSHIP OF THE KIMBALL JUNCTION TRANSIT CENTER TO HVT WHICH WAS APPRAISED IN MARCH 2022. (SEE THE ATTACHED POP FOR DETAILS ON THESE TRANSFERS.)

PURPOSE: THIS GRANT AWARD APPLIES LAPSING FFY2019 5339 LOW-NO DISCRETIONARY FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $3000000 (FULL AMOUNT) THAT WAS AWARDED TO ST. GEORGE (DISCRETIONARY ID# D2019-LWNO-035). THE LOCAL MATCH WILL COME FROM SALES TAXES. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:PROJECT #1) PURCHASE OF FIVE HYDROGEN FUEL CELL BUSES. PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY WILL BE UTILIZED STARTING AUGUST 1 2022 FOR THE RFP NO FUNDS EXPENDED. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:BY PURCHASING THE HYDROGEN FUEL CELL BUSES ST. GEORGE AND SUNTRAN WILL BE ABLE TO BEGIN OPERATION OF A ROUTE STARTING IN ST. GEORGE AND ENDING IN SPRINGDALE AND ZION NATIONAL PARK.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE PURCHASE OF HYDROGEN FUEL CELL BUSES WILL ALLOW TOURISTS AND LOCAL PEOPLE TO BE ABLE TO VISIT ZION NATIONAL PARK WITHOUT HAVING TO USE A VEHICLE TO DRIVE THERE. THIS WILL BENEFIT THE PEOPLE IN SPRINGDALE AS WELL AS THOSE WHO TRAVEL TO WORK IN SPRINGDALE AS THERE IS LIMITED ROOM FOR VEHICLE PARKING. BECAUSE OF THESE CONCERNS PEOPLE WHO WORK IN SPRINGDALE MAY ALSO CHOOSE TO USE THE ROUTE TO COMMUTE TO AND FROM WORK. THIS WILL BENEFIT ALL LOCAL RESIDENTS BECAUSE THE ROUTE WILL RESULT IN LESSENED VEHICLE CONGESTION ON STATE ROUTE 9 THE ROAD THAT LEADS TO ZION NATIONAL PARK AND IT WILL BE MORE ENVIRONMENTALLY FRIENDLY SINCE THE HYDROGEN FUEL CELLS ARE ZERO EMISSION.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:ST. GEORGE IS A DIRECT RECIPIENT. THERE ARE NO SUB-RECIEPIENTS.THE FOLLOWING DOCUMENTS ARE ATTACHED TO THIS AWARD: TIP PROJECT LISTING ALONG WITH APPROVAL LETTER SF-424 AND SUPPLEMENTAL DOCUMENTS FTA APPROVAL EMAIL DATED JULY 15 2022 FOR AMENDMENT TO DISCRETIONARY AWARD ZERO EMISSION FLEET PLAN IMPLEMENTATION AND SCHEDULE FOR PROJECT.

THIS APPLICATION APPLIES FOR MULTIPLE YEARS OF 5339 FORMULA FUNDS SUBALLOCATED FROM UTAH DOT TO CACHE VALLEY TRANSIT DISTRICT TO PURCHASE REPLACEMENT VEHICLES. FUNDS APPLIED IN THIS APPLICATION INCLUDE:$376717 (LAPSING FY19 5339 SMALL URBAN FORMULA FUNDS SUBALLOCATED BY UDOT)+ $392083 (FY20 5339 SMALL URBAN FORMULA FUNDS SUBALLOCATED BY UDOT)+ $1253672 (FY19 5339 STATEWIDE FORMULA FUNDS SUBALLOCATED BY UDOT)-------------------$2022472 TOTAL FEDERAL FUNDS. SEE ATTACHED SUBALLOCATION LETTER FROM THE STATE OF UTAH DATED 9/8/2021 UNDER APPLICATION DOCUMENTS.PURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO REPLACE AGING VEHICLES THAT ARE BEYOND USEFUL LIFE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE GRANT SCOPE OF WORK IS TO PURCHASE 6 REPLACEMENT 35-FOOT BUSES FOR FIXED ROUTE SERVICE. THE ACTIVITY IN THIS GRANT IS BROKEN INTO TWO SEPARATE PROJECTS TO TRACK THE TWO DIFFERENT FUND SOURCES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE DISTRICT EXPECTS TO TAKE DELIVERY OF THE BUSES IN THE SPRING OF 2022. UPON COMPLETION OF THE FINAL INSPECTIONS ROAD TESTS BUY AMERICA AND OTHER COMPLIANCE TESTS THE DISTRICT WILL PLACE THE BUSES IN-SERVICE AND PREPARE TO DISPOSE OF THE BUSES THAT ARE BEING REPLACED. THE NEW BUSES ARE EXPECTED TO FUNCTION IN A SIMILAR CAPACITY TO THE BUSES BEING REPLACED.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE NEW BUSES ARE EXPECTED TO BENEFIT THE PASSENGERS THE DRIVERS AND THE COMMUNITY. WE ANTICIPATE THAT THE NEW BUSES WILL BE ABLE TO TRAVEL MORE MILES BETWEEN MAJOR SERVICE CALLS AND PROVIDE A MORE RELIABLE SERVICE TO THE PASSENGERS. ADDITIONALLY THE NEW BUSES WILL HAVE IMPROVED TECHNOLOGY AND MECHANICAL FEATURES THAT PROVIDE THE DRIVER WITH THE OPPORTUNITY TO BE SAFER DURING DAILY OPERATION. THE COMMUNITY ALSO BENEFITS FROM A NEWER VEHICLE BOTH FROM APPEARANCE AND OPERATION. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONETHE MATCHING FUNDS WILL BE PROVIDED FROM A STATE OF UTAH TRANSIT TRANSPORTATION INVESTMENT FUND GRANT (STATE FUNDS) AND A LOCAL OPTION SALES TAX DEDICATED TO TRANSIT. THE MATCH RATE IN THIS AWARD WILL BE FUNDED AT 70.4% FEDERAL/29.6% LOCAL MATCH DUE TO THE PRE-AWARD NATURE OF THIS PROJECT.PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY IS BEING UTILIZED FOR THIS AWARD. THE VEHICLES ARE ALREADY ON ORDER AND WILL BE DELIVERED WITHIN THE NEXT MONTH. ALL FUNDS ARE COMMITTED IN CONTRACTS AS UNLIQUIDATED OBLIGATIONS. STIP PROJECT LISTING AND APPROVAL LETTER ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION UNDER APPLICATION DOCUMENTS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS FY2020 5339 GRANT FOR $10027844 FEDERAL DOLLARS RELATIVE TO THESE TWO PROJECTS ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE WEST BELLFORT PARK RIDE MODIFICATION PROJECT WILL HELP MEET THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE CLEAN AIR ACT. THESE REQUIREMENTS CONTRIBUTE TO THE ATTAINMENT OR MAINTENANCE OF A NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARD WITH A HIGH LEVEL OF EFFECTIVENESS IN REDUCING AIR POLLUTION. SPECIFICALLY THE AWARD WILL EXPAND AND RECONFIGURE THE WEST BELLFORT PARK AND RIDE LOT DUE TO INCREASED DEMAND THAT SURPASSES THE DAILY EXISTING PARKING CAPACITY. THIS EXISTING PARK AND RIDE UTILIZES METROS BUS SERVICE AND THE EXPANSION WILL BENEFIT COMMUTERS IN SOUTHWEST HARRIS COUNTY AND FORT BEND COUNTY AND ENSURE THAT THEY HAVE ACCESS TO DOWNTOWN HOUSTON AND THE TEXAS MEDICAL CENTER. THE EXPANSION WILL ALSO SERVE RIDERS OF THE UPTOWN BUS RAPID TRANSIT (BRT) SERVICE TRAVELING TO JOBS HEALTH CARE AND OTHER ESSENTIAL SERVICES WITHIN THEIR RESPECTIVE COMMUNITIES. PROJECT MANAGEMENT FOR THE REGIONAL TRANSIT FARE COLLECTION SYSTEM PROJECT WILL REPLACE METROS CURRENT Q-CARD SYSTEM AND SOME OF THE LEGACY SYSTEMS USED BY METRO AND OTHER REGIONAL TRANSIT PROVIDERS THROUGHOUT THE HOUSTON AREA. THE NEW SYSTEM WILL PROVIDE VARIOUS PAYMENT OPTIONS FOR PATRONS AND INTEGRATE A ROBUST SALES NETWORK THAT WILL ALLOW CUSTOMERS TO PURCHASE MEDIA AND RELOAD VALUE TO THEIR ACCOUNTS USING CASH CREDIT OR DEBIT. MOBILE PAYMENT INTEGRATION WILL ALSO BE EXPANDED DURING THE PROJECT. ADDITIONALLY THE NEW FARE SYSTEM WILL PROVIDE FOR INTEGRATION AND INTEROPERABILITY WITH REGIONAL PARTNER SYSTEMS PROVIDING A SEAMLESS FARE EXPERIENCE FOR CUSTOMERS WHEN TRAVELING THROUGHOUT THE REGION. THE PROJECT WILL RESULT IN UPDATING OR REPLACING LEGACY SOFTWARE AND EQUIPMENT INCLUDING TICKET VENDING MACHINES AND VALIDATORS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE AWARD WILL ASSIST IN: (A) FUNDING THE RECONFIGURATION AND/OR CONSTRUCTION OF ADDITIONAL BUS BAYS PARKING SPACES AND A BUS CANOPY AT THE WEST BELLFORT PARK AND RIDE FACILITY. WITHIN THE EXISTING FOOTPRINT OF THE PARK AND RIDE LOT SURFACE PARKING WILL BE EXPANDED TO MAXIMIZE OPERATIONAL EFFICIENCY AND IMPROVE PATRONS ACCESS SAFETY AND SECURITY. PHASED CONSTRUCTION AND REPLACEMENT OF THE BUS CANOPY WILL ALLOW FOR THE CONTINUATION OF NORMAL BUS OPERATIONS AND SAFE AND EFFICIENT PATRON VEHICULAR AND PEDESTRIAN CIRCULATION. AND (B) PROJECT MANAGEMENT FOR REPLACING METROS CURRENT Q-CARD SYSTEM AND SOME OF THE LEGACY SYSTEMS USED BY METRO AND OTHER REGIONAL TRANSIT PROVIDERS THROUGHOUT THE HOUSTON AREA. THE NEW SYSTEM WILL ALSO PROVIDE VARIOUS PAYMENT OPTIONS FOR PATRONS AND INTEGRATE A ROBUST SALES NETWORK THAT WILL ALLOW CUSTOMERS TO PURCHASE MEDIA AND RELOAD VALUE TO THEIR ACCOUNTS USING CASH CREDIT OR DEBIT. MOBILE PAYMENT INTEGRATION WILL ALSO BE EXPANDED DURING THE PROJECT.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RECONFIGURATION/CONSTRUCTION OF WEST BELLFORT PARK RIDE LOT WITHIN THE EXISTING FOOTPRINT WILL SERVE TO MEET THE INCREASING DEMAND FOR SAFE AND EFFICIENT PUBLIC TRANSIT FOR COMMUTERS IN SOUTHWEST HARRIS COUNTY AND FORT BEND COUNTY. THE IMPROVEMENTS WILL PROVIDE SUFFICIENT PARKING AT THE SITE TO ACCOMMODATE CURRENT AND NEAR-TERM DEMAND AND REPLACE FACILITIES THAT HAVE REACHED THE END OF THEIR USEFUL LIFE. THE EXPECTED USEFUL LIFE OF THE CONCRETE GARAGE TO BE CONSTRUCTED IS APPROXIMATELY 30-40 YEARS DEPENDING ON THE LEVEL OF MAINTENANCE. CARS ILLEGALLY PARKED THROUGHOUT THE LOT DUE TO OVERCAPACITY CREATING UNSAFE CONDITIONS FOR PEDESTRIANS AND VEHICLES WILL BE ADDRESSED AND CORRECTED.THE NEW FARE COLLECTION SYSTEM WILL PROVIDE AN ENVIRONMENT THAT WILL ALLOW FOR CONSISTENCY THROUGHOUT THE TRANSIT PAYMENT ECOSYSTEM IN THE HOUSTON AREA. OPEN PAYMENTS WILL ALLOW RIDERS TO ENJOY EASY PAYMENT METHODS USING PAYMENT ITEMS THEY CURRENTLY USE FOR OTHER PURCHASES SUCH AS CREDIT AND DEBIT CARDS MOBILE PAYMENTS ELECTRONIC WALLET PAYMENT (GOOGLE PAY AND APPLE PAY) PAYPAL AS WELL AS MULTIPLE WAYS TO DEAL WITH CASH. THE SYSTEM WILL PROVIDE CONSISTENCY AMONG MACHINES AND CUSTOMER INTERFACES WITH CLEAR MESSAGING AND REGIONAL INTEGRATION WITH OTHER TRANSIT SERVICES SUCH AS PARKING HIGHWAY TOLLS AND MICRO-TRANSIT SERVICES. CUSTOMERS WILL ALSO ENJOY IMPROVED SERVICE DELIVERY THROUGH FASTER BOARDING SHORTER DWELL TIMES AND STREAMLINING THE CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE. THE ENHANCED FARE COLLECTION SYSTEM CAN ALSO COLLECT VALUABLE INFORMATION ABOUT CUSTOMER USAGE AND BEHAVIOR THROUGH ELECTRONIC VALIDATION OF ALL FARE MEDIA INCLUDING MOBILE AND PAPER MEDIA THAT CAN HELP IMPROVE SERVICES. THE NEW SYSTEM WILL ALSO FACILITATE REGIONAL INTEROPERABILITY AND ALLOW REGIONAL TRANSIT PROVIDERS TO INTERCONNECT SERVICES SHARE INFORMATION AND PROVIDE A SEAMLESS PAYMENT EXPERIENCE FOR THE CUSTOMER.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: BENEFICIARIES OF THE TWO PROJECTS WILL BE THE POPULACE OF THE HOUSTON METRO TRANSIT SERVICE AREA AND LOCAL AREA COMMUTERS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

AWARD EXECUTIVE SUMMARYFISCAL YEAR FUNDS: 2021PROGRAM NAME: LOW OR NO EMISSION BUS PROGRAM (5339(C))PROJECT SELECTIONS ANNOUNCEMENT DATE: 6/25/2021PROJECT DESCRIPTION: FOR THIS PROJECT CAPITAL METRO WILL PURCHASE FIVE ZERO-EMISSION BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUSES TO REPLACE FIVE 40-FOOT DIESEL BUSES. OTHER PROJECT ACTIVITIES THIS GRANT COVERS INCLUDE PURCHASING AND INSTALLING CHARGING EQUIPMENT FOR THE BUSES TECHNICAL ELECTRICAL SYSTEMS TRAINING FOR VEHICLE MAINTENANCE STAFF AND PROJECT MANAGEMENT AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE. PROJECT ID: D2021-LWNO-045FUNDED AMOUNT: $2885000PURPOSE OF THE AWARD THIS APPLICATION IS TO OBLIGATE $2885000 IN DISCRETIONARY FUNDING AWARDED TO CAPITAL METROPOLITAN TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (CAPITAL METRO) THROUGH THE FISCAL YEAR 2021 LOW- OR NO-EMISSION (LOW-NO) GRANT PROGRAM. ON FEBRUARY 18 2021 THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) PUBLISHED A NOTICE OF FUNDING OPPORTUNITY ANNOUNCING THE AVAILABILITY OF COMPETITIVE FUNDING APPROPRIATED FOR THE LOW OR NO EMISSION GRANTS PROGRAM (LOW-NO PROGRAM) FOR THE FISCAL YEAR 2021 THROUGH THE FURTHER CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT 2021. ON JUNE 25 2021 FTA ANNOUNCED THE SELECTION OF PROJECTS WHICH INCLUDED $2885000 FOR CAPITAL METRO FOR THE PURCHASE OF BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUSES (PROJECT ID D2021-LWNO-045). ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED CAPITAL METRO WILL PURCHASE FIVE 40-FT HEAVY-DUTY BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUSES WITH THE FTA AWARD (INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO PRE/POST-AUDIT INSPECTIONS AND POST-DELIVERY EXTERIOR SIGNING). THE BUSES WILL BE ACQUIRED IN THE LARGE HEAVY-DUTY TRANSIT BUS CATEGORY WITH A MINIMUM USEFUL LIFE OF AT LEAST 12 YEARS OF SERVICE OR AN ACCUMULATION OF AT LEAST 500000 MILES. OTHER PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO THE ACQUISITION OF BUS CHARGING EQUIPMENT PROJECT MANAGEMENT AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT PROVIDED BY CAPITAL METROS OTHER PROJECT PARTNER THE CENTER FOR TRANSPORTATION AND THE ENVIRONMENT (CTE). CAPITAL METRO WILL PROVIDE THE $2885000 IN MATCHING FUNDS FROM ITS ANNUAL REVENUES THAT INCLUDE A VARIETY OF NON-FEDERAL SOURCES INCLUDING LOCAL DEDICATED SALES TAX (DIRECTLY LEVIED) INTERLOCAL AGREEMENTS FREIGHT INCOME AND OTHER OPERATING REVENUE.EXPECTED OUTCOMES THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL ALLOW CAPITAL METRO TO REMOVE FIVE 2008 MODEL YEAR DIESEL-FUELED BUSES FROM SERVICE AND DEPLOY FIVE ZERO-EMISSION BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUSES IN THEIR PLACE. THE FIVE BUSES BEING REPLACED OPERATE FOR APPROXIMATELY 285000 MILES AND CONSUME 88240 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL EACH YEAR.DEPLOYING BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUSES IN PLACE OF FOSSIL FUEL VEHICLES WILL REDUCE ENERGY CONSUMPTION. THE BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUSES THAT CAPITAL METRO IS PROPOSING TO PUT INTO SERVICE CONSUME LESS ENERGY PER MILE THAN BUSES THAT USE OTHER COMMON PROPULSION TECHNOLOGIES SUCH AS GASOLINE DIESEL AND NATURAL GAS ENGINES. EVEN WHEN CONSIDERING WELL-TO-WHEEL ENERGY REQUIREMENTS BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUSES ARE A MORE EFFICIENT TRANSIT SOLUTION THAN THESE OTHER VEHICLE TECHNOLOGIES. OPERATING BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUSES INSTEAD OF COMPARABLE MODERN FOSSIL FUEL BUSES (MODEL YEAR 2021 DIESEL BUS) WILL REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF ENERGY THAT CAPITAL METRO USES EACH YEAR BY 13 TERAJOULES (TJ). THAT ENERGY IS EQUIVALENT TO 219 YEARS WORTH OF GAS FOR THE AVERAGE AMERICAN CAR DRIVER EVERY YEAR.DEPLOYING THE ZERO-EMISSION BUSES IN PLACE OF THE EXISTING VEHICLES WILL REDUCE CAPITAL METROS ANNUAL GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS BY APPROXIMATELY 930 TONS AND PREVENT THE RELEASE OF 21.4 POUNDS (LBS.) OF PARTICULATE MATTER UNDER 10 MICROMETERS (PM10) ANNUALLY 19.5 LBS. OF WHICH IS FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) WHICH HAS A CONSIDERABLE HEALTH IMPACT ON THE LOCAL COMMUNITY. THIS REDUCTION IN EMISSIONS OF GHGS AND PARTICULATES RESULTS IN A SOCIAL COST SAVINGS OF $49200 ANNUALLY IN ACCORDANCE WITH EXECUTIVE ORDER 13990. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES THE ELECTRIFICATION OF CAPITAL METROS FLEET WILL BENEFIT ALL OF CAPITAL METROS CUSTOMERS ALONG WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN AREAS WHERE THE BUSES RUN INCLUDING THOSE RESIDING IN OPPORTUNITY ZONES. CAPITAL METRO IS COMMITTED TO EQUITY THE AGENCYS GROWING BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUS FLEET WILL BE USED THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY. OPPORTUNITY ZONES ARE WELL-SERVED BY CAPITAL METRO SERVICE. OVER 40 OF CAPITAL METROS 83 ROUTES RUN THROUGH OR ADJACENT TO DESIGNATED OPPORTUNITY ZONES INCLUDING 13 OF THE AGENCYS 14 HIGH-FREQUENCY ROUTES (HEADWAYS OF LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO 15 MINUTES). 252 BUS STOPS ARE IN OR WITHIN A MILE OF AN OPPORTUNITY ZONE. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS FOR THIS PROJECT.THIS PROJECT IS INCLUDED IN THE CAPITAL AREA METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION 2021 2024 TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM LIST OF GROUPED PROJECTS. SUPPORTING DOCUMENTATION HAS BEEN UPLOADED WITH THIS APPLICATION.

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST SECTION 5339 DISCRETIONARY BUS AND BUS FACILITIES FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE GALVESTON TX UZA IN THE AMOUNT OF $1060000. FUNDING WAS COMPETITIVELY AWARDED UNDER THE FY 2021 BUSES AND BUS FACILITIES PROGRAM DISCRETIONARY ID D2022-BUSC-063PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE PURCHASE OF 4 REPLACEMENT VEHICLES WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AND TRAINING/CERTIFICATION OF MAINTENANCE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: 4 BUSES WILL BE REPLACED AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AND TRAINING/CERTIFICATION OF MAINTENANCE TECHNICIANS FOR LIQUEFIED PETROLEUM GAS BUSES WILL BE PROVIDED.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: OVER 95% OF LPG IS PRODUCED IN NORTH AMERICA AND FUELS OVER 21 MILLION VEHICLES WORLDWIDE WITH JUST UNDER 300000 VEHICLES IN THE US ARE LPG FUELED. LPG HAS THE MOST ABUNDANT REFUELING INFRASTRUCTURE OF ANY ALTERNATIVE FUELS AND IS THE THIRD MOST COMMENT ENGINE FUEL BEHIND DIESEL AND GASOLINE. LPG IS STORED AT LOW PRESSURE REQUIRING MINIMAL ELECTRICAL POWER TO DISPENSE AS REQUIRED BY CNG OR ELECTRIC BUSES. IT HAS A NARROW FLAMMABILITY RANGE AND THE FUEL TANKS FOR LPG VEHICLES ARE 20 TIMES MORE PUNCTURE RESISTANT THAN GASOLINE FUELED VEHICLES. LPG IS READILY AVAILABLE ECONOMICAL SAFE AND AFFORDABLE FOR A CLEAN-BURNING ALTERNATIVE FUEL. HISTORICALLY LPG HAS BEEN LESS EXPENSIVE BY 30%-50% THAN GASOLINE AND WITHOUT THE HIGH INFRASTRUCTURE COSTS OF CNG AND/OR ELECTRIC EQUIPMENT. JUST BY BURNING A CLEANER FUEL IN THE ENGINE IS IN DIRECT CORRELATION TO LOWERING MAINTENANCE COSTS OF VEHICLES. HIGH MILEAGE VEHICLES VEHICLES THAT DRIVER 25-50000 MILES A YEAR SUCH AS ISLAND TRANSIT OFFER THE BIGGEST RETURN ON INVESTMENT IN MAINTENANCE COSTS ALONE. CURRENTLY ISLAND TRANSIT SPENDS AN ESTIMATED 52% OF ITS FTA APPORTIONMENT ON MAINTENANCE ALONE AND STILL REQUIRES ADDITIONAL ASSISTANCE FROM STATE DOT FUNDS FOR MAINTENANCE COSTS. FOR FY 2022 ISLAND TRANSIT PROGRAMMED MAINTENANCE EXPENSE IS FORECASTED AT $1149875 WHICH WOULD INCLUDES FEDERAL FUNDS AND MATCHING REQUIREMENTS. BY TRANSITIONING TO LPG ISLAND TRANSIT EXPECTS TO REDUCE MAINTENANCE COSTS BY 20% THE FIRST YEAR OF IMPLEMENTATION OF LPG BUSES. BY UTILIZING CLEANER AND THE THIRD MOST ABUNDANT FUEL AVAILABLE ISLAND TRANSIT WILL BEGIN THE TRANSITION TO A CLEANER AND GREEN BURNING FUEL IN LPG. ONE LGP VEHICLE ALONE WHEN COMPARED TO GASOLINE REDUCES GREENHOUSE GAS (GHG) BY 24% REDUCES NITROGEN OXIDE (NOX) BY 20% AND REDUCES CARBON MONOXIDE (CO) BY 60 %. WHEN COMPARED TO DIESEL THERE IS 99% FEWER PARTICULATE EMISSIONS AND DPF IS COMPLETELY ELIMINATED. THE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT WOULD BE IMMEDIATE WITH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF LPG BUSES ON GALVESTON ISLAND. CARBON EMISSIONS WOULD BE REDUCED IN AN ENVIRONMENTALLY SENSITIVE AREA AFFECTING THE AIR QUALITY AND THE PUBLIC ESPECIALLY THOSE COMMUNITIES AND INDIVIDUALS THAT UTILIZE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION. THE EJ POPULATION WOULD SEE AND FEEL THE IMPACT IMMEDIATELY AS WELL BUSES WITH LPG WITH THE EXPECTED REDUCTION IN EMISSIONS ALONE FROM CLEAN BURNING FUEL WOULD HAVE SUBSTANTIAL HEALTH BENEFITS. OVER 25% OF THE POPULATION ON GALVESTON ISLAND IS ESTIMATED NOT TO HAVE HEALTH INSURANCE JUST BY UTILIZING A CLEANER BURNING BENEFITS THE COMMUNITIES SERVED BY REDUCING HEALTHCARE COSTS FROM POOR AIR QUALITY. LPG DOES NOT REQUIRE THE SAME AMOUNT OF ENERGY TO STORE/DISPENSE AND MAINTAIN THE INFRASTRUCTURE THAT IS REQUIRED FOR CNG OR ELECTRIC BUSES. AN ESTIMATED MEDIUM SIZE FLEET OF 50-80 UNITS WOULD REQUIRE APPROXIMATELY $700000-$900000 IN DIRECT INFRASTRUCTURE COSTS ALONE FOR CNG. FOR AN ELECTRIC FLEET THE COSTS ARE EVEN GREATER IN THE AREA OF $950000-$1.5 MILLION. THE AMOUNT OF ENERGY NECESSARY FOR STORAGE DISPENSING AND MAINTENANCE EXCEEDS THE COSTS OF LPG FUELED VEHICLES ALONE WITH THE COSTS FOR THE SAME MEDIUM SIZE FLEET ESTIMATED TO BE $50000-$80000 FOR LPG FUELED VEHICLES. WHILE THE MPG ON A LPG FUELED VEHICLE IS LESS THAN A GASOLINE VEHICLE DURING THE LIFE OF THE VEHICLE THE TOTAL LBS OF CO2 PRODUCE BY AN LPG FUELED VEHICLE IS 43450 LBS LESS THAN A GASOLINE FUELED VEHICLE. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE IMPACT IS DIRECT AND IMMEDIATE TO THE COMMUNITIES SERVICED THAT ARE TRANSIT DEPENDENT THE ENVIRONMENT AND TO THE TRANSIT AGENCY ITSELF WITH A LOWER OPERATING COSTS AND A HEALTHIER WORKFORCE FROM CLEANER FUELED VEHICLES. SUBRECIPIENTS: NONELOCAL MATCH OF $187839 WILL BE FROM GALVESTON ISLAND TRANSIT CAPITAL FUNDS FUNDING THAT WAS SET ASIDE FOR FLEET REPLACEMENT AS PART OF THE LOCAL MATCH REQUIREMENTS. 85% FEDERAL MATCH WILL BE USED FOR BUS PURCHASES SINCE CLEANER FUEL VEHICLES WILL BE ACQUIRED. 80% FEDERAL MATCH WILL BE USED FOR TRAINING AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT. GALVESTON ISLAND TRANSIT (GIT) AS PART OF THE H-GAC MSA OPERATES NOT ONLY IN AN AREA THAT IS IN NON-ATTAINMENT IN REGARDS TO CURRENT OZONE GUIDELINES BUT ALSO ON AN ISLAND THAT IS DESIGNATED AS AN ENVIRONMENTALLY SENSITIVE AREA. H-GAC AS PART OF THEIR COMPREHENSIVE PLAN VISION FOR TOMORROW 2035 H-GAC LIST MITIGATION STRATEGIES FOR REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS TO REDUCE ADVERSE EFFECTS TO THE AIR QUALITY OF THE MSA. ALTERNATIVE FUELS FOR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS IS ONE OF THE MAJOR HIGHLIGHTS OF THOSE MITIGATION STRATEGIES. THE CITY OF GALVESTON COMPREHENSIVE PLAN OF 2011 ALSO LISTS SEVERAL MITIGATION STRATEGIES TO ENSURE THAT THE PUBLIC INTERESTS ARE MET WHILE PROTECTING AND PRESERVING THE NATURAL RESOURCES OF THE ISLAND. ISLAND TRANSIT HAS AN OPPORTUNITY TO IMPLEMENT THESE MITIGATION STRATEGIES BY IMPLEMENTING A BUS REPLACEMENT PROGRAM THAT UTILIZES ALTERNATIVE FUELS. ISLAND TRANSIT WILL BE REQUESTING FUNDING FOR 5-TRANSIT BUSES FUELED BY LPG. GALVESTON ISLAND TRANSIT CONSIDERED OTHER ALTERNATIVE FUELED FLEET REPLACEMENT SUCH AS ELECTRIC OR CNG (COMPRESSED NATURAL GAS). HOWEVER THE INITIAL INFRASTRUCTURE COSTS ARE SO PROHIBITIVE FOR SUCH A SMALL URBAN COMMUNITY SUCH AS CITY OF GALVESTON. AN ALTERNATIVE TO THE HIGH AND PROHIBITIVE INFRASTRUCTURE COSTS WAS LPG AND ITS MANY BENEFITS. LPG IS READILY AVAILABLE ON THE ISLAND INFRASTRUCTURE COSTS ARE MINOR IT HAS AN IMMEDIATE IMPACT ON AIR QUALITY AS IT REDUCES EMISSIONS BY HALF AND THE OVERALL COSTS OF THE PROGRAM IS SIMILAR TO GALVESTON ISLAND TRANSIT CURRENT COSTS OF OPERATING A DIESEL FLEET.

IMPROVED CUSTOMER SERVICE THROUGH CLEANER VEHICLES EXHIBITING A MORE PROFESSIONAL PRESENCE THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY IMPROVED VEHICLE LONGETIVITY THROUGH REMOVAL OF HARMFUL ROAD CONTAMINANTS IMPROVED DRAINAGE AT OPERATIONS CENTER IMPROVING AIR QUALITY BY ELIMINATING MOLD IMPROVED FACILITY APPEARANCE THROUGH REPAINTING EFFORTS AND REMOVAL OF DATED UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS TO PREVENT FUTURE ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES FROM PETROLEUM FUEL STORAGE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: EMPLOYEES THROUGH MORE RELIABLE SERVICE VEHICLES TRANSIT SYSTEM THROUGH IMPROVED IMAGE EMPLOYEES THROUGH IMPROVED INDOOR AIR QUALITY COMMUNITY THROUGH REDUCED EMISSIONS AND COMMUNITY AND NATURAL RESOURCES THROUGH REMOVAL OF USTS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NO SUBRECIPIENTS INCLUDED IN THE APPLICATION

FISCAL YEAR FUNDS: 2020PROGRAM NAME: LOW OR NO EMISSION BUS PROGRAM (5339(C))PROJECT SELECTIONS ANNOUNCEMENT DATE: 6/2/2020PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE CAPITAL METROPOLITAN TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY WILL RECEIVE FUNDS TO PURCHASE NEW ELECTRIC BUSES TO REPLACE AGING DIESEL BUSES THAT HAVE REACHED THEIR USEFUL LIFE EXPECTANCY.PROJECT ID: D2020-LWNO-037FUNDED AMOUNT: $2266000PURPOSE: THIS APPLICATION IS TO OBLIGATE $2266000 IN DISCRETIONARY FUNDING AWARDED TO CAPITAL METROPOLITAN TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY THROUGH THE FISCAL YEAR 2020 LOW OR NO EMISSION (LOW-NO) GRANT PROGRAM. ON JANUARY 24 2020 THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) PUBLISHED A NOTICE OF FUNDING OPPORTUNITY ANNOUNCING THE AVAILABILITY OF COMPETITIVE FUNDING APPROPRIATED FOR THE LOW OR NO EMISSION GRANTS PROGRAM (LOW-NO PROGRAM) FOR FISCAL YEAR 2020 THROUGH THE FURTHER CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT 2020 (P.L. 116-94). ON JUNE 2 2020 FTA ANNOUNCED THE SELECTION OF PROJECTS WHICH INCLUDED $2266000 FOR CAPITAL METROPOLITAN TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (CAPITAL METRO) FOR THE PURCHASE OF BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUSES (PROJECT ID D2020-LWNO-037). ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:CAPITAL METRO WILL PURCHASE FOUR 60FT HEAVY-DUTY BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUSES WITH THE FTA AWARD (INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO PRE/POST AUDIT INSPECTIONS POST-DELIVERY EXTERIOR SIGNING). THE BUSES WILL BE MANUFACTURED BY CAPITAL METROS PROJECT PARTNER NEW FLYER OF AMERICA. THE BUS WILL BE ACQUIRED IN THE LARGE HEAVY-DUTY TRANSIT BUS CATEGORY WITH A MINIMUM USEFUL LIFE OF AT LEAST 12 YEARS OF SERVICE OR AN ACCUMULATION OF AT LEAST 500000 MILES. OTHER PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO ACQUISITION OF BUS CHARGING EQUIPMENT PROJECT MANAGEMENT AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT PROVIDED BY CAPITAL METROS OTHER PROJECT PARTNER CENTER FOR TRANSPORTATION AND THE ENVIRONMENT (CTE).CAPITAL METRO WILL PROVIDE THE $3537236 IN MATCHING FUNDS FROM ITS ANNUAL REVENUES THAT INCLUDE A VARIETY OF NON-FEDERAL SOURCES INCLUDING LOCAL DEDICATED SALES TAX (DIRECTLY-LEVIED) INTERLOCAL AGREEMENTS FREIGHT INCOME AND OTHER OPERATING REVENUE. STATE GENERAL REVENUE THROUGH THE TEXAS COMMISSION ON ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY - TEXAS CLEAN FLEET PROGRAM IS ALSO INCLUDED.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL ALLOW CAPITAL METRO TO REMOVE FOUR 2008 MODEL YEAR DIESEL-FUELED BUSES FROM SERVICE AND DEPLOY FOUR ZERO-EMISSION BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUSES IN THEIR PLACE. COMBINED THE FOUR BUSES BEING REPLACED OPERATE FOR APPROXIMATELY 180000 MILES AND CONSUME 51429 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL EACH YEAR.BY REPLACING THE EXISTING DIESEL VEHICLES CAPITAL METRO WILL REDUCE THE ENERGY CONSUMPTION AND HARMFUL EMISSIONS INCLUDING THE EMISSION OF GREENHOUSE GASES ASSOCIATED WITH ITS FLEET. THE BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUSES THAT CAPITAL METRO IS PROPOSING TO PUT INTO SERVICE CONSUME LESS ENERGY PER MILE DRIVEN THAN BUSES THAT USE OTHER COMMON PROPULSION TECHNOLOGIES SUCH AS GASOLINE DIESEL AND NATURAL GAS ENGINES. EVEN WHEN CONSIDERING WELL-TO-WHEEL ENERGY REQUIREMENTS BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUSES ARE A MORE EFFICIENT TRANSIT SOLUTION THAN THESE OTHER VEHICLE TECHNOLOGIES. OPERATING BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUSES INSTEAD OF A COMPARABLE STANDARD BUS (MODEL YEAR 2020 DIESEL BUS) WILL REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF ENERGY THAT CAPITAL METRO USES EACH YEAR BY 7.8 TERAJOULES (TJ). THAT ENERGY IS EQUIVALENT TO 136.7 YEARS WORTH OF GAS FOR THE AVERAGE AMERICAN CAR DRIVER EVERY YEAR. FLEET EMISSIONS WILL BE REDUCED BY AN ESTIMATED 502.2 SHORT TONS OF GREENHOUSE GASES EACH YEAR. IN ADDITION THE PROJECT WILL PREVENT THE RELEASE OF 13.5 LBS PARTICULATE MATTER UNDER 10 MICROMETERS (PM10) ANNUALLY 12.3 LBS OF WHICH IS FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) WHICH HAS A CONSIDERABLE HEALTH IMPACT ON THE LOCAL COMMUNITY.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: CAPITAL METRO PROVIDES MASS TRANSPORTATION SERVICE TO THE GREATER AUSTIN METROPOLITAN AREA. ITS SERVICE AREA EXTENDS ACROSS APPROXIMATELY 537 SQUARE MILES AND INCLUDES MORE THAN 1.26 MILLION RESIDENTS WHO ARE THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS FOR THIS PROJECT. THE PROJECT LISTED IN ATTACHED DOCUMENT PAGE 62 OF 166 IN THE 2021 - 2024 CAPITAL AREA METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (ATTACHED WITH THIS APPLICATION).

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO CONSTRUCT A LITE BUS OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES PERFORMED UNDER THIS AWARD INCLUDE FINAL DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF A LITE BUS OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE FACILITY WILL ELIMINATE THE NEED FOR BUSES TO TRAVEL 32 ROUNDTRIP MILES FOR ROUTINE MAINTENANCE SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCING DEADHEAD AND EMISSIONS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS WILL BENEFIT DCTA WITH MORE EFFICIENT VEHICLE MAINTENANCE AND WILL BENEFIT PASSENGERS BY KEEPING BUSES CLOSER TO JOB-RICH CORRIDORS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES ASSOCIATED WITH THIS AWARD.DCTA WILL CONSTRUCT A LITE BUS OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY ON EXISTING LAND IT CURRENTLY OWNS ADJACENT TO THE RAIL OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY IN LEWISVILLE TX. THE LITE FACILITY IS INTENDED TO ACCOMMODATE UP TO 45 BUSES AND WILL CONSIST OF A 4320 SF MAINTENANCE FACILITY AND A 6370 SF WASH BUILDING. PRELIMINARY DESIGN WORK HAS BEEN COMPLETED AND THE LITE FACILITY WILL INCLUDE SPACE FOR OIL CHANGES MINOR REPAIRS INSPECTIONS PARTS STORAGE FUELING WASHING A DRIVER LOUNGE LOCKER ROOM SUPERVISOR OFFICE SPACE AND STAFF MEETING/TRAINING ROOMS. THIS PROJECT WAS SELECTED FOR FUNDING (PROJECT ID# D2018-BUSC-103 BUS OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY) AT $2625000 ON JUNE 25 2018 FOR THE FISCAL YEAR 2017 GRANTS FOR BUSES AND BUS FACILITIES INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT PROGRAM. FUNDING IS AT AN 80/20 FEDERAL/LOCAL MATCH WITH $2625000 IN FEDERAL FUNDS AND 525000 IN TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDITS UTILIZED IN LIEU OF LOCAL MATCH. ATTACHMENTS:- ORIGINAL DISCRETIONARY APPLICATION FORM SF-424 AND PROJECT DESCRIPTION DOCUMENTATION - TIP LISTING (10/19/2018)- FTA NEPA DETERMINATION (7/10/2019)- PROJECT SELECTION NOTICE (6/25/2018)- TDC DOCUMENTATION - SCOPE AND BUDGET

VIA METROPOLITAN TRANSIT (VIA) WAS AWARDED $6000000 OF FY 2018 SECTION 5339(B) (D2018-BUSC-223) FUNDING TO DESIGN AND CONSTRUCT A NEW PARATRANSIT OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY. THE TOTAL PROJECT COST IS $33251562 WITH $27251562 IN NON-FEDERAL MATCHING FUNDS. THE NON-FEDERAL MATCH COMES FROM $1615402 IN VIA CASH RESERVES $8050449 IN BONDS AND $17585711 IN STATE FUNDING. THE $6000000 IN AWARDED 5339(B) FUNDING WILL BE UTILIZED FOR THE DESIGN/BUILD PORTION OF THE OVERALL PROJECT AND WILL BE MATCHED AT $1500000 WITH TXDOT STATE FUNDING UNDER CSJ# 0915-12-258. THE FACILITY WILL BE LOCATED AT 4902 FREDERICKSBURG ROAD SAN ANTONIO TEXAS. THE PARATRANSIT OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY PROJECT IS PLANNED TO MEET THE NEED FOR A FULLY FUNCTIONAL OPERATING MAINTENANCE AND STORAGE FACILITY FOR VIAS PARATRANSIT OPERATIONS AND FLEET. THE FACILITY PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING WITHIN THE 11.5-ACRE SITE: PARTIAL DEMOLITION OF EXISTING BUILDING (FORMALLY A K-MART BIG BOX STORE) AND RECONSTRUCTION OF THE EXISTING BUILDING TO INCLUDE OFFICES 15 MAINTENANCE BAYS LUNCH ROOM WELLNESS CENTER CHECK-IN OFFICE LOCKERS AND RESTROOMS WITH SHOWERS; SPACE FOR A MINIMUM OF 149 PARATRANSIT VEHICLES AND 73 NON-REVENUE VEHICLES; RELOCATION AND INSTALLATION OF A PROPANE FUELING FACILITY; INSTALLATION OF TWO 10000 GALLON UNLEADED UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS; 4 BAY FUELING SERVICE ISLAND; AND A VEHICLE WASH FACILITY. THE FACILITY WILL ALSO INCLUDE 257 STANDARD PARKING SPACES AS WELL AS APPROPRIATE LANDSCAPING LIGHTING FENCING SIGNAGE IT AND SECURITY CAMERAS. THE FACILITY WILL ALSO PROVIDE SAFE ACCESS AND BE FULLY COMPLIANT WITH THE AMERICAN DISABILITIES ACT (ADA) AND ALL FEDERAL STATE AND LOCAL REGULATIONS. A PHASE I ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENT (ESA) WAS PERFORMED TO DETERMINE IF THERE ARE ANY KNOWN HAZARDOUS MATERIALS OR PREVIOUS LAND USES WITH A POTENTIAL FOR HAZARDOUS MATERIALS REMAINING WITHIN THE PROJECT AREA. THE AMERICAN SOCIETY OF TESTING AND MATERIALS (ASTM) PRACTICE E 152705 ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENTS: PHASE I ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENT PROCESS WAS USED AS A GUIDANCE DOCUMENT FOR THE PERFORMANCE OF THE ESA. THE PHASE I ESA REPORT PREPARED SEPTEMBER 2015 IS ATTACHED. ADDITIONALLY THE PROJECT QUALIFIES FOR A CATEGORICAL EXCLUSION IN ACCORDANCE WITH 23 CFR 771.118 AS FTA HAS DETERMINED THAT THERE WILL NOT BE ANY SUBSTANTIAL IMPACT TO THE ENVIRONMENT. BOTH THE ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENT AND CATEGORICAL EXCLUSION DOCUMENTS ARE ATTACHED WITH THIS APPLICATION. CONSTRUCTION OF THE FACILITY IS SCHEDULED TO BE COMPLETED BY THE END OF 2021 WITH THE FACILITY OPERATIONAL BY EARLY 2022.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DESIGN AND CONSTRUCT A NEW PARATRANSIT OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY AT 4902 FREDERICKSBURG ROAD SAN ANTONIO TX. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE THE DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF A PARATRANSIT FACILITY ON AN 11.5-ACRE SITE. THE PROJECT INCLUDES PARTIAL DEMOLITION OF AN EXISTING BUILDING (FORMERLY A K-MART BIG BOX STORE) AND RECONSTRUCTION OF THE EXISTING BUILDING.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE IMPROVEMENTS WILL PROVIDE VIA WITH MODERN AND ADEQUATE SPACE TO MAINTAIN VIAS FLEET OF PARATRANSIT VEHICLES. IT WILL ALSO CONSOLIDATE THE PARATRANSIT OPERATION INTO ONE FACILITY. VIA CURRENTLY GARAGES ITS ENTIRE FLEET (BUSES AND VANS) AS WELL AS SUPPORT VEHICLES AT A SINGLE 30-ACRE FACILITY THAT INCLUDES MAINTENANCE SHOPS. THE ADDITIONAL FACILITY RESULTING IN THIS PROJECT WILL THEREFORE ALSO REDUCE STRESS ON VIAS CURRENT FACILITY AND CONSOLIDATE AND IMPROVE EFFICIENCIES FOR THE ENTIRE PARATRANSIT OPERATION. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: VIA PARATRANSIT OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE STAFF WILL BENEFIT FROM HAVING ADDITIONAL SPACE AND MODERN FACILITIES TO MAINTAIN VIAS FLEET OF MAINTENANCE VEHICLES. THE NEW FACILITY LOCATION AT 4902 FREDERICKSBURG ROAD WILL ALSO BENEFIT PARATRANSIT CUSTOMERS BY BRINGING PARATRANSIT SERVICE CLOSER TO WHERE CUSTOMERS REGULARLY TRAVEL. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE OF THE AWARD ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THESE ARE FY17 5339 FUNDS TRANSFERRED FROM GULF COAST CENTERS GRANT TX-2020-007 TO THE GULF COAST TRANSIT DISTRICT (GCTD) IN THE FEDERAL AMOUNT OF $58143. TXDOT IS APPLYING FOR:FY20 5339 DISCRETIONARY: $1610000*PROJECTS WILL BE MATCHED USING TDCTOTAL: $1610000PURPOSE OF AWARD: THE PROJECT CONSTRUCTS A TOTAL OF TWO RURAL CAPITAL FACILITY PROJECTS WITHIN TEXAS; ONE FOR PANHANDLE COMMUNITY SERVICES (PCS) AND THE OTHER FOR ROLLING PLAINS MANAGEMENT CORPORATION (RPMC). THESE PROJECTS ARE A CONTINUATION OF THE PROJECTS FUNDED WITH FY19 DISCRETIONARY FUNDS UNDER TRAMS GRANT TX-2020-129-0. IN THE PREVIOUS GRANT THE PROJECTS WERE FUNDED UNTIL THEY ENTERED A STATE OF CONSTRUCTION READINESS. SINCE THAT PREVIOUS GRANT RPMC IS EXPECTED TO ENTER A STATE OF CONSTRUCTION READINESS BY JUNE/JULY 2021; HOWEVER THE OTHER CONSTRUCTION PROJECT FOR PCS WILL NOT BE READY UNTIL DECEMBER 2021/JANUARY 2022. THEREFORE THIS APPLICATION IS ONLY FOR RPMCS PORTION OF THE FUNDING. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: RPMC: THE FACILITY WILL MODERNIZE THE OPERATIONS BY RENOVATING THE EXISTING BUS STORAGE AREA WITH A NEW ADMINISTRATIVE ADDITION TO THE BUILDING. THE PROPOSED ADMINISTRATIVE AND OPERATIONS CENTER PROJECT ADDRESSES AN INTERNAL INFRASTRUCTURE NEED OF THE RPMCS SHARP LINES PROGRAM BY PROVIDING SAFE AND EFFICIENTLY DESIGNED OFFICE AND TRAINING SPACE LARGE ENOUGH TO ACCOMMODATE ADDITIONAL DRIVERS FLEET MAINTENANCE DISPATCH AND ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF. FTA ENVIRONMENTAL CONCURRENCE 3/10/21. SCOPE SCHEDULE AND BUDGET ATTACHED.PCS: THEYRE BUILDING A NEW MAINTENANCE AND ADMINISTRATIVE FACILITY THAT BRINGS MAINTENANCE IN-HOUSE ALLOWS FOR DEVELOPMENT OF A COMPREHENSIVE PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE AND TRAINING PROGRAM AND SERVES AS A REGIONAL MAINTENANCE CENTER TO BE USED BY OTHER PROVIDERS. *WILL APPLY FOR LATER THIS YEAR.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: RPMC: OPERATIONAL BENEFITS COST REDUCTION AND BETTER MANAGEMENT OF SERVICES. THIS INCLUDES BETTER INTRA- ORGANIZATIONAL COORDINATION AMONG ADMINISTRATIVE OPERATIONAL AND MANAGEMENT STAFF. MANAGERIAL BENEFITS - BETTER RESOURCE MANAGEMENT IMPROVED LONG TERM DECISION-MAKING AND PLANNING AND PERFORMANCE IMPROVEMENT.STRATEGIC BENEFITS - SUPPORT SYSTEM GROWTH DEVELOPMENT OF NEW FACILITY THAT WILL BE GOOD MARKETING FOR THE TRANSIT SYSTEM DEVELOP INNOVATIONS IN BUILDING FUNCTIONALITY IMPROVE TRAINING AND SAFETY.ORGANIZATIONAL BENEFITS - SUPPORT SHARP LINES ORGANIZATIONAL CHANGES FACILITATE BUSINESS LEARNING AND INTERNAL COORDINATION EMPOWERMENT AND DEVELOP COMMON VISIONS.ADDITIONALLY THE PROJECT WILL:IMPROVE SAFETY BY ELIMINATING DISPATCH AND ADMINISTRATIVE WORK SPACES FROM THE HALLWAYS; PROVIDING ADEQUATE WORK SPACE FOR ALL OPERATIONAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF; CENTRALIZING OPERATIONAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE FUNCTIONS OF THE PROGRAM; AND IMPROVE THE EFFICIENCY AND EFFECTIVENESS OF TRAINING BY HAVING SPACE ADEQUATE TO TRAIN MORE THAN THREE INDIVIDUALS AT ONE TIME. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:WITH THE IMPROVED FACILITY THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES SHALL BE THE GENERAL PUBLIC AND RESIDENTS OF COTTLE HARDEMAN FOARD WILBARGER BAYLOR ARCHER WICHITA YOUNG AND JACK COUNTIES. THESE COUNTIES ARE RURAL COMMUNITIES WITH LIMITED ACCESS TO MEDICAL DENTAL EYE CENTERS AND SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCIES. THE POPULATIONS GENERALLY SERVED BY RPMC ARE SENIOR DISABLED AND ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED RESIDENTS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE PROJECT WILL CONSIST OF REHABILITATING THE EXISTING STRUCTURE; AS WELL AS NEW CONSTRUCTION ON THE PROPERTY.LENGTH OF TIME:ALL PROJECTS CONTAINED IN THIS APPLICATION WILL BE CONSTRUCTED WITHIN 36 MONTHS OF GRANT EXECUTION.TXDOT PLANS TO APPLY FOR THE REMAINING $8600000 FOR PCS PROJECT AROUND NOV/DEC OF 2021.

PURPOSE OF THE AWARD AND ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS APPLICATION FOR BUS DISCRETIONARY 5339 FUNDS IN THE FEDERAL AMOUNT OF $14770058 WILL REPLACE METROS CURRENT QCARD SYSTEM AND SOME OF THE LEGACY SYSTEMS USED BY METRO AND OTHER REGIONAL TRANSIT PROVIDERS THROUGHOUT THE HOUSTON AREA. THE NEW SYSTEM WILL PROVIDE VARIOUS PAYMENT OPTIONS FOR PATRONS AND INTEGRATE A ROBUST SALES NETWORK THAT WILL ALLOW CUSTOMERS TO PURCHASE MEDIA AND RELOAD VALUE TO THEIR ACCOUNTS USING CASH CREDIT OR DEBIT. MOBILE PAYMENT INTEGRATION WILL ALSO BE EXPANDED DURING THE PROJECT. EXPECTED OUTCOMES AND INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE NEW FARE COLLECTION SYSTEM WILL PROVIDE AN ENVIRONMENT THAT WILL ALLOW FOR CONSISTENCY THROUGHOUT THE TRANSIT PAYMENT ECOSYSTEM IN THE HOUSTON AREA. OPEN PAYMENTS WILL ALLOW RIDERS TO ENJOY EASY PAYMENT METHODS USING PAYMENT ITEMS THEY CURRENTLY USE FOR OTHER PURCHASES SUCH AS CREDIT AND DEBIT CARDS MOBILE PAYMENTS ELECTRONIC WALLET PAYMENT (GOOGLE PAY AND APPLE PAY) PAYPAL AS WELL AS MULTIPLE WAYS TO DEAL WITH CASH. THE SYSTEM WILL PROVIDE CONSISTENCY AMONG MACHINES AND CUSTOMER INTERFACES WITH CLEAR MESSAGING AND REGIONAL INTEGRATION WITH OTHER TRANSIT SERVICES SUCH AS PARKING HIGHWAY TOLLS AND MICRO-TRANSIT SERVICES. CUSTOMERS WILL ALSO ENJOY IMPROVED SERVICE DELIVERY THROUGH FASTER BOARDING SHORTER DWELL TIMES AND STREAMLINING THE CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE. THE ENHANCED FARE COLLECTION SYSTEM CAN ALSO COLLECT VALUABLE INFORMATION ABOUT CUSTOMER USAGE AND BEHAVIOR THROUGH ELECTRONIC VALIDATION OF ALL FARE MEDIA INCLUDING MOBILE AND PAPER MEDIA THAT CAN HELP IMPROVE SERVICES. THE NEW SYSTEM WILL ALSO FACILITATE REGIONAL INTEROPERABILITY AND ALLOW REGIONAL TRANSIT PROVIDERS TO INTERCONNECT SERVICES SHARE INFORMATION AND PROVIDE A SEAMLESS PAYMENT EXPERIENCE FOR THE CUSTOMER. THIS APPLICATION WILL PROVIDE $14770058 IN FUNDING FOR PHASE 1 OF THE SYSTEM UPGRADE WITH THE PROJECT HAVING A TOTAL COST UP TO $98 MILLION. LOCAL MATCH OF $3692516 WILL BE FROM METROS SALE TAX REVENUE.PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY BEGINS ON THE DATE THE AWARD ANNOUNCEMENT WAS MADE BY FTA AUGUST 11 2020. D2020BUSC180SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

THIS PROJECT WAS SELECTED UNDER THE FISCAL YEAR 2016 GRANTS FOR BUSES AND BUS FACILITIES COMPETITIVE PROGRAM (FEDERAL REGISTER / VOL. 81 NO. 197 / WEDNESDAY OCTOBER 12 2016 PGS. 70482 - 70486). THE PROJECT BUILDS UPON THE REGIONAL MOBILITY PARTNERSHIP ESTABLISHED BETWEEN CAPITAL METROPOLITAN TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (CAPITAL METRO) AND CAPITAL AREA RURAL TRANSPORTATION SERVICE (CARTS) TO REMOVE BARRIERS TO TRANSIT AND TO SUPPORT THE CREATION OF LADDERS OF OPPORTUNITY IN THE AUSTIN URBANIZED AREA AND THE CENTRAL TEXAS REGION ONE OF THE FASTEST GROWING AREAS OF THE COUNTRY. GRANT FUNDING WILL PROVIDE THE CAPITAL FUNDING NEEDED TO SUPPORT REGIONAL PLANNING EFFORTS AND TO CLOSE SERVICE GAPS IN THE URBANIZED AREA TO REPLACE BUSES ON ROUTES THAT CAPITAL METRO AND CARTS CURRENTLY SERVE AND TO REPLACE BUSES IN THE RURAL AREA. A COMBINED TOTAL OF 45 BUSES WILL BE ACQUIRED WITH THE FUNDING. CAPITAL METRO WILL ACQUIRE 16 BUSES AND CARTS WILL ACQUIRE 29 BUSES.THE ORIGINAL PROPOSAL INCLUDING THE FTA SUPPLEMENTAL FORM SUBMITTED BY CAPITAL METRO THROUGH GRANTS.GOV IN RESPONSE TO THE NOTICE OF FUNDING AVAILABILITY HAS BEEN UPLOADED TO THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS SECTION OF THIS APPLICATION. AS INDICATED ON PAGE 6 OF THE SUPPLEMENTAL FORM TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDITS (TDCS) WILL BE USED AS LOCAL MATCH FOR THIS PROJECT.

THIS IS AN FFY2021 SECTION 5339 GRANT APPLICATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $244998.00 IN FEDERAL FUNDS (UZA CODES: 212690 472690 210000 470000). THE FUNDS BREAKDOWN ARE $244998.00 FROM FFY2021 SECTION 5339 APPORTIONMENTS.THIS APPLICATION IS FOR FEDERAL 5339 FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $244998.00. THESE FUNDS WILL BE MATCHED BY THE TENNESSEE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $30625.00 AND THE CITY OF CLARKSVILLE IN THE AMOUNT OF $30625.00. THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PURCHASE ONE (1) EXPANSION 30-FOOT BUS THREE (3) CUTAWAY PARATRANSIT VANS AND TO ACQUIRE ADP HARDWARE TO BE USED ON THE BUSES AND FOR THE DAY-TO-DAY OPERATIONS OF CTS. THE HARDWARE WILL HAVE A USEFUL LIFE OF 5 YEARS OR MORE. THE FOLLOWING TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PLAN INFORMATION IS ATTACHED TIP# 32 COMPUTER HARDWARE TIP# 63 ADA VEHICLES AND TIP#72 TRANSIT BUSES. CTS WILL NOT SPEND 1% OF THE FUNDS ON SECURITY RELATED PROJECTS. CTS CONDUCTS A SAFETY AND SECURITY ASSESSMENT ANNUALLY AND HAS DETERMINED THAT 1% OF THESE FUNDS WILL NOT BE NECESSARY FOR SECURITY RELATED PROJECTS.OMB 5 ELEMENTS1) PURPOSE OF THE AWARD.- THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS FOR THE FUNDS TO BE USED FOR THE ACQUISITION OF TWO (2) EXPANSION BUSES THREE (3) CUTAWAY PARATRANSIT VANS AND COMPUTER HARDWARE.2) ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED.- AS MENTIONED THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS FOR THE REPLACEMENT OF PARATRANSIT VEHICLES ACQUIRE EXPANSION BUSES AND COMPUTER HARDWARE FOR BUSES AND CTS. APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS GRANT APPLICATION PROVIDES A TOTAL OF $971211 IN SECTION 5339 FORMULA FUNDS TO PURCHASE SIX NEW CUTAWAY TYPE VEHICLES FOR THE DEPLOYMENT OF ON-DEMAND/PARATRANSIT SERVICES IN THE SIOUX FALLS COMMUNITY. THE TOTAL IS COMPOSED OF THREE YEARS OF FUNDS: FY 2020 (LAPSING) FY 2021 AND FY 2022 FUNDS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE SIX VEHICLES WILL BE ADA ACCESSIBLE AND SERVE THE PARATRANSIT AND ON-DEMAND TRANSIT SYSTEM COMPLEMENTING THE FIXED ROUTE SYSTEM. THESE VEHICLES WILL BE COMPATIBLE WITH OUR ACCESSIBILITY NEEDS AS WELL AS THE ARTERIAL ROAD SYSTEM FOR SAFETY OF OUR DRIVERS AND THE PROTECTION OF OUR FLEET AND PASSENGERS. THE FOCUS IS TO SECURE VEHICLES THAT DO NOT REQUIRE A CDL ARE ADA ACCESSIBLE AND PROVIDE THE NEEDED PASSENGER CAPACITY TO MEET THE DEMANDS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THESE VEHICLES WILL SERVE THE TRANSPORTATION NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY IN EMPLOYMENT MEDICAL AND OTHER DESTINATIONS. WE ARE SECURING SMALLER VEHICLES FOR EFFICIENCY AND TO MEET THE CHALLENGES THAT THE CDL REQUIRES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE COMMUNITY OF SIOUX FALLS THAT ARE SEEKING TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS. SIOUX AREA METRO IS OPEN TO EVERYONE SEEKING TRANSPORTATION.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO FUND CONSTRUCTION EXPENSES RELATED TO THE NEW OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY CURRENTLY UNDER CONSTRUCTION AT 205 ARCADIA DR.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THIS APPLICATION IS FOR FUNDING TO COVER COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH CONSTRUCTION OF THE NEW OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT GTA TO CONTINUE ITS EFFORTS TO FULLY FUND CONSTRUCTION OF ITS NEW OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY SO THAT GTA CAN CONTINUE TO PROVIDE CURRENT LEVELS OF PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICE AND TO EXPAND ITS SERVICES OVER THE COURSE OF THE NEXT SEVERAL YEARS AS OUTLINED IN ITS 2018 TRANSIT DEVELOPMENT PLAN AND 2021 UPDATE TO THE TRANSIT DEVELOPMENT PLAN. IN FACT GTAS EXISTING TRANSIT MAINTENANCE FACILITY LOCATED AT 154 AUGUSTA STREET HAS EXCEEDED ITS USEFUL LIFE AND CANNOT IN ITS CURRENT STATE CONTINUE TO SUSTAIN GTAS BUS MAINTENANCE AND OPERATIONS IN THE LONG-TERM. A NEW MAINTENANCE FACILITY IS NEEDED BEFORE GREENLINK CAN ADD NEW ROUTES INCREASE SERVICE FREQUENCIES OR EXPAND TO NEW GEOGRAPHIC AREAS IN GREENVILLE COUNTY. WHILE THE CONSTRUCTION PROCESS WILL CREATE NEARLY 800 SHORT-TERM JOBS SETTING GREENLINK IN A POSITION FOR FUTURE TRANSIT SERVICE IMPROVEMENTS WILL PROVIDE THE AGENCY WITH THE LONG-TERM CAPACITY TO QUADRUPLE ITS DIRECT WORKFORCE AND PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO REACH 73 PERCENT OF ALL JOBS IN GREENVILLE COUNTY.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: GTA AND THE RIDERS THAT RELY ON ITS SERVICE WILL BENEFIT FROM CONTINUED AND EXPANDED SERVICES PERMITTING INDIVIDUALS TO GET TO WORK HEALTHCARE GROCERY STORES AND OTHER DESTINATIONS. FURTHERMORE IT IS EXPECTED THAT RIDERSHIP WILL INCREASE AS GTA IS ABLE TO PROVIDE EXPANDED SERVICE VIA LATER HOURS INCREASED FREQUENCIES AND ADDITIONAL ROUTES RESULTING IN ADDITIONAL BENEFICIARIES BEYOND THAT OF CURRENT RIDERS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.
