1. PURPOSE: THE COMET WAS AWARDED $2935190 IN FEDERAL FUNDS ON 06/25/2021 THROUGH THE FTA LOW OR NO EMISSION VEHICLE PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT APPLICATION IS TO RECEIVE FUNDING TO PURCHASE TWO NEW FLYER XCELSIOR CHARGE (XE35) BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES AND TWO NEW FLYER 40 XCELSIOR (XHE40) FUEL CELL BUSES ALONG WITH THE NECESSARY CHARGING EQUIPMENT AND HYDROGEN REFUELING INFRASTRUCTURE. 2. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE COMET IS REQUESTING FUNDS TO PURCHASE TWO NEW FLYER XCELSIOR CHARGE (XE35) BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES AND TWO NEW FLYER 40 XCELSIOR (XHE40) FUEL CELL BUSES ALONG WITH THE NECESSARY CHARGING EQUIPMENT AND HYDROGEN REFUELING INFRASTRUCTURE. THESE BUSES WILL REPLACE FOUR 2016 STARCRAFT ALLSTAR CUTAWAY BUSES AT THE END OF THEIR USEFUL LIFE IN 2023. 3. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE COMET IS LOOKING TO INVEST IN BOTH OF THE LEADING ZERO-EMISSION TECHNOLOGIES BATTERY-ELECTRIC AND FUEL CELL ELECTRIC TO INTELLIGENTLY DEPLOY THEM ON ROUTES THAT FULLY UTILIZE THE ADVANTAGES OF EACH TECHNOLOGY. BY DEPLOYING THESE BUSES NOT ONLY WILL THE COMET REDUCE LOCAL EMISSIONS THEY WILL ALSO BE ABLE TO ESTABLISH THE SKILLS AND FAMILIARITY NECESSARY TO EXPAND THE ZERO-EMISSION FLEET AND CONTINUE TO WORK TOWARD COLUMBIAS GOAL OF IMPROVED AIR QUALITY.4. TRANSIT USERS IN PARTICULAR WILL BENEFIT FROM THE TESTING OF THESE TWO FUEL TYPES SO THAT THE COMET MAY DETERMINE WHICH ALTERNATIVE FUEL WILL BE BEST SUITED TO THE AREA. THIS WILL IMPACT FUTURE VEHICLE PURCHASES FOR THE ENTIRE TRANSIT FLEET.5. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE CENTER FOR TRANSPORTATION AND THE ENVIRONMENT THE CENTER FOR TRANSPORTATION AND THE ENVIRONMENT (CTE) IS THE NATIONAL LEADER PROVIDING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOR ZERO-EMISSION BUS (ZEB) DEPLOYMENTS. CTE PROVIDES THE EXPERTISE NECESSARY TO HELP TRANSIT AGENCIES MITIGATE RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH ZEB DEPLOYMENTS. CTE UNDERSTANDS THE TECHNICAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE CHALLENGES ASSOCIATED WITH THE PROCUREMENT DEPLOYMENT AND OPERATION OF ZEBS. CTE HAS MANAGED A RANGE OF ZEB PROJECTS OVER THE LAST DECADE FROM NEW BUS DEVELOPMENT AND DEMONSTRATION PROJECTS TO FULL FLEET DEPLOYMENT PROJECTS. CTE HAS PROVIDED TECHNICAL AND MANAGEMENT SUPPORT TO MORE THAN 70 TRANSIT AGENCIES THAT HAVE EITHER DEPLOYED OR WILL SOON DEPLOY MORE THAN 300 ZEBS. THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST:LAPSING FY 2019 SECTION 5339 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE THE MYRTLE BEACH-SOCASTEE SC/NC UZA IN THE AMOUNT OF $124475; LAPSING FY 2019 SECTION 5339 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES FUNDS ORIGINALLY DESIGNATED FOR SOUTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION ASSIGNED TO WACCAMAW RTA IN THE AMOUNT OF $560000; FY 2020 SECTION 5339 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE THE MYRTLE BEACH-SOCASTEE SC/NC UZA IN THE AMOUNT OF $190607; FY 2021 SECTION 5339 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE THE MYRTLE BEACH-SOCASTEE SC/NC UZA IN THE AMOUNT OF $82580. THE AUTHORITY WILL ALSO UTILIZE STATE MATCHING TRANSIT FUNDS (SMTF) IN THE AMOUNT OF $140000 AS LOCAL FUNDINGAND ADDITIONAL LOCAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $99415 AS LOCAL MATCH FUNDING.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TWOFOLD: THE LEASE OF A TEMPORARY MAINTENANCE FACILITY AND ASSOCIATED CAPITAL ITEMS AND THE ACQUISITION AND IMPLEMENTATION OF A NEW TWO-WAY RADIO SYSTEM.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: WACCAMAW RTA HAS IDENTIFIED A MODERATELY-SIZED WAREHOUSE TO BE LEASED AND TO SERVE AS A TEMPORARY MAINTENANCE FACILITY. THE FACILITY IS LOCATED ABOUT 3 MILES FROM THE EXISTING FACILITY AND WILL REQUIRE A NUMBER OF INVESTMENTS THAT WILL MAXIMIZE THE UTILITY OF THE BUILDING AND ACTUALLY ENHANCE OUR MAINTENANCE CAPABILITIES. THESE INVESTMENTS INCLUDE A TEMPORARY MODULAR OFFICE/RESTROOM WASTE OIL BURNER (FOR HEAT) MOBILE LIFT DRIVE-ON LIFT SCREW COMPRESSOR PRESSURE WASHER SECURITY CAMERAS W/SERVER VENTILATION FANS COOLING FANS AND A NEW SERVICE TRUCK W/TIRE LIFT. WE WILL ALSO BE PROCURING A NEW RADIO SYSTEM TO REPLACE OUR CURRENT COMMUNICATION SYSTEM.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: WRTA RECENTLY LOST THE USE OF A LEASED PARKING LOT ACROSS THE STREET FROM OUR CURRENT FACILITY. THE LOSS OF THE LOT MEANS THAT WE DO NOT HAVE ENOUGH SPACE TO ACCOMMODATE ALL OF THE FUNCTIONS CURRENTLY HOUSED WITHIN THE FACILITY NAMELY FLEET AND EMPLOYEE PARKING. AFTER CAREFUL CONSIDERATION IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE BEST PATH FORWARD WAS TO SPLIT NEARLY ALL MAINTENANCE FUNCTIONS TO ANOTHER LOCATION AS LONG AS IT WAS NOT TOO FAR AWAY. BY MAKING THE INVESTMENTS IN THIS PROJECT NOT ONLY WILL WE CREATE SPACE IN OUR CURRENT FACILITY WE CAN IMPROVE THE CONDITIONS FOR OUR MAINTENANCE PERSONNEL ENHANCE OUR ABILITY TO MAINTAIN OUR FLEET AND IMPROVE SECURITY. THE RADIO SYSTEM WAS NEEDED PRIOR TO THE NEED FOR SPLIT OPERATIONS BUT THE RADIO SYSTEM WILL ENHANCE COMMUNICATION BETWEEN LOCATIONS IN ADDITION TO REPLACEMENT OF OUR CURRENT PUSH-TO-TALK CELLULAR COMMUNICATION SYSTEM.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THESE INVESTMENTS WILL IMPROVE CONDITIONS AT OUR AGING OBSOLETE FACILITY WHILE WE DEVELOP A NEW FACILITY. MANY OF THE INVESTMENTS WILL BE IN GOOD ENOUGH CONDITION TO MOVE TO THE NEW FACILITY ONCE CONSTRUCTED. THIS WILL IMPROVE THE SECURITY FOR OUR OPERATION AS A WHOLE ESPECIALLY WITH FLEET AND EMPLOYEE PARKING. WORKING CONDITIONS FOR MAINTENANCE PERSONNEL WILL IMPROVE.ALL PROJECTS QUALIFY FOR 80% FTA MATCH AND 20% LOCAL MATCH. PDRTA (DIRECT RECIPIENT) IS APPLYING FOR SFY 2020-2021 5339 LAPSING FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $851700. FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT PUBLIC FIXED ROUTE SERVICES IN THE URBANIZED AREA. FUNDS WILL ASSIST IN COVERING EXPENSES RELATED TO PROCURING (1) HEAVY DUTY LOW FLOOR BATTERY ELECTRIC BUS AND CHARGING STATION. THE COST WILL BE $851700 (FEDERAL) AND $150300 (VOLKSWAGEN SETTLEMENT FUNDS). PDRTA AND/OR ANY SUB-GRANTEE(S) (WHEN APPLICABLE) WILL FOLLOW ALL THIRD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACT GUIDANCE) PDRTA AND/OR SUB-GRANTEE(S) WILL ENSURE THAT CONTRACTORS PROCURED WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST. THIS REQUEST IS NOT FOR RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT. THE 1% SECURITY REQUIREMENT (IF REQUIRED) CAN BE FOUND IN SURVEILLANCE. ADDITIONAL SECURITY EXPENSES WILL OCCUR WITH THE SAFETY TRAINING. THE USEFUL LIFE OF THE BUS WILL BE 12 YEARS(500000 MILES) WITH A 15 YEAR BENCHMARK. THE THOMAS BUSES BEING REPLACED WERE 10 YEAR 350000 MILE USEFUL LIFE BUSES.

THIS GRANT APPLICATION IS FOR THE REMAINDER OF GTAS ALLOCATION OF THE FY18 5339(B) APPORTIONMENT FOR A NEW TRANSIT FACILITY IN THE GREENVILLE LARGE URBAN AREA TOTALING $11000000. THE APPLICATION WILL UTILIZE $8600000 OF THE FUNDS ALLOCATED TO THE GREENVILLE TRANSIT AUTHORITY (GTA). THE OTHER $2400000 HAS ALREADY BEEN APPLIED FOR IN GRANT 2020-035. THE OVERALL START DATE OF THIS APPLICATION IS THE GRANT AWARD DATE. THE OVERALL END DATE WILL BE MARCH 26 2026. THE GREENVILLE TRANSIT AUTHORITY (GTA) THE GRANTEE WILL NOT APPLY AN INDIRECT COST RATE TO ACTIVITIES. GTA IS A 5339 DIRECT RECIPIENT FOR THE GREENVILLE SOUTH CAROLINA UZA. THIS IS NOT A RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT GRANT.SUSTAINABILITYGTA PASSED A RESOLUTION IN FEBRUARY 2021 TO PURSUE ELECTRIC OR CNG BUSES. THIS RESOLUTION CAN BE FOUND AMONG THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS. A BRIEF HISTORY OF GTAS SUSTAINABILITY WORK TO DATE IS OUTLINED BELOW:IN 2017 GTA RECEIVED ITS FIRST LOW-NO GRANT FOR $1.35M WE COMBINED THAT WITH FUNDING IN THE MAULDIN-SIMPSONVILLE UZA AND PURCHASED OUR FIRST 4 40 PROTERRA E2 CATALYST BUSES.IN 2019 GTA WAS AWARDED $2.04M IN FUNDING TO BUY 4 DIESEL OR CNG (PENDING A STATION INSTALLED AT THE MAINTENANCE FACILITY) BUSES. IN 2020 GTA WAS AWARDED $5.27M IN LOW-NO GRANT FUNDING TO PURCHASE AN ADDITIONAL 6 BUSES THESE WILL COME ONLINE THE SAME TIME AS THE NEW MAINTENANCE FACILITY. THESE 10 BUSES2019 AND 2020 FUNDINGWOULD ALLOW US TO INCREASE THE FREQUENCY ON ROUTES FROM 60 MINUTES TO 30 MINUTES.AS OUTLINED IN THE RESOLUTION THE GOAL IS TO NO LONGER BUY DIESEL BUSES AFTER THE NEW MAINTENANCE FACILITY COMES ONLINE.PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT GREENLINK HAS CREATED A STAKEHOLDER TEAM THAT WILL MEET THROUGHOUT THE LIFE OF THE PROJECT AS WELL AS A PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT PLAN CONSISTING OF AT LEAST 5 PUBLIC MEETINGS. ADDITIONALLY GREENLINK IS OPEN TO AND HAS MET WITH SEVERAL INTERESTED PARTIES OUTSIDE OF THE STAKEHOLDER GROUP AND PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT MEETINGS INCLUDING THE WASHINGTON HIGH SCHOOL ALUMNI GROUP AND VARIOUS GOVERNMENT REPRESENTATIVES SUCH AS XANTHENE NORRIS THE COUNTY COUNCILMEMBER WHOSE DISTRICT THIS PROJECT IS IN. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION REGARDING THESE EFFORTS CAN BE FOUND VIA THE FOLLOWING LINKS:HTTPS://GREENVILLESC.GOV/1725/MAINTENANCE-FACILITY-PROJECTHTTPS://TEAMS.MICROSOFT.COM/_#/FILES/GENERAL?THREADID=19:5A2D410308A74896AB6B6F1D13AB9E76@THREAD.TACV2CTX=CHANNELCONTEXT=MAINTENANCE%2520FACILITY%2520-%25203.30.21%2520PUBLIC%2520MEETINGROOTFOLDER=%252FSITES%252FGREENLINK-PRANDSOCIALMEDIA%252FSHARED%2520DOCUMENTS%252FGENERAL%252FMAINTENANCE%2520FACILITY%2520-%25203.30.21%2520PUBLIC%2520MEETINGTITLE VI THE TITLE VI EQUITY ANALYSIS IS ATTACHED (PENDING).

WACCAMAW RTA IS SUBMITTING THIS THIS GRANT UTILIZING FY 2019 5339-1 BUSES AND BUS FACILITIES FORMULA (11.12.03 BUY REPLACEMENT 30-FT BUS) FUNDING FOR THE PURPOSE OF PERFORMING LIKE-KIND EXCHANGES ON THREE VEHICLES THAT WERE TAKEN OUT OF SERVICE PRIOR TO THE END OF THEIR USEFUL LIFE. THE AUTHORITY IS REPLACING THESE THREE VEHICLES WITH NEW ONES AND MAKING APPROVED ACCOMMODATIONS FOR REMAINING LIFE DUE TO FTA. ONE (1) ADDITIONAL FORD E450 STARCRAFT CUTAWAY MEDIUM SIZE; LIGHT-DUTY WILL ALSO BE PURCHASED FOR THE FLEET WITH REMAINING FY 2019 5339-1 BUSES AND BUS FACILITIES FORMULA FUNDING. DETAILS AS FOLLOWS:TWO (2) 2011 NAVISTAR-INTERNATIONAL EZ-360 MEDIUM DUTY BUSES VINS: 1HVBTSKM4BH33 1HVBTSKM4BH33 WERE DISPOSED OF PREMATURELY DUE TO UNREPAIRABLE MANUFACTURING DEFECTS AND TAKEN OUT OF SERVICE IN JUNE 2015 EACH WITH ABOUT 85000 SERVICE MILES. THE CURRENT FTA INTEREST BASED ON STRAIGHT-LINE DEPRECIATION CALCULATES TO $211487. THE VEHICLES WERE PURCHASED IN 2011 AT A TOTAL COST OF $407852 FUNDED BY GRANT SC-96-X008-00 AND SC-86-X001-00. THE VEHICLES WERE TAKEN OUT OF SERVICE IN JUNE 2015 WITH APPROXIMATELY 85000 SERVICE MILES AND HAD BEEN ESTABLISHED AT USEFUL LIFE OF 7 YEARS/200000 MILES EACH. THE REMAINING FTA INTEREST BASED ON STRAIGHT-LINE AT THE TIME OF DISPOSAL CALCULATES TO $211487 WHICH THE AUTHORITY HAS PURCHASED AND DESIRES TO TRANSFER MAXIMUM OUTSTANDING EQUITY TO TWO NEW FORD F-550 MEDIUM-SIZE; MEDIUM-DUTY TRANSIT BUSES: WITH AT LEAST SEVEN YEARS OR AN ACCUMULATION OF AT LEAST 200000 MILES. THE NEW VEHICLES ONLY COST $200346 WITH 85% FTA FUNDS TOTALING $170294 LEAVING A REMAINING BALANCE OF $41193 WHICH THE AUTHORITY PLANS TO APPLY AS A BUDGET ADJUSTMENT WITH LOCAL FUNDS. PLEASE SEE THE ATTACHED DOCUMENT RESPONSE LETTER ON WRTA TWO BUSES LIKE-KIND EXCHANGE FOR CLEARER EXPLANATION.$211487 (REMAINING LIFE DUE FTA)-$170294 (EQUITY TRANSFERRED TO NEW REPLACEMENT VEHICLES)- $41193 (GRANT BUDGET ADJUSTMENT VIA LOCAL FUNDS)ONE (1) 2017 FORD E450 STARCRAFT CUTAWAY MEDIUM SIZE; LIGHT-DUTY VAN WAS TOTALED IN A COLLISION ON APRIL 1 2019 WITH REMAINING FEDERAL LIFE. THE VEHICLES IDENTIFICATION NUMBER WAS 1FDFE4FS5HDC06782. THE VEHICLE WAS PURCHASED UNDER GRANT SC-2016-010-00 THROUGH WACCAMAW REGIONAL COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS WITH A FEDERAL SHARE OF 85% LEAVING A REMAINING FEDERAL INTEREST OF $30027. WACCAMAW RTA UNDERSTANDS THAT REMAINING LIFE COULD HAVE BEEN CALCULATED USING MILEAGE INSTEAD OF THE STRAIGHT-LINE METHOD BUT STRAIGHT-LINE WAS USED AND WACCAMAW REGIONAL COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS HAS PROVIDED THEIR CONCURRENCE LETTER ON THE REMAINING LIFE (SEE ATTACHED CONCURRENCE LETTER). WACCAMAW RTA SEEKS TO REPLACE THIS TOTALED 2017 FORD E450 STARCRAFT MEDIUM SIZE; LIGHT-DUTY CUTAWAY VAN WITH BY PURCHASING A NEW SIMILAR REPLACEMENT MEDIUM SIZE; LIGHT-DUTY CUTAWAY VEHICLE WITH A USEFUL LIFE OF 5 YEARS OR 150000 MILES FOLLOWING THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE STRAIGHT LINE/MILEAGE DEPRECIATION METHODOLOGY. WE WILL BE REPLACING THIS VEHICLE WITH THE SAME TYPE OF VEHICLE ALTHOUGH IT WILL BE EITHER A 2021 OR POSSIBLY 2022 YEAR MODEL BEING PURCHASED THROUGH THE SOUTH CAROLINA STATE CONTRACT. PURCHASE PRICE FOR THIS NEW REPLACEMENT VEHICLE WILL BE $75000 WITH THE FOLLOWING DETAILS RELATED TO SOURCE OF FUNDS:$30027 (REMAINING FEDERAL INTEREST FROM OUTGOING VEHICLE - 40%) RECEIVED FROM INSURANCE SETTLEMENT AS BUDGET ADJUSTMENT)$25223 (NEW ADDITIONAL 5339 FUNDS - 33.6%)$19750 (NEW LOCAL FUNDS - 26.4%)$75000 (TOTAL PURCHASE PRICE)THE AUTHORITY IS ALSO APPLYING FOR ADDITIONAL 5339 FUNDING TO PROCURE A 2ND NEEDED FORD E450 STARCRAFT CUTAWAY MEDIUM SIZE; LIGHT-DUTY VAN ALSO COSTING $75000 AND WILL BE UTILIZING REMAINING FY 2019 5339-1 BUSES AND BUS FACILITIES FORMULA AT 85% FEDERAL AND 15% LOCAL FUNDING AS FOLLOWS:$63750 5339 FUNDS - 85%$11250 LOCAL - 15%$75000 (TOTAL PURCHASE PRICE)THIS ADDITIONAL FORD E450 STARCRAFT CUTAWAY VAN WILL FALL UNDER A NEW PROJECT AND UNDER ALI 11.13.04 (BUS EXPANSION).ALL FOUR BUSES/VANS WILL BE PURCHASED THROUGH FTA APPROVED TVM DEALERS THROUGH SOUTH CAROLINA STATE CONTRACT. APPROPRIATE FEDERAL CLAUSES HAVE BEEN SIGNED AND VERIFIED THROUGH STATE PROCUREMENT.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS IS A RHODE ISLAND PUBLIC TRANSIT AUTHORITY (RIPTA) GRANT APPLICATION FOR A TOTAL OF $5032502 FEDERAL FUNDS CONSISTING OF LAPSING FY2020 SECTION 5339 FUNDS TO BE MATCHED WITH $1258126 GAS TAX RECEIPT FUNDS FOR THE PURCHASE OF NINE (8.84) 40-FOOT LOW FLOOR REPLACEMENT DIESEL BUSES. THESE FUNDS CONSIST OF $1507332 FY2020 SECTION 5339 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE PROVIDENCE RI-MA URBANIZED AREA $25170 FY2020 SECTION 5339 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE NORWICH-NEW LONDON CT AND $3500000 FY2020 SECTION 5339 APPORTIONED TO THE STATE OF RHODE ISLAND (SPLIT LETTERS ATTACHED). RIPTA IS PROVIDING $1258126 IN LOCAL MATCH USING GAS TAX RECEIPTS. FURTHER DETAIL ABOUT RIPTAS FUNDING SOURCES CAN BE OBTAINED ON PAGE 28 OF THE FFY 2022-2031 TIP (ATTACHED).; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS IN THIS GRANT WILL BE USED FOR: PURCHASE OF (9) 40-FOOT DIESEL BUSES ($6290628 TOTAL / $5032502 FED / $1258126 LOCAL) - THIS PROJECT WILL REPLACE BUSES THAT ARE BEYOND THEIR USEFUL LIFE IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN RIPTAS FLEET IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR. ; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDS INCLUDED IN THIS AWARD WILL ALLOW RIPTA TO PURCHASE REPLACEMENT DIESEL BUSES WILL HELP TO MAINTAIN RIPTAS FLEET IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR BY REPLACING BUSES THAT HAVE MET THEIR END-OF-LIFE.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AWARD ARE RIPTAS PASSENGERS AND OTHER VISITORS TO RHODE ISLAND.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR RIPTAS CAPITAL AND OPERATING EXPENSES TO CONTINUE SAFE AND RELIABLE SERVICE FOR THE NEXT 8-12 MONTH PERIOD.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS AWARD ARE: FIXED-ROUTE BUS PROCUREMENT PURCHASE COMPUTER EQUIPMENT SUPPORT FACILITY REHABILITATIONS PASSENGER FACILITY REHABILITATIONS PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE STUDY DEVELOPMENT TRAINING HIGH CAPACITY TRANSIT DEVELOPMENT COMPLEMENTARY ADA PARATRANSIT SERVICE PURCHASE OFFICE EQUIPMENT AND SECURITY ENHANCEMENTS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT RIPTA TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SAFE RELIABLE SERVICE AND MAINTAIN EXISTING FLEET AND AGENCY FACILITIES. IT WILL ALSO ALLOW FOR PLANNING INITIATIVES FOR EXPANSION OF SERVICE AND/OR OTHER OUTCOMES OUTLINED IN IN THE UPWP.THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES ARE CONSIDERED TO BE SAFETY-RELATED PROJECTS FULFILLING THE BIL REQUIREMENT TO SPEND NOT LESS THAN 0.75% OF THIS AWARD ON SAFETY-RELATED PROJECTS: SUPPORT FACILITY REHABILITATIONS; PASSENGER FACILITY REHABILITATIONS; PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE; AND SECURITY ENHANCEMENTS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: RIPTA AND PASSENGERS IN RHODE ISLAND WILL BENEFIT FROM THE CAPITAL AND OPERATING FUNDS WITHIN THIS AWARD AS THEY WILL ALLOW FOR RIPTA TO MAINTAIN ITS EXISTING FLEET AND PASSENGER AND ADMINISTRATIVE FACILITIES.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

RIPTA IS SEEKING TO OBLIGATE $4946440 IN FFY19 FTA SECTION 5339 FUNDS TO REHABILITATE THE EAST SIDE TUNNEL LOCATED IN PROVIDENCE RHODE ISLAND. OF THIS TOTAL $3500000 WILL COME FROM SECTION 5339 FUNDS APPROPRIATED TO THE STATE OF RHODE ISLAND AND THE REMAINING $1446440 WILL COME FROM THE URBANIZED AREA APPORTIONMENTS TO PROVIDENCE RI-MA UZA ($1422914) AND NORWICH-NEW LONDON CT-RI UZA ($23526). THE 2000 FOOT LONG TUNNEL IS CRITICAL TO RIPTAS OPERATIONS WITH SEVEN ROUTES TRAVELING THROUGH THE TUNNEL CARRYING APPROXIMATELY 10% OF ALL RIDERS. RIPTA WILL PROVIDE 20% MATCH USING RIPTA OPERATING FUNDS (GAS TAX).PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR RIPTA TO MAKE NECESSARY REPAIRS FOR THE CONTINUED SAFE USE AND PASSAGE THROUGH OF THE EAST SIDE BUS TUNNEL.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: REPAIRS WILL BE MADE TO THE STEEL STRUCTURE SPALLING OR CRACKED CONCRETE DRAINAGE SYSTEM AND PAVEMENT. IMPROVEMENTS WILL ALSO BE MADE TO LIGHTING. IN ADDITION STEPS WILL BE TAKEN TO IMPROVE THE SAFETY AND SECURITY OF THE TUNNEL TO ENSURE A SAFE EXPERIENCE FOR RIPTA TO OPERATE IN AND FOR THE PUBLIC. THESE REPAIRS WILL ENSURE THE TUNNEL REMAINS IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT RIPTA TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SERVICE ON ROUTES PASSING THROUGH THE EAST SIDE BUS TUNNEL WITHOUT CHANGING ROUTES AND INCONVENIENCING RIDERS. THE REPAIRS MADE TO THE TUNNEL WILL ALLOW FOR SAFE USE OF THE TUNNEL BY PEDESTRIANS AND BUSES AND THEIR RIDERS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: RIPTA AND THE RIDERS THAT RELY ON ITS SERVICE WILL BENEFIT FROM THE REPAIRS TO ENSURE CONTINUING SAFE AND EFFICIENT SERVICE. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE. TOTAL PROJECT BUDGET:THIS GRANT WILL BUILDS ON EXISTING FUNDS ALREADY OBLIGATED FOR TUNNEL REPAIRS. THIS IS A RIPTA REQUEST TO OBLIGATE $2440000 OF ITS $8040000 FFY 2019 SECTION 5339 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES DISCRETIONARY AWARD (NOFO APPLICATION AND AWARD ANNOUNCEMENT ARE ATTACHED). THE FUNDS IN THIS GRANT WILL BE USED FOR:- PROCUREMENT OF THREE (3) FULLY ACCESSIBLE 40 BUSES TO SUPPORT INCREASED OPERATIONS.- ENGINEERING AND DESIGN OF UNIVERSITY OF RHODE ISLAND MOBILITY HUB- ENGINEERING AND DESIGN OF KNIGHT CAMPUS OF THE COMMUNITY COLLEGE OF RHODE ISLAND MOBILITY HUBTHIS GRANT WILL BE AMENDED IN THE FUTURE TO ADD THE REMAINING $5600000 OF RIPTAS $8040000 TOTAL AWARD TO FUND THE CONSTRUCTION OF MOBILITY HUBS AT THE UNIVERSITY OF RHODE ISLAND CAMPUS AND THE KNIGHT CAMPUS OF THE COMMUNITY COLLEGE OF RHODE ISLAND.TOTAL PROJECT BUDGET:- FTA FUNDS: $8040000- LOCAL MATCH: $2790650- TOTAL COST: $10830650THE RHODE ISLAND PUBLIC TRANSIT AUTHORITY (RIPTA) PROVIDES 16.5 MILLION TRANSIT TRIPS ANNUALLY ON A NETWORK OF FIXED ROUTE FLEX ZONE AND PARATRANSIT SERVICES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF RHODE ISLAND. THE AGENCY DIRECTLY OPERATES 230 FIXED ROUTE VEHICLES AND 130 PARATRANSIT VANS. THE MAJORITY OF BUS SERVICE IS LOCATED IN URBAN CENTERS AROUND NARRAGANSETT BAY AND AMTRAKS NORTHEAST CORRIDOR. RIPTAS PRIMARY PASSENGER FACILITIES ARE LOCATED IN HISTORIC CITY CENTERS IN PROVIDENCE PAWTUCKET AND NEWPORT RI. RIPTA IS CURRENTLY DEVELOPING A LONG-RANGE TRANSIT MASTER PLAN TO GUIDE GROWTH OF THE AGENCY THROUGH 2040. THIS PLAN HAS IDENTIFIED SEVERAL AREAS OF INVESTMENT AROUND THE STATE OF RHODE ISLAND INCLUDING THE NEED FOR AN INCREASED PRESENCE AT THE UNIVERSITY OF RHODE ISLAND (URI) IN SOUTH KINGSTOWN AND THE COMMUNITY COLLEGE OF RHODE ISLANDS KNIGHT CAMPUS (CCRI) IN WARWICK. THESE TWO LOCATIONS WILL SERVE AS OPERATIONAL HUBS FOR RIPTA SERVICE IN THE SOUTHERN PORTION OF THE STATE AND WILL ALLOW FOR A SIGNIFICANT REDESIGN OF BUS SERVICE TO BETTER SERVE RIPTA PASSENGERS AND COMMUNITIES SOUTH OF PROVIDENCE WITH INCREASED CONNECTIONS AND FREQUENCY OF SERVICE.ADDITIONALLY RIPTAS CAPITAL PLAN AND THE STATES TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PLAN HAVE IDENTIFIED THESE TWO PROJECTS AS KEY CAPITAL PROJECTS FOR THE CONTINUED GROWTH AND DEVELOPMENT OF THE STATEWIDE TRANSIT SYSTEM. THESE INVESTMENTS WILL ALLOW FOR GROWTH OF SERVICE IN THE SOUTHERN HALF OF RHODE ISLAND WHILE ALSO DEVELOPING PASSENGER INFRASTRUCTURE TO A LEVEL THAT WILL MAKE RIPTA MORE ATTRACTIVE TO POTENTIAL RIDERS. ADDITIONAL DETAILS FOR THE PLANS AT THE TWO SITES ARE:RIPTA AND URI WILL CONSTRUCT A BUS HUB ON THE CAMPUS OF URI NEAR THE FLAGG ROAD PARKING LOT (SEE ATTACHED SUPPORTING DOCUMENT RIPTA PROPOSED SERVICE PLAN AND HUB LOCATION MAPS.PDF). THIS BUS HUB WILL CREATE A MOBILITY HUB ON THE UNIVERSITYS CAMPUS THAT WILL ALLOW FOR IMPROVED REGIONAL CONNECTIVITY AND ACCESS WITHIN AND AROUND THE CAMPUS VIA BUS BIKE OR FOOT. THIS HUB WILL INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ELEMENTS: 5-8 BUS BERTHS PASSENGER FACILITIES INCLUDING SHELTERS REAL-TIME DISPLAY SCREENS AND BICYCLE RACKS BUILDING WITH INTERIOR WAITING SPACE RESTROOMS AND TICKET VENDING MACHINES GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE INCLUDING SOLAR PANELS IN ADDITION RIPTA WILL MAKE IMPROVEMENTS TO THE CCRI KNIGHT CAMPUS IN WARWICK TO ALLOW FOR A MOBILITY HUB AT THAT LOCATION. WORK INCLUDES: 2-4 BUS BERTHS PASSENGER FACILITIES INCLUDING SHELTERS AND REAL-TIME DISPLAY SCREENS

RIPTA IS REQUESTING TO OBLIGATE $13989508 OF DISCRETIONARY FUNDING FOR THE PURCHASE OF FIXED ROUTE BUSES AS DETAILED BELOW. THE BREAKDOWN OF FUNDS BEING OBLIGATED IN THIS GRANT IS AS FOLLOWS (SUPPLEMENTAL AWARD INFORMATION IS ATTACHED): * $8913508 FY20 BUS AND BUS FACILITY DISCRETIONARY PROGRAM * $5076000 FY20 LOW/NO- EMISSION DISCRETIONARY PROGRAM. * $3497377 IN MATCH WILL BE PROVIDED FROM VARIOUS SOURCES (DETAILED BELOW) TOTAL: $17486885FY20 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES FUNDING:RIPTA WILL USE $8913508 ($11141885.13 WITH MATCH) OF 2020 BUS AND BUS FACILITY FUNDING FOR THE PURCHASE OF SEVENTEEN (17) FORTY-FOOT (40) DIESEL BUSES AT AN ESTIMATED PRICE OF $625268 EACH. RIPTA WILL PROVIDE $2228377 IN GAS TAX AS MATCHING FUNDS. THESE VEHICLES WILL BE ORDERED IN FY 2022 WITH EXPECTED DELIVERY IN FY 2023. THESE VEHICLES WILL REPLACE SEVENTEEN (17) DIESEL BUSES WHICH ENTERED SERVICE IN 2010 AND WILL HAVE REACHED THEIR USEFUL LIFE (12-YEARS OR 500000 MILES) BY THE TIME THESE NEW VEHICLES ARE DELIVERED TO RIPTA. FY20 LOW/NO- EMISSION DISCRETIONARY PROGRAMRIPTA WILL USE $5076000 OF LOW/NO EMISSION GRANT PROGRAM FUNDING AWARDED IN 2020 TO FUND THE INCREMENTAL COST OF CONVERTING FIFTEEN (15) FORTY-FOOT (40) DIESEL BUSES TO ELECTRIC. THE APPLICANT FOR THIS MULTI-SOURCE GRANT IS THE MUNICIPALITY OF ANASCO PUERTO RICO; FTA GRANTEE NO. 5815. THESE ARE SECTION 5307 FROM THE FISCAL YEAR 2016 AND SECTION 5339 FROM THE FISCAL YEAR 2018. ALL THE SECTION 5307 AWARD ITEMS ARE INCLUDED IN THE STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM - FISCAL YEARS 2019 2022 - AMENDMENT #3 SECTION 5307: PAGE NO. FTA- 46 (LINES 1213) AND SECTION 5339 FUNDS ARE INCLUDED ON PAGE NO. FTA -55 LINE 2. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMEDTHE SECTION 5307 ADA PARATRANSIT OPERATING ASSISTANCE REQUESTED WILL COVER ALL ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS SALARIES PRIMARY FRINGE BENEFITS ITEMS WITH A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR FUEL PARATRANSIT PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE AND PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION. A BREAKDOWN OF THE COSTS IS INCLUDED WITHIN THE PROJECT DESCRIPTION. SECTION 5339 ASSISTANCE WILL BE USED TO ACQUIRE TWO NEW 30 FT. BUSES TO OPERATE AN APPROVED ROUTE. A BREAKDOWN OF THIS COST IS INCLUDED WITHIN THE PROJECT DESCRIPTION. THE APPLICATION INCLUDES THREE PROJECTS: PROJECT I. ADA PARATRANSIT OPERATING ASSISTANCE SECTION 5307 -11.7C.00 NON-FIXED ROUTE ADA PARATRANSIT PROJECT II. SECTION 5339 SCOPE 11.13.04 - ACQUISITION OF TWO BUSES OF 30 FT. TO OPERATE ONE APPROVED ROUTE. PROJECT III. SECTION 5307 ADA PARATRANSIT PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE - 11.7A.00.EXPECTED OUTCOMESFUNDING WILL ALLOW THE ANASCO PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM TO:A) MEET PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE STANDARDS B) PROVIDE FULL-TIME AND CONTINUOUS ADA PARATRANSIT SERVICESC) ASSIST POOR PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AND THE ELDERLY WITH NO-COST TRANSPORTATION SERVICESD) PROVIDE FIXED ROUTE TRANSPORTATION TO AN UNSERVED RURAL COMMUNITY.INTENDED BENEFICIARIESTHE BENEFICIARIES OF PARATRANSIT SERVICES ARE THE ANASCO MUNICIPALITY RIDERS THAT RELY ON ITS SERVICE WITH NO OTHER MEANS FOR COMMUTING OR GETTING TO WORK. THE POPULATION 60 YEARS AND OVER IN ANASCO ACCOUNTS FOR 27.7% OR 7236 OF ITS POPULATION OF 26555. OF THIS ELDERLY POPULATION 53.8% HAVE AT LEAST ONE TYPE OF DISABILITY AND 41.3% ARE BELOW 100 PERCENT OF THE POVERTY LEVEL. (SOURCE: AMERICAN COMMUNITY SERVICE HTTPS://DATA.CENSUS.GOV/CEDSCI/TABLE?G=0500000US72011TID=ACSST5Y2020.S0102PR).THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE TWO NEW BUSES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF THE COMMUNITIES IN ROUTE # 3 APPROVED BY THE PUERTO RICO DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION FOR THE GEOGRAPHICAL AREA OF ESPINO AND OVEJAS WARDS. THESE WARDS ARE NEARLY A ONE-AND-A-HALF-MILE DISTANCE FROM THE ANASCO URBAN CENTER WHICH IS LONG IN A SMALL TOWN. THE POPULATION FOR THOSE COMMUNITIES IS 2809 ALL RURAL WITH 29.9% 60 YEARS AND OVER AND A POVERTY LEVEL OF MORE THAN 40%. (SOURCE: DP05 ACS DEMOGRAPHIC AND HOUSING ESTIMATES 2013-2017 AMERICAN COMMUNITY SURVEY 5-YEAR ESTIMATES). PURPOSE OF THE AWARDTHE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE SECTION 5307 ADA PARATRANSIT OPERATING ASSISTANCE INCLUDING PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE DRUG AND ALCOHOL TESTING AND PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION TO THE MUNICIPALITY OF ANASCO DURING THE LOCAL FISCAL YEAR (JULY 1-JUNE 30) 2022-2023 AND FOR THE FIRST QUARTER (JULY 1- SEPTEMBER 30) OF FISCAL 2023-2024. PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE FUNDS WILL BE USED DURING THE PERIOD OF JULY 1-JUNE 30 2022-2023 WHICH IS THE LOCAL FISCAL YEAR. THE AWARD ALSO INCLUDES SECTION 5339 FUNDS FOR ACQUIRING TWO NEW 30 FT. BUSES TO OPERATE AN APPROVED ROUTE. THE ANASCO TRANSIT SYSTEM OPERATES WITH FIVE SECTION 5307 VEHICLES: THREE ARE FOR FIXED-ROUTE AND TWO FOR COMPLEMENTARY ADA PARATRANSIT. THE MUNICIPALITY DOES NOT CHARGE FEES FOR THE SERVICE. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES - THERE ARE NO SUB-RECIPIENT ACTIVITIES. THE USES OF SECTION 5307 FUNDS WHICH AMOUNT TO $129086 WILL BE DISTRIBUTED AS: $116714 FOR ADA PARATRANSIT OPERATING ASSISTANCE PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION AND DRUG AND ALCOHOL TESTING AND $12372 FOR PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE FOR TWO PARATRANSIT BUSESTHE USE OF $219003 IN SECTION 5339 FUNDS WILL BE FOR ACQUIRING TWO NEW ELEVEN-PASSENGER OR LESS VEHICLES. THE TOTAL GRANT AMOUNT REQUESTED IS $348089. THE TOTAL FEDERAL AMOUNT FOR SECTION 5307 IS $129 086 INCLUDING $25817 (20%) OF TOLL DEVELOPMENT CREDIT. THE TOTAL FEDERAL AMOUNT IS $219003 FOR SECTION 5339 INCLUDING $32850 (15%) OF TOLL DEVELOPMENT CREDIT. THE MUNICIPALITY OF CAGUAS REQUEST $2600000 COMPETITIVE SECTION 5339 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES FY 17 LAPSING FUNDS TO RENOVATE THE 40-YEAR-OLD FRANCISCO PEREIRA TRANSPORTATION TERMINAL. THE TOTAL BUDGET FOR THIS APPLICATION IS $3250000 ($2600000 FEDERAL AND $650000 LOCAL).THE FRANCISCO PEREIRA TRANSPORTATION TERMINAL WAS CONSTRUCTED IN 1980. THIS FACILITY HAS NOT EXPERIENCED ANY MAJOR REPAIRS IN THE ALMOST 40 YEARS THEY IT HAS BEEN IN OPERATION. THE BUILDING HAS EXPERIENCED THE CORROSION WEAR AND TEAR CAUSED BY THE EXTREMELY HOT AND HUMID TROPICAL WEATHER SEVERAL HURRICANES AND FREQUENT TROPICAL STORMS THAT HIT THE AREA. ON AUGUST 30 2017 THE MUNICIPALITY WAS AWARDED GRANT PR-2017-015-00 TO REPAIR AND UPGRADE THE TRANSPORTATION TERMINAL AND A TOTAL BUDGET OF $3289403 ($2631522 FEDERAL AND $657522 LOCAL) IN SECTION 5339 FORMULA FUNDS. HOWEVER THE PROJECT SCOPE CHANGED FROM REPAIRS AND UPGRADES TO THE RECONSTRUCTION OF THE FACILITY. THE TERMINAL ALSO SUFFERED CRACKS IN SOME WALLS OF ITS FIRST-FLOOR OFFICE AREA CAUSED BY RECENT SMALL QUAKES AND TELLURIC MOVEMENTS THAT ARE FREQUENT IN THE ISLAND. IT IS NECESSARY TO CARRY OUT A MAJOR REPAIR EFFORT TO PREVENT THESE FROM WEAKENING THE AREA FURTHER AND EVEN CAUSED ITS CLOSURE IN THE FUTURE. AS MUCH AS FUNDS ALLOW THE MUNICIPALITY WILL ALSO SEEK TO RENOVATE PASSENGER SERVICE AREAS TO MAKE THEM MORE APPEALING TO RIDERS AND TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS. IT HOPES TO CONVERT IT INTO AN ATTRACTIVE COMMERCIAL VENTURE THAT WILL GENERATE MUCH NEEDED REVENUE TO SUPPORT THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE TRANSCRIOLLO TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM. ON APRIL 30 2021 THE MUNICIPALITY OF CAGUAS WAS AWARDED GRANT PR-2021-012-00 FOR SECTION 5324 EMERGENCY RELIEF FUNDS. IN THIS AWARD A TOTAL OF $486096 ($486096 FEDERAL AND $48610 TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDITS) WERE ASSIGNED FOR PERMANENT REPAIRS OF THE TERMINAL ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE CORRECTION OF THE TERMINAL 2ND FLOOR WATER LEAKS TERMINAL PAINTING AND ACQUISITION OF ELECTRONIC BOARDS DUE TO THE DAMAGES CAUSED BY HURRICANE MARIA. THE TOTAL COST OF THE PERMANENT REPAIRS WAS $682055 BUT THE MUNICIPALITY RECEIVED $195959 FROM ITS INSURANCE COMPANY. NO OTHER SOURCE OF FEDERAL FUNDING WAS RECEIVED. THE MUNICIPALITY OF CAGUAS CURRENTLY HAS AN ADDITIONAL $4768478 IN SECTION 5339 FORMULA FUNDS PROGRAMED IN THE 2019-2022 STIP AMENDMENT #2 ITEM #2 PAGE FTA-32. THESE ADDITIONAL $4.768M WILL BE REQUESTED THROUGH AN UPCOMING AMENDMENT TO AWARD PR-2017-015-00.THE MUNICIPALITY CERTIFIES THAT THE ACTIVITIES CONSIDERED UNDER THIS GRANT APPLICATION (2417-2020-1) AWARD PR-2021-012-00 AND AWARD PR-2017-015-00 (OR UPCOMING AMENDMENT) ARE INDEPENDENT ACTIVITIES AND THERE IS NO DUPLICATION AMONG THEM.THE TOTAL ESTIMATED RECONSTRUCTION COSTS EXCEED $10650000. IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION THE MUNICIPALITY OF CAGUAS REQUESTS AN ADDITIONAL $2600000 (SECTION 5339 COMPETITIVE FUNDS) TO CONTINUE WITH THE TERMINAL RENOVATION AND ACQUISITION OF EQUIPMENT. THE COST ESTIMATES FOR THE ACTIVITIES REQUESTED IN THIS APPLICATION ATTACHED IN THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS SECTION. THE ACTIVITIES THAT ARE BEING INCORPORATED UNDER THIS GRANT ARE BROKEN DOWN BELOW:1)NEW METAL ROOF - $472495 (EXPECTED MINIMUM USEFUL LIFE - 20 YEARS)2)NEW BATHROOM - $273600 (EXPECTED MINIMUM USEFUL LIFE - 20 YEARS)3)NEW EXTERIOR CONSTRUCTION - $926266 (EXPECTED MINIMUM USEFUL LIFE - 20 YEARS)4)NEW ELEVATOR STAIR - $320000 (EXPECTED MINIMUM USEFUL LIFE - 20 YEARS)5)NEW UNDERGROUND WATER RESERVE PUMP SYSTEM - $150000 (EXPECTED MINIMUM USEFUL LIFE - 20 YEARS)6) NEW EMERGENCY POWER GENERATOR - $200000 (EXPECTED MINIMUM USEFUL LIFE - 20 YEARS)7) NEW LIGHTING SYSTEM - $128071 (EXPECTED MINIMUM USEFUL LIFE - 15 YEARS)8)NEW FIRE ALARM SYSTEM - $70000 (EXPECTED MINIMUM USEFUL LIFE - 15 YEARS)9)NEW COMMUNICATIONS AND SIGNALS SYSTEM - $59568 (EXPECTED MINIMUM USEFUL LIFE - 10 YEARS)10)NEW SUBSTATION AND PRIMARY POWER SYSTEM - $120000 (EXPECTED MINIMUM USEFUL LIFE - 20 YEARS)11)NEW SECONDARY POWER - $300000 (EXPECTED MINIMUM USEFUL LIFE - 20 YEARS)12)TRANSIT OFFICE AND PASSENGER SPACES FURNITURE EQUIPMENT - $150000 (EXPECTED MINIMUM USEFUL LIFE - 10 YEARS)13)PARKING EQUIPMENT - $50000 (EXPECTED MINIMUM USEFUL LIFE - 10 YEARS)14)PBLICOS OPERATION SYSTEMS - $30000 (EXPECTED MINIMUM USEFUL LIFE - 10 YEARS)TOTAL = $3250000FEDERAL = $2600000LOCAL = $650000THESE ARE FY2017 COMPETITIVE FUNDS APPORTIONED IN THE 2019-2022 STIP AMENDMENT #2 ITEM #1 PAGE FTA-42. THE MUNICIPALITY IS A DIRECT RECIPIENT AND WAS GRANTED THE AUTHORITY BY THE PUERTO RICO HIGHWAY AUTHORITY TO REQUEST THESE FUNDS DIRECTLY THROUGH TRAMS. THE ORIGINAL PROJECT CONTEMPLATED THE ACQUISITION OF VEHICLES. THESE WERE TO FINANCE VEHICLES TO PUBLIC CARRIERS BUT IN THE END THEY DECLINED TO ACCEPT. THEREFORE THE MUNICIPALITY DECIDED TO ALLOCATE THESE FUNDS ENTIRELY FOR THE RECONSTRUCTION OF THE FRANCISCO PEREIRA TERMINAL. THE CONTRACTOR ESTIMATES THAT MINIMUM USEFUL LIFE WILL INCREASE BY 30 YEARS. THIS IS AN FFY 2019 SECTION 5307 AND 5339 APPLICATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $468000.00 (5307) AND $60175 (5339). THE MUNICIPALITY OF CAMUY FALLS IN THE FUNDING CATEGORY OF BOTH THE URBANIZED AREA OF AGUADILLA (AUA) AND URBANIZED AREAS UNDER 200000 POPULATION (UZA). THE REQUESTED FUNDING FOR THIS GRANT APPLICATION WILL BE FROM THE PUERTO RICO UZA.THE 5307 APPLICATION IS FOR TWO (2) VEHICLES OF 24 PASSENGERS FOR THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF $468000 ($70200 TDCS)THE 5339 APPLICATION IS FOR THE PURCHASE OF 14 COMMUNICATIONS SECURITY AND TRACKING DEVICES (GPS) FOR THE AMOUNT OF $60175.00 ($12035 TDCS)PROJECT JUSTIFICATION / BRIEF SUMMARY:THE MUNICIPALITY OF CAMUY IS APPLYING FOR FUNDS UNDER SECTION 5307 OF THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA). THE REQUESTED FUNDS WILL ALLOW US TO PURCHASE (2) TWENTY-FOUR PASSENGER VEHICLES FOR THE EXPANSION OF FIXED ROUTE SERVICE. THE MUNICIPALITY CURRENTLY OPERATES THREE FIXED ROUTES AND PROVIDES DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICES. THE FIXED ROUTE SERVICE IS OPERATED BY THE TOURISM DEPARTMENT AND SERVICE IS ACCESSIBLE FREE OF COST FOR ALL RESIDENTS AND TOURISTS.THE OFFICE OF TOURISM FORMS PART OF OUR MUNICIPALITY OF CAMUYS PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM (CPTS) WHICH ALLOWS CAMUY RESIDENTS AND VISITORS TO LIVE MORE INDEPENDENTLY TAKE CONTROL OF THEIR LIVES AND PARTICIPATE FULLY AND PRODUCTIVELY WITHIN OUR COMMUNITY. ITS FIXED ROUTE TRAVELS ALONG MAJOR ROADS IN CAMUY. THIS SERVICE PROVIDES ACCESS TO WORK SCHOOLS BANKS PARKS SUPERMARKETS THE MAIN STREET MEDICAL FACILITIES ASSISTED LIVING CENTERS RECREATIONAL AREAS AND ENTERTAINMENT. THESE VEHICLES WILL ALLOW US TO EXPAND TWO MORE ROUTES FOR AREAS THAT ARE IN DIRE NEED OF ACCESSIBLE TRANSPORTATION.THE MUNICIPALITY OF CAMUY IS APPLYING FOR FUNDS UNDER SECTION 5339 OF THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) AS WELL. THE COMMUNICATION AND TRACKING EQUIPMENT PURCHASED WILL ALLOW ADMINISTRATION TO MAINTAIN HIGHER SAFETY STANDARDS AND MONITOR THE FUNCTIONALITY OF THE ROUTES AND EFFECTIVENESS. THE MUNICIPALITY OF CAMUY WILL ENSURE THAT ALL VEHICLES PURCHASED ARE ACCESSIBLE PURCHASED FROM AN FTA APPROVED TVM AND REPORTED TO FTA WITHIN 30 DAYS AFTER THE CONTRACT IS SIGNED. THE MUNICIPALITY WILL CHECK THE CURRENT LISTING OF TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURERS (TVM) (HTTPS: //WWW.TRANSIT.DOT.GOV/REGULATIONS-AND-GUIDANCE/CIVIL-RIGHTS-ADA/ELEGIBLE-TVMS-LIST) TO ENSURE EACH IS LISTED AS A CERTIFIED TVM IN COMPLIANCE WITH FTA REGULATIONS. THE MUNICIPALITY OF CAMUY WILL FOLLOW ALL FTA 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE).THE MUNICIPALITY OF CAMUY WILL ENSURE CONTRACTORS PROCURED WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.THE MUNICIPALITY OF CAMUY WILL OWN AND ENSURE PROPER OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF THE NEW VEHICLES.

BR #1 - MAY 21 2022- WE WILL BE MOVING $25125 FROM ALI 602-00 ORIGINALLY INTENDED FOR THE PROJECT ADMINISTRATION TO ALI 113-00 IN ORDER TO PROVIDE THE FULL AMOUNT OF $181343 FOR THE REHAB OF THE BARCELONA TERMINAL.- ALI 113-00 REHAB/RENOVATE BUS STATION - WE WILL NOT BE INCLUDING THE ACTIVITIES OF PAINT AND LIGHTING REPAIRS FOR THE BARCELONA TERMINAL AND WILL INCLUDE THE REHABILITATION OF THE THIRD LEVEL OF THE BARCELONA TERMINAL BUILDING THIS WILL INCLUDE THE REMOVAL OF SURFACE MATERIAL SEALING OF SURFACE AND RESURFACING OF THIRD LEVEL AREA. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PRESSURE WASHING SEALING AND PAINTING OF COMMON AREAS AS WELL. - EXTEND POP TO MARCH 30 2029. ACTIVITIES WILL END ON 6/30/2023 AND FIVE YEARS AFTER PER NEW GUIDANCE WILL BE 3/30/2029._________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________THIS GRANT WILL USE FY 2019 SECTION 5339 TOTALING $352838 ($61669 TDCS). THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ACQUISITION OF THREE 10 PASSENGERS HANDICAP ACCESSIBLE BUSES FOR THREE PRINCIPAL ROUTES (FY 2019-2022 STIP PAGE 95 ITEM NO. 14 PENDING ADMINISTRATIVE AMENDMENT) FOR A TOTAL OF $165000 ($24750 TDCS); PAINT AND LIGHTNING REPAIR FOR BARCELONA TERMINAL (FY 2019-2022 STIP PAGE 95 ITEM NO. 15 PENDING ADMINISTRATIVE AMENDMENT) ALONG WITH PROJECT ADMINISTRATION FOR A TOTAL OF $181343 ($36269 TDCS); PUBLIC ANNOUNCEMENT SYSTEMS FOR FIVE NEW VEHICLES (FY 2019-2022 STIP PAGE 95 ITEM NO. 16 PENDING ADMINISTRATIVE AMENDMENT) FOR A TOTAL OF $4795 ($480 TDCS) AND THE ACQUISITION OF GPS SYSTEMS FOR FIVE BUSES (FY 2019-2022 STIP PAGE 95 ITEM NO. 17 PENDING ADMINISTRATIVE AMENDMENT) FOR A TOTAL OF $1700 ($170 TDCS). THE PLANNING AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT REQUESTED FUNDS THROUGH THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) FOR THE ACQUISITION OF 9 BUSES FOR 5 DIFFERENT ROUTES IN ORDER TO SERVICE THE DIFFERENT COMMUNITIES OF MAYAGUEZ. THESE BUSES HAVE BEING SERVING OUR COMMUNITIES 5 DAYS A WEEK 12 HOURS NONSTOP WITH MANY HOURS OF USAGE CAUSING THE NORMAL WEAR AND TEAR. WE CURRENTLY HAVE 6 TROLLEYS THAT SERVE THE THREE MAIN ROUTES THROUGHOUT THE CITY CENTER. THESE ROUTES ARE HIGH VOLUME ROUTES ARE IN NEED OF REINFORCEMENT.. THERE HAVE BEEN SITUATIONS WHERE ONE TWO OR EVEN THE THREE BUSES AT THE SAME TIME ARE OUT OF SERVICE. THESE VEHICLES COULD BE USED IN SITUATIONS LIKE THE ONES MENTIONED BEFORE SO THAT NO VEHICLE IS OVER STRESSED BY HAVING TO COVER ANY OTHER ROUTES OR EVEN STOP TRANSPORTATION SERVICE. ITS BECAUSE OF THESE SITUATIONS THAT WE ARE REQUESTING THREE 10 PASSENGERS HANDICAP ACCESSIBLE BUSES. USEFUL LIFE OF THESE MEDIUM-LIGHT DUTY VEHICLES IS 5 YEARS.FOR ALL NEW AND EXISTING VEHICLES WERE ALSO REQUESTING 5 PUBLIC ANNOUNCEMENT SYSTEMS (PAS) AND 5 GPS AS WELL. THIS EQUIPMENT IS NECESSARY FOR PROPER VEHICLE USAGE AND TO COMPLY WITH FEDERAL REGULATIONS. FTA REQUIRES THAT ALL VEHICLES HAVE PAS AND GPS PROPERLY INSTALLED IN EACH VEHICLE. THE EQUIPMENT WILL INCLUDE AN EXTENDED BATTERY AND PROTECTIVE CASE WITH MAGNETIC PROTECTIVE CASE. AS PER FTA C 5010.1D IN PAGES IV-16 AND IV-17 USEFUL LIFE DOES NOT APPLY TO THIS ITEMS.WE ARE ALSO REQUESTING MAINTENANCE FUNDS FOR A PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION TERMINAL CALLED THE BARCELONA TERMINAL. THE STRUCTURES WALLS RAILING WALLS BENCHES STAIR WALLS ELEVATOR WALLS BOOTHS AND EXTERIOR SURFACE NEED TO BE CLEANED WITH PRESSURE / CHEMICAL SPRAY AND DISINFECT THE EXISTING FUNGUS CAUSED BY MOISTURE. THE INTERIOR AND EXTERIOR WALLS WILL BE SEALED PRIMED AND PAINTED WITH TWO FINISH COATS. THE PAINTING HAS A USEFUL LIFE OF 5 YEARS. THE LIGHTS AND SECURITY LIGHTS WILL BE REMOVED AND REPLACED. THIS WILL INCLUDE EXTERIOR WALL PACK LIGHTS LED OF 250 WATTS SECURITY LIGHTS AND ITS WIRING AND INTERIOR WALL PACK LIGHTS LED. LED LIGHTS HAVE A USEFUL LIFE OF 12 YEARS. IN ADDITION WE ARE REQUESTING FUNDS FOR THE OVERSIGHT OF THIS PROJECT.THE MUNICIPALITY OF MAYAGUEZ IS THE DIRECT RECIPIENT OF THESE FUNDS. START DATE IS THE DATE OF AWARD AND THE END DATE IS MARCH 30 2024. PRHTA IS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT; MAYAGUEZ IS THE DIRECT. INDIRECT COSTS WILL NOT BE CHARGED. COUNTY OF LACKAWANNA TRANSIT SYSTEM (COLTS) IS APPLYING THE FOLLOWING FEDERAL FUNDS TOWARDS THE PURCHASE OF MISCELLANEOUS SHOP EQUIPMENT ADA RELATED EXPENSES SECURITY SERVICES IT SOFTWARE EQUIPMENT PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE BUS RADIO PURCHASE INSTALLATION BUS ELECTRICAL UPGRADE INSTALLATION AND LEASE ASSOCIATED CAPITAL MAINTENANCE ITEMS. TOTAL AMOUNT OF FEDERAL FUNDING SCRANTON PA UZA OF $1964000 AND IS BROKEN UP AMONG THE FOLLOWING FUNDING SOURCES: SECTION 5307 - $1436000 - FY17 $70122 - FY18 $1365878 SECTION 5339 - $528000 - FY17 $211125 - FY18 $293270 - FY19 $23605 THE NON-FEDERAL SHARE WILL BE PROVIDED BY THE COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (PENNDOT) AND THE COUNTY OF LACKAWANNA.BUDGET REVISION #1AFTER REVIEWING BUDGETARY ASSUMPTIONS RELATED TO THE ADA AND PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE PROJECTS WE HAVE DETERMINED THAT ACTUAL COSTS RELATED TO THE ADA PROJECT ARE NOT GOING TO MEET OUR ESTIMATES. LIKEWISE THE ACTUAL PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE COSTS WILL EXCEED OUR PROJECTIONS. WITH THIS BUDGET REVISION WE ARE PROPOSING TO MOVING FUNDING BETWEEN THESE EXISTING PROJECTS AS FOLLOWS:$131730 (FEDERAL SHARE) MOVED FROM PROJECT PA-2020-039-06-00 ADA ALLOWABLE EXPENDITURES$131730 (FEDERAL SHARE) MOVED TO PROJECT PA-2020-039-03-00 PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCEBUDGET REVISION #2AFTER REVIEWING BUDGETARY ASSUMPTIONS RELATED TO THE TIRE LEASE AND PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE PROJECTS WE HAVE DETERMINED THAT ACTUAL COSTS RELATED TO THE TIRE LEASE PROJECT ARE NOT GOING TO MEET OUR ESTIMATES. LIKEWISE THE ACTUAL PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE COSTS WILL EXCEED OUR PROJECTIONS. WITH THIS BUDGET REVISION WE ARE PROPOSING TO MOVING FUNDING BETWEEN THESE EXISTING PROJECTS AS FOLLOWS:$14832 (FEDERAL SHARE) MOVED FROM PROJECT PA-2020-039-04-00 TIRE LEASE$14832 (FEDERAL SHARE) MOVED TO PROJECT PA-2020-039-03-00 PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCEBUDGET REVISION #3PURPOSEDUE TO COVID-19 WE HAVE SEEN A LACK OF DEMAND FOR ADA SERVICE WHICH IS THE PRIMARY DRIVER RELATED TO THE OVER-ESTIMATION OF ADA EXPENSE. WHEN WE ESTIMATED OUR FUNDING REQUIREMENTS RELATED TO THE CARES ACT GRANT WE UNDER-BUDGETED PM RELATED EXPENSES. WE DID THIS BECAUSE WE WERE AFRAID OF NOT HAVING ENOUGH FUNDING FOR SALARIES AND EMPLOYEE BENEFITS DURING THE PANDEMIC. OUR STRATEGY WORKED AS WE HAVE KEPT OUR EMPLOYEES EMPLOYED AND ON OUR BENEFIT PLAN THROUGHOUT THE MAJORITY OF TIME DURING THE PANDEMIC HOWEVER IT HAS CAUSED US TO BE UNDER-FUNDED AS IT RELATES TO OUR PM BUDGET.WHEN WE BUDGETED FOR A BUS ELECTRICAL UPGRADE WE DID ANTICIPATED THAT WE WERE GOING TO CHANGE DPIMS ON 13-14 BUSES OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR. IN REALITY WE JUST HAVENT SEEN THE FAILURE RATE THAT WE WERE EXPECTED TO SEE SO WE FEEL THAT KEEPING THIS LEVEL OF FUNDING WITHIN THIS PROJECT IS UNNECESSARY. WITH THIS PROPOSED BUDGET REVISION WE ARE REQUESTING THE FOLLOWING ALTERATIONS TO THE BUDGET:$12270 (FEDERAL SHARE) MOVED FROM PROJECT PA-2020-039-06 ADA ALLOWABLE EXPENSES$307184 (FEDERAL SHARE) MOVED FROM PROJECT PA-2020-039-02 BUS ELECTRICAL UPGRADE$12270 (FEDERAL SHARE) MOVED TO PROJECT PA-2020-039-03 PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE$307184 (FEDERAL SHARE) MOVED TO PROJECT PA-2020-039-07 BUS FACILITY MAINTWHEN COLTS FIRST CREATED ITS BUDGET FOR THIS GRANT WE WERE ANTICIPATING THE NEED TO PURCHASE SHOP EQUIPMENT RELATED TO SHELVING AND PAINT EQUIPMENT. WE WERE ABLE TO FIND CHEAPER ALTERNATIVES HOWEVER. THE FUNDING WILL INSTEAD BE MOVED TO IT SOFTWARE AND EQUIPMENT AS THIS FUNDING IS NEEDED TO PURCHASE A SCHEDULING SOFTWARE. THIS SOFTWARE WILL HELP OUR OPERATIONS STAFF CHANGE ROUTE CONFIGURATIONS AND SCHEDULE ROUTE TIMES MORE EFFICIENTLY. WITH THE PROPOSED BUDGET REVISION WE ARE REQUESTING TO MOVE FUNDING ACROSS THE FOLLOWING PROJECTS:$31505 (FEDERAL SHARE) FROM MISCELLANEOUS SHOP TOOLS TO$31505 (FEDERAL SHARE) IT SOFTWARE EQUIPMENT WE ARE ALSO REQUESTING TO EXTEND THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE TO 01/31/2022.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED WITH THIS REVISIONTHIS REVISION WILL MOVE FUNDING INTO THE PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE IT SOFTWARE EQUIPMENT BUS FACILITY MAINTENANCE PROJECTS.EXPECTED OUTCOMESTHIS REVISION WILL HELP IMPROVE THE EFFICIENCY OF OUR OPERATIONS EQUIPMENT.INTENDED BENEFICIARIESCOLTS EMPLOYEES CITIZENS OF LACKAWANNA COUNTY PA.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIESNONE. BUDGET REVISION #4THIS BUDGET REVISION IS TO EXTEND THE CURRENT PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE TO 04/29/2022. DESPITE ALL OF OUR PLANNED PROJECTS WITHIN THIS GRANT BEING COMPLETED WE HAVE SEEN DELAYS IN INVOICING THAT HAS DELAYED OUR GRANT DRAW PROCESS. WE BELIEVE THAT ALL OF THE INVOICES WILL BE RECEIVED AND GRANT DRAWS WILL BE COMPLETED BY THE END OF APRIL.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED WITH THIS REVISIONTHIS REVISION WILL EXTEND THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE TO THE END OF APRIL.EXPECTED OUTCOMESTHIS REVISION WILL GIVE COLTS MORE TIME TO CLOSE OUT THIS GRANT.INTENDED BENEFICIARIESCOLTS EMPLOYEES CITIZENS OF LACKAWANNA COUNTY PA.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIESNONE.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES $2290000 OF FEDERAL FY2018 SECTION 5339(C) LOW OR NO-EMISSION BUS PROGRAM GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS FOR TRIMETS ZERO EMISSION BUS PROJECT AND WILL FUND THE ACQUISITION OF UP TO (5) ZERO EMISSION BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES WITH DEPOT AND ON-ROUTE CHARGING EQUIPMENT.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: TRIMET INTENDS TO USE THE FIVE (5) BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES TO REPLACE FIVE (5) 2600 NEW FLYER LOW-FLOOR 40 DIESEL BUSES WHICH WILL BE 15 YEARS OLD AT RETIREMENT IN FY2021 AS THEY WERE ADDED TO THE FLEET IN FY2003. TRIMET IS ALSO USING PLANNING TO OPERATE THESE VEHICLES OUT OF MERLO GARAGE IN PART BECAUSE IT HAS IMMEDIATE CAPACITY FOR ADDITIONAL GROWTH AND TO CAPITALIZE ON EXISTING BEB INFRASTRUCTURE.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: BY DEPLOYING BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES IN PLACE OF THE EXISTING DIESEL BUSES TRIMET WILL REDUCE THE ENERGY CONSUMPTION AND HARMFUL EMISSIONS INCLUDING THE EMISSION OF GREENHOUSE GASES ASSOCIATED WITH ITS FLEET. THE BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES THAT TRIMET IS PROPOSING TO PUT INTO SERVICE WILL CONSUME LESS ENERGY PER MILE DRIVEN THAN BUSES THAT USE OTHER COMMON PROPULSION TECHNOLOGIES SUCH AS GASOLINE DIESEL AND NATURAL GAS ENGINES. EVEN WHEN CONSIDERING WELL-TO-WHEEL ENERGY REQUIREMENTS BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES ARE A MORE EFFICIENT TRANSIT SOLUTION THAN THESE OTHER VEHICLE TECHNOLOGIES. OPERATING BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES INSTEAD OF A COMPARABLE STANDARD BUS (MODEL YEAR 2018 DIESEL BUS) WILL REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF ENERGY THAT TRIMET USES EACH YEAR BY 8.5 TERAJOULES (TJ).; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS PILOT PROJECT CONTINUE TO PROVIDE TRIMET WITH VALUABLE FIRSTHAND EXPERIENCE AND UNDERSTANDING OF HOW THIS NEW EXTENDED RANGE BATTERY BUS TECHNOLOGY PERFORMS IN PORTLANDS OPERATING ENVIRONMENT AND CLIMATE. THE FIVE ELECTRIC BUSES WILL BE DEPLOYED ON THE LINE 20 (18 MILE LONG ROUTE SPANNING GRESHAM ON THE EASTSIDE TO BEAVERTON ON THE WESTSIDE OF PORTLAND REGION) ALONG WITH OTHER LINES.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

THE OKLAHOMA STATE UNIVERSITY (OSU) IS CONSTRUCTING A TRANSIT OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY (TOMF) TO REPLACE THEIR CURRENT 52 YEAR OLD MAINTENANCE FACILITY. THE PROJECT SITE IS LOCATED AT THE SOUTHEAST QUADRANT OF WEST LAKEVIEW AVENUE AND NORTH WESTERN ROAD IN STILLWATER PAYNE COUNTY OKLAHOMA. THE SITE IS A 20-ACRE TRACT OF LAND AND CONSISTS OF TWO PRIMARY AREAS: THE EXISTING TRANSIT STATION ON THE WEST SIDE AND A LARGER UNDEVELOPED PORTION ON THE EAST SIDE. THIS PHASED PROJECT WHICH IS DUE TO COMMENCE ON PHASE 2 WILL ALLOW OKLAHOMA STATE UNIVERSITY TO CONSOLIDATE THEIR TRANSPORTATION SERVICES SUPPORT PERSONNEL EQUIPMENT AND ALL RELATED ASSISTS AND FUNCTIONS TO THE NEW FACILITY UPON COMPLETION. THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE CONSTRUCTING AN APPROXIMATE 75000 SQ. /FT. OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY WHICH WILL HAVE APPROXIMATELY 10-16 BAYS AND PARKING FOR 100+ VEHICLES.THE TRANSIT OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY PHASE 1 IS CURRENTLY BEING FUNDED IN MULTIPLE GRANTS WHICH ARE AS FOLLOWS: OK-2019-003: FY2017 FUNDS SECTION 5339(B): $2400000; OK-2018-023-01; FY2018 SECTION 5311: $800000; FY2019 SECTION 5311: $800000. COMBINED THESE PROJECTS HAVE A TOTAL LOCAL MATCH OF $1000000.THE TRANSIT OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY PHASE 2 WILL BE FUNDED BY THE CARES ACT GRANT: OK-2020-021.FOR MORE INFORMATION AND MILESTONES PLEASE SEE THE UPLOADED ATTACHMENTS RELATED TO THE TRANSIT OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY.

MTTA IS REQUESTING SECTION 5339 FEDERAL FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE TULSA OK UZA (400600 400000) IN THE AMOUNT OF $3175604 (70% OF TOTAL PROJECT COST) TO REPLACE 6 VEHICLES REHABILITATE AND EXPAND FACILITIES TO SUPPORT THE ROUTE 66 (11TH STREET) BRT AND IMPLEMENT NEW TECHNOLOGY. THE LOCAL MATCH OF 30% OF THE PROJECT COST IS $1385864 FROM THE IMPROVE OUR TULSA 2014 SALES TAX FUND. THE BREAKDOWN IS BELOW. THE TOTAL PROJECT COST IS $4561468. THIS IS AN FY 2020 COMPETITIVE BUS AND BUS FACILITIES GRANT AWARDED TO TULSA OK. (DISCRETIONARY BUS GRANT ID: D2020BUSC170.) THIS PROJECT IS NEPA COMPLIANT PER THE APPROVED CE DATED 2/26/2020. FACILITY EXPANSION: THE CURRENT EMPLOYEE PARKING FOR MTTA IS NO LONGER SUFFICIENT WITH THE INCREASE IN BUSES FOR THE CURRENT BRT AND THEN WITH ADDING A NEW BRT IN 2023/2024. MTTA HAS PURCHASED PROPERTY ADJACENT TO OUR CURRENT PROPERTY WITH THE EXPECTATION OF BUILDING A PARKING LOT THAT WILL HOST APPROXIMATELY 100 NEW EMPLOYEE VEHICLES. THIS PROCESS WILL INVOLVE DEMOLISHING THE CURRENT BUILDING LEVELING OF THE GROUND AND SOIL NEW PAVEMENT AND PAINT/STRIPING. SPACES WILL NOT BE COVERED. THIS WILL REPLACE THE CURRENT PARKING SPACES MTTA RENTS FROM THE RAILROAD COMPANY AT A COST TO MTTA OF AROUND $18K A YEAR AND IS NOT WELL KEPT. THE EXPECTED USEFUL LIFE IS 20 YEARS. FACILITY REHABILITATION: REPLACE DAMAGED ROOF ON CALL CENTER BUILDING. ROOF WAS DAMAGED BY A STORM AND TEMPORARILY PATCHED. IT NEEDS TO BE REPLACED AND BROUGHT UP TO THE NEW BUILDING CODE. INSTALL A NEW COMMERCIAL TPO ROOF SYSTEM ON THE THREE BUILDINGS AT THE ROCKFORD COMPLEX PARATRANSIT/CALL CENTER.OMB ELEMENTS:1) PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO FUND MUCH NEEDED IMPROVEMENTS TO REPLACE VEHICLES UPGRADE FACILITIES CALL CENTER ROOF REPAIR AND EMPLOYEE PARKING LOT. AND IMPLEMENT BETTER TECHNOLOGY. 2) ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: REPLACE 6 VEHICLES REHABILITATE PARATRANSIT/CALL CENTER ROOF AND NEW PARKING LOT FOR EMPLOYEES TO UTILIZE AS THE CURRENT PARKING LOT IS NO LONGER SUFFICIENT WITH OUR SIZE AND CURRENTLY REQUIRES EMPLOYEES TO PARK OFF SITE AND WALK INTO WORK. THIS STARTED IN JULY OF 2019 WHEN TULSA ADDED THE FIRST BRT ROUTE ADDING ADDITIONAL BUSES AND WITH A 2ND BRT IN THE WORKS IT WILL CAUSE FURTHER ISSUES IF NOT IMPROVED ON IN A TIMELY MANNER ALSO IMPLEMENT TECHNOLOGY IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE TECHNOLOGY PLAN AND EXPAND THE FACILITY TO SUPPORT THE ROUTE 66 (11TH STREET) BUS RAPID TRANSIT (BRT) SYSTEM.3) EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THESE THREE PROJECTS ARE KEY IN BUILDING THE NEEDED REGIONAL NETWORK AND GROWING THE SYSTEM TO MEET THE AREAS ECONOMIC DEMANDS. THE VEHICLES REPLACE MTTAS DIESEL TRANSIT BUS WITH A CNG BUS AND 5 PARATRANSIT VEHICLES. ALL REPLACING VEHICLES HAVE MET OR EXCEEDED USEFUL LIFE; SUPPORT THE SECOND BUS RAPID TRANSIT (BRT) LINE AND BUILD REGIONAL PARATRANSIT COORDINATION. CONNECTING RURAL AND URBAN AREAS THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS WITH THE TRIBAL TRANSPORTATION SERVICES WILL SUPPORT THIS VIBRANT REGIONS MOBILITY (ATTACHMENT 27-2020 LOS MUSCOGEE (CREEK) NATION4) INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: POPULACE OF THE METROPOLITAN TULSA TRANSIT AGENCY AREA AND LOCAL AREA COMMUTERS.5) SUBRECIPIENTS: NONELOCAL MATCH FUNDING SOURCES:IMPROVE OUR TULSA-1(SALES TAX) 2014 - $700000IMPROVE OUR TULSA -2 (SALES TAX) 2018 - $4516642910 (CAPITAL FUNDING) - $234200TOTAL LOCAL MATCH - 1385864

THE CENTRAL OKLAHOMA TRANSPORTATION AND PARKING AUTHORITY (COTPA) IS SUBMITTING THIS APPLICATION FOR SECTION 5339 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES IN THE AMOUNT OF $1083764. THIS GRANT INCLUDES THE 2021 SECTION 5339 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES APPORTIONMENT IN THE AMOUNT OF $921199. THE TOTAL AMOUNT INCLUDES A FEDERAL AMOUNT OF $921199 AND A LOCAL CONTRIBUTION MATCH OF $162565 WHICH IS PROVIDED BY THE CITY OF OKLAHOMA CITY-GENERAL FUND. THIS PROJECT WILL CONSIST OF PURCHASING REPLACEMENT BUSES (2).THE FY 2021 SECTION 5339 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES FUNDS WILL ALLOW COTPA TO IMPLEMENT THE FOLLOWING PROJECT WHICH WILL CONSIST OF PURCHASING TWO (2) 40 CNG BUSES FOR THE COTPA FIXED ROUTE FLEET. THESE NEW BUSES WILL REPLACE TWO (2) 35 BUSES (DIESEL) THAT HAVE REACHED THE END OF THEIR USEFUL LIFE. THE EXPECTED OUTCOME AND PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IMPROVE THE FIXED ROUTE FLEET OF THE TRANSIT SYSTEM WHICH WILL CREATE A MORE DEPENDABLE AND RELIABLE SYSTEM ALONG WITH REDUCING CARBON EMISSIONS IMPROVING AIR QUALITY REDUCING MAINTENANCE COSTS REDUCING FUEL COSTS AND PROVIDING AN IMPROVED QUALITY OF SERVICE FOR COTPA RIDERS. THE ENTIRE OKLAHOMA CITY METROPOLITAN AREA MOSTLY THE RIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A.THE FTA ESTABLISHED POLICY ON VEHICLE USEFUL LIFE STATES THAT VEHICLES PROPOSED TO BE REPLACED MUST HAVE ACHIEVED AT LEAST THE MINIMUM NORMAL SERVICE LIFE. THE AGE OF THE TRANSIT VEHICLE TO BE REPLACED IS ITS YEARS OF SERVICE OR MILEAGE AT THE TIME THE PROPOSED NEW/REPLACED VEHICLE IS INTRODUCED INTO SERVICE. THESE BUSES HAVE A USEFUL LIFE OF 12 YEARS AND/OR 500000 MILES.THE NEW BUSES PURCHASED FROM THIS GRANT WILL REPLACE THE FOLLOWING BUSES:2009 GILLIG 35 UNIT 0905 VIN# 15GGB271791176272 599750 MILES.2009 GILLIG 35 UNIT 0906 VIN# 15GGB271991176273 600935 MILES.2021 SECTION 5339 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES APPORTIONMENT - $921199.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE CAPITAL PROJECT FUNDING FOR MULTIPLE PROJECTS INCLUDING REPLACEMENT VEHICLES AND UPDATES TO PARTAS INTELLIGENT TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS (ITS). IN ADDITION THIS AWARD SUPPORTS CAPITALIZED MAINTENANCE FACILITY REHABILITATION AND PLANNING ACTIVITIES.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE REVENUE AND SUPPORT VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS INCLUDING THREE (3) REPLACEMENT CNG TRANSIT BUSES TWO (2) LIGHT TRANSIT VEHICLES (LTVS) AND THREE (3) SUPPORT VEHICLES. ADDITIONAL ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE REPLACING AND UPDATING PARTAS ITS HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE AS WELL AS ELIGIBLE CAPITALIZED MAINTENANCE FACILITY REHABILITATION AND PLANNING ACTIVITIES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THE GRANT ARE TO ENABLE PARTA TO MAINTAIN AND REPLACE OUTDATED VEHICLES REDUCE MAINTENANCE COSTS AND LOWER THE AGE OF PARTAS FLEET. IN ADDITION UPDATED ITS INFRASTRUCTURE AND PLANNING ACTIVITIES ARE EXPECTED TO IMPROVE SERVICE EFFICIENCY AND SYSTEM RELIABILITY.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS FUNDING ARE PUBLIC TRANSIT RIDERS IN PORTAGE COUNTY OHIO AS WELL AS PASSENGERS THAT UTILIZE PARTAS EXPRESS ROUTES TO AKRON AND CLEVELAND. THIS AWARD WILL BENEFIT RIDERS BY IMPROVING THE SAFETY AND SERVICE RELIABILITY OF THE SYSTEM. IN ADDITION REMOVING OUTDATED DIESEL-FUEL POWERED VEHICLES FROM OHIOS ROADS IMPROVES THE AIR QUALITY FOR ALL RESIDENTS IN THE REGION PARTICULARLY WITHIN THE COUNTIES THAT PARTA SERVES-PORTAGE SUMMIT AND CUYAHOGA COUNTY OHIO.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES ASSOCIATED WITH THIS AWARD.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO RENOVATE THE 30 YEAR OLD FRANK R. ANGELORO MEMORIAL FACILITY WHICH HOUSES THE ENTIRETY OF LAKETRANS OPERATIONS INCLUDING MAINTENANCE BUS GARAGE DISPATCH CUSTOMER SERVICE CALL CENTER AND ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICES. ADDITIONALLY THIS AWARD WILL FUND THE CONSTRUCTION OF BUILDING ADDITION FOR OFFICES AND BUS STORAGE GARAGE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: CONSTRUCTION; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL SUPPORT THE RENOVATION OF LAKETRANS FACILITY THAT WILL ENHANCE THE WORKING ENVIRONMENT FOR ITS EMPLOYEES TO IMPROVE EFFICIENCY OF OPERATIONS WORKFORCE RETENTION AND TECHNOLOGY UTILIZATION AS WELL AS PERFORM DEFERRED MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES. CONSTRUCTION OF THE BUILDING ADDITION WILL PROVIDE MORE OFFICE AND MEETING ROOM SPACE IMPROVED TRAINING ENVIRONMENT CREATION OF ADDITIONAL VEHICLE MAINTENANCE BAY AND ADDITIONAL BUS STORAGE FOR THE INCREASING SIZE OF LAKETRANS FLEET. LAKETRAN IS GROWING ITS TRANSIT OPERATIONS TO PROVIDE MORE FIXED ROUTES LONGER OPERATING HOURS AND MORE DOOR-TO-DOOR DIAL-A-RIDE.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: LAKETRAN EMPLOYEES WILL DIRECTLY BENEFIT FROM MODERNIZED WORK SPACES. LAKE COUNTY RESIDENTS WILL BENEFIT FROM INCREASED TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AS THE ENLARGED BUS GARAGE WILL ALLOW LAKETRAN TO PURCHASE MORE VEHICLES IN WHICH TO PROVIDE MORE SERVICE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: LAKETRAN HAS NO SUBRECIPIENTS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR THE ACRTA TRANSIT SYSTEM TO ASSIST IT IN FIXED ROUTE TRANSIT OPERATIONS; TO PROVIDE NON-FIXED ROUTE ADA FUNDING TO ASSIST ACRTA IN PARATRANSIT OPERATIONS; TO DESIGN AND PURCHASE A MOBILE FARE APPLICATION; AND TO PURCHASE NEEDED ADP COMPUTER HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE TO ASSIST WITH ACRTA OPERATIONS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ALL ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES AND FUEL COVER ALL ELIGIBLE ADA EXPENSES DESIGN AND PURCHASE A MOBILE FARE APPLICATION AND UPDATE COMPUTER HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL ALLOW ACRTA TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE FIXED ROUTE TRANSIT SERVICE TO THE LIMA/ALLEN COUNTY AREA CONTINUE TO PROVIDE ADA PARATRANSIT SERVICE OFFER A MOBILE FARE COLLECTION OPTION FOR PASSENGERS AND UPDATE/UPGRADE COMPUTER HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ACRTA AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN LIMA/ALLEN COUNTY WILL BENEFIT BY CONTINUING TO ACCESS SAFE RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES WHERE IN MANY CASES THEY HAVE NO OTHER OPTIONS ESPECIALLY DISABLED AND ELDERLY PASSENGERS. THE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES ARE USED TO GET TO SCHOOL WORK MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS SHOPPING AND OTHER NEEDS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

PURPOSE: THE CHESTNUT FIELDS FACILITY WILL PROMOTE THE USE OF PUBLIC TRANSIT AND ALTERNATIVE MODES OF TRAVEL WHILE ALSO ENABLING THE BACK-OF-HOUSE OPERATIONS NECESSARY TO MAINTAIN THE TRANSIT SYSTEM AND AMENITIES IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS GRANT WILL BE USED FOR THE DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF A MULTIMODAL REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION FACILITY DESIGNED TO ADDRESS A SIGNIFICANT LACK OF PUBLIC TRANSIT INFRASTRUCTURE AND AMENITIES IN BUTLER COUNTY OHIO. EXPECTED OOUTCOMES: THE PROJECT WILL CONSOLIDATE BCRTA OXFORD OPERATIONS FROM TWO LOCATIONS DOWN TO ONE CENTRALIZED LOCATION AND WILL CREATE A MULTIMODAL TRANSPORTATION CENTER FOR BUS DROP-OFF/PICKUP CANOPY/COVERED WAITING AREA BIKE PARKING TICKET OFFICE ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICES BUS GARAGE BUS FUEL PUMP BUS WASH AND BUS STAGING/OUTDOOR STORAGE. ADDITIONALLY THESE IMPROVEMENTS WILL ENHANCE SAFETY RELIEVE TRAFFIC CONGESTION AND INCREASE ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY IN THE MOST DENSELY POPULATED PART OF WESTERN BUTLER COUNTY. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS INFRASTRUCTURE WILL SUPPORT REGIONAL JOB- AND EDUCATION-SEEKERS TRANSIT-DEPENDENT FAMILIES LOCAL RESIDENTS AND VISITORS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: BCRTA IS THE MAIN RECIPIENT AND THERE WILL BE NO SUBRECIPIENTS EXCEPT CONTRACTORS FOR ENGINEERING/DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION. SOURCES OF FEDERAL FUNDS:FFY17 5339B $2668750 (FULL ALLOCATION)FFY18 5339 $181012 (FULL ALLOCATION)FFY19 5339 $166442 (REMAINING 2019 FUNDS)FFY19 5307 $200000 (REMAINING 2019 FUNDS)FFY20 5339B $2000000 (FULL ALLOCATION)FFY13 STBG TRANSFER $4599TOTAL FEDERAL FUNDS FOR PROJECT - $5220803BCRTA WILL PROVIDE THE 20% LOCAL SHARE IN THE AMOUNT OF $1305201 FROM FUNDS ON DEPOSIT AND CONTRACT REVENUES FROM MIAMI UNIVERSITY MEDICAID AND THE BUTLER COUNTY VETERANS SERVICE COMMISSION.ATTACHMENTS TO THE GRANT INCLUDE: STIP APPROVAL LETTERS AND PROJECT LISTINGS OKI ALLOCATION LETTER AND FTA NEPA (DCE) APPROVAL.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE NIAGARA FRONTIER TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY $4844000 IN SECTION 5339 DISCRETIONARY FUNDING TO SUPPORT TRANSIT SERVICE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THIS GRANT FUNDS A PURCHASE TOWARD FOUR (4) 40-FOOT BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES (BEB) TO REPLACE AN EQUAL NUMBER OF LIFE AND MILEAGE EXPIRED BUSES CURRENTLY IN REVENUE SERVICE AS PART OF THE NFTA-METRO BUS FLEET. ULSTER COUNTY IN ALLIANCE WITH THE CLIMATE LEADERSHIP AND COMMUNITY PROTECTION ACT (CLCPA) DRAFTED AND ADOPTED A GREEN NEW DEAL PLAN IN APRIL OF 2021. THE COUNTYS PLAN ADDRESSES FLEET AND INFRASTRUCTURE ELECTRIFICATION INTEGRATION WITH GOALS OF HAVING 40% OF THE FLEET ELECTRIC/ZERO CARBON BY 2025 WITH A LONG-TERM GOAL OF HAVING 100% OF ALL FLEET VEHICLES ELECTRIC/ZERO CARBON BY 2040. THE SUB ALLOCATION LETTER DATED APRIL 26 2019 FOR THE KINGSTON APPORTIONMENT OF LAPSING FUNDS IS ATTACHED TO THIS GRANT.AS A COUNTY OPERATED PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICE LOCATED IN KINGSTON NY THE FOLLOWING APPLICATION WILL ADDRESS ULSTER COUNTY AREA TRANSIT (UCAT) CAPITAL NEEDS. IN ORDER TO SUCCESSFULLY MEET THE GOALS AS OUTLINED IN THE COUNTYS PLAN WILL REQUIRE THE ALLOCATION OF $752403 IN FEDERAL FUNDING NEEDED TO COMPLETE THE PURCHASE OF TWO (2) 35 BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES (BEB) FOR NORMAL FLEET REPLACEMENT AND THE PROCUREMENT OF EIGHT (8) 100% ELECTRIC SUPPORT VEHICLES FOR FLEET REPLACEMENTS AND EXPANSION.SOURCES OF FUNDING:LAPSING FFY 2019 SECTION 5339 POUGHKEEPSIE-NEWBURGH NY-NJ UZA 89 FUNDING OF $411753. THESE FUNDS ARE FROM THE FEDERAL REGISTER DATED MARCH 13 2019 VOL. 8 NO 144 TABLE 12. LAPSING FFY 2019 SECTION 5339 NATIONAL DISTRIBUTION FUNDING OF $251275. APRIL 26 2019 UCTC RESOLUTION 2019-08 REFLECTING THIS FUNDING IS ATTACHED TO THIS GRANT APPLICATION.LAPSING FFY 2019 SECTION 5339 SUZA FUNDING OF $89375. THESE FUNDS ARE UNDER THE KINGSTON ALLOCATION. A SUBALLOCATION LETTER DATED 6/3/2019 FROM NYSDOT IS ATTACHED SHOWING THE FUNDING AMOUNT WHICH IS LISTED UNDER THE KINGSTON ALLOCATION. THE TOTAL PROJECT COST INCLUDING MATCH IS $940504.DUE TO RESERVATION PURPOSES THE FUNDING FOR THE BUS PROJECTS WILL BE UNDER P2 AND P3 OF THIS GRANT APPLICATION. PURPOSE OF AWARD: THE SUCCESSFUL APPROVAL OF THE FOLLOWING APPLICATION WILL SUPPORT UCATS FLEET REPLACEMENT/EXPANSION AND UPGRADE OF EXISTING DIESEL TRANSIT BUSES AND GASOLINE SUPPORT VEHICLES THAT HAVE REACHED THEIR USEFUL LIFE. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: PROCUREMENT OF NEW VEHICLES UNDER THE GUIDELINES OF FTA AND COUNTY POLICY AND PROCEDURES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: IT IS THE STRATEGIC GOAL FOR UCAT TO BECOME THE PRIMARY OPTION OF TRANSPORTATION FOR ALL WITHIN THE COUNTY. THE SUCCESS OF THIS PROJECT WILL ALLOW UCAT TO PROVIDE SAFE RELIABLE SERVICES TO THE RESIDENTS AND VISITORS OF ULSTER COUNTY WHILE MINIMIZING OUR CARBON FOOTPRINT AND REDUCING CARBON EMISSIONS THAT HAVE A DIRECT IMPACT TO THE ENVIRONMENT. UCAT WILL INCREASE ITS TOTAL ELECTRIC/ZERO CARBON FLEET FROM APPROXIMATELY 6% TO 30% WITH THE SUCCESSFUL PROCUREMENT AND ACQUISITION OF THE PROPOSED VEHICLES IN THE APPLICATION. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE RESIDENTS AND VISITORS OF ULSTER COUNTY. BATTERY-POWERED ELECTRIC BUSES ELIMINATE DIESEL EXHAUST EMISSIONS AND POLLUTION AND EMIT FAR FEWER GREENHOUSES GASSES THAT CONTRIBUTE TO GLOBAL WARMING THAN DO DIESEL AND NATURAL GAS-POWERED BUSES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

THIS APPLICATION IS FOR SECTION 5339 FEDERAL FUNDING OF ROCKLAND COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION (RCDPT) LISTED PROJECTS. THE TOTAL COST OF ALL THE PROJECTS IN THIS APPLICATION IS $725373. FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $580298 WILL BE PROVIDED BY THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) FY 2018 ($204654) FY 2019 ($183856) AND FY 2020 ($191788) SECTION 5339 CARRY-OVER FUNDS. ROCKLAND COUNTY THE SMALLEST COUNTY (GEOGRAPHICALLY) IN NEW YORK STATE IS NORTH OF NEW YORK CITY. ITS TRIANGLE SHAPE IS ABOUT 176 SQUARE MILES AND ITS BORDERS ARE ROUGHLY 18 BY 20 MILES. IT IS SITUATED ON THE WEST BANK OF THE HUDSON RIVER AND IS GEOGRAPHICALLY CENTERED ABOUT 33 MILES NORTHWEST OF NEW YORK CITY. 2020 CENSUS BUREAU POPULATION TOTALS REVEALED THE COUNTYS POPULATION IS ABOUT 328329. REHABILITATION AND UPGRADES OF THE ROCKLAND COUNTY BUILDING T FACILITY WILL IMPROVE SAFETY OPERATIONAL EFFICIENCY AND ACCESSIBILITY. THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL ADVANCE THE STATE OF GOOD REPAIR AS WELL AS MODERNIZE AND ACCOMMODATE FOR GROWING DEMAND. GRANT PURPOSETHE PURPOSE OF THE GRANT IS TO UPGRADE EQUIPMENT/FURNISHING AT THE ROCKLAND COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF PLANNING AND PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION ADMINISTRATION OFFICE AND TRIPS STORAGE FACILITY BUILDING (BUILDING T) TO A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR. BUILDING T WAS CONSTRUCTED AND OPENED IN 1998 WITH 80% FUNDING FROM THE FTA. BUILDING T HAS A USEFUL LIFE OF 50 YEARS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMEDSOME OF THE IMPROVEMENTS THE COUNTY WILL PURSUE INCLUDE THE PURCHASE OF A BUILDING GENERATOR WHICH IS CRITICAL FOR OPERATIONS IN THE CASE OF A LENGTHY POWER OUTAGE UPGRADE ELECTRICAL LIGHTING TO LED REPLACE COMPRESSORS REPLACE CARPETING REPLACE WINDOWS UPGRADE WINDOW TREATMENTS AND CEILING FANS POWER WASH THE ADMINISTRATIVE MAINTENANCE AND BUS STORAGE FACILITY TO THE STATE OF GOOD REPAIR. THE COUNTY ALSO HAS 5339 FUNDING FOR THE FACILITY IMPROVEMENTS IN FTA GRANTS NY-2016-036; NY-2017-030; NY-2018-046; AND NY-2019-062 THAT IT WOULD LIKE TO SUPPLEMENT ANY ADDITIONAL COST TO THOSE PROJECTS DUE TO INFLATION.EXPECTED OUTCOME/INTENDED BENEFICIARIESTHE FACILITY MANAGEMENT AND PROJECT MANAGEMENT TEAMS WILL BE ABLE TO EFFICIENTLY USE THE FUNDING TO IMPROVE THE PHYSICAL PERFORMANCE OF ITS SYSTEM. THIS WILL POTENTIALLY LEAD TO AN INCREASE IN EMPLOYEE MORALE AND SERVICE OPERATIONS AND PROVIDE A SIGNIFICANT IMPROVEMENT TO THE RESIDENTS OF THE COUNTY THAT VISIT FOR TRANSIT INFORMATION AS WELL AS IMPROVE THE STATE OF GOOD REPAIR AND MODERNIZATION OF THE FACILITY. THIS WILL ALSO AID AND COMPLY WITH IMPROVEMENTS TO THE FTA FACILITY TAM PLAN. THE COUNTY WILL ENSURE THAT THE IMPROVEMENTS ARE ALIGNED WITH THE COUNTYS AND FTAS ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE AND TITLE VI GOALS. THERE WILL BE NO FUNDING OR EQUIPMENT PROVIDED TO SUBRECIPIENTS OR CONTRACTORSDUE TO THE CURRENT ECONOMIC CLIMATE AND IMPEDIMENTS TO THE SUPPLY CHAIN THE COUNTY WILL FIND IT CHALLENGING TO DETERMINE WHEN CERTAIN PROJECTS ABOVE MAY BE INITIATED AND WHEN THEY MAY BE COMPLETED. THE COUNTY WILL ASSEMBLE A PROJECT MANAGEMENT TEAM THAT WILL MEET BI-WEEKLY TO DETERMINE WHICH PROJECTS MAY BE COMPLETED ASAP AND WHICH MIGHT TAKE TIME AFTER CONSULTING WITH THE PROCUREMENT AND FACILITIES DEPARTMENTS. THE PROJECT MANAGEMENT TEAM WILL CONSIST OF STAFF MEMBERS AS WELL AS AND CONSULTANTS WHERE APPROPRIATE.THE FACILITY MANAGEMENT AND PROJECT MANAGEMENT TEAMS WILL BE ABLE TO EFFICIENTLY USE THE FUNDING TO IMPROVE THE PHYSICAL PERFORMANCE OF ITS SYSTEM. THIS WILL POTENTIALLY LEAD TO AN INCREASE IN EMPLOYEE MORALE AND SERVICE OPERATIONS AND PROVIDE A SIGNIFICANT IMPROVEMENT TO THE STATE OF GOOD REPAIR AND MODERNIZATION OF THE FACILITY. THIS WILL ALSO AID AND COMPLY WITH IMPROVEMENTS TO THE FTA FACILITY TAM PLAN. THE COUNTY WILL ENSURE THAT THE IMPROVEMENTS ARE ALIGNED WITH THE COUNTYS AND FTAS ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE AND TITLE VI GOALS. MODERNIZATION OF PROJECTS WILL IMPROVE ENERGY EFFICIENCY RESILIENCE SYSTEM RELIABILITY PERFORMANCE AND IMPROVE SAFETY MEASURES.THE COUNTY DOES NOT SEEK PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY.INDIRECT COSTS WILL NOT BE APPLIED TO THIS APPLICATION.THE COUNTY WILL ALSO USE 1% OF THE FUNDS FOR SAFETY AND SECURITY.PIN 8TM141 APPROVED ON E-STIP 6/3/22 HAS BEEN ADDED AS AN ATTACHMENT TO THE GRANT APPLICATION.

THE AWARD FOR THE REPLACEMENT OF THREE 40-FOOT HEAVY-DUTY TRANSIT VEHICLES IS TO MAINTAIN THE TRANSIT FLEET IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR BY LIMITING THE NUMBER OF VEHICLES BEYOND THEIR USEFUL LIFE. NEW VEHICLES WILL BE PROCURED INSPECTED AND ACCEPTED INTO THE FLEET. REPLACING VEHICLES THAT ARE PAST THEIR USEFUL LIFE WITH NEW ONES BENEFITS THE RIDING PUBLIC VIA FEWER BREAKDOWNS AND IMPROVED RELIABILITY OF TRANSIT SERVICE. REPLACING OLDER VEHICLES ALSO ALLOWS THE MAINTENANCE STAFF TO FOCUS EFFORTS ON REGULAR MAINTENANCE OF VEHICLES WITHIN THEIR USEFUL LIFE INSTEAD OF MAJOR REPAIRS TO VEHICLES BEYOND THE USEFUL LIFE THAT REQUIRE MORE TIME AND MONEY TO MAINTAIN IN GOOD WORKING ORDER. THIS AWARD HAS NO SUB-RECIPIENTS.THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES $914752 OF FEDERAL FUNDS OF WHICH $907927 ARE LAPSING FUNDS TO REPLACE THREE BUSES. SOURCE OF FUNDING:FFY 2018 SECTION 5339 LAPSING FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $907927 FROM THE POUGHKEEPSIE-NEWBURGH NY-NJ UZA DISTRIBUTION AGREEMENT. THE MPO RESOLUTION IS 18-08. FFY 2019 SECTION 5339 FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $6825 (LEAVING BALANCE OF $864775) FROM THE POUGHKEEPSIE-NEWBURGH NY-NJ UZA DISTRIBUTION AGREEMENT. THE MPO RESOLUTION IS 19-07.FUNDS WILL BE UTILIZED FOR BUS REPLACEMENT OF THREE 40-FOOT BUSES FOR THE DUTCHESS COUNTY PUBLIC TRANSIT SYSTEM.THE RESOLUTIONS ARE ATTACHED TO THE GRANT. TOTAL COST FOR THIS PROJECT INCLUDING MATCH IS $1143440.

THE PURCHASE OF REPLACEMENT CLEAN DIESEL BUSES AND PARATRANSIT VEHICLES WILL REDUCE THE FREQUENCY OF BREAKDOWNS EXPERIENCED BY NFTA-METROS LIFE AND MILEAGE-EXPIRED DIESEL-FUELED FLEET CURRENTLY IN SERVICE.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: REPLACEMENT CLEAN DIESEL BUSES AND PARATRANSIT SMALL BUSES PURCHASED THROUGH THIS GRANT WILL OPERATE OUT OF THE NFTAS BABCOCK AND FRONTIER BUS MAINTENANCE FACILITIES LOCATED IN BUFFALO NY. THESE ROUTES CONNECT PEOPLE LIVING IN THE CITY OF BUFFALO AND ITS SURROUNDING SUBURBS TO EMPLOYMENT HEALTHCARE EDUCATION AND RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES. AS SUCH BY REPLACING LIFE AND MILEAGE-EXPIRED BUSES WITH NEW CLEAN DIESEL MODELS TO OPERATE ACROSS THESE ROUTES THIS PROJECT WILL INCREASE ACCESS TO CONVENIENT RELIABLE AND EFFICIENT PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS FOR A LARGE PORTION OF THE NFTAS OVERALL RIDERSHIP.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

9/23/2021 - BUDGET REVISION - PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE END DATE REVISED TO 12/31/2023.THIS APPLICATION IS FOR THE FEDERAL FUNDING OF ROCKLAND COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION (RCDPT) LISTED PROJECTS. THE TOTAL COST OF ALL THE PROJECTS IN THIS APPLICATION IS $2006492. FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $1605194 WILL BE PROVIDED BY THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) SECTION 5307 CARRY-OVER FUNDS AND SECTION 5339. THE SECTION 5307 PORTION WILL REPRESENT A TOTAL PROJECT COST OF $1807408 AND THE FTA PORTION WILL REPRESENT $1445926. THE 5339 PORTION WILL REPRESENT $199084 IN TOTAL PROJECTS AND $159267 IN FEDERAL FUNDS. THE 20% LOCAL SHARE WILL BE PROVIDED BY THE NEW YORK STATE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION ($200649) AND ROCKLAND COUNTY ($200649). ROCKLAND COUNTY THE SMALLEST COUNTY (GEOGRAPHICALLY) IN NEW YORK STATE IS NORTH OF NEW YORK CITY. ITS TRIANGLE SHAPE IS ABOUT 176 SQUARE MILES AND ITS BORDERS ARE ROUGHLY 18 BY 20 MILES. IT IS SITUATED ON THE WEST BANK OF THE HUDSON RIVER AND IS GEOGRAPHICALLY CENTERED ABOUT 33 MILES NORTHWEST OF NEW YORK CITY. 2016 CENSUS BUREAU POPULATION ESTIMATES REVEALED THE COUNTYS POPULATION IS ABOUT 326780. THE SECTION 5339 PORTION OF THE FUNDING ($159267 FEDERAL) WILL BE USED FOR CAPITAL UPGRADES SUCH AS THE PURCHASE OF NEW OR REPLACEMENT EQUIPMENT AND OFFICE AMENITIES FOR BUILDING T THE ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICES AND TRIPS BUS STORAGE FACILITY CONSTRUCTED IN 1998 WITH FTA FUNDING. THIS ON-GOING (5339) FUNDING FROM THE PROJECTS THAT WERE APPROVED IN FTA GRANT NY-2017-030-00 IN 2017. FOR THE 5307 PORTION THE COUNTY WILL BE REQUESTING FUNDING FOR ADDITIONAL TRANSPORTATION PLANNING CONSULTANT SERVICES ($160000 FEDERAL) AS WELL AS FUNDING FOR BUS SHELTERS ($40000 FEDERAL). THE COUNTY WILL BE REQUESTING ($145926 FEDERAL) FOR PROJECT ADMINISTRATION TO AID IN COSTS RELATED TO THE IMPLEMENTATION OF PROJECTS IN THE GRANT APPLICATION. THIS GRANT ALSO INCLUDES PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ($700000 FEDERAL) AND CAPITAL COST OF CONTRACTING ($400000 FEDERAL). THE COUNTY WILL ALSO USE 1% OF THE FUNDS FOR SAFETY AND SECURITY.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PURCHASE FOUR (4) 60 HYDROGEN FUEL CELL ELECTRIC BUSES THAT WILL BE USED IN FIXED ROUTE SERVICE AND TO PROVIDE TRAINING TO THE EXISTING AND FUTURE WORKFORCE FOR THE MAINTENANCE AND OPERATION OF ZERO EMISSION VEHICLES. ALL FUNDS ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE RTCS CURRENT TRANSIT ASSET MANAGEMENT (TAM) PLAN. CURRENT TAM PLAN IS PROVIDED AS AN ATTACHMENT TO THIS APPLICATION.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FOUR (4) FIXED ROUTE DIESEL-FUELED BUSES CURRENTLY IN OPERATION WILL BE REPLACED BY FOUR (4) HYDROGEN FUEL CELL ELECTRIC BUSES. WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES WILL TAKE PLACE TO TRAIN AND EQUIP CURRENT AND FUTURE WORKFORCE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE RTC ZERO EMISSION VEHICLE TRANSITION PLAN. ALL ACTIVITIES PROPOSED IN THIS APPLICATION WILL TAKE PLACE WITHIN THE BOUNDARIES OF THE REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION COMMISSION OF SOUTHERN NEVADA (RTC) DISTRICT. THERE ARE NO OTHER TRANSIT PROVIDERS IN THE SERVICE AREA.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: CONTINUED SAFE AND EFFECTIVE OPERATION OF TRANSIT SERVICE FOR THE RESIDENTS OF CLARK COUNTY NV. THE THREE DIESEL BUSES WILL BE REPLACED WITH ZERO-EMISSION FCEBS IMPROVING LOCAL AIR QUALITY BY REDUCING CRITICAL EMISSIONS OF CRITERIA POLLUTANTS NOX CO VOC THAT CONTRIBUTE TO THE FORMATION OF GROUND LEVEL OZONE. THESE REDUCTIONS DIRECTLY SUPPORT STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT EFFORTS TO ACHIEVE THE NAAQS OZONE ATTAINMENT CLASSIFICATION. IN ADDITION ZERO EMISSION VEHICLES DO NOT EMIT PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) AND CONTRIBUTE SIGNIFICANT REDUCTIONS IN GHG EMISSIONS FURTHER CONTRIBUTING TO IMPROVED LOCAL AIR QUALITY. OVER THE 12 YEAR LIFETIME OF THE BUSES THE PROJECT IS ESTIMATED TO IMPROVE LOCAL AIR QUALITY THROUGH CRITERIA EMISSIONS REDUCTION OF 10.13 TONS NOX 0.64 TONS VOC 2.59 TONS CO AND 0.017 TONS PM2.5 AND WILL RESULT IN GHG EMISSIONS REDUCTION OF 9463 TONS OF CO2E. DIESEL CONSUMPTION WILL ALSO BE REDUCED BY AN ESTIMATED 840288 GALLONS OVER THE SAME PERIOD. WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT TRAINING WILL MAINTAIN JOB QUALITY AND AVOID DISPLACEMENT OF THE EXISTING WORKFORCE.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE RTC AS WELL AS FIXED ROUTE CLIENTS WILL BENEFIT FROM MORE RELIABLE SERVICE WITH NEW VEHICLES. THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY BENEFITS FROM A REDUCTION OF NOX PM2.5 AND HC EMISSIONS. THE TRANSIT AGENCYS GOAL IS TO HAVE A FLEET OF ALL LOW OR NO EMISSIONS VEHICLES. ZERO EMISSION VEHICLES ALIGN WITH LOCAL AND NATIONAL CLIMATE PRIORITIES AND WILL BENEFIT ALL RESIDENTS IN CLARK COUNTY BY REPLACING DIESEL-FUELED VEHICLES. THE TRANSIT AGENCY WILL ALSO BENEFIT BY REDUCING MAINTENANCE COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE OLDER VEHICLES WHICH HAVE REACHED THEIR USEFUL LIVES. PROVIDING TRAINING FOR ZERO EMISSION VEHICLES TO THE WORKFORCE WILL HELP TO STRENGTHEN THE EXISTING WORKFORCE AND BUILD SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS FOR FUTURE EMPLOYEES.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUB-RECIPIENTS WHICH WILL BE IN RECEIPT OF OR ASSOCIATED WITH ANY PROJECTS WITHIN THIS APPLICATION.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO PURCHASE HYDROGEN FUEL CELL ELECTRIC BUSES AND CONSTRUCT A HYDROGEN FUELING FACILITY.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: UP TO TWO (2) HYDROGEN FUEL CELL BUSED WILL BE PURCHASED A HYDROGEN FUELING STATION WILL BE DESIGNED AND FUELING EQUIPMENT WILL BE LEASED. AN OUTSIDE CONSULTANT WILL PROVIDE OVERSIGHT FOR THIS PROJECT. THIS WILL BE A SOLE SOURCE PROCUREMENT AS DESCRIBED IN THE GRANT APPLICATION.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS RTCS EFFORT TO TRANSITION ITS AGING DIESEL BUS FLEET TO ZERO EMISSION VEHICLES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE RESIDENTS IN THE RENO- SPARKS NV METROPOLITAN AREA.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PURCHASE THREE (3) 60 HYDROGEN FUEL CELL ELECTRIC BUSES THAT WILL BE USED IN FIXED ROUTE SERVICE AND TO ADD SOLAR LIGHTING TO 250 BUS STOPS WITHIN THE RTC SERVICE AREA. SOLAR LIGHTING PROJECT IS INCLUDED IN THE FISCAL YEARS 2021-2025 STIP FFY2022 (AMENDMENT 21-26) LATEST STATE APPROVAL DATE 04/30/2022 (STATE TIP ID: XS20180021). PLEASE SEE ATTACHED STIP APPROVAL. ALSO ATTACHED IS STIP AMENDMENT 21-32 SHOWING ROLLOVER FUNDING FOR THIS PROJECT FROM FY22 TO FY23 LATEST STATE APPROVAL DATE 11/14/2022. ALL FUNDS ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE RTCS CURRENT TRANSIT ASSET MANAGEMENT (TAM) PLAN. CURRENT TAM PLAN IS PROVIDED AS AN ATTACHMENT TO THIS APPLICATION.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THREE (3) FIXED ROUTE DIESEL-FUELED BUSES CURRENTLY IN OPERATION WILL BE REPLACED BY THREE (3) HYDROGEN FUEL CELL ELECTRIC BUSES. STANDALONE SOLAR LIGHTING WILL BE INSTALLED AT 250 EXISTING BUS STOPS WITHIN THE RTC SERVICE AREA. ALL ACTIVITIES PROPOSED IN THIS APPLICATION WILL TAKE PLACE WITHIN THE BOUNDARIES OF THE REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION COMMISSION OF SOUTHERN NEVADA (RTC) DISTRICT. THERE ARE NO OTHER TRANSIT PROVIDERS IN THE SERVICE AREA.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: CONTINUED SAFE AND EFFECTIVE OPERATION OF TRANSIT SERVICE FOR THE RESIDENTS OF CLARK COUNTY NV. THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE THE CONDITION OF THE TRANSIT SYSTEM BY PROVIDING ENHANCED SAFETY RELIABILITY AND ACCESS TO JOBS SCHOOLS AND BASIC SERVICES THROUGH INVESTMENT IN TRANSIT CAPITAL THAT WILL REDUCE HARMFUL EMISSIONS. IMPROVING TRANSIT SAFETY AND RELIABILITY INCREASES PUBLIC ACCESS AND CAN INCREASE ECONOMIC COMPETITIVENESS FOR OVER 2.2 MILLION RESIDENTS OVER 1.3 MILLION PARATRANSIT RIDERS AND NEARLY 43 MILLION ANNUAL VISITORS.OVER THE 12 YEAR LIFETIME OF THE BUSES THE PROJECT IS ESTIMATED TO IMPROVE LOCAL AIR QUALITY THROUGH CRITERIA EMISSIONS REDUCTION OF 7.60 TONS NOX 0.48 TONS VOC 1.94 TONS CO AND 0.04 TONS PM2.5 AND WILL RESULT IN GHG EMISSIONS REDUCTION OF 7097 TONS OF CO2E. DIESEL CONSUMPTION WILL ALSO BE REDUCED BY AN ESTIMATED 630216 GALLONS OVER THE SAME PERIOD. RENEWABLE ENERGY LIGHTING AT BUS STOPS PRIMARILY PLANNED FOR LOW-INCOME AND MINORITY COMMUNITIES WILL NOT ONLY CONTRIBUTE TO LOCAL AND REGIONAL CLEAN ENERGY GOALS BUT WILL IMPROVE SAFETY AND OVERALL TRANSIT EXPERIENCE FOR CURRENT AND POTENTIAL CUSTOMERS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE RTC AS WELL AS FIXED ROUTE CLIENTS WILL BENEFIT FROM MORE RELIABLE SERVICE WITH NEW VEHICLES. THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY BENEFITS FROM A REDUCTION OF NOX PM2.5 AND HC EMISSIONS. THE TRANSIT AGENCYS GOAL IS TO HAVE A FLEET OF ALL LOW OR NO EMISSIONS VEHICLES. ZERO EMISSION VEHICLES ALIGN WITH LOCAL AND NATIONAL CLIMATE PRIORITIES AND WILL BENEFIT ALL RESIDENTS IN CLARK COUNTY BY REPLACING DIESEL-FUELED VEHICLES. THE TRANSIT AGENCY WILL ALSO BENEFIT BY REDUCING MAINTENANCE COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE OLDER VEHICLES WHICH HAVE REACHED THEIR USEFUL LIVES. SOLAR LIGHTING AT BUS STOPS WILL BENEFIT PUBLIC TRANSIT RIDERS BY PROVIDING A SAFER AND MORE COMFORTABLE TRANSPORTATION EXPERIENCE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUB-RECIPIENTS WHICH WILL BE IN RECEIPT OF OR ASSOCIATED WITH ANY PROJECTS WITHIN THIS APPLICATION

APPLICATION PURPOSE: TO MAINTAIN AND EXPAND RURAL TRANSIT SERVICE THROUGHOUT NEVADA THROUGH CAPITAL ASSET REPLACEMENT AND ACQUISITION.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THIS AWARD WILL FUND TRANSIT CAPITAL PROJECTS INCLUDING THE ACQUISITION OF REPLACEMENT VEHICLES; FACILITY IMPROVEMENTS; AND MISCELLANEOUS MAINTENANCE ITEMS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS AWARD IS EXPECTED TO PRODUCE AND PRESERVE MOBILITY AMONG VISITORS TO AND RESIDENTS OF THE STATE WITH THE PASSING OF AND ADJUSTMENT TO THE PANDEMIC IT IS EXPECTED THAT RIDERSHIP NUMBERS WILL GROW THROUGHOUT THE AWARD PERIOD OR AT LEAST DURING THE FIRST PHASE. THIS GRANTS FUNDING COMBINED WITH FUNDING FROM ADDITIONAL GRANTS WILL HELP TO ACHIEVE A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FOR THE STATES RURAL TRANSIT FLEET OVER THE NEXT FOUR YEARS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: MOBILITY IN RURAL AREAS IS PARTICULARLY IMPORTANT FOR THOSE POPULATIONS CLASSIFIED AS MOST VULNERABLE ALTHOUGH ALL FUNDED SERVICES UNDER THIS AWARD WILL SERVE THE GENERAL PUBLIC TRANSIT PROPENSITY WILL BE A KEY DETERMINANT IN THE LEVEL OF BENEFIT REALIZED BY EACH DEMOGRAPHIC SOME EQUIPMENT ACQUISITIONS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE GRANT WILL FUND THE ACTIVITIES GENERALLY STATED UNDER THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED SECTION. A MORE DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF THESE ITEMS CAN BE DESCRIBED AS THE ACQUISITION OF REPLACEMENT VEHICLES; ACQUISITION OF EQUIPMENT (SUCH AS FACILITY EQUIPMENT AND TIRE BALANCER); AND MISCELLANEOUS VEHICLE MAINTENANCE (SUCH AS REPLACEMENT OF TRANSMISSIONS TIRES AIR COMPRESSORS AND OTHER PARTS AND EQUIPMENT).

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST FY 2021 SECTION 5339 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION COMMISSION OF WASHOE COUNTY IN THE AMOUNT OF $874675. PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE PURCHASE OF UP TO FIVE (5) PARATRANSIT VANS AND CONSTRUCTION OF A VIRGINIA LINE NORTHBOUND PEPPERMILL BRT STATION.
