THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST FISCAL YEAR 2021 5339 UZA IN THE AMOUNT OF $178963 AND FISCAL YEAR 2020 UZA IN THE AMOUNT OF $228193 TOTAL AMOUNT = $407156THE SOURCE OF LOCAL FUNDS USED WILL BE TOLL CREDITS.TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDITS (FORMERLY REFERRED TO AS TOLL REVENUE CREDITS) PROVIDE A CREDIT TOWARD A PROJECTS LOCAL SHARE FOR CERTAIN EXPENDITURES WITH TOLL REVENUES. THE AMOUNT OF CREDIT TOWARD LOCAL SHARE TO BE EARNED BY A STATE IS BASED ON REVENUES GENERATED BY TOLL AUTHORITIES WITHIN THE STATE. UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF 23 U.S.C. 120(J) FHWA OVERSEES THE DETERMINATION OF TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDIT WITHIN EACH STATE. FOR THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) THE EFFECT OF UTILIZING TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDITS MEANS THAT FTA IN ESSENCE PROVIDES 100 PERCENT OF THE TOTAL NET PROJECT COST. PURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE CAPITAL ASSISTANCE FOR TAHOE TRANSPORTATION DISTRICT (TTD) WHILE SUPPORTING OF BOTH REVENUE AND NON-REVENUE FLEET VEHICLES. THE GRANT WILL ALSO SUPPORT IMPROVEMENTS OF BOTH SAFETY AND QUALITY OF BUS FACILITIES THROUGH THE PURCHASE OF SECURITY AND MAINTENANCE UPGRADES. WHILE SUPPORTING PASSENGER AMENITIES AT PASSENGER STATIONS AND STOPS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:SPECIFIC ENHANCEMENT PURCHASES WILL INCLUDE REPLACEMENT OF CUTAWAY BUS WITH 4X4 UPGRADES TRANSIT SHELTERS AND PASSENGER AMENITIES SECURITY EQUIPMENT (NEST CAMERAS) INCLUDING INSTALL.THE PURCHASE OF A CUTAWAY AND ITS ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT WILL REPLACE FLEET VEHICLE: VIN 1FD4E45SX8DA86129 (TTD ID NO. 3304)NON-REVENUE FLEET VEHICLES EXPANSION WILL INCLUDE SERVICE TRUCK UPGRADES AND ADDITIONAL ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT. TRANSIT SHELTER WITH PASSENGER AMENITIES FOR STOPS #5011 AND #2109EXPECTED OUTCOME:THROUGH SERVICE UPGRADES AND REPAIRS THIS WILL SUPPORT TTDS SERVICE AREA BY IMPROVING SAFETY SECURITY AND OVERALL USER EXPERIENCE WHILE SUPPORTING FACILITIES. WITH THE FLEET EXPANSION SHELTER AND SAFETY UPGRADES THIS WILL BOOST SERVICE RELIABILITY AND SUPPLY THE CORRECT SERVICES NEEDED TO REDUCE SERVICE INTERRUPTIONS WHILE INCREASING ON TIME PERFORMANCE. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: TRANSIT STOPS AND STATION ENHANCEMENTS WILL SUPPORT TTDS SERVICE AREA IMPROVING SAFETY SECURITY FACILITIES AND OVERALL TRANSIT USER EXPERIENCE. THE BUS REPLACEMENT WILL AID TTD IN BOOSTING SERVICE RELIABILITY THROUGH A REDUCTION IN ROAD CALLS AND SERVICE INTERRUPTIONS WHILE INCREASING ON TIME PERFORMANCE. THE REPLACEMENT VEHICLE WILL AID IN ADVERSE WEATHER CONDITIONS ALLOWING FOR SAFER AND ALTERNATIVE SERVICE FOR PASSENGERS. THE PURCHASE OF TRANSIT SHELTERS WILL PROVIDE A SAFE ACCESSIBLE PLACE FOR RIDERS TO PROTECT THEMSELVES FROM THE HARSH WEATHER ELEMENTS THAT THE REGION IS KNOWN FOR. WITHIN THESE SHELTERS PASSENGER AMENITIES WILL PROVIDE FEATURES SUCH AS STREET FURNITURE-I.E. TRASH CANS BENCHES AND BIKE RACKS. THE SHELTERS WILL BE BUILT IN HIGH AREA TRAFFIC LOCATIONS PROVIDING AN OPPORTUNITY FOR MORE RIDERSHIP AND CREATE LESS TRAFFIC CONGESTION. THE PURCHASE OF NEST CAMERAS WILL ADD SAFETY AND SECURITY IMPROVING RIDER EXPERIENCES AND RELATIONSHIPS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: TTD DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS*(THIS APPLICATION FOR SECTION 5539 FEDERAL ASSISTANCE IS CONSISTENT WITH THE SUB ALLOCATION TABLE INCLUDED IN THE TAHOE REGION SUB ALLOCATION FOR FFY 2019 MEMORANDUM DATED MARCH 18 2019 AND ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION.) *

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROCURE AND IMPLEMENT A SOLAR LIGHTING SYSTEM FOR ALL JAC TRANSIT BUS STOPS AND BUS SHELTERS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: JAC WILL COMPOSE AND RELEASE A REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS FOR THE BUS STOP SOLAR LIGHTING SYSTEM FOR THE JAC TRANSIT SYSTEM. JAC WILL THEN FOLLOW FTA PROCUREMENT REGULATIONS TO SELECT THE BEST SYSTEM TO BE IMPLEMENTED AT JAC TRANSIT STOPS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: EXTENSION OF TIME TO ALLOW FOR THE SOLAR LIGHTING SYSTEM FI BE IMPLEMENTED AT ALL JAC TRANSIT STOPS AND SHELTERS WHICH WILL INCREASE THE VISIBILITY OF JAC BUS STOPS AT NIGHT AND INCREASE THE SAFETY AND SECURITY AT ALL JAC BUS STOPS AND SHELTERS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: COMMUTERS; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

THIS GRANT APPLICATION IS REQUESTING THE FULL AMOUNT OF THE FFY 2019 APPORTIONMENT OF 5339 FUNDS. IT INCLUDES A REDUCTION IN THE REQUESTED APPORTIONMENT DUE TO THE AUTHORIZATION BY NDOT TO ALLOW A SUBRECIPIENT AGENCY TO APPLY DIRECTLY FOR ITS AWARDED SHARE OF THE APPORTIONMENT (SEE ATTACHED NOTICE OF TRANSFER OF 5339 FUNDS TO TTD FOR DETAILS).THE FEDERAL SHARE IS 85 PERCENT FOR THE ACQUISITION OF VEHICLES FOR PURPOSES OF COMPLYING WITH OR MAINTAINING COMPLIANCE WITH THE AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT (ADA; 42 U.S.C. 12101 ET SEQ.) OR THE CLEAN AIR ACT (CAA; 42 U.S.C. 7401 ET SEQ.). THE VEHICLES TO BE PURCHASED WITH THESE FUNDS ARE COMPLIANT WITH THE AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT. THE FEDERAL SHARE FOR PROJECT COSTS FOR ACQUIRING VEHICLE-RELATED EQUIPMENT OR FACILITIES (INCLUDING CLEAN FUEL OR ALTERNATIVE FUEL VEHICLERELATED EQUIPMENT OR FACILITIES) FOR PURPOSES OF COMPLYING OR MAINTAINING COMPLIANCE WITH THE CAA OR FOR MEETING THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE ADA IS 90 PERCENT. FORMULA SUMMARY: TOTAL COST OF ALL PROJECTS: $1810993TOTAL FEDERAL SHARE OF ALL PROJECTS: $1544000 (ADDITIONAL $1956000 TO APPLIED FOR DIRECTLY BY SUBRECIPIENT AGENCY FOR TOTAL OF $3500000)TOTAL LOCAL MATCH SHARE OF ALL PROJECTS: $266993- AWARD PURPOSE: TO MAINTAIN AND EXPAND RURAL TRANSIT SERVICE THROUGHOUT NEVADA THROUGH CAPITAL ASSET REPLACEMENT AND ACQUISITION- ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS AWARD WILL FUND TRANSIT CAPITAL PROJECTS INCLUDING THE ACQUISITION OF VEHICLE AND FACILITY EQUIPMENT; ACQUISITION OF REPLACEMENT VEHICLES; FACILITY IMPROVEMENTS; FACILITY CONSTRUCTION; AND MISCELLANEOUS MAINTENANCE ITEMS. THE PROJECT AUTHORIZED FOR DIRECT APPLICATION BY THE SUBRECIPIENT AGENCY IS PROPERTY ACQUISITION.- EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS AWARD IS EXPECTED TO PRODUCE AND PRESERVE MOBILITY AMONG VISITORS TO AND RESIDENTS OF THE STATE. WITH THE PASSING OF AND ADJUSTMENT TO THE PANDEMIC IT IS EXPECTED THAT RIDERSHIP NUMBERS WILL GROW THROUGHOUT THE AWARD PERIOD OR AT LEAST DURING THE FIRST PHASE. THIS GRANTS FUNDING COMBINED WITH FUNDING FROM ADDITIONAL GRANTS WILL HELP TO ACHIEVE A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FOR THE STATES RURAL TRANSIT FLEET OVER THE NEXT FOUR YEARS. IT WILL ALSO ALLOW FOR FACILITY UPGRADES INCLUDING THE CONSTRUCTION OF SOLAR PANELING THAT WILL GENERATE ENOUGH POWER TO COVER THE RESPECTIVE AGENCYS OPERATIONAL NEEDS.- INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: MOBILITY IN RURAL AREAS IS PARTICULARLY IMPORTANT FOR THOSE POPULATIONS CLASSIFIED AS MOST VULNERABLE. ALTHOUGH ALL FUNDED SERVICES UNDER THIS AWARD WILL SERVE THE GENERAL PUBLIC TRANSIT PROPENSITY WILL BE A KEY DETERMINANT IN THE LEVEL OF BENEFIT REALIZED BY EACH DEMOGRAPHIC. SOME EQUIPMENT ACQUISITIONS AND THE FACILITY IMPROVEMENTS WILL PRIMARILY BENEFIT INDIVIDUAL STAFF AND SUBRECIPIENT AGENCIES.- SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE GRANT WILL FUND THE ACTIVITIES GENERALLY STATED UNDER THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED SECTION. A MORE DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF THESE ITEMS CAN BE DESCRIBED AS ACQUISITION OF REPLACEMENT VEHICLES; ACQUISITION OF EQUIPMENT (SUCH AS COMPUTERS SAFETY/SECURITY EQUIPMENT OPERATIONAL EQUIPMENT OFFICE EQUIPMENT ADA AND NON-ADA VEHICLE EQUIPMENT SUCH AS FAREBOXES AND VEHICLE LIFTS AND FACILITY EQUIPMENT); FACILITY IMPROVEMENTS SUCH AS UTILITIES UPGRADES; FACILITY CONSTRUCTION (SOLAR PANELING THAT WILL ALSO COVER/SHADE A BUS PARKING AREA); AND MISCELLANEOUS VEHICLE MAINTENANCE (SUCH AS REPLACEMENT OF TRANSMISSIONS TIRES AIR COMPRESSORS AND OTHER PARTS AND EQUIPMENT). PLEASE SEE THE ATTACHED NDOT PROGRAM YEARS 2022-25 5339 POP (FFY19 APPORTIONMENT) AND THE NEVADA PROGRAM YEARS 2022-2025 STIP (5339) FOR DETAILED INFORMATION.

NON-REVENUE FLEET VEHICLE EXPANSION WILL INCLUDE BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO THE PURCHASE A FORKLIFT AND ITS ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT AND THE PURCHASE AN ADDITIONAL SUPPORT VEHICLE AND ITS ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:TRANSIT STOP AND STATION ENHANCEMENTS WILL SUPPORT TTDS SERVICE AREA IMROVING THE SAFETY SECURITY AND OVERALL TRANSIT USER EXPERIENCE. THE PURCHASE OF NON-REVENUE FLEET VEHICLES WILL EXPAND TTDS SUPPORT FLEET.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:BUST STOP AND STATION ENHANCEMENTS WILL SUPPORT THE TTD SERVICE AREA ESPECIALLY RIDERS OF ROUTES 50 AND 55. APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF AWARD NV-2021-028-00 FY2018 5339B COMPETITIVE/BUS BUS FACILITY BUS EXPANSION/BUS REHAB IS TO ASSIST WITH PURCHASING TWO (2) NEW BUSES AND REHABILITATE THE TWO (2) EXISTING BUSES IN THE PYRAMID LAKE PAIUTE TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE PLPTT ORDERED THE TWO (2) NEW BUSES PRE-PANDEMIC AND THERE WAS A LONG WAITING LIST DUE TO THE FORD MANUFACTURING COMPANY SHUTTING DOWN. IN JANUARY OF 2022 THE BUS COMPANY THAT THE BUSES WERE ORDERED FROM INFORMED PLPTT THAT THE PRICE FOR BOTH BUSES INCREASED BY $115000. ADDITIONAL FUNDS WERE NEEDED TO BE APPLIED FOR AND THIS PUT THE PURCHASES ON HOLD. THE PROCESS FOR FINALIZING THE PURCHASES HAVE PROLONGED THE DATES. PURCHASES ARE STILL THE PLAN FOR PLPTT TO ACCOMPLISH BY 8/31/23 WITH AN EXPECTED DELIVERY DATE OF 12/31/23.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE TO COMPLETE THE PURCHASING PROCESS OF THE TWO (2) NEW TRANSIT BUSES BY 12/31/23. THE BUSES ARE TO BE DELIVERED BY OR BEFORE 12/31/23. ADDITIONAL FUNDS WERE SOUGHT TO COMPLETE THE PURCHASE OF THE TWO (2) BUSES AS THE PRICE OF THE BUSES INFLATED BY APPROXIMATELY $115000.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFITS OF THIS BUDGET REVISION WILL BE TO EXTEND THE GRANTS ENDING PERFORMANCE DATE OF 12/31/23. THE TWO (2) NEW BUSES ARE EXPECTED TO BE BUILT AND DELIVERED BY 12/31/23 ACCORDING TO THE BUS SALES COMPANY CREATIVE BUS SALES.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: RTC RECOGNIZES THAT FUEL CELL TECHNOLOGY OFFERS CRITICAL BENEFITS IN ZERO-EMISSION TECHNOLOGY WITH LONGER RANGE FASTER FUELING TIME AND CENTRALIZED FUELING INFRASTRUCTURE THAT CAN BE LEVERAGED BY A LARGE FLEET. THIS PROJECT IS THE FIRST STEP IN RTCS TRANSITION TO ZERO EMISSION TECHNOLOGY AS THEY PREPARE TO MEET NEVADAS MANDATED TARGET OF 50% ZERO EMISSION FLEETS BY 2030. THE FCEB DEPLOYMENTS ALSO SUPPORTS LOCAL PRIORITIES TO REDUCE GHG EMISSIONS IN THE TRANSPORTATION SECTOR PROVIDE ZERO EMISSION TRANSIT IN AN EXPANDING GEOGRAPHIC REGION PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH AND LEAD INNOVATION.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: PROCUREMENT OF 2 40 HYDROGEN FUEL CELL NEW FLYER EXCELSIOR FCEBS. DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF A HYDROGEN FUELING STATION.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: OVER THE 12 YEAR LIFETIME OF THE BUSES THE PROJECT IS ESTIMATED TO IMPROVE LOCAL AIR QUALITY THROUGH CRITERIA EMISSIONS REDUCTION OF 13.56 TONS NOX 1.06 TONS VOC .39 TONS CO AND .4 TONS PM2.5 AND WILL RESULT IN GHG EMISSIONS REDUCTION OF 1324 TONS OF CO2E. DIESEL CONSUMPTION WILL ALSO BE REDUCED BY AN ESTIMATED 303547 GALLONS OVER THE SAME TIME PERIOD.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL DIRECTLY BENEFIT THE OPPORTUNITY ZONES WHICH HAVE SIGNIFICANT LOWER-INCOME HOUSEHOLDS BY REDUCING HARMFUL CARBON EMISSIONS WITHIN THE AREAS AND THROUGHOUT THE VALLEY THROUGH THE USE ALTERNATIVE CLEAN AIR TECHNOLOGY BUSES. THE LINK BETWEEN AIR QUALITY AND EQUITY IMPLICATIONS PARTICULARLY EXPOSURE TO HARMFUL POLLUTANTS FOR LOWER-INCOME POPULATIONS HAS BEEN WELL DOCUMENTED. A 2018 STUDY FROM THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) SCIENTISTS PUBLISHED IN THE AMERICAN JOURNAL OF PUBLIC HEALTH FOUND THAT MINORITY AND POORER COMMUNITIES ARE DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED BY AIR POLLUTION RELATIVE TO THE OVERALL POPULATION. ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED NEIGHBORHOODS ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE POSITIONED NEAR INDUSTRIAL AREAS AIRPORTS AND MAJOR ROAD THOROUGHFARES ALL WHICH PRODUCE HIGH LEVELS OF AIR POLLUTION (HTTPS://THEHILL.COM/POLICY/ENERGY-ENVIRONMENT/375289-EPA-SCIENTISTS-FIND-EMISSIONS-GREATER-IMPACT-LOW-INCOME-COMMUNITIES). BY INVESTING IN FCEBS AND THE RELATED INFRASTRUCTURE RTC IS DOING ITS SHARE IN REDUCING POLLUTANTS WITHIN THE OPPORTUNITY ZONES TO BENEFIT ITS RESIDENTS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

THIS PURCHASE WILL REPLACE BUSES THAT HAVE REACHED THE END OF THEIR USEFUL LIFE DUE TO AGE AND MILES.

THIS APPLICATION IS FOR FFY2019 FULL APPORTIONMENT OF SECTION 5339 FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $122405 IN FTA FUNDS FOR THE CARSON AREA METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION (CAMPO). SECTION 5339(B) OF TITLE 49 UNITED STATES CODE AS AMENDED BY THE FAST ACT AUTHORIZES THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) TO AWARD THIS GRANT (CFDA #20.526). ON NOVEMBER 20 2019 THE UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (USDOT) ANNOUNCED THE FY2019 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES PROJECTS AWARDS. THE REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION COMMISSION OF SOUTHERN NEVADA (RTC) WAS AWARDED $7475000 TO FUND REPLACEMENT OF BUS CAMERA SYSTEMS AS WELL AS CONSTRUCTION OF ENHANCEMENTS TO ITS EXISTING MAINTENANCE FACILITIES.THE REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION COMMISSION OF SOUTHERN NEVADA (RTC) IS SUBMITTING THIS APPLICATION IN ITS CAPACITY AS THE TRANSIT AGENCY AND DESIGNATED RECIPIENT OF FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION FUNDS FOR THE LAS VEGAS URBANIZED AREA IN NEVADA WHICH HAS A POPULATION OF MORE THAN 2.1 MILLION RESIDENTS ACCORDING TO U.S. CENSUS DATA (2017). RESIDENTS ARE 41% WHITE 32% HISPANIC 12% BLACK 10% ASIAN 4% TWO OR MORE RACES AND 1% ISLANDER; AND MORE THAN ONE THIRD (35.9%) SPEAK A LANGUAGE OTHER THAN ENGLISH MORE THAN 1.5 TIMES THE RATE OF THE U.S. (21.8%).THE RTC IS NOT ONLY THE TRANSIT AUTHORITY BUT ALSO THE METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION AND REGIONAL TRAFFIC MANAGEMENT AGENCY FOR SOUTHERN NEVADA. THE RTCS VISION IS TO PROVIDE A SAFE CONVENIENT AND EFFECTIVE REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM THAT ENHANCES MOBILITY AND AIR QUALITY FOR CITIZENS AND VISITORS. THE RTC ENCOURAGES RESIDENTS AND VISITORS TO USE A VARIETY OF TRANSPORTATION CHOICES TO REDUCE TRAFFIC CONGESTION AND IMPROVE AIR QUALITY AND THE QUALITY OF LIFE IN SOUTHERN NEVADA.PROJECT TITLE: TRANSIT CAPITAL INVESTMENT IMPROVING SAFETY AND ACCESS TO OPPORTUNITIESTHE PROJECT WILL REPLACE CAMERA SYSTEMS ON BUSES. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO INSTALL A NEW PARATRANSIT BUS WASH AND UPGRADE THE EXISTING FIXED ROUTE BUS WASH SYSTEM AT SUNSET MAINTENANCE FACILITY (SMF).THE TRANSIT CAPITAL INVESTMENT IMPROVING SAFETY AND ACCESS TO OPPORTUNITIES PROJECT IS LOCATED IN THE 2019-2023 STIP: TIP ID XS20180021 APPROVED 2/24/20.THE RTC IS THE METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION (MPO) FOR SOUTHERN NEVADA. THEREFORE SEPARATE MPO CONCURRENCE IS NOT REQUIRED.THE $4025000 LOCAL MATCH IS PROGRAMMED IN THE RTCS CAPITAL IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM.THE PROJECT START DATE HAS BEEN DELAYED COMPARED TO THE ORIGINAL PROJECT TIMELINE IN THE DISCRETIONARY FUNDING APPLICATION DUE TO THE COVID19 PANDEMIC THE COUNTRY IS PRESENTLY EXPERIENCING. THE SECRETARY OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES (HHS) DECLARED A PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY ON JANUARY 31 2020 AND THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES HAS DECLARED THE COVID-19 OUTBREAK AS A NATIONAL EMERGENCY. THE NEVADA GOVERNOR DECLARED EMERGENCY OF MARCH 12 2020 AND ON APRIL 2 2020 THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) HAS APPROVED THE NEVADA GOVERNORS REQUEST FOR A MAJOR DISASTER DECLARATION IN NEVADA.

THESE BUSES WILL REPLACE AT LEAST FIVE (5) DIESEL AND GASOLINE BUSES WHICH WILL HAVE EXCEEDED OR WILL HAVE EXCEEDED THEIR USEFUL LIFE BY THE TIME OF REPLACEMENT. THIS WILL BUILD ON AN EXISTING ZEB FLEET TRANSITION DEPLOYMENT THAT NCRTD HAS UNDERWAY AT THEIR ESPAOLA FACILITY. NEW MEXICO ALSO RANKS IN THE TOP THIRD OF STATES IN TERMS OF CARBON DIOXIDE EMISSIONS PER CAPITA MAINLY BECAUSE IT IS THE 9TH LARGEST ENERGY PRODUCER IN THE COUNTRY AND THE 19TH LARGEST ENERGY CONSUMER PER CAPITA. THE SOURCE OF MATCHING FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $852219 IS GROSS RECEIPTS TAX ALLOCATED TO NCRTD. THE ROLLING STOCK IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION COMPLY WITH THE CLEAN AIR ACT AND/OR THE AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT AND ARE MATCHED AT 15% LOCAL MATCH. THE LOW- OR NO-EMISSION BUS-RELATED EQUIPMENT IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION COMPLY WITH THE CLEAN AIR ACT AND ARE MATCHED AT 10% LOCAL MATCH. PURPOSE: EXPANDING ZERO-EMISSION BUS OPERATIONS TO THE TAOS FACILITY TO EVENTUALLY MAKE A COMPLETE TRANSITION TO ZERO EMISSION VEHICLES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: PURCHASE OF BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUSES (3 40-FT TRANSIT STYLE BEBS AND 2 CUTAWAY STYLE BEBS) CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE DESIGN AND INSTALLATION PROJECT MANAGEMENT SUPPORT AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND WORKFORCE TRAINING. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: PROVIDE EMISSIONS REDUCTIONS FOR THE TAOS PUEBLO COMMUNITY SERVED OUT OF THIS DEPOT.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: STATE OF NEW MEXICO (RANKS IN THE TOP THIRD OF STATES IN TERMS OF CARBON DIOXIDE EMISSIONS PER CAPITA MAINLY BECAUSE IT IS THE 9TH LARGEST ENERGY PRODUCER IN THE COUNTRY AND THE 19TH LARGEST ENERGY CONSUMER PER CAPITA) AND TAOS PUEBLO AND COMMUNITY RESIDENTSSUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: REPLACE DIESEL AND GASOLINE BUSES WITH ZERO EMISSION BUSES FOR OPERATIONS ON 11 TAOS AREA ROUTES.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT WILL BE THE CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW TRANSIT OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE CENTER FOR THE CITY OF LAS CRUCES ROADRUNNER TRANSIT SYSTEM. THIS FACILITY WILL BE ONE OF SEVERAL CITY OPERATIONS ACTIVITIES TO OCCUPY A 22.832-ACRE CITY-OWNED PARCEL PURCHASED IN 1993 EXPRESSLY FOR THE PURPOSE OF CONSOLIDATING CITY OPERATIONAL AND MAINTENANCE FUNCTIONS AT A SINGLE LOCATION. THE SITE LOCATED ON THE EAST SIDE OF MOTEL BLVD AND NORTH OF AMADOR AVE IN LAS CRUCES NM AND THE TRANSIT OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE PART OF THIS FACILITY WILL BE ON APPROXIMATELY 1/5 OF THE CITY-OWNED PARCEL.THE NEW FACILITY IS DESIGNED TO BE PART OF LARGER MUNICIPAL OPERATIONS CENTER WHICH WILL HOUSE MANY OPERATIONAL ACTIVITIES FOR THE CITY. THE TRANSIT FACILITY THAT THIS GRANT WILL FUND WILL INCLUDE SPACE FOR THE ROADRUNNER TRANSIT AND DIAL-A-RIDE OPERATIONS AND ASSOCIATED VEHICLE MAINTENANCE AND STORAGE. THE FACILITY WILL HAVE GENEROUS SPACE FOR EXPANSION INCLUDING THE NEEDED CHARGING STATIONS FOR THE PLANNED ELECTRIC BUSES AND EXPANSION OF THE ELECTRIC FLEET. IT WILL INCLUDE AN ADEQUATELY SIZED PARTS ROOM DEDICATED TO TRANSIT MAINTENANCE THAT WILL ALLOW FOR STORAGE OF PARTS AND EQUIPMENT TO EXPEDITE VEHICLE REPAIRS AND REGULAR PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE. THIS WILL ALLOW SHOULD IT BE NECESSARY THE MAINTENANCE SHOP TO RUN 24-HOURS A DAY. SIX UNIVERSAL BAYS WILL BE A PART OF THE FACILITY TO ACCOMMODATE ALL TYPES OF VEHICLES IN THE TRANSIT FLEET. THE DESIGN INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING ELEMENTS NOT CURRENTLY AVAILABLE TO STAFF: A LARGE WASH BAY; LARGER FUELING AREA WITH MULTIPLE TYPES OF FUEL AND LUBRICANT PUMPS; TRAINING ROOMS FOR ALL TRANSIT STAFF ; A SEPARATE PRIVATE DISPATCH AREA; OFFICES FOR SUPERVISORS AND STAFF; A BREAK ROOM FOR STAFF AND DRIVERS WITH SEATING SHOWERS AND FULL-SIZED LOCKERS; IMPROVED BREAKROOM SEATING SHOWERS AND LOCKER FOR MAINTENANCE STAFF; SECURE PARKING FOR THE FLEET; AND AMPLE PARKING FOR THE STAFF AND VISITORS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW TRANSIT OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY FOR ROADRUNNER TRANSIT FIXED-ROUTE AND DIAL-A-RIDE OPERATIONS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: A NEW OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY THAT WILL MEET THE NEEDS OF CITY OF LAS CRUCES/ROADRUNNER TRANSIT OPERATIONS FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DECADES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PRIMARY BENEFIT WILL BE FOR CITY TRANSIT EMPLOYEES. THE NEW FACILITIES WILL VASTLY IMPROVE THE WORKING CONDITIONS AND RESOURCES NEEDED TO PROVIDE A QUALITY DELIVER OF TRANSIT SERVICES TO THE PUBLIC. THE PUBLIC IN PARTICULAR TRANSIT USERS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE IMPROVED TRANSIT OPERATIONAL SUPPORT THAT THIS FACILITY WILL PROVIDE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

THE CITY OF LAS CRUCES (CITY) IS EMBARKING ON A PROJECT THAT WILL ULTIMATELY LEAD TO THE REPLACEMENT OF ALL EXISTING FOSSIL-FUEL BUSES IN ITS FIXED-ROUTE FLEET WITH BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES. THE FIRST PHASE OF THE PROJECT IS TO REPLACE FIVE (5) OF THE OLDEST BUSES IN ITS FLEET WITH BUSES PROPELLED BY THE NEWEST BATTERY ELECTRIC TECHNOLOGY. THIS APPLICATION ALONG WITH TWO OTHER EXISTING GRANTS WILL FUND THE PURCHASE AND IMPLEMENTATION OF TWO (2) BATTERY ELECTRIC HEAVY-DUTY 35 BUSES THAT WILL REPLACE TWO (2) AGING YEAR 2004 DIESEL BUSES PLUS A SHARE OF THREE (3) ADDITIONAL HEAVY-DUTY 35 BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES TO REPLACE THREE (3) 2004 DIESEL BUSES. ALL BUSES PURCHASED WILL BE EXPECTED TO BE USED FOR A MINIMUM OF 12 YEARS OF SERVICE OR AN ACCUMULATION OF A MINIMUM OF 500000 MILES. IN THE FIRST PHASE OF THIS PROJECT THE CITY WILL PROCURE A PROJECT MANAGEMENT FIRM TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL EXPERTISE AND OVERSIGHT OF THE PROJECT FROM DEVELOPMENT OF THE BUS SPECIFICATIONS PREPARATION OF THE REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL (RFP) FOR BUS PURCHASES OVERSEE BUS PROCUREMENT PROCESS ENSURE THE NECESSARY CHARGING EQUIPMENT IS PROCURED AND ELECTRICAL PANELS ARE INSTALLED AT THE MAINTENANCE YARD AND SEE THE PROJECT THROUGH TO IMPLEMENTATION ON THE CITYS FIXED ROUTES. BECAUSE THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERY OF THESE BUSES WILL BE CONCURRENT WITH THE CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW MAINTENANCE AND OPERATIONS FACILITY THE NEW FACILITY WILL BE DESIGNED TO ACCOMMODATE THIS NEW ALL-ELECTRIC FLEET.IN ADDITION TO THE PROJECT MANAGEMENT COMPONENT THIS GRANT WILL COMPLETELY FUND TWO (2) HEAVY DUTY BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES PLUS A SHARE OF THREE (3) ADDITIONAL BUSES WHICH WILL BE FUNDED FROM THE STATE OF GOOD REPAIR GRANT #NM-2017-015.PROJECT 1 IN THIS APPLICATION WILL USE THESE FUNDS:FY2017 DISCRETIONARY SECTION 5339 LOW-NO EMISSION GRANT AWARD: $1450000 FTA AWARD WITH $341176 LOCAL MATCH FOR A TOTAL OF $1791176. THIS INCLUDES PROCUREMENT OF ADA-COMPLIANT BUSES $1134134 FTA FUNDS AND $262209 LOCAL MATCH (81.22/18.78 MATCH RATIO) AND THIRD-PARTY CONTRACTED SERVICES $315866 AND $78967 LOCAL MATCH (80/20 MATCH RATIO). PROJECT 2 OF THIS APPLICATION IS FOR PURCHASE OF ADA-COMPLIANT BUSES AND WILL USE THESE FUNDS EACH WITH A MATCH RATIO OF 85% FTA FUNDS AND 15% LOCAL FUNDS:FY2016 FORMULA SECTION 5339 SMALL URBAN FUNDING: $172335 FTA FUNDING WITH $30412 LOCAL MATCH FOR A TOTAL OF $202747FY2017 FORMULA SECTION 5339 SMALL URBAN FUNDING: $176888 FTA FUNDING WITH $31215 LOCAL MATCH FOR A TOTAL OF $208103 FY2018 FORMULA SECTION 5339 SMALL URBAN FUNDING: $240999 FTA FUNDING WITH $42529 LOCAL MATCH FOR A TOTAL OF $283528 FY2017 FORMULA SECTION 5307 SMALL URBAN FUNDING: $113900 FTA FUNDING WITH $20100 LOCAL MATCH FOR A TOTAL OF $134000 FY2018 FORMULA SECTION 5307 SMALL URBAN FUNDING: $120365 FTA FUNDING WITH $21241 LOCAL MATCH FOR A TOTAL OF $141606 TOTAL FUNDING FOR THIS GRANT WOULD BE $2274487 FROM FTA WITH $486673 LOCAL MATCH FOR A TOTAL OF $2761160.ADDITIONAL FY16 SECTION 5307 FORMULA FUNDS IN GRANT #NM-2017-02 WILL BE USED IN TANDEM WITH THIS APPLICATION TOWARDS THE PURCHASE OF THE TWO (2) BUSES. ALSO THE CITY WILL USE FY16 DISCRETIONARY SECTION 5339 STATE OF GOOD REPAIR GRANT #NM-2018-015 TO FUND THE BULK OF THREE (3) ADDITIONAL REPLACEMENT BUSES SO A TOTAL OF FIVE (5) 2004 DIESEL HEAVY-DUTY BUSES CAN BE REPLACED WITH COMPARABLE BATTERY ELECTRIC POWERED BUSES. THIS GRANT WILL CONTRIBUTE $1134000 FTA FUNDS WITH $490459 LOCAL MATCH FOR A TOTAL OF $1624459. IN SUMMARY THIS GRANT ALONG WITH THE TWO EXISTING GRANTS WILL RESULT IN THE PROCUREMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF FIVE BUSES:THIS REQUEST: $2274487 FTA FUNDS WITH $486673 LOCAL MATCH FOR A TOTAL OF $2761160.NM-2017-002: $137667 FTA FUNDS WITH $24297 LOCAL MATCH FOR A TOTAL OF $161964.NM-2017-015: $1134000 FTA FUNDS WITH $490459 LOCAL MATCH FOR A TOTAL OF $1624459.ENTIRE PROJECT: $3546154 FTA FUNDS AND $1001429 LOCAL MATCH FOR A TOTAL OF $4547583.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: PLANNING DESIGN ENGINEERING PERMITTING AND CONSTRUCTION OF INFRASTRUCTURE REQUIRED FOR INITIAL UNH DURHAM TRANSIT FLEET ELECTRIFICATION. STAFF TRAINING AND FLEET SPECIFICATION DEVELOPMENT.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUND CONSULTANT/ENGINEERING SERVICES TO RECOMMENDED INFRASTRUCTURE TECHNOLOGY AND LOCATIONAL ALTERNATIVES INCLUDING ASSISTANCE IN DEVELOPMENT OF RFB AND CONSTRUCTION OVERSIGHT OF CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE. ONGOING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE INCLUDING DEVELOPMENT OF ELECTRIC VEHICLE FLEET SPECIFICATIONS AND ROUTE OPERATION EVALUATION.CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE WILL BE EVALUATED AND SPECIFICATIONS WILL BE DESIGNED AS PART OF A CONSTRUCTION RFB PACKAGE. NO REAL ESTATE ACQUISITION IS ANTICIPATED AND CONSTRUCTION LOCATIONS YET TO BE DETERMINED WILL ADJACENT OR WITHIN EXISTING TRANSIT FACILITIES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WILL INITIATE A LONG-TERM TRANSITION OF UNH TRANSIT FLEET TO ELECTRIC POWER BY DEVELOPING A TECHNOLOGY AND INFRASTRUCTURE DEVELOPMENT ROADMAP WHICH WILL INCLUDE VEHICLE SPECS. THIS FUNDING ELEMENT SHOULD RESULT IN TECHNOLOGY SELECTION AND CONSTRUCTION OF FIRST PHASE EV CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE AT EXISTING UNH TRANSIT FACILITY/FACILITIES AS WELL AS STAFF TRAINING REGARDING ELECTRIFICATION BENEFITS AND OPERATIONS CHANGES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: TRANSITION TO LOW-NO EMISSION ELECTRIC TRANSIT FLEET WILL BENEFIT THE COMMUNITY IN TERMS OF REDUCED EMISSIONS QUIETER AND MORE RELIABLE OPERATIONS. THE TRANSITION TO NON ICE/NON-CARBON BASED FUEL WILL REDUCE UNH OPERATIONS COST AND FURTHER OUR DECARBONIZATION AND EMISSIONS REDUCTIONS GOALS. UNH IS ESPECIALLY SUITED FOR FLEET ELECTRIFICATION GIVEN OUR LANDFILL GAS CO-GENERATION OF POWER AND OUR ROUTE SYSTEM.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

PROJECT BENEFIT: SOUTHWESTERN COMMUNITY SERVICES INC. (SCS) HAS BEEN OPERATING SULLIVAN COUNTY TRANSPORTATION OUT OF TWO SMALL ROOMS WITHIN ONE OF THE AGENCYS BUILDINGS IN CLAREMONT NEW HAMPSHIRE. THE TRANSPORTATION DIRECTOR TWO DISPATCHERS AND BUS DRIVERS UTILIZE THIS SPACE AND THERE IS VERY LITTLE ROOM TO SUPPORT THE TRANSIT ACTIVITY AND RADIO COMMUNICATION. ADDITIONALLY PARKING IS LIMITED AND THERE IS VERY LITTLE STORAGE AVAILABLE. SCS BEGAN ADMINISTERING THE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION FOR SULLIVAN COUNTY IN OCTOBER 2016 AND SINCE THAT TIME THE NUMBER OF RIDERS AND THE NEEDS OF THE PROGRAM HAVE GROWN. IN ADDITION TO INCREASED BUS ACTIVITY AND COMMUNITY EVENTS THE PROGRAM IS ALSO HOPING TO EXPAND SERVICES BY ADDING A BUS ROUTE TO LEBANON (LOWER GRAFTON COUNTY). APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE STARTRAN OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND CAPITAL FUNDING TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: PURCHASE (17) SEVENTEEN PARATRANSIT VANS WITH (10) TEN PASSENGER SEATS AND ACCOMMODATION FOR (2) TWO WHEELCHAIRS. THREE (3) TO REPLACE PARATRANSIT VANS THAT HAVE REACHED THEIR USEFUL LIFE (1) ONE 2010 GLAVAL VAN (1) ONE 2012 STARCRAFT VAN AND (1) ONE 2013 FORD VAN; AND TO REPLACE (5) FIVE 2017 FORD PARATRANSIT VANS THAT WILL HAVE REACHED THEIR USEFUL LIFE BY 12/31/2023; AND TO REPLACE (4) FOUR 2019 DODGE VANS. THIS WILL REDUCE BREAKDOWNS AND INCREASE OVERALL QUALITY OF SERVICE IN ANTICIPATION OF INCREASED USE OF PARATRANSIT VANS. PROJECT PURPOSE:STARTRAN WILL CONSTRUCT A NEW FAST FUEL CNG STATION AT ITS CURRENT LOCATION AT 710 J STREET LINCOLN NE. STARTRAN IS CURRENTLY FUELING ITS CNG BUSES AT SAPP BROS WHICH IS A 12.20 MILE ROUND TRIP. CONSTRUCTING THE NEW CNG FUELING STATION AT STARTRANS CURRENT FACILITY WILL REDUCE DEADHEAD AND ADDITIONAL UNNECESSARY COSTS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:STARTRAN WILL BE CONSTRUCTING A CNG FUELING STATION THAT INCLUDES DESIGN OF THE NEW FACILITY PURCHASE OF CNG FUELING EQUIPMENT AND CONSTRUCTION/INSTALLATION OF EQUIPMENT AND FACILITY. THE FACILITY WILL INCLUDE 2-3 250 HP COMPRESSORS AND A NATURAL GAS DRYER GENERATOR ALONG WITH MODEST LIGHTING RECEPTACLE AND MISCELLANEOUS DISPENSER LOADS. THE CNG COMPRESSORS AND EQUIPMENT WILL BE MOUNTED/INSTALLED ON SKID LOADERS. THIS WILL MAKE IT SO THAT THEY ARE EASY TO MOVE IN THE FUTURE IF NEEDED. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:STARTRAN WILL BE ABLE TO FUEL THEIR CNG VEHICLES FROM THE CURRENT FACILITY LOCATION INSTEAD OF DRIVING TO A 3-PARTY LOCATION. THIS WILL SAVE ON ADDITIONAL COSTS DRIVER TIME DEADHEAD ETC.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:STARTRAN WILL BE THE MAIN BENEFICIARYSUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:N/AATTACHMENTS:CNG STATION CONCEPTUAL LAYOUTAPPROVED CATEGORICAL EXCLUSIONAPPROVED TIPEQUIPMENT LISTPROJECT TIMELINEPROJECT COST ESTIMATEWHITE PAPER RELOCATION REQUEST/REQUEST APPROVALORIGINAL BBF GRANT SUBMISSIONTRANSIT/NON-TRANSIT USE:THE FACILITY WILL NOT HAVE SHARED OR JOINT USE. THE FACILITY WILL SOLELY BE USED BY STARTRAN TRANSIT.FUNDING:FY17 5339 $2600000 (D2018-BUSC-069) (BC)FY18 5339 $774723 (STATE/TERRITORY - 31)FY18 5339 $426197 (FORMULA - BF)FY19 5339 $225242 (FORMULA - BF)FEDERAL AMOUNT: $4026162LOCAL MATCH $1006541GRANT TOTAL BUDGET: $5032703STARTRAN IS A DIVISION OF THE CITY OF LINCOLN TRANSPORTATION AND UTILITIES THAT PROVIDES FIXED-ROUTE BUS AND PARATRANSIT SERVICE WITHIN THE 90 SQUARE MILE CITY LIMITS. THE LINCOLN URBANIZED AREA HAD A POPULATION OF 258379 PEOPLE (2010 CENSUS) WHICH HAS GROWN TO 272996 IN 2014 (CENSUS 2014 EST.).STARTRAN OPERATES A FLEET OF 67 FULL SIZE (35-FOOT) COACHES AND 21 PARATRANSIT VANS ON 20 FIXED ROUTES WITH RIDERSHIP OF 10600 DAILY RIDERS(2.36 MILLION PASSENGER TRIPS IN 2015). STARTRAN BUS SERVICE OPERATES WEEKDAYS (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY) FROM 6 A.M. TO 9 P.M. AND ON SATURDAYS FROM 6 A.M. TO 7 P.M.

PURPOSE:THIS IS A SUPER GRANT COMBINING FY22 5307 AND 5339 APPORTIONMENTS. THE CITY OF GREENSBORO IS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT OF FTA SECTION 5307 AND 5339 FUNDS. THE SPLIT LETTER FOR SECTION 5307 ALLOCATED A PORTION OF FUNDS TO THE PIEDMONT AUTHORITY FOR REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION (PART) IS ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION. THE CITY OF GREENSBOROS REQUEST IS FOR $6294006 IN FFY22 5307 FUNDS FOR CAPITAL PROJECTS AND OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND $587585 IN FFY22 SECTION 5339 FUNDS FOR CAPITAL PROJECTS. THE CITY WILL ADHERE TO TABLE 3A SECTION 5307 OPERATING ASSISTANCE SPECIAL RULE OPERATOR CAPS FOR URBANIZED AREAS. THIS REQUEST IS NOT BEING USED FOR RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT AND THE CITY WILL NOT BE APPLYING INDIRECT COST RATES TO ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS GRANT. THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE UNDER THIS GRANT IS THE DATE OF THE GRANT AWARD TO MARCH 30 2030. THE CITY WILL FOLLOW ALL THIRD-PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE). THE CITY OF GREENSBORO WILL ENSURE THAT CONTRACTORS PROCURED ARE NOT ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.THE CITY OF GREENSBORO SERVES AN URBANIZED AREA WITH A POPULATION OF 200000 OR MORE AND IS REQUIRED TO ALLOCATE NOT LESS THAN 0.75 PERCENT OF ITS URBANIZED AREA FORMULA PROGRAM FUNDS TO SAFETY-RELATED PROJECTS. TO MEET THIS REQUIREMENT THE CITY OF GREENSBORO WILL SPEND $47 205 IN FEDERAL FUNDS. THE SAFETY-RELATED PROJECTS ARE PART OF ALI 11.42.20. TO MEET THE REQUIREMENT OF 1% FOR SECURITY EXPENDITURES THE CITY OF GREENSBORO WILL SPEND $64000 IN FEDERAL FUNDS. THE SECURITY EXPENDITURES ARE PART OF ALI 11.42.09.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE CITY WILL BE UTILIZING THESE FUNDS FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE AND CAPITAL PURCHASES. THE CITY WILL PERFORM PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ON ITS FLEET OF TRANSIT VEHICLES OPERATE THE SYSTEMS FIXED-ROUTE AND PARATRANSIT SERVICE AND ACQUIRE CAPITAL ITEMS INCLUDING BUS SHELTERS AND REPLACEMENT SUPPORT VEHICLES SAFETY AND SECURITY ENHANCEMENT REPLACEMENT 30-FOOT PARATRANSIT VEHICLES EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE PROVISION OF QUALITY TRANSIT SERVICE TO THE CITYS RESIDENTS AND VISITORS A MORE EFFICIENT PROCESS FOR THE INSTALLATION OF BUS SHELTERS ASSURANCE THAT THE FLEETS VEHICLES ARE KEPT IN OPTIMAL OPERATING CONDITION AND THE PROVISION OF AMENITIES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE CITY OF GREENSBOROS TRANSIT RIDERS PLUS ADJACENT RIDERS WITHIN THE COUNTY BOTH CURRENT AND FUTURE.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:NONE

PURPOSE OF AWARD - TO CONSTRUCT A NEW TRANSIT FACILITY FOR DUPLIN COUNTY IN NORTH CAROLINA. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED - CONSTRUCTION OF AN ADMINISTRATIVE AND OPERATIONS FACILITY IN DUPLIN COUNTY. EXPECTED OUTCOMES - IMPROVED SERVICE EFFICIENCY VEHICLE MAINTENANCE OPERATING COSTS. THIS FACILITY WILL ALSO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL ADMINISTRATIVE SPACE A CONFERENCE ROOM FOR TRAINING WEATHER BRIEFINGS AND STAFF MEETINGS; A COVERED SHELTER FOR PASSENGERS TO TRANSFER FROM ONE BUS TO ANOTHER ON COORDINATED ROUTES; AND A SAFER AND MORE SECURE VEHICLE MAINTENANCE FACILITY WHICH WILL KEEP THE VEHICLES IN BETTER RUNNING ORDER. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES - CITIZENS OF DUPLIN COUNTY NORTH CAROLINA. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES - CONSTRUCTION OF AN ADMINISTRATIVE AND OPERATIONS FACILITY IN DUPLIN COUNTY.

PURPOSE: THE GRANT REQUESTS THE USE OF $3512500 OF SECTION 5307 URBANIZED AREA FORMULA PROGRAM FUNDS AND $2458675 OF SECTION 5339(C) LOW AND NO EMISSIONS COMPETITIVE PROGRAM FUNDS. THE GRANT WILL USE SECTION 5307 APPORTIONMENTS FOR 2019 ($1370686) AND 2020 ($2141814). THE GRANT WILL ALSO USE SECTION 5339(C) LOW AND NO EMISSIONS FUNDS COMPETITIVELY AWARDED IN FY21 FOR REPLACING THREE (3) DIESEL BUSES WITH BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES (ID# D2021-LWNO-032).ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FIXED ROUTE AND COMPLEMENTARY ADA PARATRANSIT SERVICES PLANNING ACTIVITIES IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE UPWP REVENUE VEHICLE REPLACEMENT CONSTRUCT ADA ACCESSIBLE BUS STOPS AND PEDESTRIAN WAYS BUS SHELTERS MAINTENANCE FACILITY IMPROVEMENTS AND MAJOR BUS COMPONENT REPAIR. A PROGRAM OF PROJECTS IS ATTACHED.A MINIMUM OF 0.75% OF THE SECTION 5307 URBANIZED AREA FUNDS WILL BE EXPENDED ON SAFETY RELATED PROJECTS. SAFETY RELATED PROJECTS ARE PART OF ALI 30.09.03 OPERATING ASSISTANCE.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: CONTINUE ESSENTIAL AND RELIABLE PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICES FOR THOSE LIVING OR VISITING THE FAYETTEVILLE AREA IN A SAFE AND COST EFFECTIVE MANNER. TIMELY REPLACEMENT OF BUSES IN ACCORDANCE WITH OUR TRANSIT ASSET MANAGEMENT (TAM) PLANINTENDED BENEFICIARIES: CITIZENS AND VISITORS IN THE FAYETTEVILLE AREA WILL BENEFIT WITH IMPROVED AIR QUALITY DUE TO REDUCED EMISSIONS FROM DIESEL BUSES AND WITH A SAFER AND MORE EASILY ACCESSIBLE BUSES FOR SERVICES PROVIDED WITH SMALLER CAPACITY VEHICLES . THE TRANSIT OPERATION WILL BENEFIT FROM REDUCED COSTS FROM NEW MORE EFFICIENT VEHICLES AS WELL AS IMPROVED WORKING CONDITIONS IN OUR MAINTENANCE FACILITY. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE WILL BE NO SUBRECIPIENTS FOR THIS GRANT.THE CITY OF FAYETTEVILLE IS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT FOR FTA SECTION 5307 FUNDS FOR THE FAYETTEVILLE NC URBANIZED AREA. FTA CERTIFICATIONS AND ASSURANCES FOR 2022 WERE REVIEWED AND SIGNED BY THE FAYETTEVILLE CITY ATTORNEY KAREN M. MCDONALD AND TRANSIT DIRECTOR RANDY HUME IN TRAMS.

THIS APPLICATION IS FOR MACON COUNTY TRANSIT TO FUND THE ENGINEERING DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION TO FUND A TRANSIT FACILITY ADDITION. THIS PROJECT IS TO APPLY FOR $834848 FEDERAL/ $1043560 TOTAL IN 5339(B) FUNDS OF THE AWARDED AMOUNT OF $17275000 MILLION FOR THE 2019 5339(B) BUS BUS FACILITY DISCRETIONARY GRANT. THIS 5339(B) BUS AND BUS FACILITY GRANT WAS AWARDED ON 11/25/2019. THE DISCRETIONARY ID IS D2020-BUSC-055.1) PURPOSE OF AWARD - TO CONSTRUCT AN ADDITION TO THE CURRENT TRANSIT FACILITY FOR MACON COUNTY TRANSIT IN NORTH CAROLINA.2) ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED - CONSTRUCTION OF AN ADDITION TO THE CURRENT TRANSIT FACILITY FOR MACON COUNTY TRANSIT.3) EXPECTED OUTCOMES - THIS NEW ADDITION WILL PROVIDE A MUCH NEEDED CONFERENCE AND TRAINING SPACE FOR MACON COUNTY TRANSIT TO UTILIZE. DRIVERS WILL RECEIVE TRAININGS IN THIS AREA ALONG WITH STAFF MEETINGS AND SPECIAL WEATHER BRIEFINGS. IN ADDITION THIS ADDITION WILL PROVIDE A COVERED SHELTER FOR DRIVERS TO RECORD THE CONDITION OF THEIR TRANSIT VEHICLE BEFORE THEIR ROUTE BEGINS. 4) INTENDED BENEFICIARIES - CITIZENS OF MACON COUNTY NORTH CAROLINA.5) SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES - CONSTRUCTION OF AN ADDITION TO THEIR CURRENT TRANSIT FACILITY IN MACON COUNTY.

WESTERN PIEDMONT REGIONAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY OPERATING AS GREENWAY PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IS REQUESTING FUNDS APPORTIONED TO HICKORY NC UZA IN THE AMOUNT OF $178504. PURPOSE: WPRTA WILL UTILIZE FUNDS TO PURCHASE REPLACEMENTS FOR COMPUTER HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE (COMPUTER SYSTEMS HAVE MET USEFUL LIFE) AND AN INTERIOR AND EXTERIOR UPGRADE/MODERNIZATION TO THE EXISTING TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION/OPERATIONS FACILITY (BUILDING IS 40+ YEARS IN AGE). FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PURCHASE BUS STOP SIGNS SECURITY CAMERAS AND A KEY FOB ENTRY SYSTEM FOR ALL TRANSIT FACILITIES. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: WPRTA WILL BE REPLACING HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE FOR ADMINISTRATIVE AND OPERATIONS STAFF. UP TO 60 COMPUTERS AND PRINTERS WILL BE PURCHASED. ADDITIONALLY COMPUTER SOFTWARE UPGRADES WILL BE PURCHASED. FACILITY INTERIOR UPGRADE AND MODERNIZATION WILL INCLUDE RENOVATION TO BATHROOMS PAINTING AND CARPET REPLACEMENT. FACILITY EXTERIOR UPGRADE WILL INCLUDE FUNCTIONAL LANDSCAPING. WPRTA WILL PURCHASE SECURITY CAMERAS. BUS STOP SIGNS AND POSTS WILL BE PURCHASED. A KEY FOB ENTRY SYSTEM FOR ALL TRANSIT FACILITIES WILL BE PURCHASED. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: PROJECTS WILL IMPROVE THE STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FOR TRANSIT ASSETS AT WPRTA.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: POPULACE OF THE WPRTA SERVICE AREA AND LOCAL AREA COMMUTERS. FUNDING FOR THIS PROJECT WILL ENSURE CONTINUITY OF SERVICE WITH UPGRADED EQUIPMENT AND FACILITY.THE WESTERN PIEDMONT REGIONAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY IS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT FOR FTA SECTION 49 USC 5307 FUNDS; THEREFORE ALSO THE RECIPIENT OF SECTION 5339 FUNDS FOR THE HICKORY NC URBANIZED AREA.

RECIPIENT IS APPLYING FOR FFY19 SECTION 5339 LAPSING FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $1380254 TO BE USED TOWARDS DEVELOPMENT AND DEPLOYMENT OF A PARK AND RIDE FACILITY ADJACENT TO THE GORALEIGH TRANSIT MAINTENANCE AND OPERATIONS FACILITY. TRIPS FROM THIS PARK AND RIDE WILL TAKE PATRON FROM THE EAST AND SOUTHEAST OF RALEIGH TO THE DOWNTOWN GORALEIGH TRANSFER STATION LOCATED AT 210 SOUTH BLOUNT STREET RALEIGH NC.1. PURPOSE:TO PROVIDE A NEW PARK AND RIDE FACILITY ADJACENT TO GORALEIGHS POOLE ROAD MAIN FACILITY TO ACCOMMODATE CURRENT RIDERSHIP AND FUTURE GROWTH.2. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE CONSTRUCTION OF A 230 PARK AND RIDE FACILITY TO INCLUDE TWO BUS SHELTERS ELECTRIC VEHICLE CHARGING STATIONS STORMWATER CONTROL MEASURES LIGHTING AND SECURITY CAMERAS. THE WORK INCLUDES ROCK EXCAVATION PRESENT ON THE SITE.3. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:OUTCOMES EXPECTED ARE 230 PARKING SPACES FOR BUS PATRONS COMMUTING FROM THE EAST AND SOUTH OF RALEIGH AND RELIEVING PRESSURE ON THE GORALEIGH FACILITYS PARKING LOT. 4. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE NEW PARK AND RIDE FACILITY WILL PROVIDE TRANSIT PATRONS LIVING EAST OF RALEIGH MORE CONVENIENT ACCESS TO THE BUS SYSTEM. TRANSIT CUSTOMERS HAVE BEEN USING THE GORALEIGH FACILITYS PARKING LOT TO SERVE THIS NEED AND THIS HAS CREATED DAY TIME SHORTAGES OF AVAILABLE SPACES FOR STAFF AND VISITORS TO THE EXISTING FACILITY. 5. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES IN THIS APPLICATIONBREAKOUT OF FUNDS ARE AS FOLLOWS:$1380254 - FFY19 5339 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES LAPSE YEAR: 09/30/2022FTA CATEGORICAL EXCLUSION LETTER AND DOCUMENTED CATEGORICAL EXCLUSION ARE ATTACHED TO APPLICATION.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO COVER 50% OF OPERATING AND 80-95% OF CAPITAL AND PLANNING RELATED PROJECTS AND EXPENSES INCLUDING SECTION 5307 FFY 2017 2018 2019 2020 AND 2021 ALLOCATIONS TOTALING $5963171 AND SECTION 5339 FFY 2019 2020 AND 2021 ALLOCATIONS TOTALING $465183. THE 5%-50% LOCAL SHARE WILL BE SUPPLIED BY THE STATE OF NORTH CAROLINA NON-FEDERAL TRANSIT FUNDS LOCAL VEHICLE REGISTRATION TAX REVENUE AND GENERAL FUND CONTRIBUTIONS FROM THE CITIES OF CONCORD AND KANNAPOLIS. THE AWARD START DATE IS THE SAME AS THE DATE OF THE AWARD. THE AWARD END DATE IS 3/30/2033.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE EXPENSES SUCH AS CAPITAL COST OF THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING OPERATING ASSISTANCE NON-FIXED ROUTE ADA PARATRANSIT SERVICE EMPLOYEE EDUCATION AND TRAINING COMPREHENSIVE PLANNING ENGINEERING AND CONSTRUCTION OF BUS STOP STATIONS AND ACQUISITION OF PARATRANSIT SCHEDULING SOFTWARE CAD/AVL SYSTEM MOBILE FARE COLLECTION SYSTEM RADIOS BICYCLE RACKS DATA MANAGEMENT SOFTWARE SUPPORT VEHICLES EXPANSION VEHICLE AND REPLACEMENT VEHICLES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL ALLOW CONCORD KANNAPOLIS AREA TRANSIT TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE AND ENHANCE PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICE AND AMENITIES TO ITS CUSTOMERS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE POPULACE OF THE CITIES OF CONCORD AND KANNAPOLIS AS WELL AS VISITORS TO THE AREA AND COMMUTERS INTO AND OUT OF CHARLOTTE.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.THE CITY OF CONCORD IS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT OF 5307 AND 5339 PROGRAM FUNDS IN THE CONCORD UZA. THIS APPLICATION IS CONSISTENT WITH THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT SUB-ALLOCATION LETTER DATED APRIL 1 2021. THE APPLICATION DOES NOT INCLUDE FUNDS FOR RESEARCH AND/OR DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES. INDIRECT COSTS WILL NOT BE APPLIED TO THIS APPLICATION AND ITS SCOPE OF WORK.THE NCDOT STIP IS ATTACHED IN THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS SECTION.CONCORD KANNAPOLIS AREA TRANSIT SERVES AN URBANIZED AREA WITH POPULATIONS OF 200000 OR MORE AND IS REQUIRED TO ALLOCATE NOT LESS THAN 0.75 PERCENT OF THEIR URBANIZED AREA FORMULA PROGRAM FUNDS TO SAFETY-RELATED PROJECTS. TO MEET THIS REQUIREMENT CONCORD KANNAPOLIS AREA TRANSIT WILL PURCHASE AND INSTALL A NEW COMPUTER AIDED DISPATCH/AUTOMATIC VEHICLE LOCATION (CAD/AVL) SYSTEM ON ITS FLEET OF 18 VEHICLES. THE SAFETY RELATED PROJECTS ARE PART OF ALI 11.52.04. IN ADDITION THE REQUIRED 1% FOR SECURITY EXPENDITURES ARE ALSO PART OF ALI 11.52.04.

THE CITY OF ASHEVILLE IS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT AND APPLYING FOR THE FFY2020 AND FFY2021 SECTION 5307 FUNDS FOR THE CAPITAL COST OF CONTRACTING. THE TOTAL 5307 AMOUNT REQUESTED IS $2358190 AND IS ALSO APPLYING FOR $291828 FROM THE ANNUAL FFY2020 JARC (5307) CALL FOR PROJECTS. ADDITIONALLY THE CITY IS APPLYING FOR THE FFY2019 FFY2020 AND FFY2021 SECTION 5339 FUNDS FOR $741039 TO IMPLEMENT TRANSIT CAPITAL PROJECTS. TOTAL FTA FUNDS REQUESTED IS $3391057.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE 2 YEARS OF OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO THE CITY OF ASHEVILLE AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS FOR TRANSIT OPERATIONS AND IMPLEMENTATION OF CAPITAL PROJECTS IN THE ASHEVILLE URBANIZED AREA. THE AWARDS WILL BE USED AS FOLLOWS: - USE OF FFY2020 AND FFY2021 5307 ALLOCATIONS FOR TRANSIT OPERATIONS FOR THE AMOUNT OF $2358190 FROM JULY 1 2021 TO JUNE 30 2023. - USE OF FFY2020 5307 (JARC) ALLOCATIONS FOR TRANSIT OPERATIONS FOR THE AMOUNT OF $291828 - UTILIZE FFY2019 FFY2020 AND FFY2021 5339 ALLOCATIONS FOR IMPLEMENTATION OF CAPITAL PROJECTS FOR THE AMOUNT OF $741039.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ALL ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES FUEL ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR AND/OR ITEMS HAVING THE USEFUL LIFE OF FIVE OR MORE YEARS PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE AND OTHER CAPITAL PROJECTS ETC TO CONTINUE TRANSIT OPERATIONS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDS AWARDED WILL PERMIT THE CITY OF ASHEVILLE AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS TO CONTINUE PROVIDING TRANSIT OPERATIONS IN ASHEVILLE URBANIZED AREA AND IN BUNCOMBE COUNTY THAT WILL OFFER TRANSIT SERVICE FOR PASSENGERS COMMUTING COMMUTE TO AND FROM WORK MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AT A VARIETY OF MEDICAL FACILITIES AND PARTICIPATE IN SOCIAL EVENTS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE CITY OF ASHEVILLE ITS SUBRECIPIENTS AND THEIR RIDERS THAT RELY ON PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICES IN THE ASHEVILLE UZA AND BUNCOMBE COUNTY WILL BENEFIT FROM CONTINUED SERVICE THAT WILL ENABLE WORKERS TO GET TO AND FROM WORK AND PARTICIPATE IN SOCIAL AND CULTURAL EVENTS AS WELL AS TO TRAVEL TO AND FROM MEDICAL FACILITIES IN THE AREA FOR THEIR MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS. SUBRECIPIENTS ACTIVITIES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT BUNCOMBE COUNTY TO CONTINUE PROVIDING TRANSIT OPERATIONS TO COUNTY RIDERS THAT USE THE BLACK MOUNTAIN TRAILBLAZER DEVIATED FIXED-ROUTE SERVICE FOR MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS ATTEND SOCIAL EVENTS AND COMMUTE TO AND FROM WORK. THE CITY OF ASHEVILLE WILL ENSURE ALL TRANSIT VEHICLES PURCHASED ARE ADA ACCESSIBLE PROCURED FROM AN FTA-APPROVED TVM AND REPORTED TO THE FTA WITHIN 30 DAYS AFTER THE CONTRACT IS EXECUTED.THE CITY OF ASHEVILLE WILL CHECK THE CURRENT LISTING OF TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURERS (TVM) THROUGH THE FTA WEBSITE TO ENSURE EACH TVM IS LISTED AS A CERTIFIED TVM IS IN COMPLIANCE WITH FTA REGULATIONS.THE CITY OF ASHEVILLE WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C 4220.IF (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDELINES).THE CITY OF ASHEVILLE WILL ENSURE CONTRACTORS PROCURED WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.THE OVERALL PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE IS THE AWARD DATE.FREQUENCY OF MILESTONE PROGRESS REPORTS (MPR)QUARTERLYFREQUENCY OF FEDERAL FINANCIAL REPORTS (FFR)QUARTERLYTHE CITY OF ASHEVILLE IS REQUIRED TO USE 1% ($23581.90) OF THE TOTAL 5307 FUNDS BEING REQUESTED FOR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SECURITY PROJECTS PER C. 9030.1E. HOWEVER DUE TO THE NEED TO USE ALL THE 5307 FUNDS FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE THE CITY OF ASHEVILLE CONSIDERS SUCH EXPENDITURES UNNECESSARY FOR THIS GRANT APPLICATION. THE CITY OF ASHEVILLE CERTIFIES THAT SUCH EXPENDITURES ARE NOT NEEDED FOR THIS GRANT AND WILL NOT USE ANY OF ITS SUBALLOCATED 5307 FUNDS FOR FFY2020 AND FFY2021 FOR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SECURITY PROJECTS. A LETTER EXPLAINING THIS ACTION IS ATTACHED IN THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS. ALL PROJECTS ARE PROGRAMMED IN THE NCDOT 2020-2029 STATE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (STIP) APPROVED IN OCTOBER 2021. THE STIP ID # FOR THE 5307 TRANSIT OPERATIONS IN THE STIP IS AS FOLLOWS: TO-4075 FOR TRANSIT OPERATIONS TM-5138 FOR JARC OPERATIONS AND TA-6626 FOR 5339 OTHER CAPITAL PROJECTS. ALL THE PROJECTS STIP ID NUMBERS ARE LISTED ON PAGES 18 TO 20 OF 26 AND ATTACHED IN APPLICATION DOCUMENTS.

THE REPLACEMENT SERVICE VEHICLE IS USED TO TRANSFER OPERATORS BETWEEN SHIFT TRADE-OUTS AT TRANSFER STATIONS AND IS USED BY SUPERVISORS TO RESPOND TO ACCIDENTS AND OTHER OPERATIONAL NEEDS. THE MINIMUM USEFUL LIFE OF A MEDIUM DUTY (PURPOSE BUILT) TRANSIT BUS 30-35 CAPACITY SHALL BE DEFINED AS SEVEN (7) YEARS AND 200000 MILES;D.THE MINIMUM USEFUL LIFE OF A LARGE HEAVY-DUTY TRANSIT BUS SHALL BE DEFINED AS:EIGHT (8) YEARS FOR VEHICLES ( 30 TO 35 FEET) WITH 30 35 PASSENGER CAPACITY AND 250000 MILES;TEN (10) YEARS FOR VEHICLES WITH GREATER THAN 35 PASSENGER CAPACITY; AND 350000 MILES; E. THE MINIMUM USEFUL LIFE OF AN OVER THE ROAD COACH TRANSIT BUS SHALL BE DEFINED AS TWELVE (12) YEARS FOR VEHICLES WITH GREATER THAN 35 PASSENGER CAPACITY; AND/OR 500000 MILES; F. APPLICATION PURPOSE: PROGRAM DISCRETIONARY GRANT AWARD FUNDSBI-STATE IS SUBMITTING THIS APPLICATION TO APPLY FOR AND PROGRAM FUNDS AWARDED IN THE FISCAL YEAR 2022 SECTION 5339(C) LOW OR NO EMISSION VEHICLE PROGRAM. AS PUBLISHED IN THE TABLES REFERENCED IN THE MARCH 4 2022 FEDERAL REGISTER (VOLUME 87 NO. 43) THE FULL ALLOCATION FOR THE BI-STATE DEVELOPMENT AGENCY FOR FY2022 IS $5412960.IN THIS APPLICATION BSD IS APPLYING FOR $5412960 OF ITS TOTAL ALLOCATION OF $5412960. LOCAL MATCH FUNDS OF $1353240 WILL BE PROVIDED FOR A TOTAL OF $6766200 IN PROJECTS BEING PROGRAMMED IN THIS APPLICATION. BSD MATCH FUNDS ARE DERIVED FROM LOCAL SALES TAX.TO DATE FY2022 SECTION 5339(C) LOW OR NO EMISSIONS BUS FUNDS HAVE BEEN APPLIED AS FOLLOWS:(+)$ 5412960TOTAL FY2022 SECTION 5339(C) LOW OR NO EMISSIONS $ 5412960AVAILABLE TO PROGRAM AS OF LAST APPLICATION(-)$ 5412960APPLYING FOR IN THIS APPLICATION(-)$ 0REMAINING FUNDS TO PROGRAM AT A LATER DATE; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS PROGRAMMED IN THIS APPLICATION WILL SUPPORT THE CONTINUED INTEGRATION OF METROS ZERO-EMISSION BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES BY REPLACING UP TO SIX (6) DIESEL-POWERED BUSES THAT HAVE MET THEIR USEFUL LIFE WITH SIX BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUSES. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO INVOLVE THE ACQUISITION OF RELATED CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE AT METROS DEBALIVIERE BUS FACILITY LOCATED AT 535 DEBALIVIERE STREET ST. LOUIS MO 63112. THIS APPLICATION REQUESTS FUNDING OF THE INCREMENTAL COSTS OF THE PURCHASE PRICE AND NECESSARY PROFESSIONAL CONSULTATION.BUSES WILL BE ASSIGNED A USEFUL LIFE OF 12 YEARS OR 500000 MILES WHICHEVER COMES FIRST. IN OUR SECTION 5339(C) APPLICATION BSD IDENTIFIED THE PARTNERS BELOW THAT WILL BE ASSISTING IN THE CONTINUATION OF ADDING BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES TO OUR METROBUS FLEET. PER THE APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS IF AN APPLICATION THAT INVOLVES SUCH A PARTNERSHIP IS SELECTED FOR FUNDING THE COMPETITIVE SELECTION PROCESS WILL BE DEEMED TO SATISFY THE REQUIREMENT FOR A COMPETITIVE PROCUREMENT UNDER 49 U.S.C. 5325(A) FOR THE NAMED ENTITIES. AS WE CONTINUE TO EXPANSION OF OUR BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUS FLEET WE CONTINUE TO PARTNER WITH GILLIG CENTER FOR TRANSPORTATION AND THE ENVIRONMENT (CTE) AND AMEREN MISSOURI. AMEREN MISSOURI LOCAL UTILITY PROVIDER WILL SUPPLY THE ELECTRICAL POWER TO THE FACILITY FOR THE CHARGING STATIONS AND HAS EXPRESSED ITS COMMITMENT THROUGHOUT THIS ENDEAVOR TO PROTECT THE ENVIRONMENT THROUGH ITS PROGRAMS AND INITIATIVE AIMED AT CLEANER ENERGY SOURCES.CENTER FOR TRANSPORTATION AND THE ENVIRONMENT (CTE) NON-PROFIT WHOSE MISSION IS TO IMPROVE THE EFFICIENCY AND SUSTAINABILITY OF ENERGY CONSUMPTION AND TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS PROVIDED TECHNICAL INFORMATION FOR THE APPLICATION SUBMITTAL AND CONTINUES TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL EXPERTISE IN THE IMPLEMENTATION OF BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES INTO THE METROBUS FLEETGILLIG LLC MANUFACTURER OF BUSES MEETS FTA REQUIREMENTS AS A QUALIFIED TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER (TVM); WE WILL PURCHASE REPLACEMENT BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES FROM THIS VENDOR.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WILL REPLACE UP TO SIX DIESEL BUSES WITH BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES AND INSTALL THE RELATED CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE. THE SHIFT FROM DIESEL TO ENGINE WILL REDUCE ENERGY CONSUMPTION HARMFUL EMISSIONS DIRECT CARBON EMISSIONS AND AS RESULT CREATE SOCIAL COST SAVINGS THAT BENEFIT THE AGENCY AND COMMUNITY OVERALL.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ALONG WITH SUPPORTING THE GOALS OF THE JUSTICE40 INITIATIVE BY SERVING THE DISADVANTAGED POPULATION IN THE CITY OF ST. LOUIS THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO BENEFIT THE ENVIRONMENT BY SUPPORTING CLEAN AIR INITIATIVES WHICH CALL FOR THE REDUCTION OF HARMFUL EMISSIONS DIRECT CARBON EMISSIONS AND ENERGY CONSUMPTION. LOUIS MO THE OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT CLEAN AIR INITIATIVES WHICH CALL FOR THE REDUCTION OF HARMFUL EMISSIONS DIRECT CARBON EMISSIONS AND ENERGY CONSUMPTION WHICH SUPPORT THE REGIONS ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY GOALS AND OVERALL EFFORTS TO IMPROVE AIR QUALITY.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE ACTIVITIES IN THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COMMUNITY IMMEDIATELY SURROUNDING THE DEBALIVIERE BUS FACILITY AS WELL AS ALONG THE BUS ROUTES THAT OPERATE FROM THE FACILITY. REQUIRED CERTIFICATIONS/STATEMENTSTHE SECTION 3019 OF THE FAST ACT REQUIRES THAT GRANTS FOR BUSES AND BUS FACILITIES FORMULA AND COMPETITIVE PROGRAM RECIPIENTS TO THE EXTENT POSSIBLE USE INNOVATIVE PROCUREMENT TOOLS IN THE VEHICLE ACQUISITION PROCESS. BI-STATE CURRENTLY USES A STANDARD COMPETITIVE RFP PROCESS IN WHICH THE HIGHEST RANKING FIRM IS AWARDED THE CONTRACT. WE CURRENTLY HAVE AN IDIQ (INDEFINITE DELIVERY/INDEFINITE QUANTITY) CONTRACT FOR HEAVY DUTY BUSES (WHICH INCLUDES ELECTRIC BUSES) AWARDED TO GILLIG AS A RESULT OF THIS COMPETITIVE PROCESS. A FIVE-YEAR PROCUREMENT CONTRACT WAS AWARDED TO GILLIG IN 2021. A TASK ORDER IS ISSUED AGAINST THIS CONTRACT IN A SPECIFIED QUANTITY AND DOLLAR AMOUNT AS BUSES ARE NEEDED FOR REPLACEMENT UNDER METROS VEHICLE REPLACEMENT PLAN. METRO USES A THIRD PARTY FOR ON-SITE VEHICLE INSPECTIONS ON REVENUE VEHICLES. THESE SERVICES ENSURE THAT EACH VEHICLE BEING PROCURED IS MANUFACTURED IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FTA REGULATIONS STATED IN 49 CFR PART 661 AND 663.37 AND COMPLIES WITH THE SPECIFICATIONS OF THE ORDER. BI-STATE WILL CONDUCT THE REQUIRED PRE-AWARD AND POST-AWARD BUY AMERICA REVIEWS AND SUBMIT THOSE REVIEWS TO THE FTA REGION VII OFFICE. ALL BUY AMERICA PRE-AWARD DOCUMENTS ARE PROVIDED BY THE OEM AND CONTENT IS AUDITED TO VERIFY THE MANUFACTURER WILL MEET THE PRE-AWARD PURCHASERS REQUIREMENT UNDER 49 CFR 663.27 AND THE FMVSS CERTIFICATION UNDER 49 CFR 663.41 AT THE PRE-AUDIT PHASE. AT THIS PHASE IT IS CONFIRMED THAT THE FINAL ASSEMBLY IS COMPLETED IN A FACILITY IN THE UNITED STATES. AS REQUIRED BY THE FTA THE IN-PLANT INSPECTOR WILL VISUALLY VERIFY COMPONENTS LISTED ON THE BUY AMERICA COMPONENT LIST ARE ACTUALLY INSTALLED ON THE VEHICLE.THE POST-DELIVERY DOCUMENTS ARE GENERATED BY A BUY AMERICA COMPLIANCE AUDITOR EMPLOYED BY THE INSPECTION CONTRACTOR. THEY WILL REVIEW ALL SUPPORTING DOCUMENTATION AND CERTIFY THAT THE MANUFACTURER MEETS THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE POST-DELIVERY BUY AMERICA CERTIFICATION UNDER 49 CFR 663.35 THE POST-DELIVERY PURCHASERS REQUIREMENT CERTIFICATION UNDER 49 CFR 663.41 AND THE FEDERAL MOTOR VEHICLE SAFETY STANDARD CERTIFICATION UNDER 49 CFR 663.41. THE POST-DELIVERY AUDIT WILL AGAIN CONFIRM THE MANUFACTURER COMPLETED THE MANUFACTURING PROCESS IN THE UNITED STATES.MS 06-07-2022

THE KANSAS CITY AREA TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (KCATA) IS REQUESTING $3279828 IN FEDERAL SECTION 5339C LONO FUNDING DISCRETIONARY ID - D2021-LWNO-028 FOR THE PURCHASE OF THREE NEW ADA ACCESSIBLE BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES (BEBS) NEEDED TO REPLACE AGING DIESEL BUSES THAT HAVE REACHED THEIR USEFUL LIFE EXPECTANCY CONSTRUCTION AND INSTALLATION OF CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE AND TO PROVIDE WORKFORCE TRAINING FOR KCATA TECHNICIANS FOR MAINTAINING THE NEW TECHNOLOGY.FUNDING SUMMARY:FY 2021 LONO EMISSIONS$ 3279828LOCAL MATCH: $ 577191GRAND TOTAL $ 3857019TOTAL SECTION 5339(C) LONO FUNDS TO BE APPLIED TO THIS APPLICATION: $3279828 LOCAL MATCH - LOCAL FUNDING SOURCES INCLUDE CONTRACTUAL AGREEMENTS WITH LOCAL COMMUNITIES 1/2 CENT TRANSPORTATION SALES TAX AND 3/8 CENT ATA SALES TAX. STIP/TIP- PROJECTS ARE INCLUDED IN THE 2016-2020 TIP PG. 204 TIP # 995002. THE ONE DOT STIP APPROVAL DATE IS DECEMBER 22 2015. ITS- THERE ARE NO ITS COMPONENTS IN THIS GRANT. TRANSIT PROVIDERS IN AREA: THE KANSAS CITY AREA TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (KCATA) IS AN INTERSTATE AGENCY OF MISSOURI AND KANSAS GOVERNED BY A BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS WHICH IS RESPONSIBLE FOR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IN THE REGION. THE ATA HAS A SEVEN-COUNTY JURISDICTION - THE COUNTIES OF CASS CLAY JACKSON AND PLATTE IN MISSOURI; AND JOHNSON LEAVENWORTH AND WYANDOTTE IN KANSAS. THE KCATA OPERATES FIXED ROUTE DEMAND RESPONSIVE AND BUS RAPID TRANSIT SERVICE SEVEN DAYS A WEEK BETWEEN THE HOURS OF 4 A.M. TO 1 A.M. KCATA ALSO OPERATES A SHARE-A-FARE PROGRAM WHICH PROVIDES DOOR-TO-DOOR SERVICE TO ELIGIBLE ELDERLY AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES. KCATA OPERATES FROM A SINGLE MAINTENANCE AND ADMINISTRATION FACILITY IN KANSAS CITY MISSOURI. OTHER TRANSIT PROVIDERS IN THE AREA INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING:THE JO OPERATED BY JOHNSON COUNTY (KANSAS) TRANSIT AND THE BUS OPERATED BY UNIFIED GOVERNMENT OF WYANDOTTE COUNTY/KANSAS CITY KANSAS ARE OTHER TRANSIT PROVIDERS THAT FEED INTO AND PROVIDE SIMILAR SERVICE IN THE KANSAS CITY URBANIZED AREA. TVM COMPLIANCE - KANSAS CITY AREA TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY WILL REQUIRE EACH TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER (TVM) AS A CONDITION OF BEING AUTHORIZED TO BID OR PROPOSE ON FTA-ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS TO CERTIFY THAT IT HAS COMPLIED WITH THE TVM REQUIREMENTS OUTLINED ON 49 CFR 26.49. ALTERNATIVELY KCATA MAY AT ITS DISCRETION AND WITH FTA APPROVAL ESTABLISH PROJECT-SPECIFIC GOALS FOR DBE PARTICIPATION IN THE PROCUREMENT OF TRANSIT VEHICLES IN LIEU OF THE TVM COMPLYING WITH THIS ELEMENT OF THE PROGRAM. TO ENSURE THAT THE REGULATIONS ARE COMPLIED WITH AS A CONDITION OF DETERMINING RESPONSIVENESS KCATA WILL REVIEW THE FTAS ELIGIBLE TO BID LIST FOR TVMS AND WHEN APPROPRIATE OBTAIN A COPY OF THE TVM CERTIFICATION ASSOCIATED WITH ANY VEHICLES ACQUIRED WITH FEDERAL FUNDS. CCR EXPIRATION DATE: MARCH 8 2022PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE FOR THIS APPLICATION IS: START DATE: 1/3/2022 END DATE: 2/27/2026THIS GRANT WILL NOT SUPPORT ANY RESEARCH OR DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS INDIRECT COSTS WILL NOT BE APPLIED TO THIS APPLICATION AND ITS SCOPE OF WORK A COPY OF THE FY 2021 MASTER AGREEMENT WILL BE RETAINED ON FILE. THE FY 2021 CERTIFICATIONS AND ASSURANCES HAVE BEEN ATTACHED TO THE RECIPIENT ORGANIZATION DOCUMENTS.PROJECT BENEFITSTHE PURCHASE OF THREE BEBS AND CONSTRUCTION AND INSTALLATION OF CHARGING EQUIPMENT WILL ADVANCE SMART MOVES 3.0 GOALS AND POTENTIALLY REDUCE OPERATIONAL COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH MAINTAINING AGING DIESEL BUSES IN THE LONG TERM. ELECTRIFICATION WILL PROVIDE BENEFITS TO ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES IN THE KANSAS CITY REGION BY REDUCING TAILPIPE EMISSIONS SUCH AS IN CLEANER AIR AND THE ALL-ELECTRIC PROPULSION AND AUXILIARY SYSTEMS WILL CREATE SMOOTHER QUIETER RIDES FOR KCATA PASSENGERS.PROJECT OUTCOMESTHIS PROJECT SUPPORTS MANY LOCAL AND REGIONAL PLANS INCLUDING THE MID-AMERICA REGIONAL COUNCIL (MARC) 2021 REGIONAL CLIMATE ACTION PLANS GOAL TO SHIFT THE REGIONS FLEET TO LOW AND NO EMISSION VEHICLES. SMART MOVES 3.0 THE LONG-RANGE TRANSIT PLAN RECOMMENDS THAT KCATA REPLACE CONVENTIONAL DIESEL POWERED VEHICLES BY CONVERTING THE FLEETS TO ELECTRIC VEHICLES OR OTHER ALTERNATIVE FUELS. THE PLAN OUTLINES A GOAL FOR ENSURING THAT TRANSIT SYSTEMS ARE MAINTAINED IN A GOOD CONDITION INCLUDING TRANSIT VEHICLES TO KEEP EXISTING RIDERS AND ATTRACT NEW USERS. AS PART OF KCATAS 2021 RIDEKC NEXT SYSTEM REDESIGN TO REDUCE UNPRODUCTIVE SERVICE WHILE ACCELERATING TECHNOLOGY AND INNOVATION TO ENHANCE SERVICE DELIVERY. KCATA WILL CONDUCT A REGIONAL BEB EVALUATION AND SHAPE A LONG-TERM ELECTRIFICATION STRATEGY FOR THE REGIONAL FLEET FOR THE FUTURE WHICH INCLUDES ELECTRICITY SUPPLY BUILDOUT BY 2023.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: BUDGET REVISION REQUEST TO EXTEND PROJECT PERIOD TO FEBRUARY 28 2026.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: KCATA RECEIVED THE GRANT IN JULY OF 2021. ALTHOUGH THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC HAD BEEN IN THE US FOR A YEAR MANY ORGANIZATIONS WERE STILL EXCISING REMOTE WORK POLICIES TO INCLUDE KCATA. THE FUTURE WORK POLICY WHETHER HYBRID OR SET IN ONE LOCATION FROM HOME OR OFFICE - WAS STILL UNCERTAIN AND THEREFORE THE START OF THE PROJECT WAS DELAYED AS COVID UPTICKS WERE STILL OCCURRING. THE LONG-TERM STATUS OF THE ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICES WERE STILL UNCERTAIN. NOW THAT THE PANDEMIC HAS SUBSIDED AND THE NUMBER OF VACCINATED PERSONNEL HAS INCREASED KCATA EMPLOYEES ARE WORKING FULL TIME IN THE OFFICE. A DESIGN TEAM HAS BEEN SELECTED AND PLANS FOR DESIGN ARE PROGRESSING.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: IMPROVE AND EXTEND THE LIFE OF KCATAS AGED OPERATIONS CENTER AND BRING THE FACILITY TO A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: TRANSIT EMPLOYEES AND ANY PEDESTRIANS THAT WILL VISIT THE FACILITY TO ATTEND MEETINGS ETC.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

THIS GRANT INCLUDES A LOCAL SHARE WHICH WILL BE MADE UP BY A MINNESOTA STATE SHARE OF $83900 AND A LOCAL SHARE OF $112100 FROM GENERAL FUNDS OF THE CITY OF MANKATO.THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PURCHASE FOUR (4) BUSES FOR THE MANKATO TRANSIT SYSTEM OPERATING IN THE MANKATO MINNESOTA URBANIZED AREA.TWO (2) EXPANSION CLASS 400 LOW FLOOR GAS BUSES TOTALING $376000ONE (1) REPLACEMENT CLASS 400 LOW FLOOR GAS BUS TOTALING $188000ONE (1) REPLACEMENT CLASS 700 LOW FLOOR DIESEL BUS TOTALING $557000ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER THE COST OF PURCHASING FOUR BUSES IN ORDER TO CONTINUE TRANSIT OPERATIONS FOR THE MANKATO TRANSIT SYSTEM IN A SAFE SECURE AND EFFICIENT MANNER.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT MANKATO TRANSIT SYSTEM TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE TRANSIT SERVICES TO OUR COMMUNITY FOR FIXED ROUTES DEMAND RESPONSE AND PARATRANSIT SERVICES IN A SAFE AND EFFICIENT MANNER THAT WOULD OTHERWISE NOT BE POSSIBLE WITHOUT THESE FOUR BUSES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: MANKATO TRANSIT SYSTEM AND THE RIDERS THAT RELY ON ITS SERVICES WILL BENEFIT FROM THESE BUSES. RIDERSHIP FOR PARATRANSIT HAS GROWN APPROXIMATELY 50% WHEN COMPARED TO PRE-PANDEMIC CONDITIONS. ONE COMMUNITY WITHIN THE MANKATO URBANIZED AREA IS SEPARATED BY A RIVER AND CONNECTED BY ONE BRIDGE WITH MULTIMODAL ACCESS. TRANSIT SERVICES PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR NEIGHBORS SUCH AS ADULT BASIC EDUCATION FOOD SHELF OR GROCERY STORES FOR AREAS WITH FOOD DESERTS AS WELL AS HEALTH CARE RETAIL SHOPPING EMPLOYMENT ENTERTAINMENT AND ALL FEDERAL OFFICES. ENSURING THE BUSES ARE AVAILABLE AND WITHIN THEIR USEFUL LIFE IS PARAMOUNT TO THIS NECESSARY SERVICE.NO SUBRECIPIENTS.ATTACHED INCLUDES FUNDING SPLIT LETTERS MNDOT APPROVAL LETTERS AND CORRESPONDING STIP PAGES FOR 2022. IN EXECUTING THIS GRANT THE CITY OF MANKATO AGREES TO ABIDE BY SECTION 3011 OF THE FAST ACT (49 U.S.C. 5323(J)(2)(C) REGARDING THE PHASED INCREASE IN DOMESTIC CONTENT UNDER THE BUY AMERICA STATUTE FOR ROLLING STOCK.AS GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDES AN FTA-FUNDED TRANSIT VEHICLE PURCHASE RECIPIENT AGREES TO COMPLY WITH THE RELATED REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN 49 CFR 26.49(A). SPECIFICALLY RECIPIENT MUST ENSURE AS A CONDITION OF BEING AUTHORIZED TO BID OR PROPOSE ON FTA-ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS THAT EACH TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER CERTIFIED THAT IT COMPLIED WITH DOT REQUIREMENTS FOR SUBMITTING A DBE PROGRAM AND GOAL TO FTA PRIOR TO BIDDING. RECIPIENT IS ALSO REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE NAME OF THE SUCCESSFUL BIDDER AND THE TOTAL DOLLAR VALUE OF THE CONTRACT WITHIN 30 DAYS OF MAKING A FTA- ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE AWARD USING THE REQUIRED FTA REPORTING TOOL. RECIPIENT UNDERSTANDS THAT FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS MAY RESULT IN FORMAL ENFORCEMENT ACTION OR APPROPRIATE SANCTION AS DETERMINED BY FTA INCLUDING REIMBURSEMENT OF FTA FUNDS USED FOR THE VEHICLE PROCUREMENT.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE FOR SAGINAW TRANSIT AUTHORITY TO ASSIST WITH FIXED ROUTE AND DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICES DURING THE PERIOD OF 10/1/2022 THROUGH 9/30/2024 AS WELL AS THE ROOF REPLACEMENT PLANNED TO BEGIN IN FY2023 FLEET CAMERAS PURCHASE AND INSTALL PLANNED FOR FY2023 THE PURCHASE OF UP TO NINE (9) REPLACEMENT 35 TRANSIT BUSES AND TO COMPLETE THE PURCHASE OF 8 TRANSIT BUSES FROM GILLIG.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: STARS IS PLANNING THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES WITH THIS AWARD:OPERATING ASSISTANCE - USED TO COVER OPERATING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS SALARIES FUEL OPERATING SUPPLIES CLEANING PRODUCTS AND OTHER NEEDED ITEMS FOR STARS TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO THE SAGINAW RESIDENTS WITH FIXED ROUTE AND DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICES WITH AT LEAST 1% ALLOCATED TO SECURITY-RELATED EXPENSES BETWEEN 10/1/2022 AND 9/30/2024.PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE - USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE PURCHASES OF REPAIR PARTS SUPPLIES AND EMPLOYEE LABOR DIRECTLY RELATED TO THE MAINTENANCE OF THE ROLLING STOCK NEEDED TO KEEP OUR FLEET VEHICLES IN WORKING ORDER FOR REVENUE SERVICES BETWEEN 10/1/2022 AND 9/30/2024.ROOF REPLACEMENT - STARS INTENDS THIS PROJECT TO BE THE REPAIR AND REPLACEMENT OF THE ROOF ON THE STARS ADMINISTRATION AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY TO KEEP THE FACILITY IN GOOD WORKING ORDER FOR THE STAFF TO PROVIDE PUBLIC TRANSIT TO SAGINAW RESIDENTS AND SHOULD BE STARTED ON OR AFTER 4/1/2023 WITH THE PROJECT COMPLETION ON OR BEFORE 9/30/2024.FLEET CAMERAS PURCHASE AND INSTALL - STARS INTENDS THIS PROJECT TO INSTALL NEW CAMERAS AND RELATED HARDWARE ON OUR ROLLING STOCK FLEET TO KEEP THE RIDERS AND EMPLOYEES SAFE AND SHOULD BE STARTED ON OR AFTER 4/1/2023 WITH THE PROJECT COMPLETION ON OR BEFORE 9/30/2024. PURCHASE UP TO NINE (9) REPLACEMENT 35 TRANSIT BUSES - STARS WILL PURCHASE UP TO NINE (9) REPLACEMENT 35 TRANSIT BUSES AFTER 4/1/2023 WITH AN ANTICIPATED DELIVERY OF THE COMPLETED BUSES ON OR BEFORE 9/30/2024.PAYMENT TO GILLIG TO COMPLETE PURCHASE OF EIGHT (8) TRANSIT BUSES - STARS INTENDS TO USE A PORTION OF THIS AWARD TO FULFILL A PAYMENT TO GILLIG FOR PREVIOUSLY DELIVERED BUSES. THESE BUSES HAD AN INCREASE IN PRICING PRIOR TO DELIVERY DUE TO THE RECENT INFLATION AND STARS IS INTENDING TO USE THIS FUNDING TO COVER THE DIFFERENCE AND WILL MAKE THIS PAYMENT UPON EXECUTION OF THE ACTIVE GRANT.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: OPERATING ASSISTANCE - THIS FUNDING WILL PERMIT STARS TO CONTINUE OPERATIONS.PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE - THIS FUNDING WILL PERMIT STARS TO KEEP THE ROLLING STOCK FLEET IN WORKING CONDITION TO CONTINUE OPERATIONS.ROOF REPLACEMENT - THIS FUNDING WILL REPLACE THE CURRENT ROOFING ON THE STARS ADMINISTRATION AND MAINTENANCE THAT IS LEAKING AND AT THE END OF THE ORIGINAL USEFUL LIFE WHICH WILL ALLOW STARS STAFF TO CONTINUE OPERATIONS FROM THE MAIN FACILITY.FLEET CAMERAS PURCHASE AND INSTALL - THIS FUNDING WILL PURCHASE AND INSTALL NEW CAMERAS AND RELATED HARDWARE ON OUR ROLLING STOCK FLEET TO KEEP THE RIDERS AND EMPLOYEES SAFE.PURCHASE UP TO NINE (9) REPLACEMENT 35 TRANSIT BUSES - THIS FUNDING IS TO PURCHASE UP TO NINE (9) REPLACEMENT 35 TRANSIT BUSES TO INCREASE THE RELIABILITY OF THE ROLLING STOCK FLEET ALLOWING STARS TO PLAN AND EXECUTE FIXED ROUTE SERVICES EFFICIENTLY AND RELIABLY FOR THE RESIDENTS OF SAGINAW WITH FEWER BREAKDOWNS AND NEEDED REPAIRS OF THE FLEET.PAYMENT TO GILLIG - COMPLETE A PAYMENT FROM A PURCHASE OF EIGHT (8) TRANSIT BUSES FROM GILLIG FROM THE GRANT MI-2020-043 AND TO REMAIN IN GOOD STANDING WITH OUR VENDOR.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT WOULD BE THE USERS OF THE STARS TRANSIT SYSTEM BOTH CURRENT AND FUTURE AND THE EMPLOYEES OF STARS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT WILL BE TO PROVIDE ONE YEAR OF PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE FUNDS (OCTOBER 2023 THROUGH SEPTEMBER OF 2024) AND TO PURCHASE SIX LIGHT-DUTY CUTAWAY BUSES THAT WILL REPLACE SIX LIGHT-DUTY CUTAWAY BUSES THAT HAVE MET THEIR USEFUL LIFE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ALL ELIGIBLE PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE EXPENSES FOR THE TIMEFRAME INDICATED INCLUDING MECHANIC SALARIES VEHICLE PARTS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR. PURPOSE: THIS AWARD WILL ENABLE THE ANN ARBOR AREA TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (AAATA) TO CONTINUE PUBLIC TRANSIT OPERATIONS AND MAINTAIN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR OF TRANSIT ASSETS SERVING ANN ARBOR-YPSILANTI AREA COMMUNITY MEMBERS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE AAATA WILL REQUEST REIMBURSEMENT FOR ELIGIBLE CAPITAL AND OPERATING ACTIVITIES REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN TRANSIT SERVICE INCLUDING LARGE BUS REPLACEMENT; SMALL BUS REPLACEMENT; BUS TERMINAL FACILITY REHABILITATION AND ASSOCIATED ARCHITECTURE/ENGINEERING; SUPPORT VEHICLE REPLACEMENT; ARCHITECTURE AND ENGINEERING FOR FACILITY REHABILITATION; REPLACEMENT OF OFFICE FURNISHINGS; HARDWARE SOFTWARE AND MISCELLANEOUS SUPPORT EQUIPMENT PROJECTS; REPLACEMENT OF MAINTENANCE EQUIPMENT; AND ASSISTANCE WITH ONGOING OPERATING COSTS PRIORITIZING OPERATOR WAGES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE AAATA EXPECTS TO CONTINUE PROVIDING BOTH FIXED-ROUTE AND DEMAND-RESPONSE SERVICES IN THE ANN ARBOR-YPSILANTI AREA ENSURING THE COMMUNITY HAS ACCESS TO SAFE RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: COMMUNITY MEMBERS THROUGHOUT THE GREATER ANN ARBOR-YPSILANTI AREA WILL BENEFIT FROM THE AAATAS CAPACITY TO MAINTAIN LOCAL TRANSIT SERVICES AND ASSETS THAT FACILITATE ACCESS TO KEY DESTINATIONS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES ARE INCLUDED IN THIS AWARD. STATE CAPITAL MATCH IN THE AMOUNT OF $3606834 WILL BE PROVIDED THROUGH THE COMPREHENSIVE TRANSPORTATION FUND. LOCAL MATCH IN THE AMOUNT OF $3000000 WILL BE PROVIDED FROM ELIGIBLE LOCAL FUNDS FROM OPERATIONS. IN EXECUTING THIS GRANT THE ANN ARBOR AREA TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (AAATA) AGREES TO ABIDE BY SECTION 3011 OF THE FAST ACT (49 U.S.C. 5323(J)(2)(C) REGARDING THE PHASED INCREASE IN DOMESTIC CONTENT UNDER THE BUY AMERICA STATUTE FOR ROLLING STOCK. AS GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDES AN FTA-FUNDED TRANSIT VEHICLE PURCHASE THE RECIPIENT (AAATA) AGREES TO COMPLY WITH THE RELATED REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN 49 CFR 26.49(A). SPECIFICALLY RECIPIENT MUST ENSURE AS A CONDITION OF BEING AUTHORIZED TO BID OR PROPOSE ON FTA-ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS THAT EACH TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER CERTIFIED THAT IT COMPLIED WITH DOT REQUIREMENTS FOR SUBMITTING A DBE PROGRAM AND GOAL TO FTA PRIOR TO BIDDING. RECIPIENT IS ALSO REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE NAME OF THE SUCCESSFUL BIDDER AND THE TOTAL DOLLAR VALUE OF THE CONTRACT WITHIN 30 DAYS OF MAKING A FTA- ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE AWARD USING THE REQUIRED FTA REPORTING TOOL. RECIPIENT UNDERSTANDS THAT FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS MAY RESULT IN FORMAL ENFORCEMENT ACTION OR APPROPRIATE SANCTION AS DETERMINED BY FTA INCLUDING REIMBURSEMENT OF FTA FUNDS USED FOR THE VEHICLE PROCUREMENT.THE AAATA WILL FOLLOW ALL THIRD-PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE) AND WILL ENSURE CONTRACTORS PROCURED ARE NOT SUSPENDED OR DEBARRED FROM FEDERAL CONTRACTING. THE OPERATING COSTS AND TIMEFRAMES INCLUDED IN THIS APPLICATION WERE DETERMINED TO BE REASONABLE THROUGH ANALYSIS OF PRIOR-YEAR OPERATING EXPENSES AS REPORTED TO THE NTD AND 7-YEAR OPERATING BUDGET FORECASTS PREPARED DURING AAATAS ANNUAL BUDGET PROCESS. THE AAATA UNDERSTANDS THAT THE EXPENSES REQUESTED IN THIS APPLICATION ARE SUBJECT TO REVIEW FOR REASONABLENESS DURING THE TRIENNIAL REVIEW. ATTACHMENTS INCLUDE: FY21 FY22 EXPORTS FROM JOBNET STIP SYSTEM FY21 FY22 RTA SPLIT LETTERS FY21 FY22 CMAQ FLEX FUND TRANSFER DOCUMENTATION AND VEHICLE REPLACEMENT SCHEDULE.

THE PURCHASE OF PROPANE POWERED VEHICLES HAS A LOWER CARBON CONTENT THAN GASOLINE DIESEL HEAVY FUEL OIL OR ETHANOL. NATURAL GAS (METHANE) GENERATES FEWER CARBON DIOXIDE (CO2) EMISSIONS PER BTU THAN PROPANE BUT NATURAL GAS IS CHEMICALLY STABLE WHEN RELEASED INTO THE AIR AND PRODUCES A GLOBAL WARMING EFFECT 25 TIMES THAT OF CARBON DIOXIDE. PROPANE ALSO HAS A SHORT LIFETIME IN THE ATMOSPHERE AND LOW CARBON CONTENT IT IS ADVANTAGEOUS FROM A CLIMATE CHANGE PERSPECTIVE IN COMPARISON TO OTHER FUELS. THIS IS A NEW FY 2021 GRANT APPLICATION FOR SECTION 5339B FUNDING. THIS GRANT APPLICATION WILL PROVIDE A TOTAL COST OF $1824416 IN FEDERAL FUNDING FOR TWO ACTIVITY LINE ITEMS WITHIN ONE PROJECT. THE TOTAL MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (MDOT) MATCH FOR THIS APPLICATION IS $456104. THE TOTAL PROJECT AMOUNT IS $2280520.THE CAPITAL AREA TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (CATA) WILL UTILIZE THIS FUNDING TO REHABILITATE THE DOWNTOWN LANSING MICHIGAN BUS TERMINAL BUILDING (CATA TRANSPORTATION CENTER [CTC]). THE REHABILITATION WILL INCLUDE BOTH ARCHITECTURAL/ENGINEERING DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION TO INTERIOR AND EXTERIOR COMPONENTS OF THE FACILITY.PURPOSE OF THE AWARD: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO OBLIGATE SECTION 5339B BUS AND BUS FACILITIES PROGRAM FUNDS TO THE CAPITAL AREA TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (CATA) IN LANSING MICHIGAN. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: CATA WILL UTILIZE THIS FUNDING TO REHABILITATE THE DOWNTOWN LANSING MICHIGAN BUS TERMINAL BUILDING (CATA TRANSPORTATION CENTER [CTC]). THE REHABILITATION WILL INCLUDE BOTH ARCHITECTURAL/ENGINEERING DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION TO INTERIOR AND EXTERIOR COMPONENTS OF THE FACILITY.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: CATA WILL UTILIZE THIS AWARD TO REHABILITATE OUR DOWNTOWN LANSING BUS TERMINAL TO ALIGN WITH STATE OF GOOD REPAIR TARGETS ESTABLISHED IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF OUR TRANSIT ASSET MANAGEMENT (TAM) PLAN.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: RENOVATING INTERIOR/EXTERIOR COMPONENTS OF THE CTC WILL BENEFIT THE LONGEVITY OF THE BUILDING ITSELF AND THE OPERATION OF CATA FIXED-ROUTES. THE CTC PROVIDES A VITAL TRANSIT LINK FOR APPROX. 8600 RIDERS EACH WEEKDAY AND IS THE MAIN BOARDING CENTER AND TRANSFER POINT FOR ABOUT HALF OF OUR FIXED ROUTES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPENT ACTIVITIES IN THIS AWARD.ATTACHMENTS TO THIS APPLICATION INCLUDE THE TIP PROJECT LIST UNIFIED WORK PROGRAM AND LONG-RANGE PLAN.

THIS IS A NEW FY 2021 GRANT APPLICATION FOR FY 2020 SECTION 5339C LOW-NO EMISSION GRANT PROGRAM FUNDING. THIS GRANT APPLICATION WILL PROVIDE A TOTAL COST OF $1971211 IN FEDERAL FUNDING FOR ONE ACTIVITY LINE ITEM (ALI) WITHIN ONE PROJECT. THE TOTAL MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (MDOT) MATCH FOR THIS APPLICATION IS $492803. MDOT WILL PROVIDE 20% MATCH FOR THIS PROJECT USING COMPREHENSIVE TRANSPORTATION FUNDS (CTF) FOR ALL ACTIVITY LINE ITEMS. THE TOTAL PROJECT COST IS $2464014.THE CAPITAL AREA TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (CATA) WILL USE THESE FUNDS TO ACQUIRE EXPANSION BATTERY ELECTRIC LARGE BUSES RELATED CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE EQUIPMENT AND INSTALLATION OF RELATED EQUIPMENT. PURPOSE OF THE AWARD: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO OBLIGATE SECTION 5339C LOW OR NO EMISSION GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS TO THE CAPITAL AREA TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (CATA) IN LANSING MICHIGAN. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: CATA WILL USE THESE FUNDS TO ACQUIRE EXPANSION BATTERY ELECTRIC LARGE BUSES RELATED CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE EQUIPMENT AND INSTALLATION OF RELATED EQUIPMENT.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: CATA WILL UTILIZE THIS AWARD TO ACQUIRE ELECTRIC EXPANSION BUSES TO ACCOMMODATE GROWTH IN DEMAND FOR BUS SERVICE. THESE NEW BUSES WILL HELP INCREASE SERVICE EFFECTIVENESS AND VEHICLE RELIABILITY.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE A DIRECT ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT BY REDUCING CATAS CARBON FOOTPRINT OF OUR FIXED-ROUTE VEHICLES. THE EXPANSION VEHICLES WOULD BE REPLACING LOCALLY-FUNDED DIESEL BUSES WHICH CATA PURCHASED AS A RESULT OF INCREASED DEMAND IN THE SYSTEM.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPENT ACTIVITIES IN THIS AWARD.IN EXECUTING THIS GRANT THE CAPITAL AREA TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY AGREES TO ABIDE BY SECTION 3011 OF THE FAST ACT (49 U.S.C. 5323(J)(2)(C) REGARDING THE PHASED INCREASE IN DOMESTIC CONTENT UNDER THE BUY AMERICA STATUTE FOR ROLLING STOCK.AS GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDES AN FTA-FUNDED TRANSIT VEHICLE PURCHASE RECIPIENT AGREES TO COMPLY WITH THE RELATED REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN 49 CFR 26.49(A). SPECIFICALLY RECIPIENT MUST ENSURE AS A CONDITION OF BEING AUTHORIZED TO BID OR PROPOSE ON FTA-ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS THAT EACH TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER CERTIFIED THAT IT COMPLIED WITH DOT REQUIREMENTS FOR SUBMITTING A DBE PROGRAM AND GOAL TO FTA PRIOR TO BIDDING. RECIPIENT IS ALSO REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE NAME OF THE SUCCESSFUL BIDDER AND THE TOTAL DOLLAR VALUE OF THE CONTRACT WITHIN 30 DAYS OF MAKING AN FTA- ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE AWARD USING THE REQUIRED FTA REPORTING TOOL. RECIPIENT UNDERSTANDS THAT FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS MAY RESULT IN FORMAL ENFORCEMENT ACTION OR APPROPRIATE SANCTION AS DETERMINED BY FTA INCLUDING REIMBURSEMENT OF FTA FUNDS USED FOR THE VEHICLE PROCUREMENT.ATTACHMENTS TO THIS APPLICATION INCLUDE THE TIP PROJECT LIST UNIFIED WORK PROGRAM LONG-RANGE PLAN AND MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION SPLIT LETTER.

THIS AWARD COMBINES DISCRETIONARY FUNDING FROM FY 2017 5339(B) AND FY2018 5339(B) TO SUPPORT THE RECONSTRUCTION OF THE COOLIDGE TERMINAL AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY; D2018-BUSC-058 AND D2018-BUSC-179. FUNDING FROM THESE AWARDS WILL SUPPORT ARCHITECTURE AND ENGINEERING WORK TO DESIGN THE NEW FACILITY INCLUDING ALL DESIGN STUDIES AND DOCUMENTATION REQUIRED FOR THE NATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL POLICY ACT (NEPA) PROCESS.THIS PROJECT IS REQUIRED TO RETURN THE COOLIDGE TERMINAL TO A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR: COOLIDGE HAS NOT BE AN ACTIVE TERMINAL OR MAINTENANCE FACILITY SINCE A DECEMBER 2011 FIRE RENDERED THE FACILITY INOPERABLE. ORIGINALLY CONSTRUCTED IN 1928 THE FACILITY IS CURRENTLY 93 YEARS OLD.FUNDING IN THIS AWARD INCLUDES:FY2017 5339B: TOTAL FUNDING OF $4500000 INCLUDING $3600000 IN FTA FUNDING AND $900000 IN STATE MATCH FUNDING PROVIDED BY THE STATE OF MICHIGANS COMPREHENSIVE TRANSPORTATION FUND (CTF). TIP JOB NUMBER 212369FY2018 5339B: TOTAL FUNDING OF $11920048 INCLUDING $9536038 IN FTA FUNDING AND $2384010 IN STATE MATCH FUNDING PROVIDED BY THE CTF. TIP JN 212369ATTACHMENTS TO THIS AWARD INCLUDE THE FY2017 AND FY2018 5339B APPLICATION SUPPLEMENTAL FORMS AN APPROVED TIP AND LONG-RANGE PLAN.THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO RECONSTRUCT THE COOLIDGE TERMINAL TO PROVIDE A FACILITY FOR DDOT BUS OPERATIONS MAINTENANCE AND SUPPORT FUNCTIONS AND BUS STORAGE. COOLIDGE WILL PROVIDE SPACE FOR DDOT TO GROW ITS FLEET AND THUS TO EXPAND SERVICE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE THE DEVELOPMENT OF PROGRAMMATIC ELEMENTS AND CONCEPTUAL DESIGN OF THE SITE INVESTIGATION OF THE EXISTING SITE CONDITIONS AND CONDUCTING AN ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT ANALYSIS. WITH THE ADDITION OF A CONSTRUCTION MANAGER CONSTRUCTION COST ESTIMATES WILL BE DEVELOPED TO VERIFY CONCEPTUAL DESIGNS.THE EXPECTED OUTCOME IS TO DEFINE THE FUNCTIONAL REQUIREMENTS AND SPACE NEEDS THAT WILL SERVE AS THE BASIS FOR DESIGN OF THE COOLIDGE TERMINAL FACILITY RECONSTRUCTION.THE COOLIDGE TERMINAL FACILITY RECONSTRUCTION WOULD BENEFIT DDOT WITH IMPROVED MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AND ALLOW FOR BUS FLEET EXPANSION. IT WILL ALSO IMPROVE THE SYSTEM CONDITION AND SERVICE AND ENHANCE ACCESS AND MOBILITY WITHIN DDOTS SERVICE AREA.THIS PROJECT DOES NOT INCLUDE SUBRECIPIENTS.
