APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS GRANT INCLUDES $2060922 IN FY 2020 AND $390998 IN FY2021 SECTION 5339(A) NATIONWIDE PROGRAM FUNDING ALLOCATION FOR THE ACQUISITION AND REHABILITATION OF 3101 S POWERLINE ROAD NAMPA IDAHO. THIS FACILITY WILL SERVE AS THE NEW TREASURE VALLEY TRANSIT ADMINISTRATIVE AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED CONSIST OF PROPERTY ACQUISITION AND REHABILITATING THE EXISTING FACILITY. REHAB CONSISTS OF CLEANING PAINTING FLOORING CEILING REPLACEMENT FURNITURE WINDOW COVERING IT SUPPORT UPDATE ELECTRICAL SYSTEM INTERIOR AND EXTERIOR LIGHTING UPDATES INTERIOR DESIGN LANDSCAPING SIGNAGE EMERGENCY DETECTION SYSTEMS MOVING COSTS ETC.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PURCHASE OF THIS PROPERTY WILL ULTIMATELY SUPPORT SUSTAINED TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AND PROVIDE ADDITIONAL ACCESS TO TRANSIT.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: TREASURE VALLEY TRANSIT STAFF AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC WHO ACCESS TREASURE VALLEY TRANSIT SERVICES WHICH INCLUDE PEOPLE IN THE COUNTIES OF ADAMS VALLEY WASHINGTON PAYETTE BOISE CANYON GEM AND ADA (ITD DISTRICT 3) IN IDAHO.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: TREASURE VALLEY TRANSIT IS ITDS SUBRECIPIENT AND WILL COMPLETE ALL ACTIVITIES INCLUDING PROPERTY ACQUISITION AND REHABILITATION ACTIVITIES ON THE PROPERTY PURCHASED.

THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES $1920000 IN FY2021 SECTION 5339(B) BUS AND BUS FACILITY COMPETITIVE FUNDS (D2022-BUSC-028) FOR THE PURCHASE OF APPROXIMATELY THREE REPLACEMENT 35FT ELECTRIC BUSES FOR THE BOISE URBANIZED AREA.PURPOSE:THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES FY2021 SECTION 5339(B) BUS AND BUS FACILITY COMPETITIVE FUNDS (D2022-BUSC-028) FOR THE PURCHASE OF APPROXIMATELY THREE REPLACEMENT 35FT ELECTRIC BUSES FOR THE BOISE URBANIZED AREA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:PROCUREMENT OF APPROXIMATELY THREE REPLACEMENT 35FT ELECTRIC BUSES FOR THE BOISE UZA.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE THREE REPLACEMENT VEHICLES WILL PROVIDE RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AS WELL AS REDUCE FUEL AND MAINTENANCE COSTS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE GENERAL PUBLIC WITHIN THE BOISE UZA.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS IN THIS AGREEMENT.

THIS GRANT INCLUDES $2140000 IN FY2020 SECTION 5339(B) COMPETITIVE FUNDS DISCRETIONARY ID#D2020-BUSC-123 FOR THE COMPRESSED NATURAL GAS FUELING ISLAND SYSTEM RENOVATION AND PARKING LOT REHABILITATION AND EXPANSION AT THE ORCHARD STREET VEHICLE MAINTENANCE FACILITY LOCATED AT 4701 SOUTH NORTHRUP STREET BOISE ID. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE:- COMPRESSED NATURAL GAS FUELING ISLAND SYSTEM RENOVATION: RENOVATIONS TO THE EXISTING COMPRESSED NATURAL GAS FUELING EQUIPMENT.- PARKING LOT REHABILITATION: CONSTRUCTION OF NEW PAVEMENT AND ADDITIONAL BUS PARKING ON THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE FACILITY IMPROVE EXISTING STORMWATER RETENTION POND TO STORE WATER ONSITE UPGRADE EXISTING LIGHTING ON THE EASTSIDE OF THE PROPERTY AND REHABILITATE EXISTING PAVED AREAS AS NEEDED.THESE PROJECTS FALL WITHIN THE HIGHEST PRIORITIES OF THE REGIONS LONG-RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLAN COMMUNITIES IN MOTION 2.0 AND VRTS TRANSIT EXPANSION PLAN VALLEYCONNECT 2.0.PURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO FUND THE FIRST PHASE OF THE ORCHARD FACILITY MASTER PLAN WHICH SERVES TO OUTLINE IMPROVEMENTS NEEDED OVER THE NEXT TWENTY YEARS TO ADDRESS ADDITIONAL SITE AND BUILDING LIMITATIONS IN THE FACE OF GROWING AND CHANGING REVENUE FLEET NEEDS. IMPROVEMENTS INCLUDED IN THE FIRST PHASE INCLUDE THE COMPRESSED NATURAL GAS FUELING ISLAND SYSTEM RENOVATION AND PARKING LOT REHABILITATION.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:- COMPRESSED NATURAL GAS FUELING ISLAND SYSTEM RENOVATION: RENOVATIONS TO THE EXISTING COMPRESSED NATURAL GAS FUELING EQUIPMENT.- PARKING LOT REHABILITATION: CONSTRUCTION OF NEW PAVEMENT AND ADDITIONAL BUS PARKING ON THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE FACILITY IMPROVE EXISTING STORMWATER RETENTION POND TO STORE WATER ONSITE UPGRADE EXISTING LIGHTING ON THE EASTSIDE OF THE PROPERTY AND REHABILITATE EXISTING PAVED AREAS AS NEEDED.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:ADDITIONAL PARKING AT THE ORCHARD STREET MAINTENANCE FACILITY AND SAFER UP TO DATE FUELING STRUCTURE FOR CNG FUELED BUSES WHICH WILL SUPPORT MORE CONSISTENT TRANSIT SERVICES. ULTIMATELY THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE LARGER GOAL OF THE ELECTRIFICATION OF THE VRT FLEET BY PROVIDING CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE AND PARKING FACILITIES TO SUPPORT CHARGING ELECTRIC VEHICLES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:VRT STAFF AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN THE BOISE URBANIZED AREA.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:NONE

THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES $822120 IN FY2020 SECTION 5339(A) STATEWIDE FUNDS TO PAY FOR REHAB AND RENOVATION COSTS FOR THE MCCALL MULTIMODAL CENTER LOCATED AT 210 PARK STREET MCCALL ID. THESE ACTIVITIES ARE CURRENTLY FUNDED UNDER ID-04-0028 HOWEVER DUE TO INCREASED COSTS THIS GRANT IS NEEDED TO COMPLETE THE WORK BEING UNDERTAKEN AT THIS FACILITY. WORK INCLUDES: - NON-STRUCTURAL INTERIOR WORK; - REMODELING THE EXTERIOR OF AN EXISTING OFFICE BUILDING TO ASSURE ADA ACCESS;- CREATE BUS PULL-INS;- PROVIDE NEW PAVING AND LANDSCAPING- SPACE FOR PASSENGERS TO WAIT PURCHASE BUS TICKETS AND HAVE ACCESS TO RESTROOMS; AND- CREATING A BREAK ROOM FOR DRIVERS AND ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE SPACE.PURPOSE:THIS GRANT WILL COMPLETE REHABILITATION ACTIVITIES WHICH WILL BRING THE MCCALL MULTIMODAL CENTER LOCATED AT 210 PARK STREET MCCALL ID UP TO ADA STANDARDS AND CREATE SPACES FOR RIDERS TICKETING STAFF DRIVER BREAK AREAS AND ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICES.ACTIVITIES BE PERFORMED:REHABILITATION ACTIVITIES INCLUDING NON-STRUCTURAL INTERIOR WORK EXTERIOR MAINTENANCE AND COSMETIC REFURBISHMENT REMODELING OF THE EXTERIOR OF THE EXISTING OFFICE BUILDING TO ASSURE ADA ACCESS CREATE BUS PULL-INS PROVIDE NEW PAVING AND LANDSCAPING PROVIDE SPACE FOR PASSENGERS TO WAIT PURCHASE BUS TICKETS AND HAVE ACCESS TO RESTROOMS AND CREATE A BREAKROOM FOR DRIVERS AND ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE SPACE.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:AN ADA ACCESSIBLE MULTIMODAL TRANSIT CENTER FOR PASSENGERS AND TREASURE VALLEY TRANSIT (TVT) STAFF.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE GENERAL PUBLIC ACCESSING TRANSIT IN MCCALL ID AND STAFF OF TVT.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:ITD HAS ONE SUBRECIPIENT TVT WHO WILL COMPLETE ALL ACTIVITIES WITHIN THIS GRANT.

THIS GRANT APPLIES FOR $694000 IN FY2018-2020 SECTION 5339(A) FUNDS FOR THE PURCHASE OF APPROX. THREE 35 REPLACEMENTS BUSES FOR THE BOISE UZA. VEHICLES BEING PROCURED UNDER THIS GRANT WILL REPLACE VEHICLES THAT HAVE MET THEIR USEFUL LIFE.FUNDING BREAKS DOWN AS FOLLOWS:$123926 IN FY2018 SECTION 5339(A) $555436 IN FY2019 SECTION 5339(A)$15638 IN FY2020 SECTION 5339(A)THE REMAINING FY2020 SECTION 5339(A) FUNDS WILL BE AMENDED INTO THIS GRANT TO FULLY FUND THE PURCHASE WITHIN THE NEXT FISCAL YEAR.

SECTION 5339 GRANT (NON-URBAN)APRIL 2014AMENDMENT #1THE IOWA DOT RESPECTFULLY SUBMITS THIS APPLICATION FOR $1250000 IN SECTION 5339 FUNDING FOR NINETEEN (19) VEHICLE REPLACEMENT PROJECTS FOR ELEVEN (11) DIFFERENT NONURBAN TRANSIT SYSTEMSPROJECTS IN THIS APPLICATION INCLUDE THE PURCHASE OF TWO 30 HD BUSES TEN LD BUSES AND SEVEN VANS. ALL TRANSIT SYSTEMS ARE PUBLIC BODIES WITH THE EXCEPTION OF REGION 1 AND REGION 9 WHICH ARE PRIVATE-NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. EACH TRANSIT SYSTEM WITH PROJECTS CONTAINED IN THIS APPLICATION HAVE BEEN DETERMINED TO BE SERVING MINORITY POPULATIONS BASED ON 2000 CENSUS DATA. PROGRAM OF PROJECTS ATTACHED LOCAL FUNDING COMES FROM GENERAL FUND LEVIES AND SOMETIMES FROM TRUST AND AGENCY LEVIES. EACH TRANSIT SYSTEM HAS CERTIFIED THAT LOCAL SHARES FOR THEIR PROJECTS ARE AVAILABLE. CERTIFICATION AND ASSURANCES: INDIVIDUAL SUBRECIPIENT CERTIFICATIONS AND ASSURANCES ARE A REQUIRED PART OF THE SUBRECIPIENTS CONSOLIDATED FUNDING APPLICATION MATERIALS SUBMITTED TO THE IOWA DOT ANNUALLY. THIS DOCUMENTATION IS ON FILE AT THE DOT AND IS AVAILABLE FOR FTA INSPECTION AT ANY TIME.PLANNING/PROGRAMMING: THE IOWA DOT REQUIRES ALL TRANSIT PROJECTS TO BE INCLUDED IN THE STATE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (STIP) APPROVED BY FTA OCTOBER 1 2013. A COPY OF THE OCTOBER 1 2013 MASTER AGREEMENT IS ON FILE IN THE DEPARTMENTS OFFICE OF PUBLIC TRANSIT LOCATED AT 800 LINCOLN WAY AMES IA 50010. ALL SUB-RECIPIENTS HAVE BEEN FURNISHED WITH A HARD COPY OF THE MASTER AGREEMENT OR HAVE BEEN PROVIDED THE FTAS WEB SITE ADDRESS SO THAT THEY MAY OBTAIN A COPY.PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT: IOWA REQUIRES A PUBLIC HEARING FOR EACH TRANSIT PROJECT PROGRAMMED IN THE STIP. THE PUBLIC HEARING MAY BE COMBINED WITH ANOTHER HEARING. A PUBLIC HEARING NOTICE IS REQUIRED TO BE PUBLISHED APPROXIMATELY 30 DAYS IN ADVANCE OF THE HEARING IN A NEWSPAPER OF GENERAL CIRCULATION SERVING THE PROJECT AREA. THE NOTICE IS ALSO SUBMITTED TO THE OFFICE OF PUBLIC TRANSIT FOR INCLUSION IN THE PRIVATE SECTOR CLEARINGHOUSE MAILING. AN AFFIDAVIT OF PUBLICATION IS REQUIRED. PROCEEDINGS OF THE HEARING MUST BE INCLUDED WITH THE APPLICATION. THIS MAY BE A FORMAL TRANSCRIPT OR IT MAY BE MINUTES OF THE BOARD MEETING AT WHICH THE HEARING WAS HELD ETC. SO LONG AS ANY COMMENTS MADE AT THE HEARING ARE RECORDED. THE PUBLIC HEARING DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED IN THE SUBRECIPIENTS APPLICATION FILES AND IS AVAILABLE FOR FTA INSPECTION AT ANY TIME.13(C) LABOR CERTIFICATION INFORMATION LISTED BELOW.NO PROJECTS IN THIS APPLICATION ARE USING FORCE ACCOUNT LABOR FOR ANY ACTIVITIES IN THE BUDGET.IOWA DOT CCR EXPIRATION DATE: SEPTEMBER 16 2014PROJECT DETAILSREPLACEMENT VEHICLESALL NINETEEN(19) VEHICLES DESCRIBED IN THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS AS REPLACEMENTS FOR EXISTING TRANSIT ROLLINGSTOCK ARE LISTED IN THE ATTACHED TABLE ENTITLED: VEHICLES PROPOSED FOR REPLACEMENT. THEY ALL WELL EXCEED FTAS SERVICE LIFE REQUIREMENT RESPECTIVE TO THAT TYPE OF EQUIPMENT. A FEW OF THE VEHICLES IN THIS APPLICATION WILL BE PURCHASED WITH SURVEILLANCE SYSTEMS. THE SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM WOULD PROVIDE SECURITY FOR THE DRIVER AND MONITORING FOR PROBLEMS THAT ARISE SUCH AS VANDALISM UNRULY BEHAVIOR AND CRIMINAL ACTIVITY. THESE SURVEILLANCE SYSTEMS WILL DETER THIS TYPE OF BEHAVIOR ALONG WITH PROVIDING USEFUL INFORMATION INVESTIGATING CRIMINAL ACTIVITIES. NO SURVEILLANCE SYSTEMS IN THIS APPLICATION ARE TIED TO AN ITS PROJECT.ONLY TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURES (TVM) WITH AN APPROVED FTA DBE PROGRAM AND GOAL WILL BE UTILIZED FOR IOWA VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS.THESE VEHICLES WILL MEET THE CLEAN AIR ACT (CAA) AND AMERICAN WITH DISABILITIES ACT (ADA) REQUIREMENTS. PASSAGE OF THE AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT (ADA) AFFORDS FURTHER JUSTIFICATION FOR THE FEDERAL ASSISTANCE SOUGHT IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION. THIS GREATLY ASSISTS IOWAS TRANSIT SYSTEMS IN MEETING THEIR ADAS GOALS. ALL VEHICLES IN THIS APPLICATION ARE ADA ACCESSIBLE.THE FUNDING IS NECESSARY TO ALLOW THESE NON-URBAN SYSTEMS TO CONTINUE TO MEET THE INCREASED DEMAND FOR GENERAL PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICES INCLUDING SERVICES TO THE ELDERLY DISABLED AND TRANSPORTATION DISADVANTAGED. APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THE PROJECT IS FOR THE DES MOINES AREA REGIONAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY (DART) TO DESIGN AND CONSTRUCT THE FIRST PHASE OF DARTS NEW OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY. PHASE 1 WILL CONSIST OF CONSTRUCTING THE MAINTENANCE BUILDING PARTS ROOM FACILITIES AND THE ASSOCIATED SITE PREPARATION. SPECIFICALLY THE PROJECT SCOPE INCLUDES LAND ACQUISITION AE CONSTRUCTION AND EQUIPMENT FOR THE FIRST PHASE OF A NEW OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY THAT WILL REPLACE AN OUTDATED AND UNDERSIZED FACILITY FROM 1977. THE PHASE 1 MAINTENANCE BUILDING WILL SIT ON 37 ACRES AT THE INTERSECTION OF SE 36TH ST AND VANDALIA ROAD SOUTHEAST OF DOWNTOWN DES MOINES AND MOST IMPORTANTLY OUTSIDE THE IMMEDIATE FLOOD PLAIN. THE 82000 SQUARE FOOT MAINTENANCE BUILDING AND 106000 SQUARE FOOT STORAGE BARN WILL OCCUPY 16 ACRES OF THE SITE AND INCLUDE A MODERN MAINTENANCE SHOP PAINT BOOTH PARTS OFFICE WITH INVENTORY STORAGE FARE COLLECTION EQUIPMENT AND MONEY ROOM MECHANICAL ROOM FACILITY MAINTENANCE STOREROOM FUELING LANE BUS WASH AND BARN; THE PROJECT WILL ALSO INCLUDE 110000 SQUARE FEET OF PAVING. THE SUBSEQUENT PHASE WILL COMPLETE THE STORAGE BARN TO ACCOMMODATE THE ENTIRE DART FLEET WITH AN ADDITIONAL 106000 SQUARE FEET ALONG WITH A 25000 SQUARE FOOT OPERATIONS AND ADMINISTRATION BUILDING ON THE REMAINING AREA OF THE SITE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: LAND ACQUISITION ACTIVITIES (APPRAISALS LEGAL ACQUISITION)DESIGN (AE)FACILITY CONSTRUCTION (SITE PREP CONSTRUCTION EQUIPMENT PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION SOFT COSTS INCLUDING CONTINGENCY); EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PROPOSED FACILITY HAS THE FOLLOWING BENEFITS:BETTER ACCESS TO PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION BY DESIGNING AND CONSTRUCTING A FACILITY THAT INCREASES EFFICIENCY AND IMPROVED ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITSSOUND INVESTMENT IN PUBLIC FUNDS THAT SUPPORT A NEW UPDATED AND ENERGY EFFICIENT FACILITY RATHER THAN CONTINUE TO INVEST IN AN OLDER INEFFICIENT STRUCTURE THAT HAS SIGNIFICANT OPERATIONAL CHALLENGES AND RISKSREDUCED RISK OF MAJOR SYSTEM FAILURES BREAKDOWNS AND/OR FLOODING EVENTS WHICH LEADS TO A LOWER COST AND LESS TIME MAINTAINING AN OLD AGING HIGH RISK STRUCTURESIZED APPROPRIATELY FOR TODAYS VEHICLES TECHNOLOGY AND SERVICE NEEDSSAFETY: WIDER LANES AND DOOR OPENINGS IMPROVED CIRCULATION PATTERN REMOVAL OF BLIND SPOTSIMPROVED CONDITION OF THE BUSES BY LOWERING DOWNTIME FOR MAINTENANCE RESULTING IN IMPROVED RELIABILITYIMPROVED TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES FOR STAFF AND HIGHER EMPLOYEE MORALE; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS GRANT WILL BENEFIT THE RIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSIT IN THE GREATER DES MOINES METROPOLITAN AREA AND IN POLK COUNTY.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS FOR THIS GRANT.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ASSIST THE CITY OF DAVENPORTS TRANSIT DIVISION IN PURCHASING FOUR ELECTRIC BUSES TO REPLACE FOUR DIESEL BUSES AS WELL AS TO PURCHASE AND INSTALL THE NECESSARY CHARGING EQUIPMENT FOR THESE BUSES AND LASTLY TO TRAIN ALL RELEVANT STAFF/EMPLOYEES TO UNDERSTAND OPERATE AND LEARN HOW TO MAINTAIN THE BUSES AS PART OF WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THERE ARE 3 MAIN ACTIVITIES/PROJECTS THAT ARE PART OF THIS AWARD. THE PURCHASE AND DEPLOYMENT OF FOUR ELECTRIC BUSES THE PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION OF ELECTRIC BUSES CHARGING EQUIPMENT WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT TO BE ABLE TO OPERATE MAINTAIN AND FULLY TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THE ELECTRIC BUSES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE CITY EXPECTS TO BE ABLE TO RETIRE 4 DIESEL BUSES AND REPLACE THEM WITH FOUR ELECTRIC BUSES. ADDITIONALLY THIS IS EXPECTED TO HAVE SEVERAL POSITIVE EFFECTS INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO LOWER COST OF OPERATIONS FOR THE CITY CLEANER AIR FOR DRIVERS RIDERS AND ALL CITY RESIDENTS AND FEWER GREENHOUSE GASES EMITTED THEREBY SLOWING THE RATE AT WHICH GLOBAL WARMING INCREASES. THIS WILL ALSO IMPROVE THE STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FOR CITIBUS TRANSIT.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE CLEANER AIR THE CITY AND BY EXTENSION TAXPAYERS WHO HAVE A LOWER COST OF OPERATION FOR PROVIDING TRANSIT AND ALL THE CITY STAFF WHO IS PROVIDED ADDITIONAL TRAINING WHICH ENSURES THEIR CONTINUED EMPLOYMENT AS GOOD PAYING UNIONIZED JOBS WITH THE CITY.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUB-RECIPIENT ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED WITH THIS AWARD.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO USE SEC. 5339 CAPITAL FUNDS TO PROCURE SOFTWARE TO ASSIST STAFF IN PLANNING NEW AND MODIFYING EXISTING ROUTES; UNDERSTAND THE FINANCIAL OPERATIONAL DEMOGRAPHIC AND RIDERSHIP IMPACTS OF EXISTING OR ALTERED FIXED ROUTES; CREATING ROSTERS/SCHEDULES/RUN-BIDS FOR DRIVERS EVERY THREE MONTHS; OPTIMIZE THE USE OF CURRENT RESOURCES AND SUGGEST MORE EFFICIENT USE OF DRIVERS BUSES OR OTHER RELATED CRITERIA; AND SCHEDULE DRIVER TO FILL OPEN WORK DUE TO PLANNED AND UNPLANNED ABSENCES BASED ON UNION LOCAL STATE AND FEDERAL RULES AND ENSURE ALL WORK HAS AN ELIGIBLE DRIVER ASSIGNED TO IT.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THERE IS ONE MAIN ACTIVITY TO THIS AWARD AND THAT IS THE PROCUREMENT OF PLANNING AND SCHEDULING SOFTWARE. THE PROCUREMENT WILL INCLUDE NOT ONLY THE SOFTWARE ITSELF BUT ALSO TRAINING FROM THE VENDOR FOR STAFF ON HOW TO USE IT PROPERLY.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE CITY EXPECTS TO USE THIS SOFTWARE TO BETTER ALLOCATE BUSES AND DRIVERS ALLOWING DRIVERS TO HAVE BETTER AND MORE CONSISTENT SCHEDULES TO HELP WITH BURNOUT AND RECRUITMENT. THE CITY ALSO EXPECTS THIS SOFTWARE TO AID IN PLANNING NEW ROUTES OR DETERMINING IF SERVICE IS OVERPROVIDED IN ONE AREA AND UNDERPROVIDED IN ANOTHER AND TO ASSIST IN MODIFYING EXISTING ROUTES OR PLANNING NEW ROUTES TO BETTER PROVIDE SERVICE. THE CITY ALSO EXPECTS THIS SOFTWARE TO AID STAFF IN SCHEDULING DRIVERS FOR WORK INCLUDING DEALING WITH TIME OFF AND UNION RULES ABOUT ASSIGNING OPEN WORK SO THAT DISPATCH CAN CONFIRM THAT ALL OPEN WORK HAS BOTH AN ELIGIBLE DRIVER AND BUS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE CITY STAFF WHO CURRENTLY HAVE TO DO ALL PLANNING AND SCHEDULING TASKS BY HAND THE DRIVERS WHO WILL HAVE BETTER SCHEDULES AND RIDERS WHO WILL HAVE BETTER SERVICE COVERAGE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE JULE WHICH WILL IMPROVE SERVICE WITH THE INTRODUCTION OF A BATTERY ELECTRIC BUS INTO THE FLEET A NEW ADA PASSENGER VAN FOR DRIVER TRANSPORT AND NEW BUS SHELTERS TO ENHANCE RIDER EXPERIENCE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE PROJECT WILL REPLACE ONE BUS IN THE FIXED ROUTE FLEET WITH A BATTERY ELECTRIC BUS AND ACCOMPANYING CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE. A NEW ADA PASSENGER VAN WILL REPLACE THE EXISTING DRIVER TRANSPORT VEHICLE THAT HAS EXCEEDED ITS USEFUL LIFE. THE PROJECT ALSO INCLUDES THE PURCHASE OF 4 BUS SHELTERS WITH SOLAR-POWERED LIGHTING THAT WILL EITHER REPLACE EXISTING SHELTERS IN POOR CONDITION OR BE INSTALLED IN A STOP LOCATION WITH HIGH USE TO HELP ENHANCE RIDER EXPERIENCE.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PROJECTS WILL ENHANCE ACCESS AND MOBILITY FOR OUR PASSENGERS WITH CONTINUED BUS FLEET RELIABILITY AND IMPROVED AMENITIES. THE PROJECT SERVES AS THE JULES FIRST STEP TOWARDS ELECTRIFICATION OF THE BUS FLEET. ALL PROJECTS WILL IMPROVE THE STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FOR TRANSIT ASSETS AT THE JULE.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THESE IMPROVEMENTS CAN BENEFIT THE ENTIRE DUBUQUE COMMUNITY PARTICULARLY THE 41009 RESIDENTS WHO LIVE WITHIN MILE OF A BUS STOP. THE FIXED ROUTES PROVIDE ACCESS TO 31333 JOBS WITHIN MILE OF A BUS STOP. WE DESIGNED OUR ROUTES IN COLLABORATION WITH EMPLOYERS WHO COUNT ON US TO TRANSPORT THEIR EMPLOYEES. OUR FIXED ROUTE SYSTEM PROVIDES ACCESS TO IMPORTANT ACTIVITIES FOR PERSONAL NEEDS AND THE COMMUNITYS ECONOMIC VITALITY. THE ELECTRIFICATION OF THE BUS FLEET ALIGNS WITH THE CITY OF DUBUQUES GOALS TOWARDS REDUCING OVERALL VEHICLE EMISSIONS IMPROVING AIR QUALITY FOR ALL CITIZENS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE CITY OF DAVENPORT HAS CONTRACTED WITH TRANSLOC TO PROVIDE AUTOMATIC VEHICLE LOCATION (AVL) SERVICES FOR THE PAST FIVE YEARS AND WANTS TO PUT OUT AN RFP TO ENSURE THAT THE CITY IS ABLE TO HAVE THE LOWEST COST FOR THESE SERVICES AND ALSO TO SEE IF THERE HAVE BEEN ANY ADVANCEMENTS OR ADDITIONAL TECHNOLOGIES DEVELOPED IN THE PAST FIVE YEARS THAT WOULD RESULT IN BETTER CUSTOMER SERVICE OR EASIER IMPLEMENTATION.THIS NEW SYSTEM WOULD ALSO HAVE A USEFUL LIFE OF 5 YEARS THOUGH COULD LAST LONGER IF THERE ARE NO NEW TECHNOLOGICAL CHANGES IN THE NEXT 10 YEARS.THE CITY WILL ALSO ASK ALL VENDORS TO LIST ANY ADDITIONAL PRODUCTS OR SERVICES THAT THEY FEEL COMPLEMENT THEIR (COMPUTER AIDED DISPATCH) CAD/AVL SYSTEM AS ADDITIONAL AND NOT GUARANTEED TO BE PURCHASED ADD-ONS AND IF THE LOWEST BIDDER HAS ANY SYSTEMS THAT ARE ALSO A GOOD OPTION THE CITY MAY OR MAY NOT CHOOSE TO PURCHASE THOSE ADDITIONAL PRODUCTS OR SERVICES AS PART OF THIS PROJECT AS WELL.THE CITY WILL ENSURE THE WINNING VENDORS PRODUCTS AND SERVICES INTEGRATE WITH REGIONAL ITS ARCHITECTURE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: RELEASE AN RFP FOLLOWING ALL FTA REQUIREMENTS SUCH AS GETTING AN INDEPENDENT COST ESTIMATE PERFORMING A COST-PRICE ANALYSIS ETC FOR PROVIDING AVL SERVICES AS WELL AS POTENTIALLY OTHER RELATED SERVICES FOR THE CITY OF DAVENPORT FOR THE NEXT 5 YEARS.UPON AWARD OF A CONTRACT THE VENDOR WILL SEND STAFF OUT TO THE CITY WITH HARDWARE TO INSTALL ON THE BUSES THOUGH IT MAY ONLY BE A FEW OF THE BUSES AS ALL THE BUSES WITH ETA VOICE ANNUNCIATORS ALREADY HAVE ALL THE NECESSARY HARDWARE INSTALLED. THE VENDOR WILL ALSO SEND STAFF TO TRAIN ALL TRANSIT STAFF ON PROPER USE OF THE NEW SYSTEM.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE CITY EXPECTS TO HAVE SEVERAL VENDORS PROPOSE AVL SOLUTIONS TO THE CITY AND UPON SELECTING THE BEST RESPONSIBLE AND RESPONSIVE BIDDER THE CITY WILL PURCHASE AN AVL SOLUTION FOR THE CITY FOR THE NEXT FIVE YEARS AND POSSIBLY RELATED SERVICES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES WOULD BE CUSTOMERS WHO HAVE A BETTER WAY TO SEE BUS LOCATION IN REAL TIME DAVENPORT TRANSIT STAFF WHO HAVE AN EASIER AND MORE EFFICIENT TIME MAINTAINING THE SYSTEM AND POTENTIALLY ALL RESIDENTS IF THE CITY IS ABLE TO FIND A VENDOR WHO IS ABLE TO PROVIDE THE REQUESTED SERVICES AT A LOWER PRICE THAN THE CITY IS CURRENTLY PAYING.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ON THIS GRANT.

THE AMES TRANSIT AGENCY (CYRIDE) WILL UTILIZE ITS ENTIRE FFY2021 SECTION 5339 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES AWARD OF $3185374 FEDERAL TO PURCHASE THREE NEW BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES (REPLACING THREE 17-YEAR OLD HD ORION V BUSES PAST THEIR USEFUL LIFE OF 12 YEARS) AND TWO ARTICULATED 60 HD BUSES (REPLACING AN 17 YEAR OLD ORION V AND A 16 YEAR OLD ORION VII). THE TOTAL PROJECT COST FOR THIS PROJECT IS $4310000 ($3185374 FEDERAL; $562126 LOCAL MATCH). SOURCES OF THE $562126 LOCAL MATCH REQUIREMENT FOR THIS GRANT WILL BE DERIVED FROM CYRIDES TRANSIT BOARD WHICH INCLUDES THE CITY OF AMES (PROPERTY TAX LEVY) IOWA STATE UNIVERSITY (ISU ADMINISTRATION BUDGET) AND THE IOWA STATES STUDENT GOVERNMENT (STUDENT FEES). CYRIDE ANTICIPATES A 3-YEAR PROJECT TIMELINE WITH DELIVERY OF THE VEHICLES/FACILITY MODIFICATIONS ANTICIPATED FOR COMPLETION NO LATER THAN SEPTEMBER 30 2026. AMES IS USING INNOVATIVE PROCUREMENT AUTHORIZED UNDER THE FAST ACT 3019.TO VIEW CYRIDES FEDERAL AWARD VISIT: HTTPS://WWW.FEDERALREGISTER.GOV/DOCUMENTS/2022/03/18/2022-05734/ANNOUNCEMENT-OF-FISCAL-YEAR-2021-GRANTS-FOR-BUSES-AND-BUS-FACILITIES-PROGRAM-PROJECT-SELECTIONSTHE ANTICIPATED USEFUL LIFE OF THE NEW REPLACEMENT VEHICLES IS 12 YEARS OR 500000 MILES. ALL BUSES WITHIN THIS REQUEST WILL MEET ADA THEREFORE THE PROJECT REQUIRES A 15% LOCAL MATCH. ALL LOCAL FUNDS HAVE BEEN FORMALLY APPROVED THROUGH CYRIDES ANNUAL CAPITAL BUDGET PROCESS OR ARE BEING HELD IN A RESERVE ACCOUNT. CYRIDE WILL ALSO UTILIZE THE AMES AREA MPOS STBG PROGRAM FUNDS TO ADD FUNDING TO THE ARTICULATED BUSES FOR ADDITIONAL FUNDING THROUGH APPROVED GRANT IA-2022-020-00 (FY2022 STBG FUNDING) AND FUTURE STBG GRANT THAT WILL BE SUBMITTED BY 10/1/2022 TO FTA WITH FY2023 STBG FUNDING. FOR MORE INFORMATION VIEW THE ATTACHED FY21-GRANTS-FOR-BUSES-AND-BUS-FACILITIES-SUPPLEMENTAL-FORM ALSO SUBMITTED IN GRANTS.GOV.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: TO MEET THE AMES COMMUNITYS SUSTAINABILITY GOALS CYRIDE HAS COMMITTED TO ELECTRIC BUS TECHNOLOGY THROUGH THE PURCHASE OF THREE ELECTRIC BUSES REPLACING THREE DIESEL BUSES PAST THEIR USEFUL LIFE AND TWO ARTICULATED BUSES. THE AMES TRANSIT AGENCYS (CYRIDES) PROJECT WILL BE ITS THIRD DEPLOYMENT OF ELECTRIC BUS TECHNOLOGY WITHIN THE AMES IOWA COMMUNITY. IN MARCH 2019 CYRIDE COMPLETED A 100% LOCALLY FUNDED FEASIBILITY ANALYSIS (SEE ATTACHED CYRIDE_BEB FLEET AND FACILITY TRANSITION STUDY.PDF) TO DETERMINE THE FEASIBILITY OF OPERATING BATTERY ELECTRIC BUS TECHNOLOGY IN AMES IOWA. THIS STUDY ANALYZED CYRIDES ROUTES COMPARED TO ELECTRIC BUS RANGE CONSTRAINTS ISSUES WITH HOUSING ELECTRIC VEHICLES WITHIN ITS 1980S FACILITY AS WELL AS OVERALL BENEFITS (INCLUDING ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS) AND CHALLENGES CYRIDE MIGHT FACE IN IMPLEMENTING THIS BUS TECHNOLOGY. ADDITIONALLY THE STUDY DETERMINED BASED ON CURRENT TECHNOLOGY AND VEHICLE RANGE THAT 17 BUSES OR APPROXIMATELY 18% OF CYRIDES FLEET COULD BE OPERATED DAILY WITH DEPOT CHARGING AND NO SUBSTANTIAL CHANGES IN HOW CYRIDE DEPLOYS ITS SERVICE. FURTHER IT WAS DETERMINED THAT ELECTRIC BUSES WOULD PROVIDE A SUBSTANTIAL COST AND EMISSIONS SAVINGS OVER THE 18-YEAR LIFE OF THE VEHICLES (CYRIDES USEFUL-LIFE BENCHMARK REPLACEMENT AGE). AS A RESULT CYRIDES TRANSIT BOARD OF TRUSTEES (COMPRISED OF REPRESENTATIVE ORGANIZATIONS AND GENERAL PUBLIC THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY) COMMITTED TO AN INITIAL ELECTRIC BUS PROJECT (2 BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES UNDER IA-2021-002-00) WITH THE GOAL OF MOVING TOWARD THE MAXIMUM NUMBER OF ELECTRIC BUSES THAT CAN BE EFFICIENTLY DEPLOYED IN ITS OPERATION. THEN WITH THE FY2021 5307 APPORTIONMENT CYRIDE FURTHERED THIS GOAL BY REQUESTING THREE MORE BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES UNDER THAT PENDING GRANT (IA-2021-022-00). THIS GRANT ONCE FUNDED AND PROCURED WILL BRING CYRIDES TOTAL ELECTRIC FLEET TO EIGHT (8) AND CYRIDES TOTAL ARTICULATED BUS FLEET TO TEN (10). ACCORDING TO FTA THE BUSES TO BE REPLACED ONLY NEED TO MEET THE AGE OF 12 YEARS AND/OR A MILEAGE REQUIREMENT OF 500000 MILES ON THESE BUSES. ALL THESE VEHICLES HAVE MET FTAS DEFINED USEFUL LIFE AGE OF 12 YEARS AS THEY ARE ALL 16-17 YEARS OF AGE. WHILE THE BUSES HAVENT REACHED THE 500000 MILEAGE REQUIREMENT TO BE REPLACED THEY ONLY NEED TO MEET THE AGE REQUIREMENT TO MEET FTAS REQUIREMENT. MILEAGE FOR THESE THREE VEHICLES AVERAGE 289894 MILES EACH. THERE IS MODERATE TO HIGH CORROSION ON ALL THESE VEHICLES WITHIN THE ADA REQUIRED WHEELCHAIR LIFTS ON THESE LOW-FLOOR VEHICLES. ALL CYRIDE PURCHASES AFTER 2006 HAVE BEEN ALL LOW-FLOOR VEHICLES WITH WHEELCHAIR RAMPS THAT CAN BE DEPLOYED MANUALLY IF NECESSARY TO ELIMINATE ISSUES WITH CONSTANT BREAKAGE OF HYDRAULIC HOSES ON THESE WHEELCHAIR LIFTS OPERATED IN MIDWESTERN CLIMATE. WHEN A HOSE BREAKS IT IS NECESSARY TO TAKE THE BUS OUT OF SERVICE UNTIL THE WHEELCHAIR LIFT IS FULLY REPAIRED. NEW LOW-FLOOR BUSES WOULD ALLOW PASSENGER TO BOARD MORE EASILY WITH ONE STEP ONTO THE BUS AS WELL AS ELIMINATE TAKING THE BUS OUT OF SERVICE FOR REQUIRED WHEELCHAIR LIFT REPAIRS. THEREFORE THE REPLACEMENT OF THE FOUR 2005 VEHICLES BELOW THAT WERE PURCHASED WITH A WHEELCHAIR LIFT WILL PROVIDE ENHANCEMENTS FOR ADA PASSENGERS AS THE NEW VEHICLE WILL PROVIDE A RAMP STYLE FOR ADA PASSENGERS TO EASILY BOARD THE BUSES AND COULD BE MANUALLY DEPLOYED IF NECESSARY. SPECIFICALLY THE VEHICLES ARE IDENTIFIED BELOW WITH THE TPMS# IDENTIFIED FOR THE STIP: *REPLACE VEHICLE ID #949- 2005 ORION V; 17 YEARS OF AGE; 273619 MILES; HIGH PRIORITY TO REPLACE WITHIN CYRIDES TAM PLAN; TPMS#5567. A BATTERY ELECTRIC BUS WILL REPLACE THIS VEHICLE.*REPLACE VEHICLE ID #950 - 2005 ORION V; 17 YEARS OF AGE; 287655 MILES; HIGH PRIORITY TO REPLACE WITHIN CYRIDES TAM PLAN; TPMS#5564. A BATTERY ELECTRIC BUS WILL REPLACE THIS VEHICLE.*REPLACE VEHICLE ID #952- 2005 ORION V; 17 YEARS OF AGE; 276409 MILES; HIGH PRIORITY TO REPLACE WITHIN CYRIDES TAM PLAN; TPMS#5565. A BATTERY ELECTRIC BUS WILL REPLACE THIS VEHICLE.*REPLACE VEHICLE ID #951- 2005 ORION V; 17 YEARS OF AGE; 276046 MILES; HIGH PRIORITY TO REPLACE WITHIN CYRIDES TAM PLAN; TPMS#5566. AN ARTICULATED BUS WILL REPLACE THIS VEHICLE. STBG FUNDING (FY2022) WILL COMPLETE THIS BUS PURCHASE VIA GRANT IA-2022-020-00.*REPLACE VEHICLE ID #502- 2006 ORION VII; 16 YEARS OF AGE; 335740 MILES; HIGH PRIORITY TO REPLACE WITHIN CYRIDES TAM PLAN; TPMS#6015. AN ARTICULATED BUS WILL REPLACE THIS VEHICLE. STBG FUNDING (FY2023) WILL COMPLETE THIS BUS PURCHASE. (THIS GRANT WILL BE SUBMITTED APPROXIMATELY 10/1/2022 IN TRAMS WHEN FHWA FUNDING IS FULLY TRANSFERRED.)FOR PROCUREMENT CYRIDE INTENDS TO UTILIZE THE WASHINGTON STATE TRANSIT BUS COOPERATIVE (MASTER CONTRACT #06719-01) APPROVED APRIL 1 2021 TO PURCHASE NOVA BUSES FOR BOTH ITS 40 ELECTRIC BUSES AND 60 DIESEL BUS PURCHASES UNDER THIS GRANT. (SEE ATTACHED NOVA MASTER CONTRACT AND EXHIBIT A EXHIBIT B EXHIBIT E AND PA DOCUMENTS). ACCORDING TO THE FAST ACT SECTION 3019 CYRIDE MAY PARTICIPATE IN A COOPERATIVE PROCUREMENT CONTRACT WITHOUT REGARD TO WHETHER THE OTHER GRANTEE IS LOCATED IN THE SAME STATE AS THE PARTIES TO THE CONTRACT. THE INNOVATIVE INFRASTRUCTURE JOBS ACT (IIJA) NOW REQUIRES TO THE EXTENT POSSIBLE THIS INNOVATIVE PROCUREMENT TOOL FOR APPLICANTS. INITIALLY CYRIDE HAD CITED THE COMMONWEALTH OF VIRGINIA CONTRACT WITHIN ITS FY21 BUS BUS FACILITIES SUPPLEMENTAL FORM PROPOSAL BUT THE VIRGINIA CONTRACT IS NOW BEING REBID AND IS CURRENTLY UNAVAILABLE. THE WASHINGTON STATE CONTRACT 06719-01 FOR NOVA HAS BEEN VETTED AS WELL AS HAS A TWO-YEAR WARRANTY ON BUS PURCHASES. FURTHERMORE CYRIDE WAS INSTRUMENTAL IN HELPING THE STATE OF IOWA TO OBTAIN A PARTICIPATING ADDENDUM TO THIS CONTRACT BETWEEN NOVA BUS US INC. AND THE STATE OF IOWA. AS A CITY WITHIN THE STATE OF IOWA THE AMES TRANSIT AGENCY (CYRIDE) IS AN ELIGIBLE PURCHASER AND IS AUTHORIZED TO PURCHASE UNDER THIS PARTICIPATING ADDENDUM IN LIEU OF A SEPARATE COMPETITIVE SELECTION PROCESS. SEE ALL FIVE NOVA MASTER CONTRACT 06719 REFERENCED DOCUMENTS ATTACHED TO THE APPLICATION FOR MORE INFORMATION. CYRIDE WILL SUBMIT A PURCHASING AUTHORIZATION REQUEST TO THE DEPARTMENT OF ENTERPRISE SERVICES IN OLYMPIA WASHINGTON SPECIFICALLY FOR THIS PROCUREMENT ONCE THE FEDERAL/LOCAL FUNDING IS FULLY AVAILABLE TO ESTABLISH A FORMAL COOPERATIVE PURCHASING AGREEMENT FOR THIS GRANT. THE STATE OF WASHINGTONS MASTER CONTRACT WAS COMPETITIVELY BID EVALUATED AND AWARDED UNDER THE PROCUREMENT LAWS OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON AND MEETS FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION REQUIREMENTS FOR A STATE COOPERATIVE PURCHASING CONTRACT UNDER THE FAST ACT SEC. 3019. SEE RCW CHAPTER 39.26.050(1) AND PUB.L. 114-94. THERE ARE NO PENDING PROTESTS OR LAWSUITS PERTAINING TO PROCUREMENT OR AWARD OF THE MASTER CONTRACT.FORCE ACCOUNT LABOR - AMES TRANSIT AGENCY IS NOT UTILIZING FORCE ACCOUNT LABOR FOR ANY ACTIVITIES ON THE BUDGET.VEHICLE PURCHASE AND ADA - THIS GRANT WILL FUND THE COST OF THREE BATTERY ELECTRIC WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE BUSES. THESE BUSES WILL MEET ADA ACCESSIBILITY REQUIREMENTS. THEREFORE THIS GRANT IS BEING FUNDED AT 85% FEDERAL WITH A 15% LOCAL MATCH.AMES TRANSIT AGENCY (CYRIDE) DOES NOT BILL FOR INDIRECT COSTS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE AMES TRANSIT AGENCYS (CYRIDES) PROJECT WILL BE ITS THIRD DEPLOYMENT OF ELECTRIC BUS TECHNOLOGY WITHIN THE AMES IOWA COMMUNITY. IN MARCH 2019 CYRIDE COMPLETED A 100% LOCALLY FUNDED FEASIBILITY ANALYSIS (SEE ATTACHED CYRIDE_BEB FLEET AND FACILITY TRANSITION STUDY.PDF) TO DETERMINE THE FEASIBILITY OF OPERATING BATTERY ELECTRIC BUS TECHNOLOGY IN AMES IOWA. THIS STUDY ANALYZED CYRIDES ROUTES COMPARED TO ELECTRIC BUS RANGE CONSTRAINTS ISSUES WITH HOUSING ELECTRIC VEHICLES WITHIN ITS 1980S FACILITY AS WELL AS OVERALL BENEFITS (INCLUDING ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS) AND CHALLENGES CYRIDE MIGHT FACE IN IMPLEMENTING THIS BUS TECHNOLOGY. ADDITIONALLY THE STUDY DETERMINED BASED ON CURRENT TECHNOLOGY AND VEHICLE RANGE THAT 17 BUSES OR APPROXIMATELY 18% OF CYRIDES FLEET COULD BE OPERATED DAILY WITH DEPOT CHARGING AND NO SUBSTANTIAL CHANGES IN HOW CYRIDE DEPLOYS ITS SERVICE. FURTHER IT WAS DETERMINED THAT ELECTRIC BUSES WOULD PROVIDE A SUBSTANTIAL COST AND EMISSIONS SAVINGS OVER THE 18-YEAR LIFE OF THE VEHICLES (CYRIDES USEFUL-LIFE BENCHMARK REPLACEMENT AGE). AS A RESULT CYRIDES TRANSIT BOARD OF TRUSTEES (COMPRISED OF REPRESENTATIVE ORGANIZATIONS AND GENERAL PUBLIC THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY) COMMITTED TO AN INITIAL ELECTRIC BUS PROJECT (SEE GRANT IA-2021-002-00) WITH THE GOAL OF MOVING TOWARD THE MAXIMUM NUMBER OF ELECTRIC BUSES THAT CAN BE EFFICIENTLY DEPLOYED IN ITS OPERATION. AN ADDITIONAL GRANT IS PENDING UNDER IA-2021-022-00 FOR THREE MORE BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES UTILIZING CYRIDES FY2021 5307 APPORTIONMENT FUNDING. THIS GRANT SUBMISSION WILL BRING CYRIDES TOTAL ELECTRIC FLEET TO EIGHT (8) BUSES. THIS GRANT SUBMISSION WILL ALSO BRING CYRIDES TOTAL ARTICULATED 60-FOOT BUS FLEET TO TEN (10) BUSES ALLOWING CYRIDE TO OPERATE ITS #23 ORANGE ROUTE EXCLUSIVELY WITH ARTICULATED BUSES. THIS BUS ROUTE IS THE LARGEST ROUTE TRANSPORTING AS MANY AS 14000 RIDES PER DAY. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: AMES IOWA RESIDENTS (66427 POPULATION) UNIVERSITY STUDENTS AT IOWA STATE UNIVERSITY AND VISITORS TO THE COMMUNITY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: CYRIDE DOES NOT HAVE SUBRECIPIENTS.

IOWA CITY TRANSIT PARTNERED WITH PROTERRA IN APPLYING FOR THE GRANT FUNDS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: LOWER EMISSIONS AS OUTLINED IN IOWA CITYS CLIMATE ACTION PLAN.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PEOPLE OF IOWA CITY AND RIDERS ON IOWA CITY TRANSIT BUSES THROUGH REDUCED EMISSIONS AND NOISE. THE LOCAL/CITY SHARE WILL BE 15% WHICH WILL BE $213794.THE CITY IS COMMITTING AN ADDITIONAL $14540 (~.9%) BEYOND THE REQUIRED 15% ON PROJECT 1 ALI 11.12.02 TO COVER REMAINING EXPENSES.THE SPARE RATIO OF DAVENPORT TRANSITS FLEET IS CURRENTLY HIGHER THAN WOULD NORMALLY BE EXPECTED CURRENTLY 53% FOR TWO SIGNIFICANT REASONS. FIRST DUE TO THE ADVANCED AGE OF MUCH OF THE FLEET CURRENTLY 9 OF THE 23 BUSES IN USE ARE PAST THEIR USEFUL LIFE IN TERMS OF BOTH AGE AND MILEAGE THE CITY DOES NOT DIFFERENTIATE BETWEEN NORMAL BUSES WHICH GO OUT ON A ROUTE EVERY DAY AND SPARES WHICH ARE ONLY USED IN CASE OF EMERGENCY AND INSTEAD USES EVERY BUS IN ITS FLEET AT LEAST A FEW TIMES EACH WEEK BARRING MAINTENANCE ISSUES IN ORDER TO TRY AND KEEP MILEAGE LOW ACROSS THE ENTIRE FLEET. ADDITIONALLY FOR THE PAST FEW YEARS THE MAXIMUM VEHICLES IN OPERATIONAL SERVICE WAS ACTUALLY 19 AS THE CITY RAN A STRETCH SHUTTLE SERVICE FOR THE IOWA AND ILLINOIS DOT WHILE THEY BUILD AN NEW INTERSTATE 74 BRIDGE OVER THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER. THAT SERVICE HAS NOW ENDED AND THAT IS ALSO CONTRIBUTING TO THE HIGHER THAN EXPECTED SPARE RATIO.ATTACHED DOCUMENTS:LONG RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLANURBAN TIPSTIPSCREENSHOT OF STIP UPDATED AND INCLUDING PROJECTVEHICLE DISPOSITION FORMFTA FHWA ONE DOT APPROVAL LETTERSAM.GOV SCREENSHOT OF EXCLUDED PARTIES LIST TVRM SCREENSHOTTVM_DBE CERTIFICATION

PURPOSE: IOWA DOT IS APPLYING FOR THE FY2021 LOW OR NO EMISSION BUS PROGRAM (5339(C)) (LOW-NO) GRANT FUNDS ON BEHALF OF THREE REGIONAL PUBLIC TRANSIT SYSTEMS IN THE AMOUNT OF $2784940 FEDERAL FUNDS. OPPORTUNITY ID: FTA-2021-001-LOWNOTHE THREE TRANSIT SYSTEMS HAVE BUSES THAT MEET ALL CRITERIA FOR REPLACEMENT AND WOULD BENEFIT FROM A REPLACEMENT TRANSITION TO ELECTRIFICATION AND PROCUREMENT OF 25 ZEB BATTERY ELECTRIC VEHICLES. THIS GRANT INCLUDES ONE REPLACEMENT VEHICLE FOR REGION 10 FIVE REPLACEMENT VEHICLES FOR REGION 11 AND THREE REPLACEMENT VEHICLES FOR REGION 16 AND RELATED TRAINING AND INFRASTRUCTURE COSTS. DETAILS ARE PROVIDED IN THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS AND THE IADOT LOWNO-2021 SUPPLEMENTAL FORM ATTACHED TO THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS SECTION. PROJECT MANAGEMENT FOR THE SUBRECIPIENTS WILL BE PERFORMED BY A THIRD-PARTY VENDOR AND ADMINISTERED BY THE IOWA DOT.TOTAL PROJECT COST: $3263488 FEDERAL SHARE TOTAL: $2784940LOCAL SHARE TOTAL: $478548SUMMARY OF BUDGET BREAKDOWN NOTED BELOW. DETAILS OF THE BUDGET AT THE PROJECT LEVEL ARE ATTACHED IN THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS SECTION.REGION 10PROJECT COST: $451619FEDERAL SHARE: $388345REGION 11PROJECT COST: $1648585FEDERAL SHARE:$1413168REGION 16PROJECT COST: $947284FEDERAL SHARE: $810627IOWA DOTPROJECT COST: $216000FEDERAL SHARE:$172800ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THREE OF IOWAS RURAL TRANSIT SYSTEMS WILL ACQUIRE ELECTRIC VEHICLES FOR THE FIRST TIME. IOWA DOT WILL COORDINATE WITH CALSTART FOR EXPERIENCE AND EXPERTISE IN BATTERY-ELECTRIC VEHICLE DEPLOYMENT AND WITH ALLIANT ENERGY WHICH IS A PUBLIC UTILITY THAT SERVES ALL THREE TRANSIT REGIONS IN THIS PROJECT. CALSTART WILL BE A KEY PARTNER WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL CONSULTING AND ASSISTANCE FOR THE PURPOSE OF DEPLOYMENT AND OPERATIONS OF THE BUSES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WILL ENABLE THE TRANSIT AGENCIES TO PURCHASE BATTERY-ELECTRIC ZERO EMISSION BUSES (ZEBS) TO REPLACE OLD HIGH MILEAGE EXPENSIVE-TO-OPERATE GAS AND DIESEL BUSES. THE PROJECT WILL SERVE THREE RURAL AND URBAN REGIONS AND WILL ENABLE EACH OF THE TRANSIT AGENCIES TO FURTHER THEIR SUCCESS IN REDUCING FLEET EMISSIONS WHILE EXPANDING SAFE AND SECURE TRANSIT OPTIONS FOR THEIR COMMUNITIES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE CITIZENS OF IOWA WHO RESIDE IN THE AREAS SERVED BY CORRIDORRIDES (REGION 10) HEART OF IOWA REGIONAL TRANSIT AGENCY (REGION 11) AND SOUTH EAST IOWA REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION-SEIBUS (REGION 16).SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: SUBRECIPIENT AGENCIES WITH PROVIDE CLEAN ENERGY MODERN BATTERY-ELECTRIC ZERO EMISSION BUS SERVICE TO CLIENTS.LOCAL FUNDING COMES FROM GENERAL FUND LEVIES AND SOMETIMES FROM TRUST AND AGENCY LEVIES. EACH PARTNER TRANSIT AGENCY AND THE PUBLIC UTILITY ALLIANT HAVE PROVIDED COMMITMENTS THAT LOCAL SHARES FOR THEIR PROJECTS ARE AVAILABLE

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST FY2021 SECTION 5339(C) DISCRETIONARY FUNDS AWARDED TO THE STATE OF HAWAII DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (HDOT) IN THE AMOUNT OF $5150000 AND FY2019 FY2020 AND FY2021 SECTION 5339 RURAL AND SMALL URBAN FORMULA FUNDS (APPORTIONED TO UZA 150000) IN THE AMOUNT OF $1934283 TO SUPPLEMENT THE DISCRETIONARY AWARD. A SUMMARY AND BREAKDOWN OF FUNDING REQUESTED IS PROVIDED BELOW:SUMMARY OF FUNDING FOR THIS APPLICATION:5339(C) FY2021 LOW-NO: FEDERAL = $5150000 / LOCAL MATCH = $922101 / SUBTOTAL = $6072101 / ADJUSTMENT (VW SETTLEMENT) = $3530000 / SUBTOTAL (W/ VW) = $96021015339 FY2020 RURAL FORMULA: FEDERAL = $696801 / LOCAL MATCH = $121623 / SUBTOTAL = $8184245339 FY2021 RURAL FORMULA: FEDERAL = $592721 / LOCAL MATCH = $69957 / SUBTOTAL = $6626785339 FY2019 SMALL URBAN FORMULA (LAPSING 09/30/2022): FEDERAL = $400702 / LOCAL MATCH = $68671 / SUBTOTAL = $4693735339 FY2020 SMALL URBAN FORMULA: FEDERAL = $244059 / LOCAL MATCH = $27118 / SUBTOTAL = $271177TOTAL FUNDING: FEDERAL = $7084283 / LOCAL MATCH = $1209470 / SUBTOTAL = $8293753 / ADJUSTMENT (VW SETTLEMENT) = $3530000 / GRAND TOTAL (W/ VW) = $11823753BREAKOUT OF FUNDING FOR SUBRECIPIENTS:A) COUNTY OF HAWAII MASS TRANSIT AGENCY (HMTA) FEDERAL = $1861345 / LOCAL MATCH = $314906 / SUBTOTAL ELIGIBLE = $2176251 / ADJUSTMENT (VW SETTLEMENT) = $1765000 / SUBTOTAL (W/ VW) = $3941251B) COUNTY OF KAUAI TRANSPORTATION AGENCY (CKTA) FEDERAL = $3361593 / LOCAL MATCH = $579658 / SUBTOTAL ELIGIBLE = $3941251 / ADJUSTMENT (VW SETTLEMENT) = $0 (SEE NOTE 3) / SUBTOTAL = $3941251C) COUNTY OF MAUI DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (MDOT) FEDERAL = $1861345 / LOCAL MATCH = $314906 / SUBTOTAL ELIGIBLE = $2176251 / ADJUSTMENT (VW SETTLEMENT) = $1765000 / SUBTOTAL (W/ VW) = $3941251PURPOSE: THE STATE OF HAWAII ZERO EMISSION BUS (HZEB) PROGRAM WILL REPLACE NINE (9) AGING DIESEL BUSES THAT ARE AT OR BEYOND THEIR USEFUL LIFE WITH NINE (9) NEW BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES (BEBS). THE BUSES WILL BE DISTRIBUTED AMONG THREE RURAL TRANSIT AGENCIES PARTNERING IN THIS PROGRAM - THE COUNTIES OF HAWAII KAUAI AND MAUI. CHARGERS AND RELATED INFRASTRUCTURE AS WELL AS TOOLS AND WORKFORCE TRAINING IS ALSO INCLUDED IN THIS APPLICATION.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: NINE (9) BEBS WILL BE PROCURED ALONG WITH CHARGING EQUIPMENT AND TOOLS. DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION WILL TAKE PLACE TO PREPARE FACILITIES FOR INSTALLATION OF THE CHARGING EQUIPMENT. WORKFORCE TRAINING WILL BE CONDUCTED FOR THE COUNTIES TO USE AND MAINTAIN THE BEBS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: DEPLOYING BEBS IN PLACE OF EXISTING DIESEL VEHICLES WILL REDUCE HARMFUL EMISSIONS SUCH AS GREENHOUSES GASES THAT ARE ASSOCIATED WITH HDOTS SUBRECIPIENT FLEETS. OPERATING BEBS IN LIEU OF COMPARABLE STANDARD BUSES WILL REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF ENERGY CONSUMED BY THE FLEETS EACH YEAR AND PREVENT THE RELEASE OF GREENHOUSE GASES CARBON MONOXIDE (CO) NITROGEN OXIDES (NOX) SULFUR OXIDES (SOX) AND VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS (VOC). THE BEBS WILL ALSO REDUCE EMISSION OF PARTICULATE MATTER UNDER 10 MICROMETERS (WHICH HAS A CONSIDERABLE NEGATIVE IMPACT ON HUMAN HEALTH).INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: HMTA PROVIDES ISLAND-WIDE FIXED ROUTE PARATRANSIT AND RIDESHARE TAXI SERVICES TO RESIDENTS OF HAWAII ISLAND. IN THE NEAR TERM HTMA INTENDS TO DEPLOY THE BEBS ON CIRCULATORS AND SHORTER ROUTES WHERE THEY CAN EFFECTIVELY IMPROVE SERVICE REDUCE EMISSIONS AND CREATE A MORE LIVABLE ENVIRONMENT. CKTA PROVIDES FIXED ROUTE AND PARATRANSIT SERVICE IN AND BETWEEN VARIOUS COMMUNITIES ON THE ISLAND OF KAUAI. CKTA PLANS TO OPERATE THE BEBS ON ROUTES THAT WILL HAVE THE BIGGEST IMPACT ON REDUCTION OF EMISSIONS DIESEL FUEL CONSUMPTION AND THE LARGEST POSITIVE IMPACT ON DENSE AND FRAGILE COMMUNITIES WHICH ARE PRIMARILY FIXED ROUTE SERVICES BETWEEN THE NORTH AND WEST ENDS OF THE ISLAND TO THE CENTRAL AREA. MDOT PROVIDES FIXED ROUTE PARATRANSIT AND COMMUTER BUS SERVICE IN AN BETWEEN VARIOUS CENTRAL SOUTH WEST AND UPCOUNTRY MAUI COMMUNITIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE COUNTY SUBRECIPIENTS ON THIS PROJECT WILL PROCURE BEBS AND CHARGERS AND PREPARE THEIR RESPECTIVE FACILITIES FOR THE CHARGER INSTALLATIONS. TRAINING WILL BE CONDUCTED FOR DRIVERS AND MECHANICS.NOTES:1) PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY WAS REQUESTED BY HDOT TO INITIATE PROCUREMENT OF THE NINE (9) BEBS PRIOR TO EXECUTION OF THIS GRANT APPLICATION. FTA APPROVED THE REQUEST ON 01/26/2022. NO EXPENSES HAVE BEEN INCURRED PRIOR TO 01/26/2022. REFER TO THE ATTACHMENTS FOR MORE DETAIL.2) THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES LAPSING FUNDS: FY2019 5339 SMALL URBAN FORMULA IS LAPSING ON 09/30/2022.3) HAWAII COUNTY AND MAUI COUNTY WILL EACH RECEIVE $1765000 OF NON-FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE VW SETTLEMENT ($3530000 TOTAL) TO SUPPORT THEIR BUS PROCUREMENT ON THIS APPLICATION (INCLUDED ON PROJECT 1 AS AN ADJUSTMENT AMOUNT IN THE ALI BUDGET). KAUAI COUNTY IS INELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE THOSE FUNDS DUE TO THE SIZE AND AGE OF THE BUSES BEING REPLACED AND THUS THEIR FEDERAL SHARE AND LOCAL MATCH AMOUNTS ON THIS APPLICATION ARE HIGHER THAN THE OTHER TWO COUNTIES. ALL COUNTIES WILL RECEIVE THE SAME NUMBER OF BUSES AND CHARGERS.4) LOCAL MATCH HAS BEEN VERIFIED.

THIS GRANT APPLICATION CONSISTS OF THREE HAWAII DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (HDOT) SECTION 5339(B) BUS AND BUS FACILITIES DISCRETIONARY FUNDING APPLICATIONS (FY2017 FY2019 AND FY2020) THAT WERE AWARDED BY FTA AND 5339 RURAL AND SMALL URBAN FORMULA FUNDS USED TO SUPPLEMENT THE FY2020 DISCRETIONARY FUNDING.PROJECT 1) FY2017 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES (DISCRETIONARY FULL SCOPE AWARDED)- PURPOSE: HAWAII COUNTYS VAN SIZED VEHICLES ARE ESPECIALLY SUSCEPTIBLE TO BREAKDOWNS IN THEIR TRANSMISSIONS AND ENGINES AND ARE OFTEN SIDELINED. THIS PROJECT WILL REPLACE OLDER VEHICLES WITH NEW MID-DUTY SIZED VANS THAT ARE ADA ACCESSIBLE.- ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: PURCHASE SIX (6) VEHICLES FOR HAWAII COUNTY- EXPECTED OUTCOME: INCREASED RELIABILITY ON-TIME PERFORMANCE SAFETY AND PUBLIC PERCEPTION OF SERVICE. REDUCED REPAIR COSTS FREQUENCY OF BREAKDOWNS. - INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: RESIDENTS WHO RELY ON THE BUS TO TRAVEL FOR MEDICAL EMPLOYMENT EDUCATION AND OTHER NEEDS.- SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: HAWAII COUNTY: BUY SIX (6) REPLACEMENT 30-FT BUSESSUBTOTAL FTA SHARE (FY2017 DISCRETIONARY): $576000 (LAPSING 9/30/2021)SUBTOTAL LOCAL MATCH: $144000TOTAL FOR PROJECT 1: $720000PROJECT 2) FY2019 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES (DISCRETIONARY FULL SCOPE AWARDED)- PURPOSE: HAWAII COUNTYS ACTIVE FLEET HAS BEEN PLAGUED WITH BREAKDOWNS AND AS A RESULT RIDERSHIP HAS DROPPED. NEW BUSES WILL BE PURCHASED FOR HAWAII COUNTY TO REPLACE VEHICLES THAT HAVE REACHED THEIR USEFUL LIFE INCREASING RELIABILITY AND REDUCING DEPENDENCY ON CONTRACTORS. DUE TO STEADY INCREASES IN DEMAND FOR TRANSIT SERVICE KAUAI COUNTY RIDERSHIP HAS DOUBLED AND THE KAUAI BUSS VEHICLES HAVE REACHED THEIR USEFUL LIVES AT AN ACCELERATED PACE. NEW BUSES WILL HELP TO ENSURE SAFE AND RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION FOR RIDERS.- ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: PURCHASE TEN (10) BUSES FOR HAWAII COUNTY AND SIX (6) BUSES FOR KAUAI COUNTY- EXPECTED OUTCOME: INCREASED RELIABILITY ON-TIME PERFORMANCE SAFETY AND PUBLIC PERCEPTION OF SERVICE. REDUCED REPAIR COSTS FREQUENCY OF BREAKDOWNS.- INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: RESIDENTS WHO RELY ON THE BUS TO TRAVEL FOR MEDICAL EMPLOYMENT EDUCATION AND OTHER NEEDS.- SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: HAWAII COUNTY: BUY TEN(10) REPLACEMENT 40-FT BUSES KAUAI COUNTY: BUY THREE (3) REPLACEMENT 30-FT BUSES KAUAI COUNTY: BUY THREE (3) REPLACEMENT 30-FT BUSESSUBTOTAL FTA SHARE (FY2019 DISCRETIONARY): $6586650SUBTOTAL LOCAL MATCH: $ 1162350TOTAL FOR PROJECT 2: $ 7749000PROJECTS 3 4 5 AND 6) FY2020 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES (DISCRETIONARY SCALED PROJECT SCOPE AWARDED) FY2018 AND FY2020 5339 RURAL AND SMALL URBAN FORMULA FUNDS.NOTE: THE FY2020 SECTION 5339(B) BUS AND BUS FACILITIES DISCRETIONARY APPLICATION INCLUDED USE OF FORMULA FUNDS (LABELED AS OTHER FEDERAL FUNDS) TO SUPPLEMENT DISCRETIONARY FUNDING FOR HYBRID BUSES IN ADDITION TO THE LOCAL MATCH. SINCE THE PROJECTS ON THIS APPLICATION ARE SEPARATED BY FUNDING SOURCE THE FY2020 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES DISCRETIONARY AWARD SPANS OVER PROJECTS 3 4 5 AND 6.- PURPOSE: AS AN IMPORTANT STEP IN THE TRANSITION TOWARDS 100% RENEWABLE ENERGY BY 2035 HYBRID BUSES WILL BE PURCHASED FOR ALL THREE COUNTIES. APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE AND GOALS OF THE AWARD ARE TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE REPLACEMENT OF UP TO TWENTY-FIVE (25) AGING CNG BUSES THAT HAVE SURPASSED THEIR USEFUL LIFE WITH TWENTY-FIVE (25) BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUSES. THE NEW BUSES WILL BE SUPPORTED WITH THE ACQUISITION AND INSTALLATION OF UP TO TWENTY-FIVE (25) PLUG-IN DEPOT CHARGERS. THIS PROJECT WILL HELP LOWER GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS AND HELP REDUCE MAINTENANCE COSTS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE THE REPLACEMENT OF UP TO TWENTY-FIVE (25) AGING CNG BUSES THAT HAVE SURPASSED THEIR USEFUL LIFE WITH TWENTY-FIVE (25) BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUSES. THE NEW BUSES WILL BE SUPPORTED WITH THE ACQUISITION AND INSTALLATION OF UP TO TWENTY-FIVE (25) PLUG-IN DEPOT CHARGERS AT THE MARTA PERRY BUS GARAGE. THE PROJECT ALSO INCLUDES TECHNICAL SERVICES PROGRAM SUPPORT AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES FOR THE AUTHORITY TO HELP TRAIN BUS OPERATIONS STAFF.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THERE ARE A NUMBER OF EXPECTED OUTCOMES AND BENEFITS OF THIS PROJECT. ELECTRIC BUSES PRODUCE SIGNIFICANTLY LOWER GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS THAN DIESEL DIESEL HYBRID AND NATURAL GAS-POWERED BUSES. ELECTRIC BUSES CAN DELIVER FINANCIAL BENEFITS INCLUDING SUBSTANTIALLY REDUCED MAINTENANCE COSTS COMPARED TO DIESEL AND COMPRESSED NATURAL GAS ALTERNATIVES OVER A VEHICLES LIFETIME AND IN PLACES WHERE UTILITY RATE POLICIES ARE FAVORABLE REDUCED FUEL COSTS. ALSO BY REDUCING AIR POLLUTION ELECTRIC BUSES CAN ALSO DELIVER SIGNIFICANT SOCIETAL BENEFITS INCLUDING AVOIDED HEALTHCARE EXPENSES RESULTING FROM CLEANER AIR. IN ADDITION ELECTRIC BUSES ALSO PRODUCE MUCH LESS NOISE THAN COMBUSTION ENGINE BUSES. ; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AWARD ARE THE MARTA PATRONS THAT RIDE ONE OF THE THIRTY-SEVEN (37) OF MARTAS 113 ROUTES THAT OPERATE FROM THE PERRY BUS GARAGE. THESE ROUTES SERVICE A DIVERSE CROSS-SECTION OF MARTAS SERVICE AREA. IN ADDITION THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO BENEFIT THE LOCAL POPULATION IN THOSE COMMUNITIES THAT THESE CLEANER ZERO EMISSIONS BUSES WILL SERVE. BENEFITS INCLUDE REDUCING GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS AND IMPROVING THE AIR QUALITY IN THE COMMUNITIES INCLUDING THOSE IDENTIFIED AS DISADVANTAGED; HELPING TO DELIVER SOCIETAL BENEFITS INCLUDING AVOIDED HEALTHCARE EXPENSES RESULTING FROM CLEANER AIR; AND IMPROVED TRANSIT SERVICE WITH MODERNIZED FLEET.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVISTS PLANNED FOR THIS AWARD.

THIS IS AN ACCOMPANYING APPLICATION TO GA-2021-028-00 AND GA-2020-032-00 FOR THE NEXT PHASING OF ELECTRIFICATION IN CATS TRANSIT SYSTEM. PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO CONTINUE SUPPORTING THE TRANSIT PROGRAM IN CHATHAM COUNTY WITH FLEET REPLACEMENT TO MAINTAIN STATE OF GOOD REPAIR DEVELOPMENT OF ON-ROUTE CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE AND DEPOT CHARGERS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: CAT CONTINUES TO ACCELERATE THE GOAL OF CONVERTING ITS FIXED ROUTE FLEET TO ZERO-EMISSION VEHICLES AND PROVIDE IMMEDIATE RELIEF TO THE AUTHORITYS AGING FLEET. THIS PROJECT WILL HELP THE AUTHORITY REDUCE MAINTENANCE COSTS PROVIDE BETTER SERVICE TO EXISTING CUSTOMERS AND HELP CAT ACHIEVE ITS ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP GOALS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT CHATHAM AREA TRANSIT TO PROVIDE FOUNDATIONAL ELEMENTS THAT SUPPORT AND MAINTAIN THE DIRECTIVE AND GOALS OF THE CAT ORGANIZATION IN THE AREAS OF FLEET REPLACEMENT AND ELECTRIC INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT. CHATHAM AREA TRANSIT IS COMMITTED TO CONTINUAL IMPROVEMENT THROUGH ITS GROW GREEN INITIATIVE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS SERVICE BENEFITS PEOPLE THROUGHOUT THE SAVANNAH-CHATHAM COUNTY AREA BY PROVIDING RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION TO EMPLOYMENT AND OTHER ACTIVITY CENTERS WITH ONGOING PROTECTION OF THE HEALTH SAFETY AND WELFARE OF THE PUBLIC AT LARGE.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.THIS APPLICATION IS NOT FOR RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT. AN INDIRECT COST RATE WILL NOT BE APPLIED TO ACTIVITIES IN THIS APPLICATION. CHATHAM AREA TRANSIT AUTHORITY IS A DESIGNATED RECIPIENT. THE GRANTEE OR SUB-GRANTEE (WHEN APPLICABLE) WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE). THE GRANTEE OR SUB-GRANTEE (WHEN APPLICABLE) WILL ENSURE CONTRACTORS PROCURED WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST. CHATHAM AREA TRANSIT WILL ENSURE THAT ALL VEHICLES PURCHASED ARE ACCESSIBLE PURCHASED FROM AN FTA APPROVED TVM AND REPORTED TO FTA WITHIN 30 DAYS AFTER CONTRACT IS SIGNED. CHATHAM AREA TRANSIT WILL CHECK THE CURRENT LISTING OF TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURERS (TVM) (HTTPS://WWW.TRANSIT.DOT.GOV/REGULATIONS-AND-GUIDANCE/CIVIL-RIGHTS-ADA/ELIGIBLE-TVMS-LIST) TO ENSURE EACH IS LISTEN AS A CERTIFIED TVM IN COMPLIANCE WITH FTA REGULATIONS.THE ABOVE REQUESTED ELECTRIC FLEET REPLACEMENT AND INFRASTRUCTURE ASSISTANCE ARE LISTED IN OUR TIP AMENDMENT ADOPTED BY THE CORE MPO DATED APRIL 27 2022 (ATTACHED). THE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR ASSISTANCE WITH ELIGIBLE FLEET REPLACEMENT AND INFRASTRUCTURE INSTALLATION REQUIRED TO PRESERVE OR EXTEND THE FUNCTIONALITY AND SERVICEABILITY OF OUR BUS FLEET AND RELATED ASSETS IN A COST EFFECTIVE MANNER. MATCHING FUNDS WILL COME FROM SPECIAL PURPOSE LOCAL OPTION SALES TAX (SPLOST) A FUNDING MECHANISM USED IN GEORGIA TO ALLOW COMMUNITIES TO TAX THEMSELVES FOR A SPECIFIC PURPOSE. THE CURRENT INTERGOVERNMENTAL AGREEMENT FOR SPLOST LISTS PUBLIC TRANSIT AS AN APPROVED USE OF SPLOST FUNDING AS PROVIDED BY CHATHAM COUNTY. SPLOST HAS BEEN A CONSISTENT AND RELIABLE MECHANISM FOR FUNDING OF CAPITAL PROJECTS AT CAT AND THROUGHOUT CHATHAM COUNTY. CHATHAM AREA TRANSIT HAS PARTNERED WITH GEORGIA POWER TO ENSURE A SHARED COMMITMENT TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF ELECTRIC TRANSPORTATION INFRASTRUCTURE AND THE USE OF ELECTRIC VEHICLES AS A RELIABLE AND EFFICIENT MEANS OF TRANSPORTATION. GEORGIA POWER HAS SUPPORTED CHATHAM AREA TRANSIT IN ITS ELECTRIC BUS AND ELECTRIC TRANSPORTATION INITIATIVES AS CAT CONTINUES TO MODERNIZE ITS TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM (ATTACHED).

PURPOSE OF THE AWARD: THE XPRESS VEHICLE REPLACEMENT - ELECTRIC COMMUTER BUS AND CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT PHASE 1 PROJECT WILL REPLACE TEN MODEL YEAR 2004 DIESEL TRANSIT BUSES THAT ARE PAST THEIR USEFUL LIFE WITH NEW ZERO-EMISSION BATTERY ELECTRIC (BE) COMMUTER BUSES. TO SUPPORT THOSE NEW ELECTRIC BUSES THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO DEPLOY TEN CHARGING STATIONS AT THE SOUTH EAST CORNER OF XPRESSS SOUTH OPERATIONS FACILITY (5250 FRONTAGE RD FOREST PARK GA 30297) AND AN ADDITIONAL CHARGER WITHIN THE MAINTENANCE FACILITY ON-SITE. THE PROJECT IS THE FIRST PHASE OF AN EFFORT TO REPLACE 20 XPRESS DIESEL BUSES THAT HAVE REACHED THEIR USEFUL LIFE WITH BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE ATL WAS AWARDED $5473485 IN FEDERAL FUNDING FOR THE PROJECT THROUGH THE FY2021 SECTION 5339(C) LOW NO PROGRAM PROJECT ID D2021-LWNO-013. FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PURCHASE BUSES BATTERY WARRANTIES BUS DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS/LAPTOP DATA ACCESS TOOLS BUY AMERICA AUDITS QA INSPECTIONS WORKFORCE TRAINING AND PROJECT MANAGEMENT/TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FROM CONSULTANTS. FOR FACILITY UPGRADES FEDERAL FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO PURCHASE AND INSTALL CHARGERS AND DISPENSERS AND CHARGE MANAGEMENT SOFTWARE. IN ITS APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL FUNDING ATL NAMED MCI CTE AND ATKINS AS PROJECT PARTNERS. CTE WILL PROVIDE PROJECT MANAGEMENT AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE SERVICES. ATKINS WILL PROVIDE ANY NEEDED ENGINEERING AND DESIGN SERVICES. MCI WILL PROVIDE THE BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES BATTERY WARRANTIES CHARGERS/DISPENSERS CHARGER/DISPENSER INSTALLATION AND CHARGE MANAGEMENT SOFTWARE TO OPERATE THE CHARGERS. INSPECTION AND AUDIT SERVICES WILL BE PROCURED VIA THE FTAS SMALL PURCHASES PROCESS WITH A MINIMUM OF TWO BIDS SOLICITED. IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT MOST WORKFORCE TRAINING ACTIVITIES WILL BE PROCURED THROUGH MCI HOWEVER SUPPLEMENTAL TRAININGS MAY BE NEEDED ON A COURSE BY COURSE BASES AND PROCURED IN A MANNER CONSISTENT WITH FTA GUIDANCE. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:REPLACING OLD 2004 DIESEL BUSES WITH BE WILL IMPROVE THE RIDER EXPERIENCE AND SUBSTANTIALLY REDUCE HARMFUL EMISSIONS AND NOISE POLLUTION PROVIDING SIGNIFICANT BENEFITS TO XPRESS RIDERS AND THE COMMUNITIES IN WHICH IT OPERATES.MCIS D45 CRTE LE CHARGE COMMUTER BUSES MODEL IS THE FIRST AND ONLY BE COMMUTER BUS TO HAVE PASSED ALTOONA TESTING (PASSED DECEMBER 2020). THESE BUSES WILL REPLACE MODEL YEAR 2004 DIESEL COACHES THAT WERE REHABBED IN 2017 AND WILL EXCEED THEIR USEFUL LIFE IN 2021 SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCING EMISSIONS FROM XPRESS OPERATIONS AND IMPROVING THE SYSTEMS STATE OF GOOD REPAIR. GIVEN THE NATURE OF COMMUTER TRANSIT SERVICE CHARGERS MUST BE DEPLOYED AT A 1:1 RATIO WITH BUSES TO ENSURE ALL VEHICLES CAN SIMULTANEOUSLY RECHARGE IN A BRIEF MIDDAY TIMEFRAME PRIOR TO RESUMING AFTERNOON SERVICE. AN ADDITIONAL CHARGER WILL BE PLACED INSIDE THE MAINTENANCE FACILITY. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:XPRESS RIDERS AND RESIDENTS OF FULTON CLAYTON AND HENRY COUNTIES ARE THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT. IN PARTNERSHIP WITH CTE AND ATKINS XPRESS COMPLETED A BE BUS NEEDS ASSESSMENT IN 2018 AS A FIRST STEP TOWARD A MORE EFFICIENT AND SUSTAINABLE FLEET. THE ANALYSIS SHOWED BE BUSES CAN SUCCESSFULLY OPERATE ON XPRESS ROUTES 430 431 432 440 441 442 AND 453 WHICH SERVE FULTON CLAYTON AND HENRY COUNTIES IN THE SOUTHERN METRO-ATLANTA REGION. THESE COMMUNITIES ARE COMPRISED PRIMARILY OF MINORITY POPULATIONS (66%) AND HAVE A HIGHER SHARE OF LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS THAN THE STATEWIDE AVERAGE. EJ POPULATION RIDERSHIP ON THESE ROUTES 77% MINORITY AND 17% LOW-INCOME HIGHER THAN THE SYSTEM WIDE EJ RIDERSHIP OF 71% MINORITY AND 14% LOW-INCOME. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A. NONE.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD FOR FFY23 SECTION 5307 FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $2008837 IS TO PROVIDE OPERATING AND CAPITAL ASSISTANCE FOR EXPENSES INCLUDING PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE OPERATING EXPENSES ACQUISITION OF COMMUNICATIONS EQUIPMENT AND SECURITY EQUIPMENT.*****ADDITIONALLY THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD FOR FFY23 SECTION 5339 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO CHARLOTTE COUNTY IN THE AMOUNT OF $278438 FOR THE PURCHASE OF ONE REPLACEMENT VEHICLE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: SECTION 5307 FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ALL ELIGIBLE PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE AND OPERATING EXPENSES INCLUDING CONTRACT DRIVERS SALARIES FUEL ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR. *****SECTION 5339 FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PURCHASE ONE REPLACEMENT VEHICLE.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: SECTION 5307 FUNDING WILL ALLOW CHARLOTTE COUNTY TRANSIT TO MEET PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE STANDARDS AND CONTINUE TO PROVIDE OPERATIONS.*****SECTION 5339 FUNDING WILL ALLOW CHARLOTTE COUNTY TRANSIT TO REPLACE ONE VEHICLE PAST ITS USEFUL LIFE.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: CHARLOTTE COUNTY TRANSIT AND ITS PASSENGERS THAT RELY UPON THE SERVICE WILL BENEFIT FROM THE CONTINUED SERVICES SUCH AS WORKERS BEING ABLE TO GET TO WORK AND/OR PASSENGERS BEING ABLE TO GET TO THEIR DESTINATION.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.

FEDERAL FUNDS FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE WILL ALLOW TO CONTINUE EXISTING SERVICES AND WILL BE MATCHED WITH LOCAL FUNDING SOURCE THE COUNTY MUNICIPAL SERVICE TAX UNIT (MSTU) WHICH HELPS WITH EFFORTS OF ENHANCING EXISTING SERVICES AND PROVIDING NEW SERVICES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ST. APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE 1 YEAR OF PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE 1 YEAR OF OPERATING ASSISTANCE 1 YEAR OF ADA PARATRANSIT SERVICES THE RECONSTRUCTION OF THE AGENCYS OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY INCLUDING THE VEHICULAR AND PEDESTRIAN GATES; BUS SHELTER REHABILITATION AND THE PREPARATION OF A ZERO-EMISSIONS TRANSITION PLAN TO ASSIST THE FIXED ROUTE TRANSIT OPERATIONS DURING THE PERIOD OF 10/01/2021 TO 3/30/2026.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ALL ELIGIBLE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE AND OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS THE OPERATION CONTRACT EXPENSES AND FUEL; THE HIRING OF A 3RD PARTY VENDOR TO DEVELOP A ZERO-EMISSIONS TRANSITION PLAN; CONTRIBUTE TOWARDS THE RECONSTRUCTION OF A NEW TRANSIT OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY; THE PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION OF A REPLACEMENT VEHICULAR AND PEDESTRIAN GATES THAT HAVE MET THEIR USEFUL LIFE AND THE REHABILITATION OF BUS SHELTERS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT COLLIER COUNTY TO MEET PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE STANDARDS CONTINUE TO PROVIDE OPERATIONS AND COMPLY WITH ITS TRANSIT ASSET MANAGEMENT (TAM) PLAN BY EXTENDING THE LIFE OF BUS SHELTERS REPLACING ITS OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY THAT HAS EXCEEDED USEFUL LIFE IMPROVING SAFETY AND SECURITY OF ASSETS AND FACILITY WITH THE REPLACEMENTS GATES AND SET A PLAN FOR THE TRANSITION TO SUSTAINABLE BUS OPERATION FOR THE AGENCY.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: WORKERS TO GET TO WORK AND OTHER DESTINATIONS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.

THIS GRANT APPLICATION IS UTILIZING FFY 2018 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES FORMULA PROGRAM FUNDS FOR THE REPLACEMENT OF OUR TRANSIT VEHICLES. THE TOTAL FEDERAL SHARE FOR THIS GRANT PERIOD IS $492039.00 . THIS AMOUNT CONSISTS OF THE PASCO COUNTY ALLOCATION OF $358.374.00 FROM THE TAMPA-ST. PETERSBURG LARGE URBANIZED AREA APPORTIONMENT AND $133665.00 FROM THE ZEPHYRHILLS SMALL URBANIZED AREA APPORTIONMENT. THIS AMOUNT DOES NOT EXCEED PASCO COUNTYS REGIONAL ALLOCATION OF THE FY 2018 AVAILABLE APPORTIONMENT. TOLL REVENUE CREDITS OF $89594.00 (LARGE URBAN 2018) AND $33416.00 (SMALL URBAN 2018) WAS APPROVED ON 07/02/18 BY THE STATE OF FLORIDA TO BE USED FOR THE 20% LOCAL MATCH [FMS 402397-1/402413-1].THE CURRENT ALLOCATION AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE THREE TRANSIT AGENCIES IN THIS REGION WAS PROVIDED TO FTA ON MAY 23 2018. THIS AGREEMENT DEFINITIVELY OUTLINES THE APPLICABLE SPLIT ALLOCATION BETWEEN PASCO COUNTY (GOPASCO) HILLSBOROUGH AREA REGIONAL TRANSIT (HART) AND PINELLAS SUNCOAST TRANSIT AUTHORITY (PSTA). THE GOVERNOR OF FLORIDA THROUGH FDOT APPROVED THE PASCO COUNTY BOARD OF COUNTY COMMISSIONERS AS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT OF THE SMALL URBANIZED PROGRAM FUNDS ON APRIL 28 2003 AND THE FTA REGION IV ADMINISTRATOR SUBSEQUENTLY ACCEPTED THIS DESIGNATION ON MAY 8 2003 AND AGAIN ON AUGUST 4 2006. PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THE GRANT FUNDING WILL BE TO REPLACE ONE OF OUR OLDER TRANSIT BUSES THAT HAS REACHED ITS USEFUL LIFE WITH A NEWER VEHICLE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: GOPASCO WILL PURCHASE A NEW TRANSIT BUS THAT MEETS OUR CURRENT NEEDS AND THE RETIRING BUS WILL BE SURPLUSED/SOLD.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: ONCE RECEIVED THE NEW BUS WILL BE PUT INTO SERVICE AND ANY FUNDS GENERATED FROM THE SALE OF THE OLD BUS WILL BE HANDLED ACCORDING TO FTA REGULATIONS. THIS PURCHASE WILL ALLOW GOPASCO TO ACHIEVE ITS TRANSIT ASSET MANAGEMENT PLAN GOALS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFICIARIES OF THESE FUNDS ARE THE GOPASCO CUSTOMERS WHO WILL BE ABLE TO RIDE IN UPDATED AND CLEANER RUNNING BUSES WITH MODERN AMENITIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES.THE RECIPIENT OR SUB-RECIPIENT (WHEN APPLICABLE) WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE).

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMBINED FY 2022 FTA SECTION 5307/5339 SUPERGRANT IS TO PROVIDE CAPITAL ASSISTANCE OPERATING ASSISTANCE ADA-PARATRANSIT OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE FOR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IN INDIAN RIVER COUNTY WHICH CONSISTS OF THE GOLINE FIXED-ROUTE SYSTEM AND THE COMMUNITY COACH DEMAND-RESPONSE SERVICE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITIES WILL REPLACE VEHICLES AND EQUIPMENT THAT HAVE EXCEEDED USEFUL LIFE REQUIREMENTS ACQUIRE AND CONSTRUCT BUS SHELTERS FOR FIXED-ROUTE SERVICE CONSTRUCT BUS STATION IMPROVEMENTS AT THE NORTH COUNTY HUB AND PERFORM MONTHLY SERVICE AND REPAIRS FOR ALL VEHICLES. THE ACTIVITIES ARE NECESSARY TO MAINTAIN A RELIABLE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM. INDIAN RIVER COUNTY WILL ENSURE THAT ALL VEHICLES PURCHASED ARE ACCESSIBLE PURCHASED FROM AN FTA APPROVED TVM AND REPORTED TO FTA WITHIN 30 DAYS AFTER CONTRACT IS SIGNED.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT INDIAN RIVER COUNTY TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SAFE AND RELIABLE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE THAT HAS BEEN IMPACTED BY MULTIPLE WAVES OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: MOST RIDERS ARE DEPENDENT ON THE GOLINE AND COMMUNITY COACH TO GET TO EMPLOYMENT SCHOOL MEDICAL SHOPPING AND TOURISM-RELATED DESTINATIONS.SUB-RECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONETHE TOTAL ELIGIBLE COST IS $3804712. THE FEDERAL SHARE IS $3804712 WHICH CONSISTS OF $3348741 IN FTA SECTION 5307 FUNDS AND $455971 IN FY22 FY21 FTA SECTION 5339 CAPITAL BUS REPLACEMENT FUNDS. COPIES OF THE FLORIDA GOVERNORS APPORTIONMENT LETTERS ARE ATTACHED FOR FY22 FTA SEC 5307 FY22 FTA SEC 5339 AND FY21 FTA SEC 5339 PROGRAMS. THIS SUPERGRANT WILL CONSIST OF $2249329 IN CAPITAL EXPENDITURES AND $1555383 IN OPERATING EXPENDITURES. THE NONFEDERAL SHARE OF OPERATING EXPENDITURES (50%) WILL BE SPLIT BETWEEN $777691.50 IN FDOT GRANTS AND $777691.50 FROM INDIAN RIVER COUNTY. OF THE TOLL REVENUE CREDIT AMOUNT $448340 SUPPORTS THE NONFEDERAL SHARE OF 5307 CAPITAL EXPENDITURES. THE GRANT INCLUDES ADMINISTRATION OF THE PROJECT AND THE PURCHASE OF ONE REPLACEMENT BUS AT OR UNDER 35-FEET WITH A WHEEL CHAIR LIFT.THE TOTAL PROJECT COST IS $608025 WITH THE NON-FEDERAL PORTION OF $121605 AND THE FEDERAL PORTION OF $486420. THE BAY COUNTY TRANSPORTATION PLANNING ORGANIZATION (TPO) WILL ENSURE THAT ALL VEHICLES PURCHASED ARE ACCESSIBLE PURCHASED FROM AN FTA APPROVED TVM AND REPORTED TO FTA WITHIN 30 DAYS AFTER CONTRACT IS SIGNED. THE BAY COUNTY TPO WILL CHECK THE CURRENT LISTING OF TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURERS (TVM) (HTTPS://WWW.TRANSIT.DOT.GOV/REGULATIONS-AND-GUIDANCE/CIVIL-RIGHTS-ADA/ELIGIVLE-TVMS-LIST) TO ENSURE EACH IS LISTED AS A CERTIFIED TVM IN COMPLIANCE WITH FTA REGULATIONS. THE GRANTEE OR SUB-GRANTEE (WHEN APPLICABLE) WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE). THE GRANTEE OR SUB-GRANTEE (WHEN APPLICABLE) WILL ENSURE CONTRACTORS PROCURED WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.

THE CAT ADMINISTRATION AND MAINTENANCE FACILITY IS LOCATED AT 8300 RADIO ROAD NAPLES FL. THE FACILITY CURRENTLY HOUSES THE TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION OFFICES MAINTENANCE AREA AND A PASSENGER TRANSFER CENTER. IT IS A MULTIMODAL FACILITY THAT SERVES BUSES PASSENGER CARS PEDESTRIANS AND BICYCLES. THE MAINTENANCE FACILITY IS A PREFABRICATED STEEL BUILDING THAT WAS CONSTRUCTED IN 1985.DUE TO THE AGE OF THE FACILITY AND THE FACT THAT LESS RESTRICTIVE BUILDING CODES WERE IN PLACE AT THE TIME OF CONSTRUCTION THE BUILDING IS SUSCEPTIBLE TO COMPLETE DESTRUCTION DURING INCLEMENT WEATHER. DURING THE LAST HURRICANE THE STRUCTURAL INTEGRITY OF THE MAINTENANCE BUILDING WAS SEVERELY TESTED WITH DAMAGES SUSTAINED TO THE ROOF AND EXTERIOR WALL MEMBRANE OF THE FACILITY. WITHOUT THE MAINTENANCE BUILDING THE TRANSIT SYSTEM WOULD BE VERY VULNERABLE.FUNDING IS NEEDED TO REFURBISH/REBUILD AND EXPAND WITH FURNISHINGS THE AGING MAINTENANCE BUILDING OPTIMIZING AVAILABLE SPACE FOR EFFECTIVE OPERATIONAL USE BUILT TO LEADERSHIP IN ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL DESIGN (LEED) STANDARDS; AND UPDATE WITH STATE-OF-THE-ART EQUIPMENT TO ACCOMMODATE INNOVATIVE MOBILITY SERVICE TO THE COMMUNITY. IN ADDITION COLLIER COUNTY IS REQUESTING FUNDING TO PURCHASE BUSES AND INTRODUCING ELECTRIC BUSES INTO THE FLEET THAT WOULD ALSO FUNCTION AS BACK POWER TO EMERGENCY FACILITIES IN THE EVENT OF EMERGENCIES; AND INSTALLATION OF SOLAR PANELS THAT WILL BE A POSITIVE IMPACT ON THE ENVIRONMENT BUT ALSO PROVIDE BACK UP ENERGY FOR THE MAINTENANCE FACILITY AND SHADE FOR BUSES.THE PTNE DIVISION AND THE COLLIER COUNTY FACILITIES MANAGEMENT DIVISION WILL PROVIDE OVERSIGHT AND PROJECT MANAGEMENT FOLLOWING THE FTA GRANT AWARD FOR THIS PROJECT. THE FEDERAL GRANT AMOUNT REQUESTED IS $9020000 (D2020-BUSC-113). THE CURRENT PROJECT TOTAL IS $11275000. THE 20% REQUIRED MATCHING SHARE FOR THE PROJECT IS BEING PROVIDED IN PART BY FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (FDOT) TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDITS (TDC) IN THE AMOUNT OF $225500.

THIS IS AN FFY 2017 SECTION 5339(B) BUSES AND BUS FACILITIES INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT PROGRAM GRANT APPLICATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $1913000. THE MANATEE COUNTY APPROVED PROGRAM OF PROJECTS EXPENDS THE FTA SECTION 5339(B) BUSES AND BUS FACILITIES INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT PROGRAM GRANT FUNDS (FEDERAL FISCAL YEAR 2017) FOR ELIGIBLE CAPITAL EXPENSES WHICH INCLUDES THE REHABILITATION OF TRANSIT BUSES AND TROLLEYS ENGINE AND TRANSMISSION REHABILITATION AND REBUILD COSTS FOR TRANSIT BUSES AND TROLLEYS IN THE EXISTING FIXED ROUTE FLEET TO EXTEND THEIR USEFUL LIFE. APPORTIONMENT FOR MANATEE COUNTY BOARD OF COUNTY COMMISSIONERS (MCAT) IS $1913000 (TABLE 1 FTA FEDERAL REGISTER).THIS GRANT FUNDING IS LISTED IN THE STIP FOR FDOT ITEM NO. 444398-1. TO MEET GRANT CRITERIA A 20% LOCAL SHARE IS REQUIRED FOR CAPITAL PROJECTS. MANATEE COUNTY HAS COORDINATED WITH FDOT ON TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDITS IN THE AMOUNT OF *$478250 TO BE USED FOR THE 20% LOCAL MATCH FOR THE CAPITAL PORTION OF THIS GRANT APPLICATION. THIS AMOUNT REPRESENTS THE REQUIRED LOCAL MATCH AS REFLECTED IN THE NOTIFICATION *(1.25 X $1913000 = $2391250 - $1913000 = $478250). THE FDOT APPROVAL LETTER WILL BE ATTACHED TO THE PROJECT INFORMATION SECTION OF THE GRANT ONCE RECEIVED. MANATEE COUNTY ACKNOWLEDGES UNDERSTANDING AND ACCEPTANCE OF CONDITION OF AWARD. MANATEE COUNTY AND/OR SUB-GRANTEE (WHEN APPLICABLE) WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE). MANATEE COUNTY WILL CHECK THE DEBARMENT AND SUSPENSION LIST TO ENSURE THAT ALL CONTRACTORS DOING WORK FOR MANATEE COUNTY ARE NOT ON THE LIST.IN ACCORDANCE WITH SECTIONS 5303 5304 AND 5336 THE SARASOTA/MANATEE METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION REQUESTS THAT THE MANATEE COUNTY BOARD OF COUNTY COMMISSIONERS (FOR MANATEE COUNTY AREA TRANSIT) AND THE SARASOTA COUNTY TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (FOR SARASOTA COUNTY AREA TRANSIT) BE THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENTS OF 5307 AND 5339 FORMULA FUNDS FOR THE SARASOTA-BRADENTON URBANIZED AREA. THE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION AS THE GOVERNORS DESIGNEE UNDER CHAPTERS 20.05(1)(A) (B) 20.23(1)(A) AND 341.051(1)(A) FLORIDA STATUTES CONCURS WITH THIS DESIGNATION. THE 5307 DESIGNATED RECIPIENT LETTER RESOLUTION AND OPINION OF COUNSEL ARE ATTACHED IN THE TRAMS RECIPIENT PROFILE.THE PERIOD FOR GRANT ACTIVITY IS OCT 1 2017 TO MAR 30 2021.

THE DISTRICT DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (DDOT) IS APPLYING FOR FFY 2019 SECTION 5339C LOW OR NO EMISSIONS GRANTS PROGRAM (LOWNO PROGRAM) FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $2600000 TO SUPPORT THE PURCHASE OF THE REPLACEMENT OF (2) TWO OBSOLESCENT DC CIRCULATOR DIESEL TRANSIT BUSES WITH BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES (BEBS) (3) CHARGERS AND (2) TWO DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS. THE NON-FEDERAL SHARE WILL BE PROVIDED BY THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA. ON JULY 26 2019 THE FISCAL YEAR 2019 LOW OR NO EMISSION GRANT PROGRAM PROJECT SELECTIONS NOTICE WAS PUBLISHED ON THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) WEBSITE ANNOUNCING THE AGENCYS SELECTION OF PROJECTS FUNDED UNDER THE LOWNO PROGRAM. IN THIS NOTICE AS DETAILED ON PAGE 4 DDOT WAS SELECTED TO RECEIVE $2600000 IN FTA FFY 2019 SECTION 5339C LOWNO PROGRAM FUNDS (D2019-LWNO-006). THE OVERALL PROJECT COST IS $29331176. A COPY OF THE COMPETITIVE APPLICATION PROPOSAL IS ATTACHED.THIS GRANT WILL NOT FULLY FUND THE PROJECT. THIS APPLICATION DOES NOT INCLUDE FUNDS FOR RESEARCH AND/OR DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES. INDIRECT COSTS WILL NOT BE APPLIED TO THIS APPLICATION AND ITS SCOPE OF WORK. THE AWARD START DATE IS THE SAME AS THE DATE OF AWARD. THE END DATE IS 12/31/28. PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO SUPPORT THE PURCHASE OF THE REPLACEMENT OF DIESEL VEHICLES WITH BATTERY ELECTRIC VEHICLES CHARGING EQUIPMENT AND DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: REPLACEMENT OF TWO VEHICLES INSTALLATION OF TWO CHARGES AND IMPLEMENTATION OF DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS TO SUPPORT ELECTRIC FLEET.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT DDOT TO SUPPORT THE REPLACEMENT OF DIESEL VEHICLES IN ITS FLEET WITH ZERO-EMISSIONS BATTERY ELECTRIC VEHICLES. IT WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE EXPANSION OF MORE SUSTAINABLE AND GREEN TRANSIT SERVICES TO HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES IN THE DISTRICT.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE REPLACEMENT OF DIESEL VEHICLES WITH NEW BATTERY-ELECTRIC VEHICLES WILL BRING SIGNIFICANT BENEFITS TO THE DISTRICT THE COMMUNITIES THAT WE SERVE THE RIDING PUBLIC AND THE REGIONS TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM PARTICULARLY IMPROVING SUSTAINABLE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AND IMPROVED AIR QUALITY. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

THE FACILITY WILL HOUSE AN EXPANDED FLEET OF BATTERY-ELECTRIC VEHICLES AND ELECTRICAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SUPPORT THE SAFETY AND RELIABILITY OF THE OVERALL DC CIRCULATOR SERVICE. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: IMPROVEMENTS TO THE SITE WILL BE UNDERTAKEN IN TWO PHASES. THE FIRST PHASE OF CONSTRUCTION WILL INCLUDE UTILITY UPGRADES (WATER AND SANITARY) ADDITIONAL CHARGING AND VEHICLE STORAGE CAPACITY PAVEMENT CURB AND GUTTER CANOPY FOUNDATIONS STRUCTURE AND UPGRADES TO ELECTRICAL INFRASTRUCTURE. THE SECOND PHASE OF CONSTRUCTION WILL INCLUDE A OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE BUILDING MAINTENANCE BAYS A WASH BAY SOLAR PANELS AND BATTERY STORAGE. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT DC CIRCULATOR TO MODERNIZE AND EXPAND THE SOUTH CAPITOL STREET FACILITY AND PROVIDE THE ABILITY TO DDOT TO TRANSITION MORE THAN HALF OF ITS FLEET TO ELECTRIC. IT WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE IMPLEMENTATION OF A NEW BUS ROUTE SERVICE IN WARD 7 EXPANDING TRANSIT OPTIONS TO A HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED COMMUNITY. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: AN EXPANDED AND CONSTRUCT SOUTH CAPITOL MAINTENANCE FACILITY WILL BRING SIGNIFICANT BENEFITS TO THE DISTRICT THE COMMUNITIES THAT WE SERVE THE RIDING PUBLIC AND THE REGIONS TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM PARTICULARLY IMPROVING SUSTAINABLE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AND IMPROVED AIR QUALITY. THE SITE WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE IMPLEMENTATION OF A NEW BUS ROUTE SERVICE IN WARD 7 EXPANDING TRANSIT OPTIONS TO AN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITY. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE THE OVERALL ESTIMATED COST OF THE PROJECT FOR PHASE 1 IS $32267126 AND FOR PHASE 2 IS $33593236. THE TOTAL ESTIMATE OF THE PROJECT IS $65860362. THIS GRANT WILL NOT FULLY FUND THE PROJECT. THIS APPLICATION DOES NOT INCLUDE FUNDS FOR RESEARCH AND/OR DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES. INDIRECT COSTS WILL NOT BE APPLIED TO THIS APPLICATION AND ITS SCOPE OF WORK. THE AWARD START DATE IS THE SAME AS THE DATE OF AWARD. THE END DATE IS 12/31/26.

WMATA ANTICIPATES A CONTRACT AWARD AND NOTICE TO PROCEED BY MARCH 2023 AND INSTALLATION STARTING IN JUNE 2023. THERE IS CURRENTLY NO CHANGE TO THE SCOPE OF WORK AND THERE IS NO CHANGE TO THE BUDGET AS PART OF THIS REVISION. ORIGINAL:APPLICATION EXECUTIVE SUMMARYTHE WASHINGTON METROPOLITAN AREA TRANSIT AUTHORITY (WMATA) IS APPLYING $3600000 (FEDERAL) OF FFY 2017 SECTION 5339 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES DISCRETIONARY FUNDS TO FUND A PORTION OF THE BUS SHELTERS REPLACEMENT PROGRAM. WMATA HAS AN INVENTORY OF 408 BUS AND KISS-AND-RIDE SHELTERS WITH 255 SHELTERS CURRENTLY IDENTIFIED IN NEED OF REPLACEMENT. THEY ARE BEYOND THEIR USEFUL LIFE AND CAN NO LONGER BE EFFECTIVELY REPAIRED. REPLACEMENT OF BUS SHELTERS WILL IMPROVE CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE GREATLY BY PROVIDING PROTECTION FROM THE WEATHER AND IMPROVE SAFETY BY PROVIDING ADDITIONAL LIGHTING AT THE BUS STOP. THE NEW SHELTER DESIGN REQUIRES VERY MINIMAL MAINTENANCE. THESE BUS SHELTERS ARE IN SUPPORT OF WMATAS FY19 CAPITAL IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (CIP). THE TOTAL FUNDING FOR THIS PROJECT IS $4500000 ($3600000 FEDERAL) TO REPLACE 33 BUS SHELTERS. THE NON-FEDERAL SHARE WILL BE PROVIDED BY THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA THE STATE OF MARYLAND AND PARTICIPATING JURISDICTIONS IN THE COMMONWEALTH OF VIRGINIA.ON JUNE 25 2018 A FEDERAL REGISTER NOTICE (FRN) WAS PUBLISHED ANNOUNCING THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATIONS SELECTION OF PROJECTS FUNDED WITH FFY 2017 SECTION 5339 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES PROGRAM DISCRETIONARY FUNDS TO FUND CAPITAL INVESTMENTS FOR BUSES BUS FACILITIES AND BUS RELATED EQUIPMENT. IN THIS FRN AS DETAILED ON PAGE 29605 THE WMATA BUS SHELTER ASSET REPLACEMENT PROGRAM PROJECT WAS LISTED AS BEING SELECTED TO RECEIVE AN ALLOCATION OF $3600000. THIS ANNOUNCEMENT BEGAN THE PRE-AWARD PERIOD FOR THE NAMED GRANTEES. THE PROJECT ID NUMBER FOR WMATA IS D2018-BUSC-028.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS AWARD WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO SUPPORT CAPITAL INVESTMENTS THAT WILL CATALYZE THE TRANSITION TO 100% ZERO-EMISSION TRANSIT BUS SERVICES FOR THE SOUTHEAST AREA TRANSIT DISTRICT (SEAT) IN CONNECTICUT.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE DESIGN WORK TO MODERNIZE AND EXPAND SEATS 42-YEAR-OLD BUS FACILITY; ACQUISITION OF TWENTY-FOUR 1:1 ELECTRICAL CHARGERS (ELECTRIC VEHICLE SUPPLY EQUIPMENT OR EVSE); AND THE PURCHASE AND DEPLOYMENT OF THE SYSTEMS FIRST TWO 40-FOOT BEBS. IN ADDITION SEAT WILL DEVELOP A WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT PLAN TO PREPARE ITS EXISTING STAFF FOR THE TRANSITION TO BEB AND IS COLLABORATING WITH CONNECTICUT STATE COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES (CSCU) TO FOSTER NEW EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES WITH THE TRANSIT DISTRICT.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WILL PROMOTE ENVIRONMENTAL EQUITY IN OVERBURDENED COMMUNITIES IN SOUTHEASTERN CT. ZERO EMISSION TECHNOLOGY WILL LOWER ADVERSE HEALTH IMPACTS FOR THIS VULNERABLE POPULATION.IMPROVEMENTS TO SEAT OPERATIONS WILL MOST BENEFIT THE URBAN CORES WHERE RIDERSHIP IS STRONGEST.THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TRAINING TO CURRENT STAFF AND CREATE NEW JOBS THROUGH SUPPLIER RELATIONSHIPS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE LOW HOUSEHOLD INCOMES AND INDIVIDUALS OF SMALL URBAN AREAS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

PROJECT 2 - 5339 (FORMULA DISTRIBUTION) THE PROJECT WILL SUPPLEMENT A STATEWIDE BATTERY ELECTRIC BUS PURCHASE OF 27 BUSES FOR THE CTTRANSIT DIVISIONS HARTFORD NEW HAVEN STAMFORD AND WATERBURY AS WELL AS OTHER OPERATORS IN THE STATE INCLUDING MILFORD TRANSIT DISTRICT ESTUARY/MIDDLETOWN AREA TRANSIT (MERGED) AND GREATER BRIDGEPORT TRANSIT TO INTRODUCE AND EXPAND THE ELECTRIC BUS PROGRAM.THE FUNDING WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE PURCHASE OF MISCELLANEOUS CAPITAL/SUPPORT EQUIPMENT AND VARIOUS NECESSARY FACILITY IMPROVEMENTS FOR CTTRANSITS HARTFORD NEW HAVEN STAMFORD AND WATERBURY DIVISIONS. PROJECT 3 - 5339 (NATIONAL DISTRIBUTION) THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE A CONTINUATION OF THE STATEWIDE BATTERY ELECTRIC BUS PURCHASE FOR THE CTTRANSIT DIVISIONS HARTFORD NEW HAVEN STAMFORD AND WATERBURY AS WELL AS OTHER OPERATORS IN THE STATE INCLUDING MILFORD TRANSIT DISTRICT ESTUARY/MIDDLETOWN AREA TRANSIT (MERGED) AND GREATER BRIDGEPORT TRANSIT TO INTRODUCE AND EXPAND THE ELECTRIC BUS PROGRAM.THE BUS PROCUREMENT IN PROJECTS 2 3 ARE THE SAME. THEY HAVE BEEN BROKEN OUT TO SEPARATE THE FTA SECTION 5339 FORMULA DISTRIBUTION AND THE NATIONAL DISTRIBUTION. CTDOT WILL UPDATE THIS GRANT VIA BUDGET REVISION AS NEEDED ONCE BUS PROCUREMENT PLANS HAVE BEEN FINALIZED TO ENSURE ACCURATE QUANTITIES AND/OR LOCATION OF VEHICLE.PROJECT 4 - 5337 (HARTFORD AREA) FUNDING WILL SUPPORT THE FACILITY IMPROVEMENTS/UPGRADES TO CTTRANSIT HARTFORDS H2 BUILDING. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: A TOTAL OF 39 BEBS WILL BE PURCHASED FOR CTTRANSIT DIVISIONS AND OTHER OPERATORS STATEWIDE INCLUDING MILFORD TRANSIT DISTRICT MIDDLETOWN AREA TRANSIT AND GREATER BRIDGEPORT TRANSIT REPLACING BUSES THAT HAVE EXCEEDED THEIR USEFUL LIFE BENCHMARK AND DEPLOYING ZERO EMISSION BEBS IN THEIR PLACE. ONGOING FACILITY IMPROVEMENTS/UPGRADES RELATED TO THE ELECTRIFICATION OF CTTRANSIT HARTFORDS H2 BUILDING.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ALL COMMUNITIES WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED AIR QUALITY RESULTING FROM DECREASED CARBON EMISSIONS AND HAVE THE EQUAL POTENTIAL TO BENEFIT FROM MORE RELIABLE SERVICE DUE TO RANDOM BUS ASSIGNMENT POLICIES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

THE CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION IS REQUESTING THE FOLLOWING FUNDS FOR THE DEPLOYMENT OF BATTERY ELECTRIC BUS (BEB) DEPLOYMENT AT CTTRANSIT BUS DEPOT IN WATERBURY:* $7404210 (FEDERAL); $8882188 (TOTAL) OF SECTION 5339 FUNDS AWARDED TO THE DEPARTMENT THROUGH THE FY 2021 LOW OR NO EMISSIONS GRANT PROGRAM AND * $3660592 (FEDERAL); $4575740 (TOTAL) OF PRIOR YEAR SECTION 5307 FORMULA FUNDS. (OLDEST FUNDS AVAILABLE.) PURPOSE: CTDOT WILL LEVERAGE $4575740 IN 5307 FUNDING (FEDERAL SHARE: $3660592 LOCAL MATCH: $915148) COMMITTED FOR FIXED ROUTE BUS REPLACEMENTS. 5307 FUNDING WILL BE USED TO COVER THE BASE COST OF THE BUSES (I.E. COST OF A COMPARABLE DIESEL OR DIESEL-ELECTRIC HYBRID BUS PLUS APPLICABLE LABOR) AS WELL AS BUS CONFIGURATIONS WHILE LOW-NO FUNDING WILL BE USED FOR INCREMENTAL COST AND ALL COSTS RELATED TO ELECTRICAL FACILITY DESIGN AND PROCUREMENT OF THE ELECTRICAL SERVICE AND CHARGING EQUIPMENT AT THE CTTRANSIT WATERBURY DEPOT AS WELL AS WORKFORCE TRAINING AND CONSULTANT SERVICES FROM CTE TO SUPPORT THE BEB DEPLOYMENT. MATCHING FUNDS WILL BE PROVIDED AS STATE DOT BOND FUNDS.AS A RESULT THE LOW-NO PROJECT BUDGET IS BASED ON THE INCREMENTAL COST OF $5173260 FOR TEN BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES ($517326 PER BUS) PLUS $1900000 FOR THE COST OF FACILITY UPGRADES $1084600 FOR THE COST OF PROCUREMENT AND INSTALLATION OF CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE $365000 FOR PROJECT MANAGEMENT SERVICES AND $36000 FOR WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: CTDOT WILL DEPLOY TEN (10) BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES (BEBS) IN THE WATERBURY DIVISION OF THE CTTRANSIT SYSTEM. THESE WILL BE A ONE-FOR-ONE REPLACEMENT FOR TEN (10) EXISTING DIESEL 35 BUSES AT THEIR WATERTOWN BUS DEPOT JUST NORTH OF WATERBURY. EQUALLY AS IMPORTANT WILL BE THE PREPARATION OF FACILITY INFRASTRUCTURE TO HANDLE FUTURE 100% ELECTRIFICATION OF THE TRANSIT AND PARATRANSIT FLEET. MAJOR PROJECT ELEMENTS INCLUDE A LARGE EXPANSION OF THE FACILITYS ELECTRICAL SERVICE THAT CONNECTS IT TO THE ELECTRICITY UTILITY PROVIDER EVERSOURCE; INSTALLATION OF FACILITY SWITCHGEAR AND BREAKER PANELS TO SUPPORT THE CHARGING OF THE TEN (10) BEBS; AND TEN (10) DC FAST CHARGERS. THE PROJECT ALSO INCLUDES UPSIZING OF THE FIRE SUPPRESSION SYSTEM AND OTHER ASSOCIATED FACILITY SYSTEMS.EXPECTED OUTCOME: DEPLOYING THE ZERO-EMISSION BUSES IN PLACE OF THE EXISTING VEHICLES WILL REDUCE CTDOTS ANNUAL GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS BY APPROXIMATELY 770 TONS AND PREVENT THE RELEASE OF 18.4 POUNDS (LBS.) PARTICULATE MATTER UNDER 10 MICROMETERS (PM10) ANNUALLY 17.2 LBS. OF WHICH IS FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) WHICH HAS A CONSIDERABLE HEALTH IMPACT ON THE LOCAL COMMUNITY. THIS REDUCTION IN EMISSIONS OF GREENHOUSE GASES AND PARTICULATES RESULTS IN A SOCIAL COST SAVINGS OF $40500 ANNUALLY IN ACCORDANCE WITH EXECUTIVE ORDER 13990.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: POPULACE OF THE WATERBURY SERVICE AREA.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A
