COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (CDOT) APPLIES FOR $12000000 OF FY2019 5339(B) FUNDS FOR THE WINTER PARK LIFT OPERATIONS FACILITY CONSTRUCTION PROJECT. THE DISCRETIONARY ID IS D2020-BUSC-020.LOCAL MATCHING FUNDS COMES FROM THE TOWN OF WINTER PARKS DEDICATED SALES TAX REVENUE FOR TRANSIT AND OTHER REVENUE SOURCES INCLUDING FUNDS FROM OTHER MUNICIPALITIES AND A GRANT FROM COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (CDOT). THE DISCRETIONARY GRANT INCLUDED AN APPROXIMATELY 58.5% FEDERAL SHARE AND 41.5% LOCAL SHARE $12000000 FEDERAL AND $8500000 LOCAL FOR A TOTAL OF $20500000. AT THIS TIME THE OVERALL PROJECT COST HAS INCREASED TO OVER $26000000 DUE TO DELAYS AND INCREASES IN SUPPLY COSTS DUE TO COVID-19 AND LOCAL FIRES THAT OCCURRED IN 2020. SOME OF THE ADDITIONAL COSTS WILL BE COVERED BY LOCAL FUNDS AND WINTER PARK IS LOOKING FOR OTHER SOURCES TO HELP WITH THE OVERAGE. ONLY THE FUNDS AWARDED IN THE DISCRETIONARY GRANT ARE INCLUDED IN THIS AWARD. AT GRANT CLOSEOUT THE FULL PROJECT COSTS WILL NEED TO BE REPORTED TO DETERMINE THE FEDERAL SHARE OF THE ASSETS.CDOT THE DIRECT RECIPIENT OF THESE FUNDS ASSUMES ALL RESPONSIBILITY ASSOCIATED WITH THE AWARD FOR THE FUNDS.PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY IS SELECTED FOR THIS GRANT FOR CONTRACTING PURPOSES ONLY. THE TOWN OF WINTER PARK HAS PUBLISHED A REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL IN DECEMBER 2020 AND SELECTED CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT GENERAL CONTRACTING (CMGC) TEAM. THE FOLLOWING SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS ARE INCLUDED:- SCOPE OF WORK - COMPETITIVE AWARD APPLICATION- NOTICE OF AWARD- FINAL CATEX AND APPROVAL LETTER

PURPOSE OF THE AWARD THIS SUPERGRANT WILL UTILIZE SEC 5307 AND LAPSING SEC 5339 FORMULA FUNDS TO CONTINUE TO FUND DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF MOUNTAIN METROS TRANSIT CAMPUS EXPANSION PROJECT. THIS PROJECT INCLUDES CONSTRUCTING A NEW 72000 SQUARE FOOT STRUCTURE LOCATED AT 1190 TRANSIT DRIVE IN COLORADO SPRINGS COLORADO. THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES LAPSING FUNDS.THE $12065582 FEDERAL TOTAL IS COMPOSED OF THE FOLLOWING AMOUNTS:PROJECT 1 - SEC 5307 FUNDS$ 6822436 - FY2017 SEC 5307 (FULL APPORTIONMENT) $ 3473178 - FY2018 SEC 5307 (PARTIAL APPORTIONMENT WHICH WILL LEAVE A REMAINING UNOBLIGATED BALANCE OF $3454525)$10295614 - TOTAL SEC 5307 FUNDS PROJECT 2 - SEC 5339 FORMULA FUNDS$ 917415 - FY2018 5339 LAPSING (FULL APPORTIONMENT)$ 852553 - FY2019 5339 (FULL APPORTIONMENT)$1769968 - TOTAL SEC 5339 FUNDSTHE APPROXIMATE TOTAL COST OF THE FULL PROJECT IS $16.0M. ADDITIONAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $948481 IS PROVIDED FOR THIS PROJECT THROUGH APPLICATION #CO-2021-005-00 THE FY2017 SECTION DISCRETIONARY 5339(B) GRANT. PLEASE SEE THE FUNDING MATRIX THAT HAS BEEN UPLOADED IN TRAMS FOR MORE DETAIL. THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES $831500 FOR LOCAL IN-KIND CONTRIBUTION TOWARDS THE LOCAL SHARE OF THE PROJECT. THIS PARCEL OF PROPERTY ORIGINALLY OWNED BY THE CITY OF COLORADO SPRINGS WAS DONATED TO MOUNTAIN METRO TRANSIT FOR USE IN CONSTRUCTION OF THE FACILITY. MMT RECEIVED CONCURRENCE ON THIS DONATION FROM THE FTA ON NOVEMBER 6 2019. THE LETTER IS ATTACHED IN THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS. PROJECT RELATED DOCUMENTS INCLUDING STIP APPROVED NEPA DOCUMENTS AND OTHER MATERIALS ARE UPLOADED INTO TRAMS. PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY IS REQUESTED IN CONNECTION WITH DESIGN AND PRE-CONSTRUCTION ACTIVITIES THAT HAVE BEEN UNDERTAKEN PRIOR TO GRANT AWARD DATE.MMT WILL USE AT LEAST 1% PERCENT OF THE INCLUDED SEC 5307 FUNDING TOWARDS SECURITY AND SURVEILLANCE EQUIPMENT FENCING AND OTHER UPGRADES AS NEEDED TO INCREASE THE SAFETY AND SECURITY OF THE TRANSIT OPERATIONS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES INCLUDE DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF THE FACILITY EXPANSION PROJECT. MORE DETAILS ARE PROVIDED IN THE PROJECT DESCRIPTIONS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE FACILITY EXPANSION WILL PROVIDE MMT WITH INCREASED VEHICLE MAINTENANCE AND STORAGE CAPACITY IN ORDER TO MEET OPERATIONAL NEEDS FOR PROVIDING TRANSIT IN THE GROWING COLORADO SPRINGS REGION INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE MMT AND ITS EMPLOYEES IN ORDER BETTER ULTIMATELY SERVE TRANSIT PATRONS OF THE COLORADO SPRINGS REGION.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NO SUBRECIPIENTS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS AWARD.

BUDGET REVISION #1 - 6/2/2022IN THE FY2021 4TH QUARTER MPR MMT ESTIMATED THE DELIVERY OF THE CHARGERS WOULD BE MAY OF 2022 HOWEVER PROTERRA INFORMED US THE DELIVERY IS ANTICIPATED TO BE SEPTEMBER-OCTOBER OF 2022. PER PROTERRA THIS DELAY IS DUE TO A MICROCHIP SHORTAGE AND SUPPLY CHAIN ISSUES PROTERRA DOESNT EXPECT ANY FURTHER DELAYS. THE 2 BEBS PURCHASED THROUGH THIS GRANT ARE CURRENTLY BEING CHARGED WITH THE CHARGERS THAT WERE PURCHASED THROUGH THE COLORADO SETTLEMENT/FASTER FUNDING AND ARE OUT IN REVENUE SERVICE.THE CURRENT PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE IS 6/30/2022 HOWEVER DUE TO THE DELAYED DELIVERY MMT WILL NEED AN EXTENSION OF THE POP. AN UPDATED POP OF 12/31/2022 WOULD BE A SUFFICIENT AMOUNT OF TIME TO ENSURE DELIVERY AND FINAL INVOICE. ------------------------------------------------------------ORIGINAL AWARD:THIS IS MOUNTAIN METROPOLITAN TRANSITS FFY2019 DISCRETIONARY 5339(B) APPLICATION IN THE FULL AMOUNT OF $1621500 TO FUND TWO (2) EXPANSION BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES AND TWO (2) CHARGING UNITS. THE TOTAL PROJECT COST IS $2565048. MMT HAS CHOSEN TO COMMIT A HIGHER AMOUNT OF LOCAL MATCH TO STRATEGICALLY LEVERAGE AVAILABLE FUNDING. THE GRANT WILL BE FUNDED AT A COST SHARING RATIO OF 63.2% FEDERAL AND 36.8% LOCAL MATCH. THIS REPRESENTS A GREATER LOCAL MATCH THAN THE 25% LOCAL MATCH THAT WAS PROPOSED IN MMTS ORIGINAL DISCRETIONARY APPLICATION A COPY OF WHICH IS ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION.PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY IS REQUESTED STARTING AS OF JULY 13 2020 WHICH IS AFTER THE DATE OF THE PROJECT SELECTION NOTICE DATED MARCH 2 2020. HOWEVER NO COSTS WERE INCURRED UNTIL MARCH 25 2021 WHICH COINCIDES WITH THE DATE THE OPTION TO CONTRACT FOR THE VEHICLES WAS EXECUTED. ON MARCH 25 2021 THE AMOUNT OF $1523803 IN THIS APPLICATION WAS OBLIGATED.THE BUSES AND EQUIPMENT FUNDED IN THIS APPLICATION ARE CLEARED AS A CATEGORICAL EXCLUSION.THE PROJECT IS INCLUDED IN THE TIP/STIP WITH APPROPRIATE DOCUMENTATION ATTACHED.THE ORIGINAL DISCRETIONARY APPLICATION IS UPLOADED IN ATTACHED DOCUMENTS.THE NOFO AND PROJECT SELECTION FEDERAL REGISTER NOTICES ARE UPLOADED IN TRAMS. THE DISCRETIONARY ID FOR THIS PROJECT IS D2020-BUSC-015 AS DOCUMENTED IN PROJECT SELECTION NOTICE.

BUDGET REVISION #1 5/31/2022: RTD IS REQUESTING TO EXTEND THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE THROUGH 12/31/2023. RTD AWARDED A CONTRACT TO NEW FLYER OF AMERICA FOR THE PURCHASE OF BUSES AND SPARE PARTS WHICH ARE NOT EXPECTED TO BE DELIVERED UNTIL THE SECOND QUARTER OF 2023. BIDS FOR CHARGING STATIONS WERE DUE IN MID-APRIL 2022 AND CONTRACT WILL BE AWARDED ONCE THEY ARE REVIEWED. THE EXTENSION WILL ALLOW TIME FOR THE RECEIPT OF THE ELECTRIC BUSES SPARE PARTS AND PURCHASE/INSTALL OF CHARGING STATIONS. ------------------------------------------------ORIGINAL AWARD:RTD IS APPLYING FOR THE FULL AMOUNT OF DISCRETIONARY FY 2019 SEC 5339 LOW-NO FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $2600000. AS ANNOUNCED IN THE JULY 26 2019 FEDERAL REGISTER (DISCRETIONARY ID #D2019-LWNO-005). THE FEDERAL FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PURCHASE TWO ELECTRIC BUSES AND SPARE PARTS AND FIVE CHARGING STATIONS AS WELL AS IMPLEMENTATION ASSISTANCE FROM CTE. THE TWO ELECTRIC VEHICLES FUNDED IN THE GRANT ARE PART OF THE LARGER OVERALL PROCUREMENT FOR SEVENTEEN ELECTRIC VEHICLES CONSISTENT WITH RTDS DISCRETIONARY APPLICATION. THE SEC 5339 LOW-NO FUNDS ALLOW RTD AND CDOT TO LEVERAGE THE STATES VOLKSWAGON SETTLEMENT FUNDS OF $8542500 TO MEET THE ENTIRE PROCUREMENT OF SEVENTEEN (17) ELECTRIC BUSES CONSISTENT WITH THE COMMITMENTS RTD MADE IN THE DISCRETIONARY APPLICATION (ATTACHED). THE LOCAL MATCH WILL ALSO CONSIST OF RTDS SALES AND USE TAX DOLLARS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PROJECT WILL BE USED BY ASUCD-UNITRANS (WHICH IS A UNIT OF THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA DAVIS AND SUB-RECIPIENT TO THE CITY OF DAVIS PROVIDING TRANSIT SERVICE FOR THE CITY OF DAVIS AND UC DAVIS) AND BY THE CITY OF DAVIS (FOR PARATRANSIT SERVICE).; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS FROM THIS AWARD WILL BE USED BY ASUCD-UNITRANS (SUB-RECIPIENT) TO PURCHASE ELECTRIC BUSES TO REPLACE CNG BUSES THAT HAVE SURPASSED THEIR USEFUL LIVES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE CONTINUITY OF FIXED ROUTE TRANSIT SERVICE IMPROVED SYSTEM RELIABILITY IMPROVED EFFICIENCY REDUCED OPERATING AND MAINTENANCE COSTS AND COMPLIANCE WITH ELECTRIC CONVERSION REGULATIONS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE RESIDENTS AND VISITORS TO THE CITY OF DAVIS THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA-DAVIS AND TRANSIT CUSTOMERS WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM CONTINUED SERVICE THAT IS RELIABLE AND MORE SUSTAINABLE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: ALL ACTIVITIES WILL BE UNDERTAKEN BY THE CITYS SUB-RECIPIENT THE REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA-DAVIS THROUGH ITS OPERATING UNIT ASUCD-UNITRANS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO CONTINUE CONSTRUCTION OF A BUS TRANSFER HUB IN HESPERIA.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: CONSTRUCTION OF A BUS SHELTER FOR TWELVE (12) BUS PARKING SPACES CIVIL -ROADWAY IMPROVEMENTS SIDEWALK INSTALLATION LANDSCAPING AND AN APPROXIMATELY 2500 SQUARE-FOOT BUILDING THAT WOULD HOUSE SIX (6) RESTROOMS AND A SECURITY CONTROL ROOM. THE PROJECT WOULD SERVE AS PASSENGER LOADING AREAS FOR VVTAS EXISTING AND FUTURE BUS FLEET.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL ALLOW VVTA TO CONSTRUCT A TRANSFER HUB THAT WILL ALLOW THE AGENCY TO PROVIDE SAFE RELIABLE TRANSIT SERVICE.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: RIDERS IN THE VICTOR VALLEY COMMUNITY WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: FUNDS ARE REQUESTED FOR BUS STOP IMPROVEMENTS AT SEVERAL LOCATIONS IN THE IMPERIAL COUNTY REGION.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: BUS STOP IMPROVEMENTS AT VARIOUS BUS STOPS IN THE IMPERIAL COUNTY REGION. IMPROVEMENTS INCLUDE ADDING BUS SHELTERS BENCHES TRASH ENCLOSURES AND ADDING ACCESSIBLE SIDEWALK AND LOADING PADS AT BUS STOPS LOCATIONS AS NECESSARY. SEVERAL BUS STOP LOCATIONS WILL REQUIRE A SHELTER AND A BENCH BECAUSE THEY CURRENTLY ONLY HAVE THE BUS STOP SIGNAL POST. OTHER BUS STOPS ALREADY HAVE A BENCH IN PLACE AND WILL ONLY REQUIRE THE SHELTER TO BE ADDED ALONG WITH A TRASH CAN ENCLOSURE. ICTC WILL ALSO PURSUE SOLAR LIGHTING FOR THE SHELTERS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: IMPROVING BUS STOP FACILITIES IS ALWAYS A PRIORITY FOR ANY TRANSIT AGENCY. BUS SHELTERS PROVIDE PASSENGERS WITH PROTECTION FROM THE WEATHER ESPECIALLY IN THE IMPERIAL COUNTY REGION WHERE WE ARE SUSCEPTIBLE TO HIGH TEMPERATURES AND SHADE IS REQUIRED AT A EVERY BUS STOP. BUS SHELTERS MAKE WAITING FOR THE BUS MORE PLEASANT AND EVEN REDUCE THE PERCEIVED WAITING TIME FOR THE AVERAGE RIDER. THE IMPROVEMENTS ON THE TARGETED BUS STOPS WILL MAKE THE STOPS SAFER AND MORE RELIABLE FOR RIDERS WHO DEPEND ON THE FIXED-ROUTE SYSTEM FOR THEIR EVERYDAY TRANSPORTATION NEEDS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE DAILY PASSENGER WOULD BENEFIT THE MOST FROM BUS STOP IMPROVEMENTS WITHIN THEIR AREA BECAUSE IT WILL PROVIDE A MORE SAFE AND PLEASANT EXPERIENCE WHILE WAITING FOR THE BUS. SENIORS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES WILL HAVE A MORE STABLE LOCATION TO WAIT FOR THE BUS. THE AGENCY WILL ALSO BENEFIT BECAUSE BUS SHELTERS PROMOTE PUBLIC TRANSIT IN GENERAL BY PROVIDING COMMUTERS A SAFE SPACE TO WAIT FOR THE BUS. THIS WILL IMPROVE THE OVERALL TRANSPORTATION EXPERIENCE AND MAY EVEN CHANGE PEOPLES PERCEPTION OF RIDING THE BUS. DUE TO THE INCREASED COMFORT THAT IT PROVIDES A DESIGNATED WAITING SPOT ENCOURAGES MORE PEOPLE TO RIDE THE BUS OR SELECT OTHER MODES OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE FUNDS IN THIS GRANT ALLOW OMNITRANS TO PURCHASE FOUR HYDROGEN-FUEL CELL POWERED BUSES AND RELATED INFRASTRUCTURE. THE BUSES WILL REPLACE FOUR 40-FOOT CNG-FUELED BUSES THAT HAVE REACHED THE END OF LIFE. THIS PROJECT ALLOWS OMNITRANS TO CONTINUE ITS IMPLEMENTATION OF OUR ZERO EMISSIONS FLEET STRATEGY.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDING WILL PERMIT OMNITRANS TO PURCHASE THE REPLACEMENT OF FOUR 40-FOOT CNG-POWERED BUSES WITH FOUR 40 FOOT HYDROGEN-FUEL CELL POWERED BUSES AND RELATED INFRASTRUCTURE TO FUEL AND MAINTAIN THE BUSES. THE FUNDING WILL ALSO ALLOW OMNITRANS TO DO DO WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT BY TRAINING INTERNS ON PROPULSION SYSTEMS AND VEHICLE MAINTENANCE.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT OMNITRANS TO PURCHASE THE REPLACEMENT OF FOUR 40 -OOT HYDROGEN-FUEL CELL POWERED BUSES. THE BUSES WILL ALLOW OMNITRANS CONTINUE TO PROVIDE OPERATIONS AND KEEP ROLLING STOCK VEHICLES IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR. THE FUNDS WIL ALSO BE USED TO BUY A PORTABLE HYDROGEN STATION TO FUEL THE BUSES. LASTLY THE FUNDS ALLOW OMNITRANS TO DEVELOP A FUTURE WORKFORCE BY TRAINING INTERNS ON A NEW PROPULSION SYSTEM.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: OMNITRANS AND THE RIDERS THAT RELY ON ITS SERVICE WILL BENEFIT FROM CONTINUED SERVICES PERMITTING RIDERS TO GET TO WORK AND OTHER DESTINATIONS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR TWO PROJECTS: (1) ROLLING STOCK PROCUREMENT AND (2) WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT.THE PROCUREMENT OF SIX (6) ZERO-EMISSION BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES (BEBS) RELATED TRANSIT EQUIPMENT AND ELECTRIC VEHICLE CHARGING STATIONS. THE PROJECT DEDICATES 5% FOR WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FLEET ELECTRIFICATION IS CRITICAL FOR NVTA TO MEET ITS 2040 VISION OF A ZERO-EMISSION FLEET IN ORDER TO REDUCE OVERALL ENERGY USE AND GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: NAPA COUNTY COMMUNITIES- CITY OF AMERICAN CANYON NAPA ST. HELENA CALISTOGA THE TOWN OF YOUNTVILLE THE COUNTY OF NAPA RESIDENTS BUSINESSES AND VISITORS TO THE REGION.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO MAKE IMPROVEMENTS TO THE AGENCYS FLEET.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS IN THIS GRANT WILL BE USED TO PURCHASE TWO (2) REPLACEMENT PARATRANSIT VEHICLES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: ACTIVITIES PERFORMED IN THIS GRANT WILL INCREASE RIDERSHIP AND SYSTEM RELIABILITY BY IMPROVING SAFETY AND COMFORT AND REDUCE MAINTENANCE COSTS BY REPLACING OLDER VEHICLES WITH NEW ONES. ; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: LOCAL RESIDENTS AND BUSINESSES WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT AS VVTA RIDERS WILL HAVE ENHANCED TRANSIT OPTIONS FOR LOCAL RIDERS PROVIDING RIDES TO LOCAL BUSINESS AND SCHOOLS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST FY2021 SECTION 5339 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE SANTA CRUZ AND WATSONVILLE UZAS IN THE AMOUNT OF $524355 FOR FLEET WIDE INSTALLATION OF AUTOMATED PASSENGER COUNTER (APC) SYSTEM FOR BUSES. METRO HAS A NEED FOR AN APC SYSTEM FOR BUSES. METRO CURRENTLY RELIES ON MANUAL SURVEYS TO GATHER SAMPLES OF PASSENGER BOARDING AND ALIGHTING INFORMATION.APCS ON BUSES ARE A CORE TECHNOLOGY PLATFORM THROUGHOUT THE TRANSIT INDUSTRY THAT WILL HELP METRO OPTIMIZE EFFICIENCY ENHANCE SERVICE AND FACILITIES PLANNING AND IMPROVE CUSTOMER SAFETY AND RELIABILITY. THE PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION OF AN AUTOMATED ROBUST AND SCALABLE RIDERSHIP DATA MANAGEMENT AND ANALYTICS SOFTWARE PLATFORM A FIRST FOR METRO WILL ALLOW STAFF TO COLLECT REAL TIME BOARDING AND ALIGHTING INFORMATION ON 100% OF ITS FLEET. CURRENTLY RIDERSHIP INFORMATION IS ONLY AVAILABLE ON AN EXTREMELY LIMITED BASIS THROUGH MANUALLY-CONDUCTED SURVEYS. APCS WILL REMOVE MANY OF THE CURRENT MANUAL DATA ENTRY STEPS REQUIRED FOR COLLECTING RIDERSHIP DATA WHILE ALLEVIATING LABORIOUS DATA PROCESSING ACTIVITIES AND DATA MANIPULATION. APCS WILL ALSO HELP AUTOMATE FUTURE FTA NATIONAL TRANSIT DATABASE (NTD) AND INTERNAL RIDERSHIP REPORTING.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL COVER ALL CAPITAL EXPENSES RELATED TO FLEET WIDE INSTALLATION OF APCS.METRO HAS ALREADY DEVELOPED SPECIFICATIONS IN HOUSE AND PREPARED BID DOCUMENTS. METRO ALSO SOLICITED BIDS FOR THIS PROJECT AND AWARDED INSTALLATION AND CONSTRUCTION CONTRACTS TO THE MOST RESPONSIVE AND RESPONSIBLE BIDS. THE CONTRACTOR WILL START INSTALLATION AND CONSTRUCTION. ONCE CONSTRUCTION COMPLETED METRO WILL SUBMIT FINAL REPORT AND CLOSE FTA GRANT. ; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL ALLOW METRO INSTALL APCS ON ITS BUSES. THE INFORMATION COLLECTED WILL PROVIDE METRO WITH A RICH DATASET THAT STAFF CAN USE TO OPTIMIZE IMMEDIATE CAPITAL AND SERVICE PLANNING NEEDS. TWO YEARS INTO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC METRO RIDERSHIP HAS ONLY RECOVERED TO HALF OF ITS PREPANDEMIC LEVELS. FUTURE SERVICE FLEET AND FACILITY NEEDS DEPEND ON OBTAINING ACCURATE RIDERSHIP INFORMATION ON WHERE AND WHEN CUSTOMERS ARE BOARDING. THE INFORMATION COLLECTED FROM APCS WILL HELP STAFF PLAN AND OPTIMIZE:1. ROUTE AND SERVICE CHANGES2. VEHICLE ASSIGNMENTS AND CROWDING3. THE BUS REPLACEMENT PLAN AND FUTURE FLEET NEEDS4. FACILITY NEEDS INCLUDING THE PROPOSED SOUTH COUNTY BUS DIVISION; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: POPULATION OF THE THE SANTA CRUZ COUNTY SERVICE AREA WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS ON WHICH VEHICLE THEY FEEL COMFORTABLE RIDING. HAVING A FLEET THAT IS 100% APC-EQUIPPED WILL PROVIDE ACCURATE PASSENGER LOAD INFORMATION (PLI) FOR PASSENGERS ON ALL BUSES ENHANCING SERVICE QUALITY AND BOOSTING CUSTOMER CONFIDENCE IN METRO SERVICES DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC AND AFTER. FUTURE SERVICE FLEET AND FACILITY NEEDS DEPEND ON OBTAINING ACCURATE RIDERSHIP INFORMATION ON WHERE AND WHEN CUSTOMERS ARE BOARDING.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR ONE PROJECT: THE PROCUREMENT OF EIGHT (8) ZERO-EMISSION BATTERY (ZEB) ELECTRIC BUSES RELATED TRANSIT EQUIPMENT AND ELECTRIC VEHICLE CHARGING STATIONS. THE NEW ZEBS WILL REPLACE EIGHT UNLEADED AND DIESEL REVENUE SERVICE BUSES IN VINE TRANSITS FLEET THAT ARE WELL BEYOND THE END OF THEIR USEFUL LIVES. THE NEW BUSES WILL BE PLACED IN HIGH-CAPACITY SERVICE ROUTES THAT SERVE THE REGION AND CONNECT TO OTHER TRANSIT SERVICES IN THE GREATER BAY AREA.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: NVTA WILL PROCURE EIGHT (8) ZERO-EMISSION BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES TO REPLACE EIGHT DIESEL AND GASOLINE BUSES THAT HAVE OUTLIVED THEIR USEFUL LIVES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FLEET ELECTRIFICATION IS CRITICAL FOR NVTA TO MEET ITS 2040 VISION OF A ZERO-EMISSION FLEET IN ORDER TO REDUCE OVERALL ENERGY USE AND GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: NAPA COUNTY COMMUNITIES- CITY OF AMERICAN CANYON NAPA ST. HELENA CALISTOGA THE TOWN OF YOUNTVILLE THE COUNTY OF NAPA RESIDENTS BUSINESSES AND VISITORS TO THE REGION.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

OVERALL GRANT FUNDING:FY 2021 SECTION 5339 BAKERSFIELD UZA (069530): $500000TOTAL FEDERAL FUNDS (SECTION 5339): $500000OVERALL GRANT FUNDINGTOTAL FEDERAL FUNDS: $500000TOTAL LOCAL (TDA) MATCH: $125000TOTAL ELIGIBLE PROJECT COST: $625000GOLDEN EMPIRE TRANSIT IS HEREBY SUBMITTING THIS GRANT APPLICATION TO REQUEST SECTION 5339 ($500000) FUNDS IN SUPPORT OF THE FOLLOWING CAPITAL PROJECT.FIVE (5) REPLACEMENT CNG PARA-TRANSIT BUSES: THIS PROJECT WAS INCLUDED IN THE 2021 FTIP AMENDMENT NO. 5 (KER210814) WHICH THE FEDERAL APPROVAL ON AUGUST 13 2021.THIS GRANT APPLIES TO THE REPLACEMENT OF LIKE-KIND EQUIPMENT. THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST FFY2020 AND FFY2021 SECTION 5339 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE SAN LUIS OBISPO (UZA #063130) ARROYO GRANDE-GROVER BEACH (UZA #061960) AND PASO ROBLES-ATASCADERO (UZA #064140) IN THE AMOUNT OF $390000. FUNDING FOR ALL PROJECTS INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION IS PROVIDED BY THE FOLLOWING APPORTIONMENT YEARS AND URBANIZED AREAS (UZAS):FFY20 5339 SAN LUIS OBISPO (UZA #063130): $141057FFY20 5339 ARROYO GRANDE-GROVER BEACH (UZA #061960): $107535FFY20 5339 PASO ROBLES-ATASCADERO (UZA #064140): $128577TOTAL FEDERAL FY20 5339: $377169FFY21 5339 ARROYO GRANDE-GROVER BEACH (UZA #061960): $12831TOTAL FEDERAL FY21 5339: $12831OVERALL GRANT FUNDINGTOTAL FEDERAL FUNDS: $390000TOTAL LOCAL MATCH (STATE TRANSIT ASSISTANCE AND TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT ACT): $97500 TOTAL ELIGIBLE PROJECT COST: $487500THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES SECTION 5339 FUNDING TO PROVIDE CAPITAL ASSISTANCE AND BUS REHABILITATION AND OVERHAUL ACTIVITIES. THE APPLICATION SCOPE OF WORK INCLUDES REIMBURSEMENT OF COSTS FOR FLEET REPLACEMENT CAPITAL ASSISTANCE AND BUS REHABILITATION AND OVERHAUL ACTIVITIES FROM THE PASO ROBLES-ATASCADERO UZA (#064140) THE SAN LUIS OBISPO UZA (#063130) AND THE ARROYO GRANDE-GROVER BEACH UZA (#061960). THE SAN LUIS OBISPO REGIONAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY (RTA) IS REQUESTING FTA SECTION 5339 FORMULA FUNDS FROM FFY20 AND FFY21 TO SUPPORT THE FOLLOWING PROJECTS: 1.ROLLING STOCK: THIS GRANT INCLUDES $90000 IN FY20 SECTION 5339 FUNDING FOR THE REPLACEMENT OF ONE (1) 2015 FORD E450 STARCRAFT GASOLINE-POWERED VEHICLE FOR THE NIPOMO DIAL-A-RIDE SERVICE FOR THE COUNTY. THE VEHICLE BEING REPLACED HAS MET ITS USEFUL LIFE OF 4 YEARS AND/OR 100000 MILES PRIOR TO DELIVERY OF THE REPLACEMENT VEHICLE AND WILL BE DISPOSED OF IN ACCORDANCE TO FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS. THE RTA WILL CONTRACT WITH A THIRD-PARTY PROVIDER FOR THE PROCUREMENT OF THIS VEHICLE AND ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH ALL APPLICABLE CLEAN AIR ACT STANDARDS (CAA) AND THE AMERICANS DISABILITIES ACT (ADA) REQUIREMENTS. THE RTA PLANS TO USE A COOPERATIVE PROCUREMENT TO PURCHASE THE VEHICLE WHICH IS CONSISTENT WITH USING ONE OF THE FAST ACT INNOVATIVE PROCUREMENT METHODS FOR A PROCUREMENT OF FOUR OR FEWER VEHICLES.2.REHABILITATION AND OVERHAUL: THIS GRANT ALSO INCLUDES $300000 IN FY20 AND FY21 SECTION 5339 FUNDING TO PROVIDE THE CRITICAL ENGINE REHABILITATION AND OVERHAUL SERVICES FOR FOUR (4) HEAVY-DUTY DIESEL 2015 BUSES THAT ARE NEARING THE 500000 MILES USEFUL LIFE STANDARD AND ARE EXPERIENCING SIGNIFICANT MECHANICAL ISSUES RESULTING IN COSTLY REPAIRS. THE RTA WILL CONTRACT OUT THESE ENGINE REHABILITATION AND OVERHAUL SERVICES TO A THIRD-PARTY AND WILL ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH ALL APPLICABLE CLEAN AIR ACT STANDARDS (CAA) AND FTA PROCUREMENT REQUIREMENTS.PURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THIS FUNDING IS TO SUPPORT A VEHICLE REPLACEMENT CAPITAL PROJECT AND BUS ENGINE REHABILITATIONS FOR THE COUNTY. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE RTA WILL PURCHASE A REPLACEMENT OF ONE (1) 2015 FORD E450 STARCRAFT GASOLINE-POWERED VEHICLE FOR THE NIPOMO DIAL-A-RIDE SERVICE FOR THE COUNTY THROUGH A THIRD PART PROVIDER. THE RTA WILL ALSO USE FUNDING TO PROVIDE THE CRITICAL ENGINE REHABILITATION SERVICES FOR FOUR (4) HEAVY-DUTY DIESEL 2015 BUSES THAT ARE NEARING THE 500000 MILES USEFUL LIFE STANDARD.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THIS GRANT AWARD WILL REIMBURSE THE RTA FOR CAPITAL COSTS NECESSARY TO MAINTAIN CRITICAL TRANSIT FLEET SERVICES FOR THE COMMUNITY. UNDER THE ELIGIBILITIES OF THE FTA SECTION 5339 FUNDS RECIPIENTS WILL BE ABLE TO UTILIZE THESE FUNDS AT A MAXIMUM OF 80-PERCENT FEDERAL SHARE FOR THE VEHICLE REPLACEMENT AND REHABILITATION AND OVERHAUL SERVICES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL DIRECTLY BENEFIT FROM THE PUBLIC TRANSIT OPTIONS PROVIDED BY THE RTA. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES PERFORMED AS PART OF THIS GRANT REQUEST. THE NIPOMO DIAL-A-RIDE SERVICES ARE FULLY OPERATED BY IN-HOUSE RTA STAFF.

FUNDING FOR THIS PROJECT INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION IS PROVIDED BY THE FOLLOWING APPORTIONMENT YEARS AND URBANIZED AREA:FY2019 5339 SIMI VALLEY SMALL URBAN (UZA #062710): $350251OVERALL GRANT FUNDINGTOTAL 5339 FFY19 FEDERAL FUNDS: $350251LOCAL TDA MATCH FUNDS: $87563TOTAL ELIGIBLE PROJECT COST: $437814PURPOSE: TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE ACQUISITION AND INSTALLATION OF SAFETY AND SECURITY TECHNOLOGY EQUIPMENT FOR SIMI VALLEY TRANSIT VEHICLES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE SAFETY AND SECURITY EQUIPMENT SUCH AS: PURCHASING AN ON-BOARD VIDEO SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM FOR ALL TWENTY-THREE (23) FIXED-ROUTE AND PARATRANSIT VEHICLES PROVIDING SAFETY MESSAGES ON BOARD WITH MONITORS/DISPLAYS AND WIFI SERVICES THAT WOULD PROVIDE THE LATEST UPDATES SUCH AS COVID-19 MANDATES AND CLEANING INFORMATION AND INSTALL AN AIR PURIFICATION SYSTEM THAT WILL REMOVE HARMFUL CONTAMINANTS AND PROVIDE CLEANER AIR INSIDE SIMI VALLEY TRANSITS ELEVEN (11) FIXED ROUTE AND TWELVE (12) PARATRANSIT VEHICLES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT SIMI VALLEY TRANSIT TO IMPROVE AIR QUALITY WHILE REMOVING HARMFUL CONTAMINANTS (INCLUDING COVID-19) PROVIDING IMMEDIATE SAFETY MESSAGES ON-BOARD AND ENHANCING VIDEO QUALITY AND RELIABILITY THEREBY IMPROVING THE SAFETY AND SECURITY OF THE VEHICLES OPERATORS AND PASSENGERS ON THE ENTIRE SIMI VALLEY TRANSIT SYSTEM. THIS PROJECT WILL ALLOW STAFF TO KEEP OUR PASSENGERS AND OPERATORS SAFE THROUGH UPDATED TECHNOLOGY SUCH AS: 1) ON-BOARD MONITORS DISPLAYING UPDATED SAFETY PRACTICES INCLUDING WIFI; 2) SAFETY MONITORING AND INVESTIGATIVE PROCESSES WITH NEW UPDATED VIDEO SURVEILLANCE; AND 3) PROVIDING PURIFIED AIR ON OUR VEHICLES TO GREATLY REDUCE THE CIRCULATION OF CONTAINMENTS SUCH AS COVID-19 IN A CONFINED SPACE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SIMI VALLEY TRANSIT AND OUR RIDERS THAT RELY ON ITS SERVICE WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS ADDED SECURITY AND SAFETY. THESE FUNDS ARE NECESSARY IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN RELIABLE SAFE AND SECURE TRANSIT SERVICE FOR THE CITY OF SIMI VALLEY TRANSIT. FUNDING EXPENSES DIRECTLY RELATED TO PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES ALLOWS SIMI VALLEY TRANSIT TO ALLOCATE RESOURCES MORE EFFICIENTLY AND EFFECTIVELY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NO SUBRECIPIENTS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS AWARD.THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE FY2019 5339 FEDERAL FUNDS OF $350251 FOR BUS TECHNOLOGY EQUIPMENT FOR SIMI VALLEY TRANSIT VEHICLES. THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE AIR QUALITY SAFETY SECURITY AND MONITORING ON ALL OF OUR TRANSIT VEHICLES OPERATORS AND PASSENGERS. LOCAL MATCH IS $87563 FOR A TOTAL PROJECT COST OF $437814. THIS PROJECT IS PROGRAMMED IN THE 2021 FTIP (PROJECT: VEN190707) WHICH WAS APPROVED ON APRIL 16 2021. IN ORDER TO REFLECT THE CORRECT AMOUNTS THE CITY OF SIMI VALLEY SUBMITTED PROGRAMMING UPDATES IN ADMINISTRATIVE MODIFICATION #21-11.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THE PROJECT IS TO REPLACE AN EXISTING TRANSIT YARD WITH A NEW MODERN MAINTENANCE FACILITY CAPABLE OF SERVICING A ZERO-EMISSION PUBLIC TRANSIT FLEET AND TO ACCOMMODATE FUTURE GROWTH IN PUBLIC TRANSIT.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW BUS MAINTENANCE FACILITY WHICH WILL INCLUDE A 20000 SQ. FT MAINTENANCE BUILDING WITH 6 BUS BAYS AN 8000 SQ. FT ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE AND TRANSIT EMERGENCY OPERATIONS CENTER AND A MODERN BUS WASH BUS STORAGE AREA AND VISITOR/ EMPLOYEE PARKING AREAS. THE FACILITY WILL BE CAPABLE OF STORING UP TO 100 VEHICLES OF VARIOUS SIZES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE MAINTENANCE FACILITY IS A CRITICAL COMPONENT FOR IMPROVING TRANSIT OPERATIONS WHICH CREATES AN ALTERNATIVE COMMUTE OPTION FOR RIDERS AND A CRITICAL MOBILITY FOR TRANSIT DEPENDENT RIDERS (LOW INCOME ELDERLY AND DISABLED). THE NEW FACILITY WILL ENSURES BUSES CAN OPERATE SMOOTHLY AND MORE RELIABLY TO ENCOURAGE TRANSIT USE AND REDUCE HARMFUL EMISSIONS FROM SINGLE-OCCUPANCY VEHICLES AND IMPROVE CONDITIONS ON THE HIGHWAY. THE MAINTENANCE FACILITY IS NECESSARY TO FUEL ELECTRIC VEHICLES ALREADY ON-ORDER AND ELECTRIC VEHICLES ACQUIRED IN THE FUTURE AS THE VINE SYSTEM TRANSITIONS TO ZERO-EMISSION VEHICLES. LASTLY THE PROJECT IS ESTIMATED TO CREATE 624 DIRECT AND INDIRECT JOBS AND SPUR GROWTH/DEVELOPMENT IN THE AREA.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: NAPA COUNTY JURISDICTIONS- CITY OF AMERICAN CANYON NAPA ST. HELENA CALISTOGA THE TOWN OF YOUNTVILLE THE COUNTY OF NAPA RESIDENTS BUSINESSES AND VISITORS TO THE REGION.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NVTA IS THE SPONSOR OF THIS PROJECT AND WILL OVERSEE THE CONSTRUCTION. PURPOSE: THIS APPLICATION IS FOR $2521984 OF FISCAL YEAR 2020 COMPETITIVE SECTION 5339 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES FUNDS AWARDED TO MONTEREY-SALINAS TRANSIT FOR BUS REPLACEMENTS. AN ALLOCATION SUMMARY IS INCLUDED BELOW. FY 2020 5339 AWARD: $2521984MATCHING FUNDS ARE FROM STATE OF CALIFORNIA SB1 STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FUNDS AMOUNTING TO $630496. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED / EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE GRANT ALONG WITH THE OTHER LOCAL FUNDS IDENTIFIED ABOVE PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE REPLACEMENT OF 8 OLD DIESEL AND GAS BUSES WITH 8 NEW DIESEL AND GAS BUSES. THE START DATE IS AUGUST 1 2021 AND THE END DATE IS DECEMBER 31 2023.THIS APPLICATION DOES NOT INCLUDE FUNDS FOR RESEARCH AND/OR DEVELOPMENT.INDIRECT COSTS WILL NOT BE APPLIED TO THIS APPLICATION AND ITS SCOPE OF WORK.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES / SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: MST IS THE PRIMARY PUBLIC TRANSIT PROVIDER IN MONTEREY COUNTY WHICH IS LOCATED ALONG THE CENTRAL COAST OF CALIFORNIA. THE AGENCY OPERATES OVER SIXTY ROUTES SERVING THE COUNTYS ESTIMATED 435594 RESIDENTS. IT OPERATES THROUGH TWO MAJOR TRANSIT HUBS IN MONTEREY AND SALINAS AS WELL AS SECONDARY HUBS IN MARINA AND SAND CITY. ADDITIONALLY MST PROVIDES CONNECTIONS TO THE CITY OF PASO ROBLES IN SAN LUIS OBISPO COUNTY THE CITIES OF SANTA CRUZ AND WATSONVILLE IN SANTA CRUZ COUNTY AND SAN JOSE IN SANTA CLARA COUNTY. MST IS THE ONLY PUBLIC TRANSIT AGENCY THAT PROVIDES FIXED-ROUTE DEMAND-RESPONSE AND SPECIAL SEASONAL TRANSIT SERVICE TO A 295-SQUARE-MILE AREA OF MONTEREY COUNTY CALIFORNIA AS WELL AS CONNECTIONS IN THREE OTHER COUNTIES. MST OPERATES A FLEET OF OVER 100 BUSES FOR ITS FIXED-ROUTE SERVICE. MST HAS A FLEET OF ROUGHLY 40 BUSES FOR PARATRANSIT SERVICE AND GENERAL PUBLIC DIAL-A-RIDE SERVICE IN THE RURAL AREA. IN FISCAL YEAR 2019 MST CARRIED OVER 4475000 PASSENGERS AND OPERATED OVER 5971000 SERVICE MILES. FROM SAN JOSE TO PASO ROBLES MST OPERATES SERVICE THAT EXTENDS ROUGHLY 1/5 THE LENGTH OF THE ENTIRE STATE OF CALIFORNIA. THE STRETCH OF SERVICE AREA IS COMPARABLE TO THE DISTANCE BETWEEN WASHINGTON D.C. AND PHILADELPHIA. TO THE NORTH IN SAN JOSE CALIFORNIA MST ROUTES TERMINATE AT THE DIRIDON STATION WHICH IS A MULTIMODAL STATION SERVING AMTRAK CALTRAIN AND SANTA CLARA VALLEY TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY. WITH THE START OF MSTS LINES 82 AND 83 IN 2011 MST CLOSED A PUBLIC TRANSIT GAP THAT EXISTED BETWEEN NORTHERN CALIFORNIA AND SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA ALONG THE U.S. HIGHWAY 101 CORRIDOR. NOW TO THE SOUTH IN PASO ROBLES CALIFORNIA MSTS ROUTES SERVE THE PASO ROBLES TRANSIT CENTER A MULTI-MODAL STATION SERVING GREYHOUND AMTRAK PASO EXPRESS AND SAN LUIS OBISPO REGIONAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY. MSTS WIDE RANGE OF SERVICE ALLOWS RESIDENTS OF MONTEREY COUNTY TO CONNECT WITH OTHER PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICES OUTSIDE THE COUNTY ULTIMATELY ENABLING MONTEREY COUNTY RESIDENTS TO TRAVEL ACROSS THE STATE. THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR RTA TRANSIT SERVICES THROUGHOUT THE SAN LUIS OBISPO COUNTY REGION (INCLUDING FOUR URBANIZED AREAS) FROM JULY 1 2020 THROUGH JUNE 30 2021 PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES WITH THE ENGINE REHABILITATION OF TEN (10) DIESEL-POWERED HEAVY-DUTY 40-FOOT 35-FOOT BUSES REPLACEMENT OF ONE (1) ADA PARATRANSIT CUTAWAY VEHICLE WITH LIKE REPLACEMENT OF TWO (2) DIESEL-POWERED HEAVY-DUTY 40-FOOT BUSES WITH TWO NEW 40-FOOT ELECTRIC ZERO-EMISSION BUSES AND PROVIDE CAPITAL FUNDING FOR THE PURCHASE OF VARIOUS VEHICLE MAINTENANCE EQUIPMENT AND BUS STOP IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS FOR BOTH THE SAN LUIS OBISPO REGIONAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY (RTA) AND SOUTH COUNTY TRANSIT (SCT). THE COSTS IDENTIFIED IN THIS GRANT ARE NOT SUBJECT TO REIMBURSEMENT BY ANY OTHER FUNDING SOURCES AND ARE NOT DUPLICATED IN THIS APPLICATION. DETAILS OF THIS GRANT ARE PINNED IN TRAMS. THE FUNDS FOR THESE PROJECTS ARE INCLUDED IN THE SAN LUIS OBISPO COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (SLOCOG) 2021 FEDERAL TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (FTIP) WHICH WAS SUBMITTED TO THE FEDERAL HIGHWAY ADMINISTRATION (FHWA) AND THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) ON JANUARY 5 2021. PROJECTS FUNDED BY THE SANTA MARIA UZA ARE INCLUDED IN THE SANTA BARBARA COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (SBCAG) 2021 FTIP APPROVED BY THE SBCAG BOARD ON FEBRUARY 8 2021. THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION AND THE US DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION FORMALLY APPROVED THE SLOCOG AND SBCAG FTIPS ON APRIL 16TH 2021. ALL LOCAL FUNDS TO MATCH THESE FEDERAL FUNDS FOR THIS GRANT APPLICATION INCLUDE FUNDS FROM THE STATE TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT ACT (TDA) RURAL TRANSIT FUNDS (RTF) AND STATE GREENHOUSE GAS REDUCTION FUND.PURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO CONTINUE TRANSIT SERVICE OPERATIONS AT CURRENT SERVICE-LEVELS THROUGHOUT THE COUNTY OF SAN LUIS OBISPO PROVIDE ENGINE REHABILITATION SERVICES FOR TEN (10) HEAVY-DUTY DIESEL BUSES TO ENSURE THE VEHICLES WILL REACH THEIR FTA USEFUL LIFE REPLACE EXISTING ROLLING STOCK THAT HAVE MET AND EXCEEDED THEIR FTA USEFUL LIFE (INCLUDING 1 ADA CUTAWAY AND 2 HEAVY-DUTY 40FT. DIESEL BUSES) PROCURE FLEET MAINTENANCE EQUIPMENT THAT IS ESSENTIAL TO MAINTAINING THE RTAS CURRENT FLEET IN A SAFE AND OPERATIONAL MANNER AND PROVIDE FOR CRITICAL REPAIRS AND SAFETY IMPROVEMENTS TO THE VARIOUS RTA AND SCT BUS STOP LOCATIONS THROUGHOUT THE COUNTY.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:OPERATIONS:THE COUNTY OF SAN LUIS OBISPO ENCOMPASSES APPROXIMATELY 3299 SQUARE MILES. THIS GRANT INCLUDES OPERATIONS PROJECT TO SUPPORT CONTINUED TRANSIT OPERATION SERVICES PROVIDED IN-HOUSE BY THE RTA THROUGHOUT THE COUNTY. THE RTA OPERATES FIVE FIXED-ROUTES TO SAN LUIS OBISPO SANTA MARIA ATASCADERO TEMPLETON PASO ROBLES SAN MIGUEL LOS OSOS MORRO BAY CAYUCOS CAMBRIA SAN SIMEON PISMO BEACH GROVER BEACH ARROYO GRANDE NIPOMO AS WELL AS CONNECTING TO THE CITY OF SANTA MARIA IN NORTHERN SANTA BARBARA COUNTY. A SMALL PORTION OF TRANSIT OPERATIONS IS PROVIDED BY A THIRD-PARTY CONTRACTOR FOR THE CITY OF ATASCADERO (SUBRECIPIENT) FOR THE OPERATION OF THE ATASCADERO DIAL-A-RIDE SERVICE. PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE:THIS GRANT ALSO INCLUDES FUNDING TO PROVIDE THE CRITICAL ENGINE REHABILITATION SERVICES FOR TEN (10) HEAVY-DUTY DIESEL 2013 BUSES THAT ARE NEARING THE 500000 MILES USEFUL LIFE STANDARD AND ARE EXPERIENCE SIGNIFICANT MECHANICAL ISSUES RESULTING IN COSTLY REPAIRS. THE RTA WILL CONTRACT OUT THESE ENGINE REHABILITATION SERVICES TO A THIRD-PARTY AND WILL ENSURE THAT IT WILL COMPLY WITH ALL APPLICABLE FTA PROCUREMENT REQUIREMENTS. ROLLING STOCK:THIS GRANT INCLUDES FUNDING FOR THE REPLACEMENT OF THREE TRANSIT VEHICLES (1 ADA CUTAWAY AND 2 HEAVY-DUTY DIESEL BUSES) THAT HAVE MET AND EXCEED THEIR FTA USEFUL LIFE IN BOTH MILEAGE AND YEARS. THE 2 HEAVY-DUTY DIESEL BUSES WILL BE REPLACED WITH ELECTRIC ZERO EMISSION BUSES. THE ELECTRIC BUS REPLACEMENT PROJECT IS THE FIRST PROCUREMENT OF THIS VEHICLE TYPE FOR THE RTA. AS SUCH THIS PROJECT INCLUDES THE PROCUREMENT OF SPARE ELECTRIC BUS PARTS AND CRITICAL TRAINING FOR OPERATORS AND MECHANICS ON THE OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE OF ELECTRIC BUSES. THE RTA WILL CONTRACT WITH THIRD-PARTY PROVIDERS FOR THE PROCUREMENT OF THESE VEHICLES SPARE PARTS AND TRAINING. THE RTA WILL ENSURE THAT IT COMPLIES WITH ALL APPLICABLE FTA PROCUREMENT REQUIREMENTS. MAINTENANCE EQUIPMENT:THIS GRANT INCLUDES THE PROCUREMENT OF FLEET MAINTENANCE EQUIPMENT CRITICAL FOR MAINTAINING THE RTA AND SCT TRANSIT FLEET. NEW EQUIPMENT WILL BE NEEDED WITH THE COMPLETED CONSTRUCTION OF THE NEW BUS MAINTENANCE FACILITY. THE RTA HAS DETERMINED CRITICAL EQUIPMENT NEEDS FOR THE NEW BUILDING AND WILL CONTRACT WITH THIRD-PARTY PROVIDERS FOR THE PROCUREMENT OF VEHICLE MAINTENANCE EQUIPMENT. THE RTA WILL ENSURE THAT IT COMPLIES WITH ALL APPLICABLE FTA PROCUREMENT REQUIREMENTS. BUS STOP IMPROVEMENTS:THIS GRANT INCLUDES FUNDING FOR REPAIRS AND SAFETY IMPROVEMENTS FOR VARIOUS RTA AND SCT BUS STOP LOCATIONS THROUGHOUT THE COUNTY OF SAN LUIS OBISPO. THE RTA IS IN PROCESS OF UPDATING ITS BUS STOP IMPROVEMENT PLAN AND THIS FUNDING WILL PROVIDE FOR THE INSTALLATION OF NEW SOLAR LIGHT POLES REPAIRS TO BUS SHELTER SOLAR LIGHTING AND THE REPLACEMENT OF BENCHES AND TRASH RECEPTACLES THAT ARE IN NEED OF REPAIR. THE RTA WILL CONTRACT WITH THIRD-PARTY PROVIDERS FOR THE PROCUREMENT OF BUS STOP REPAIR SERVICES AND EQUIPMENT. THE RTA WILL ENSURE THAT IT COMPLIES WITH ALL APPLICABLE FTA PROCUREMENT REQUIREMENTS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE CONTINUED TRANSIT OPERATION SERVICES WILL RESULT IN AN IMPROVEMENT TO PUBLIC HEALTH AS RIDERS WILL HAVE ACCESS TO BUS STOPS; LINKING TO JOBS MEDICAL EDUCATIONAL SHOPPING OTHER TRANSPORTATION MODES (TRAIN STATION BIKE/PEDESTRIAN PATHS). THE REPLACEMENT OF DIESEL BUSES WITH ELECTRIC ZERO-EMISSION BUSES WILL REDUCE HARMFUL GREENHOUSE GASES HELP COMMUNITIES ADAPT TO THE IMPACTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE PROVIDE MEANINGFUL BENEFITS TO PRIORITY POPULATIONS AND ALLOW THE RTA TO BEGIN IMPLEMENTING THE CALIFORNIA AIR RESOURCES BOARD INNOVATIVE CLEAN TRANSIT (ICT) FLEET RULE. THE BUS STOP IMPROVEMENTS ARE EXPECTED TO SLIGHTLY INCREASED RIDERSHIP WITH THE IMPROVED SAFETY FOR EMPLOYEES RIDERS AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE PROJECTS IDENTIFIED IN THIS GRANT WILL BENEFIT LOCAL RESIDENTS OF SAN LUIS OBISPO COUNTY AS WELL AS TOURISTS VISITING THE AREA. LOCAL RESIDENTS WILL BENEFIT FROM INCREASED ACCESS TO WORK EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS AND LOCAL HEALTH PROVIDERS. TOURISTS WILL BENEFITS FROM THE CONNECTION TO BUSINESSES AND SHOPPING COMPLEXES THROUGHOUT THE COUNTY. BUSINESSES WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED TRAFFIC FLOW AND GREATER PEDESTRIAN ACCESS. STUDENTS OF THE THREE EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS IN OUR COUNTY (CALIFORNIA POLYTECHNIC UNIVERSITY (CAL POLY) CUESTA COMMUNITY COLLEGE AND HANCOCK COMMUNITY COLLEGE) WILL BENEFIT FROM THE SERVICES WITH CONTINUED ACCESS TO AND FROM CAMPUSES. LOCAL PARTNERSHIPS WILL ALSO BENEFIT FROM THESE PROJECTS AS THE RTA WORKS CLOSELY WITH OUR STATE AND COUNTY PARTNERS IN IMPROVING WORKFORCE TRANSPORTATION INCLUDING DISCOUNTED PASSES FOR PERSONS TRANSITIONING INTO NEW JOBS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT PLANS TO SUBAWARD FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $39163 TO THE CITY OF ATASCADERO (SUBRECIPIENT TO THE RTA) FOR CONTINUED TRANSIT OPERATIONS OF THE ATASCADERO DIAL-A-RIDE SERVICES. THE CITY OF ATASCADERO CONTRACTS-OUT THESE SERVICES TO A LOCAL TRANSIT PROVIDER.

THE START DATE IS MARCH 1 2021 AND THE END DATE IS DECEMBER 31 2022.THIS APPLICATION DOES NOT INCLUDE FUNDS FOR RESEARCH AND/OR DEVELOPMENT.INDIRECT COSTS WILL NOT BE APPLIED TO THIS APPLICATION AND ITS SCOPE OF WORK.MST IS THE PRIMARY PUBLIC TRANSIT PROVIDER IN MONTEREY COUNTY WHICH IS LOCATED ALONG THE CENTRAL COAST OF CALIFORNIA. THE AGENCY OPERATES OVER SIXTY ROUTES SERVING THE COUNTYS ESTIMATED 435594 RESIDENTS. IT OPERATES THROUGH TWO MAJOR TRANSIT HUBS IN MONTEREY AND SALINAS AS WELL AS SECONDARY HUBS IN MARINA AND SAND CITY. ADDITIONALLY MST PROVIDES CONNECTIONS TO THE CITY OF PASO ROBLES IN SAN LUIS OBISPO COUNTY THE CITIES OF SANTA CRUZ AND WATSONVILLE IN SANTA CRUZ COUNTY AND SAN JOSE IN SANTA CLARA COUNTY. AGENCY INFORMATION IS PROVIDED IN ATTACHMENT A. MST IS THE ONLY PUBLIC TRANSIT AGENCY THAT PROVIDES FIXED-ROUTE DEMAND-RESPONSE AND SPECIAL SEASONAL TRANSIT SERVICE TO A 295-SQUARE-MILE AREA OF MONTEREY COUNTY CALIFORNIA AS WELL AS CONNECTIONS IN THREE OTHER COUNTIES. MST OPERATES A FLEET OF OVER 100 BUSES FOR ITS FIXED-ROUTE SERVICE. MST HAS A FLEET OF ROUGHLY 40 BUSES FOR PARATRANSIT SERVICE AND GENERAL PUBLIC DIAL-A-RIDE SERVICE IN THE RURAL AREA. IN FISCAL YEAR 2019 MST CARRIED OVER 4475000 PASSENGERS AND OPERATED OVER 5971000 SERVICE MILES. FROM SAN JOSE TO PASO ROBLES MST OPERATES SERVICE THAT EXTENDS ROUGHLY 1/5 THE LENGTH OF THE ENTIRE STATE OF CALIFORNIA. THE STRETCH OF SERVICE AREA IS COMPARABLE TO THE DISTANCE BETWEEN WASHINGTON D.C. AND PHILADELPHIA. TO THE NORTH IN SAN JOSE CALIFORNIA MST ROUTES TERMINATE AT THE DIRIDON STATION WHICH IS A MULTIMODAL STATION SERVING AMTRAK CALTRAIN AND SANTA CLARA VALLEY TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY. WITH THE START OF MSTS LINES 82 AND 83 IN 2011 MST CLOSED A PUBLIC TRANSIT GAP THAT EXISTED BETWEEN NORTHERN CALIFORNIA AND SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA ALONG THE U.S. HIGHWAY 101 CORRIDOR. NOW TO THE SOUTH IN PASO ROBLES CALIFORNIA MSTS ROUTES SERVE THE PASO ROBLES TRANSIT CENTER A MULTI-MODAL STATION SERVING GREYHOUND AMTRAK PASO EXPRESS AND SAN LUIS OBISPO REGIONAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY. MSTS WIDE RANGE OF SERVICE ALLOWS RESIDENTS OF MONTEREY COUNTY TO CONNECT WITH OTHER PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICES OUTSIDE THE COUNTY ULTIMATELY ENABLING MONTEREY COUNTY RESIDENTS TO TRAVEL ACROSS THE STATE. RTD WILL PROVIDE THE REQUIRED 20% MATCH OF $312000 CONSISTING OF TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT ACT (TDA) FUNDS. THE TOTAL ELIGIBLE COSTS FOR THIS APPLICATION IS $1560000.PROJECT DETAILS:P1. FARE VENDING MACHINES (FVM)1665-2019-2-P1 -- 11.32.06 ACQUIRE - STATIONARY BUS FARE COLL EQUIPFTIP #: 212-0000-0739MPO APPORTIONMENT APPROVAL DATE: JUNE 21 2018 (FY17-18) AND APRIL 19 2019 (FY18-19)THIS PROJECT CONSISTS OF THE REPLACEMENT OF 37 AGING FARE VENDING MACHINES (FVM) WITH NEW FVM. THE PROJECT BUDGET INCLUDES $138041 IN FY17-18 5339 FUNDS AND $595015 IN FY18-19 5339 FUNDS FOR A TOTAL OF $733056 IN FTA 5339 FUNDS.PROJECT BENEFITS:THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TECHNOLOGY UPGRADES THAT WILL BE MORE RELIABLE AND USER FRIENDLY FOR TRANSIT CUSTOMERS. RTD ANTICIPATES COST SAVINGS ASSOCIATED WITH MORE RELIABLE EQUIPMENT DUE TO LESS FREQUENT MAINTENANCE ASSOCIATED WITH FEWER EQUIPMENT BREAKDOWNS. THE NEW FVM WILL PROVIDE TRANSIT CUSTOMERS WITH VARIOUS PAYMENT OPTIONS INCLUDING CASH DEBIT AND CREDIT. THE NEW FVM WILL ALSO IMPROVE TRANSIT EXPERIENCE FOR RIDERS AND PROMOTE THE ADAPTATION TO RECENT TECHNOLOGICAL TRENDS IN TRANSIT.P2. BROADBAND ON BUSES AND BUS STOPS1665-2019-2-P2 -- 11.62.02 PURCHASE COMMUNICATIONS SYSTEMFTIP #:212-0000-0474MPO APPORTIONMENT APPROVAL DATE: APRIL 19 2019THIS PROJECT CONSISTS OF THE INSTALLATION OF BROADBAND EQUIPMENT ON 40 TRANSIT SERVICE VEHICLES FOR THE PURPOSES OF EXPANDING NETWORK ACCESS THROUGHOUT THE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM. THE PROJECT BUDGET INCLUDES $331824 IN FY17-18 5339 FUNDS.PROJECT BENEFITS:THIS PROJECT WILL ENABLE REAL-TIME VIDEO ACCESS IMPROVE BUS LOCATION INFORMATION IMPROVE REAL-TIME ARRIVAL ESTIMATES AND ENABLE SECURE ACCESS TO APPLICATIONS SUCH AS SPEAR AND TRAPEZE FROM SERVICE VEHICLES.P3. BUS REHABILITATION1665-2019-3-P3 -- 11.14.40 REHAB/REBUILD SPARE PARTSFTIP #: 212-0000-0737MPO APPORTIONMENT APPROVAL DATE: APRIL 19 2019THIS PROJECT CONSISTS OF BUS REHABILITATION ACTIVITIES INCLUDING THE PURCHASE AND REPLACEMENT OF MAJOR COMPONENTS AND PARTS. THE PROJECT BUDGET INCLUDES $183120 IN FY17-18 5339 FUNDS.PROJECT BENEFITS:BUS REHABILITATION WILL MAINTAIN THE RELIABILITY OF AGING VEHICLES AND CONTRIBUTE TOWARDS MEETING THEIR MINIMUM USEFUL LIFE. IT WILL ALSO ENHANCE THE PERFORMANCE OF THE BUS AND ITS PROPULSION SYSTEM THUS PROMOTING RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION SERVICE WITH FEWER OPERATIONAL ISSUES.LOCATION DESCRIPTION:SAN JOAQUIN COUNTY CA IS LOCATED IN NORTHERN CALIFORNIAS CENTRAL VALLEY EAST OF THE SAN FRANCISCO BAY AREA JUST OVER THE ALTAMONT PASS. THE COUNTY IS HOME TO A SOPHISTICATED TRANSPORTATION NETWORK COMPRISED OF AN INTERNATIONAL DEEP WATER PORT MAJOR INTERSTATE HIGHWAYS AIR AND RAIL SERVICES AND DELTA RECREATION AND WATERWAYS. SAN JOAQUIN REGIONAL TRANSIT DISTRICT (RTD) IS A PUBLIC TRANSIT SPECIAL DISTRICT THAT OPERATES A WIDE RANGE OF TRANSIT SERVICES WHICH INCLUDE FIXED-ROUTE ADA DEVIATED FIXED-ROUTE COMMUTER INTERCITY AND MOBILITY-ON-DEMAND SERVICES THROUGHOUT THE COUNTY MOST OF WHICH OPERATE WITHIN THE CITY OF STOCKTON CA. ITS COMMUTER SERVICE PROVIDES CONNECTIONS TO THE SACRAMENTO REGION AND THE GREATER SAN FRANCISCO BAY AREA.

BUDGET REVISION #2 SEPTEMBER 2022THIS BUDGET REVISION IS EXTENDING THE GRANTS PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE END DATE FROM 09/30/2021 TO 12/31/2024 DUE TO VEHICLES FOR THIS PROCUREMENT ARE PURCHASED USING A THE CALACT/MBTA PURCHASING COOPERATIVE. WHEN WE PRICED VEHICLES FOR PURCHASE THE PROCESS TO MANY MONTHS TO GET ALL VENDORS TO SUPPLY PRICING. ONCE THIS WAS COMPLETED THE VEHICLE VENDORS IN THE COOPERATIVE SUSPENDED THE CONTRACT FOR RENEGOTIATION OF THE PRICING DUE TO SIGNIFICANT PRICE INCREASES FOR COMPONENTS THE PURCHASED FOR THE VEHICLE PRODUCTIONS. AS OF 08/19/22 THAT CONTRACT IS STILL SUSPENDED AND NO DATE HAS BEEN GIVEN FOR WHEN THE NEW PRICING WILL BE AVAILABLE. ALSO THERE IS A SEVERE INDUSTRY SHORTAGE OF FORD F-550 CHASSIS THAT COULD CAUSE A SEVERAL YEAR DELAY IN THE PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF VEHICLES. THIS IS FORCING MTS TO LOOK AT OTHER MODELS AND OPTIONS OF VEHICLES FOR PURCHASE. WE ARE HOPEFUL THE REVISED PRICING WILL BE RELEASED BY 12/31/2022 AND IT WILL TAKE MTS 6-8 MONTHS FROM THEN TO COMPLETE PRICING AND APPROVAL PROCESS TO PLEASE THE VEHICLE ORDER. THE DELIVERY TIME FOR THE VEHICLES ONCE THE ORDER IS PLACED IS UNKNOWN AT THIS TIME.A FEDERAL RATIO OF 80/20 APPLIES AND LOCAL FUNDING OF $136713 IN CALIFORNIA TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT ACT FUNDING WILL BE PROVIDED BY MTS TO MEET THIS REQUIREMENT. THESE BUSES WILL MEET THE CLEAN AIR ACT (CAA) STANDARDS AND ALL ADA REQUIREMENTS. THESE ACTIVITIES ARE A CATEGORICAL EXCLUSION UNDER NEPA. THIS BUDGET REVISION WILL ALSO EXTEND THE GRANT PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE TO SEPTEMBER 30 2025.-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------BUDGET REVISION SEPTEMBER 2021THIS BUDGET REVISION IS MOVING $546852 IN FEDERAL FUNDING FROM ALI 11.12.01 (FY18 5339 40 BUS REPLACEMENT) TO NEW ALI 11.12.03. APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE GOALS OF THE AWARD ARE TO REPLACE THE JONESBORO ECONOMICAL TRANSPORTATION (JET) AGING DIESEL POWERED TRANSIT BUSES ENCOURAGE CLEAN ENERGY MODES OF TRANSPORTATION TO REDUCE GREENHOUSE EMISSIONS TO INCREASE INTEREST IN USING PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION INSTEAD OF PERSONAL GAS VEHICLES AND IMPROVE SERVICE PERFORMANCE TO JETS RISING RIDERSHIP.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE CITY WILL COMPLETE THE PROCUREMENT PROCESS AND ACQUIRE THREE BIDS. THE HYBRID BUSES WILL REPLACE AND EXPAND JONESBOROS AGING FLEET THAT IS CAUSING MORE POLLUTION RISKING HIGH MAINTENANCE COSTS AND DECREASING SERVICE PERFORMANCE.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFITED POPULATION WILL BE INDIVIDUALS IN POVERTY PERSONS THAT ARE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION DEPENDENT DUE TO NOT HAVING A VEHICLE JONESBOROS LIMITED ENGLISH PROFICIENCY POPULATION (INTERNATIONAL POPULATION UNIVERSITY FOREIGN STUDENTS) PERSON WITH DISABILITIES AND THE ELDERLY.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

THIS IS A FY21 5339(B) BUS AND BUS FACILITIES FUNDING APPLICATION FOR THE CITY OF MOBILE AL (MOBILE AL UZA) IN THE AMOUNT OF $4850535 REPRESENTING 80% FEDERAL SHARE OF THE TOTAL ELIGIBLE AMOUNT. THE TOTAL COST FOR THIS PROJECT IS $6063169 (FEDERAL $4850535 LOCAL $1 212634).PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE CITY OF MOBILE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM (THE WAVE TRANSIT SYSTEM) FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IN REPLACING AN AGED FLEET OF TWELVE (12) BUSES THAT HAVE EXCEEDED THEIR USEFUL LIFE WITH TWELVE (12) NEW 35 LOW FLOOR HEAVY DUTY TRANSIT BUSES FOR ITS FIXED ROUTE SERVICE. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE CITY OF MOBILE WILL PURCHASE TWELVE (12) 35 LOW FLOOR HEAVY DUTY BUSES TO REPLACE TWELVE (12) OF ITS AGING 29 AND 35 BUSES THAT HAVE EXCEEDED ITS USEFUL LIFETIME MILEAGE AND/OR LIFETIME AGE.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: REPLACEMENT OF THESE VEHICLES WOULD REDUCE MAINTENANCE REPAIR COST SUBSTANTIALLY DECREASE THE NUMBER OF ROAD CALLS RESULTING IN MISSED TRIPS AS WELL AS PROVIDE THE PASSENGERS WITH SAFE AND RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION. THE GOAL IN REPLACING THE AGING FLEET IS TO IMPROVE THE MOBILITY OF PEOPLE WITHIN THE CITY OF MOBILE WHO RELY ON PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES; TO TRANSITION MORE RIDERS FROM DEMAND RESPONSE TO FIXED ROUTE BY PROVIDING ADA ACCESSIBLE FIXED ROUTE BUSES; TO DIRECTLY PROVIDE CONNECTIVITY TO EMPLOYMENT EDUCATION RECREATION AND PUBLIC SERVICES; AND TO IGNITE COMMUNITY REVITALIZATION FOR THE DISADVANTAGED POPULATIONS IN OUR AREA INCLUDING THE LOW-INCOME DISABLED AND ELDERLY WITH THE PRESENCE OF NEW BUSES INCLUSIVE OF NEW TECHNOLOGY.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE WAVE TRANSIT SYSTEM (WTS) PARTNERS WITH MOBILE COUNTY PUBLIC SCHOOL SYSTEM (MCPSS) BY PROVIDING MONTHLY BUS PASSES AT A DISCOUNTED RATE TO STUDENTS AND PARENTS OF STUDENTS WHO UTILIZE PUBLIC TRANSIT FOR TRANSPORT TO SCHOOL AND HOME. WITHIN MOBILE EACH OF THE HIGH SCHOOLS ARE LOCATED WITHIN WALKING DISTANCE OF A WTS ROUTE. THE CITY OF MOBILE IS HOME TO 66% OF THE TOTAL MINORITY POPULATION IN MOBILE COUNTY. THE HIGHEST PERCENTAGE OF LOW INCOME HOUSEHOLDS AND THE HIGHEST PROSPENSITY FOR TRANSIT IS DOWNTOWN. WTS OFFERS FIXED ROUTE SERVICE TO THESE AREAS VIA FOUR (4) ROUTES. THESE AREAS CONSIST OF INDIVIDUALS LIVING IN A GEOGRAPHIC PROXIMITY OF EACH OTHER IN DISTRESSED NEIGHBORHOODS LOW-INCOME TO POVERTY-STRICKEN CONDITIONS TRANSIT DEPENDENT AND 95% ARE MINORITIES. WTS ALSO OPERATES ONE NEIGHBORHOOD SERVICE THAT IS ON-DEMAND RESPONSE. THE RIDERS SCHEDULE SERVICE THE DAY BEFORE AND THE ROUTE IS PLANNED FOR THE FOLLOWING DAY. THE CONCEPT WORKS BY PROVIDING SERVICE TO LOW DENSITY AND LOW-INCOME NEIGHBORHOODS UTILIZING THE HUB CONCEPT WHERE SMALLER VEHICLES CARRY RIDERS INTO HUBS OR TRANSFER CENTERS THAT CONNECT TO FIXED ROUTES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONETHIS PROJECT IS PROGRAMMED IN THE ALABAMA 2019-2023 STIP THAT WAS APPROVED AND UPDATED ON AUGUST 21 2021.THE LOCAL MATCH WILL BE PROVIDED BY THE CITY OF MOBILE PER RESOLUTION DOCKET NUMBER 31.973 ADOPTED NOVEMBER 2 2021 IN THE AMOUNT OF $1212634.THE CITY OF MOBILE WILL ENSURE THAT ALL VEHICLES PURCHASED ARE ADA ACCESSIBLE PURCHASED FROM A FTA APPROVED TVM AND REPORTED TO FTA WITHIN 30 DAYS AFTER THE CONTRACT IS SIGNED.THE CITY OF MOBILE WILL CHECK THE CURRENT LISTING OF TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURERS (TVM) TO ENSURE EACH IS LISTED AS A CERTIFIED TVM IN COMPLIANCE WITH FTA REGULATIONS.THE CITY OF MOBILE (GRANTEE) AND/OR ANY APPLICABLE SUB-GRANTEE(S) (WHEN APPLICABLE) WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACT GUIDANCE).THE CITY OF MOBILE (GRANTEE) AND/OR ANY APPLICABLE SUB-GRANTEE(S) (WHEN APPLICABLE) WILL ENSURE THAT CONTRACTORS PROCURED WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.THE CITY OF MOBILE (GRANTEE) AND/OR ANY APPLICABLE SUB-GRANTEE(S) (WHEN APPLICABLE) WILL ENSURE THAT ALL THIRD PARTY CONTRACTORS HAS NOT BEEN CONVICTED OF A FELONY CRIMINAL VIOLATION UNDER ANY FEDERAL LAW WITHIN THE PRECEDING 24 MONTHS.

THIS IS A FY20 FY21 5339 BUS AND BUS FACILITIES FUNDING APPLICATION FOR THE CITY OF MOBILE (MOBILE AL UZA) IN THE AMOUNT OF $692032 REPRESENTING 80% FEDERAL SHARE OF THE TOTAL ELIGIBLE AMOUNT.THE TOTAL COST FOR THESE PROJECTS IS $865040 (FEDERAL $692032 LOCAL $173008). APPORTIONED FUNDS APPLIED ARE FY2020 FOR $448220 (FEDERAL $358576 LOCAL $89644) AND FY 2021 FOR $416820 (FEDERAL 333456 LOCAL $83364).PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE CITY OF MOBILE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM (THE WAVE TRANSIT SYSTEM) FUNDING FOR THE REPLACEMENT AND TECHNOLOGY UPGRADE OF ITS MOBILITY VEHICLES AND THE REHABILITATION OF THE BUS WASH FACILITY.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PURCHASE FOUR (4) ALLSTAR F450 MODIFIED VANS THIRTY (30) FAREBOX VALIDATORS FOR THE MOBILITY ASSISTANCE VEHICLES AND REHABILITATION OF BUS WASH SYSTEM EQUIPMENT HOUSING.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: CURRENTLY THE WAVE TRANSIT SYSTEM (WTS) HAS AN AGED FLEET OF FOURTEEN (14) MODIFIED VANS FOR OUR COMPLEMENTARY DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE (MAP) THAT EXCEEDS THE USEFUL LIFETIME MILEAGE OF 200000 MILES AND/OR AGE. REPLACEMENT OF THESE VEHICLES WOULD REDUCE MAINTENANCE REPAIR COST SUBSTANTIALLY AND DECREASE THE NUMBER OF ROAD CALLS RESULTING IN MISSED TRIPS AS WELL AS PROVIDE THE PASSENGERS WITH SAFE AND RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION. IN ADDITION THESE VEHICLES WILL BE EQUIPPED WITH THE LATEST FAREBOX TECHNOLOGY WHICH WILL ELIMINATE THE USAGE OF PAPER TICKETS BY UTILIZING SMART CARDS AND MOBILE TICKETING. THE REHABILITATION OF THE BUS WASH SYSTEM WILL ALLOW NOT ONLY BUSES TO BE SERVICED BUT WILL ALSO ACCOMMODATE SUPPORT VEHICLES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: 1) THE DISABLED AND ELDERLY ALONG WITH TRANSIT DEPENDENT INDIVIDUALS WITHIN THE CITY OF MOBILE WHO RELY ON PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES.2) PROVIDE A SAFE AND MORE SECURE ENVIRONMENT FOR PASSENGERS WITH THE ELIMINATION OF CASH FARES TO SMART CARDS AND MOBILE TICKETING.3) PROVIDE STATE OF GOOD REPAIR CONDITION OF FEDERAL ASSETS WITH THE REPLACEMENT OF ROLLING STOCK AND REHABILITATION OF THE BUS WASH SYSTEM.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONETHESE PROJECTS ARE PROGRAMMED IN THE ALABAMA 2019-2023 STIP THAT WAS APPROVED AND UPDATED ON AUGUST 21 2021.THE LOCAL MATCH WILL BE PROVIDED BY THE CITY OF MOBILE UTILIZING FUNDS RESERVED IN THE GENERAL AND CAPITAL FUNDS BUDGET.THE CITY OF MOBILE WILL ENSURE THAT ALL VEHICLES PURCHASED ARE ACCESSIBLE PURCHASED FROM A FTA APPROVED TVM AND REPORTED TO FTA WITHIN 30 DAYS AFTER CONTRACT IS SIGNED.THE CITY OF MOBILE WILL CHECK THE CURRENT LISTING OF TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURERS (TVM) TO ENSURE EACH IS LISTED AS A CERTIFIED TVM IN COMPLIANCE WITH FTA REGULATIONS.THE CITY OF MOBILE (GRANTEE) AND/OR ANY APPLICABLE SUB-GRANTEE(S) (WHEN APPLICABLE) WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACT GUIDANCE).THE CITY OF MOBILE (GRANTEE) AND/OR ANY APPLICABLE SUB-GRANTEE(S) (WHEN APPLICABLE) WILL ENSURE THAT CONTRACTORS PROCURED WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.THE CITY OF MOBILE (GRANTEE) AND/OR ANY APPLICABLE SUB-GRANTEE(S) (WHEN APPLICABLE) WILL ENSURE THAT ALL THIRD PARTY CONTRACTORS DOES NOT HAVE ANY UNPAID FEDERAL TAX LIABILITIES THAT HAS BEEN ASSESSED AND NOT PAID IN A TIMELY MANNER.THE CITY OF MOBILE (GRANTEE) AND/OR ANY APPLICABLE SUB-GRANTEE(S) (WHEN APPLICABLE) WILL ENSURE THAT ALL THIRD PARTY CONTRACTORS HAS NOT BEEN CONVICTED OF A FELONY CRIMINAL VIOLATION UNDER ANY FEDERAL LAW WITHIN THE PRECEDING 24 MONTHS.

THIS IS AN FFY 2020 FAST ACT SECTION 5339(B) BUSES AND BUS FACILITIES PROGRAM APPLICATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $12541782. THIS GRANT APPLICATION IS FOR PHASE 1 OF A TWO PHASED PROJECT. THE APPLICATION IS FOR THE ENGINEERING DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF A MULTIMODAL TRANSFER STATION FACILITY. IT WILL USE FFY 2020 FAST ACT SECTION 5339(B) APPROPRIATION. LOCAL MATCH WILL COME FROM THE CITY OF HUNTSVILLE AL CAPITAL IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM. THE FIRST PHASE IS A PROPOSED NEW BUS TRANSFER STATION ON CITY OF HUNTSVILLE OWNED PROPERTY LOCATED SOUTHEAST OF THE INTERSECTION OF CHURCH AND PRATT AVENUE 100 PEGRAM STREET HUNTSVILLE AL 35801. THE PROPOSED SITE IS APPROXIMATELY MILE FROM THE EXISTING BUS TRANSFER STATION AND IS CONNECTED TO THE EXISTING PROPERTY. THE PROPOSED NEW STATION WILL BE ALL ENCOMPASSING AND LARGE ENOUGH TO ACCOMMODATE INCREASING RIDERSHIP DEMAND. THE PROPERTY IS A REMNANT TRACT ACQUIRED FROM THE CHURCH STREET IMPROVEMENTS PROJECT THAT WAS FUNDED IN PART BY FEDERAL HIGHWAY AUTHORITY (FHWA). A MEMO OUTLINING CITY OWNERSHIP OF THE LAND AND INTENT TO UTILIZE THE REMNANT FOR THIS PUBLIC USE PROJECT IS ATTACHED IN THE GRANT DOCUMENTS.THE CITY OF HUNTSVILLE AL IS A DESIGNATED RECIPIENT OF SECTIONS 5307 AND SECTION 5339 FORMULA PROGRAM FUNDS. THE HUNTSVILLE UZA RECEIVES 100% OF FEDERAL FUNDING. THERE IS NO SPLIT ALLOCATION LETTER.PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT: TO CONSTRUCT A NEW MULTIMODAL TRANSFER STATION TO ACCOMMODATE THE EXPENDING SERVICE NEEDS OF HUNTSVILLE TRANSIT. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: PHASE I ENGINEERING AND DESIGN CONSTRUCTION SPECIFICATIONS AND CONSTRUCTION OF MULTIMODAL TRANSFER STATION. PHASE II ENGINEERING AND DESIGN RENOVATION OF CURRENT TRANSFER STATION AND PART OF OPERATIONS FACILITY.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: PHASE I FACILITY AND BAYS EQUIPPED FOR EXPANSION PLANS. INCREASED SAFETY WITH DESIGN FLOW PARKING AREAS PLACEMENT CAMERA SYSTEMS AND FENCING.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PASSENGERS AND DRIVERS SAFETY AND CONVENIENCE LOCATION EASILY ACCESSIBLE TO GENERAL PUBLIC AND ABILITY TO OFFER RURAL PROVIDERS OPERATIONS SPACE.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: DESIGN ENGINEERING CONSTRUCTION AND SUB-CONTRACTS.THE CITY OF HUNTSVILLE OR ITS SUB-GRANTEE (WHEN APPLICABLE) WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PART CONTRACTING GUIDANCE).THE CITY OF HUNTSVILLE AL AND SUB-GRANTEE (WHEN APPLICABLE) WILL ENSURE CONTRACTORS PROCURED WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.

ALABAMA AM UNIVERSITY BULLDOG TRANSIT SYSTEM (BTS) IS REVOLUTIONIZING TRANSIT BY TRANSITIONING TO SMART AND SUSTAINABLE GREEN MOBILITY BY STRATEGICALLY REPLACING ITS FOSSIL FUEL-POWERED BUSES/VEHICLES THAT HAVE REACHED BEYOND THE END OF THEIR USEFUL LIFE. TO DATE (6) NEW ZERO-EMISSION ADA BATTERY ELECTRIC HEAVY DUTY TRANSIT BUSES HAVE BEEN ACQUIRED. A BUS STORAGE FACILITY WITH RELATED CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE AND A BUS WASH FACILITY ARE UNDER CONSTRUCTION. THIS PROPOSED PROJECT SEEKS TO FULFILL THE UNIVERSITY BULLDOG TRANSIT SYSTEM (BTS) GOAL OF ACHIEVING A 100% SUSTAINABLE ZERO EMISSIONS TRANSIT SYSTEM. $336000 BUDGET IS SLATED FOR A ZERO EMISSIONS 25-FOOT ADA 7 YEAR USEFUL LIFE SHUTTLE BUS WILL BE PURCHASED TO REPLACE A 2005 25-FOOT FOSSIL FUEL SHUTTLE BUS VIN # HA46391 THAT HAS REACHED BEYOND ITS USEFUL LIFE SERVICING THE EXISTING UNIVERSITY NORMAL HILLS 9 COMPLEX 500 RESIDENT APARTMENTS A NEW WELCOME AND EVENT CENTERS UNDER CONSTRUCTION. THE BATTERY ELECTRIC FLEET WILL NEED AT LEAST ONE 500KW PLUG IN FAST CHARGE DEPOT. IN THIS PROJECT WE WILL ERECT A SERVICE BAY TO ACCOMMODATE THE NEW BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES WHICH REQUIRE LARGER SPACE AND SPECIALIZED EQUIPMENT. TO ACHIEVE THE GOAL OF 100% ZERO EMISSIONS TRANSIT THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE INSTALLING A ONE (1) MEGAWATT SOLAR SYSTEM TO HARNESS SOLAR ENERGY AND INSTALL AN ENERGY STORAGE SYSTEM WITHOUT SENDING ENERGY BACK TO THE TO THE GRID CREATING A MICROGRID TO POWER THE CHARGING STATIONS AND BUS FACILITY CAMPUS. GIVEN THE TRANSITION TO NEW MOBILITY TECHNOLOGY THERE IS A NEED FOR WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT TRAINING TECHNICIANS TO SERVICE THE BUSES MAINTAIN THE MICROGRID SYSTEMS AND BUS OPERATORS INCLUDING OPERATIONS STAFF. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL MOVE THE TRANSIT TO BECOME A 100% ZERO EMISSIONS TRANSIT SYSTEM CREATE A QUITE ENVIRONMENT REDUCE HARMFUL EMISSION INCREASED PASSENGER RIDERSHIP REDUCTION OF OPERATING COST AND BECOME A MODEL TRANSIT SYSTEM IN THE NATION BENEFITING THE UNIVERSITY COMMUNITY AND THE US TRANSIT TRANSIT COMMUNITY. ALABAMA AM UNIVERSITY RECIPIENT 2542 WAS AWARDED $2156692 D2021-LWNO-001AND $2119128 D2021-LWNO-002.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ALABAMA AM UNIVERSITY BULLDOG TRANSIT SYSTEM (BTS) FUNDS FOR ZERO EMISSIONS BUSES AND RELATED INFRASTRUCTURE TO ACHIEVE THE GOAL OF A 100% ZERO EMISSIONS TRANSIT.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PURCHASE A 25 NO EMISSIONS SHUTTLE BUS CONSTRUCT AN ELECTRIC BUS/VEHICLE SERVICE BAY ERECT PHASE 1 MICRO-GRID POWERED BY SOLAR ARRAY SYSTEM AND ELECTRIC STORAGE SYSTEM TO POWER ELECTRIC CHARGING STATION AND RELATED FACILITIES. PART OF THE FUNDS WILL COVER WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT FOR THE ELECTRIC ZERO EMISSIONS BUSES AND INFRASTRUCTURE.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE BULLDOG TRANSIT WILL BE ABLE TO ACHIEVE ITS OBJECTIVE OF OPERATING A 100% ZERO EMISSIONS TRANSIT SYSTEM NO/ZERO EMISSIONS BUSES/VEHICLES POWERED BY ZERO/NO EMISSIONS POWER SOURCE/MICROGRID SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCING HARMFUL EMISSIONS AND REDUCING HARMFUL ENERGY DEPENDENCY SUPPORTING NATIONS ENERGY SECURITY AND ADOPTING TO NEW MOBILITY TECHNOLOGIES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE US LESS RELIANCE ON FOSSIL FUEL THE STATE INCREASE IN CHARGING STATIONS INFRASTRUCTURE LOCAL SURROUNDING COMMUNITY REDUCTION IN HARMFUL EMISSIONS THE UNIVERSITY LEARNING ENVIRONMENT WITH LESS NOISE AND REDUCTION IN HARMFUL EMISSIONS OPERATING A CLEAN QUITE TECHNOLOGICAL ADVANCED BUSES/VEHICLES HARNESSING CLEAN ENERGY FROM SOLAR REDUCING OPERATIONS COSTS IN FUEL AND MAINTENANCE. MODEL SYSTEM THAT CAN BE ADOPTED TO OTHER TRANSIT AGENCYS AND TRAINED WORKFORCE IN NEW MODE OF MOBILITY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE
